The burger sounded so delicious but when I got it, the applewood smoked bacon in my burger was pretty burnt on some parts & the whole burger was really greasy from the caramelized onions that the bottom bun was soggy & falling apart. As for the fries, they were doused in salt & waaay too salty! & much to my disappointment, the truffle flavor was very weak! I could tell all the ingredients are good quality but the execution of the food just wasn't there when I went. I did like the chill atmosphere & that the burgers are wrapped & served nicely on plates. Maybe I'll give it a second chance due to the superior reviews & hopefully it'll be as good as everyone is raving about!
author: Sarah C.

description:
As I was taking Lyft over to the restaurant, the driver told me that Roam has the best burger he's had - in SF, at least. With these high expectations I walked in. The place is pretty small - not enough tables for everyone that's for sure. You order first, then sit down. 

I got the Sunny Side Burger - I love a good egg on a burger. I order the beef patty (maybe should have gone with something else?). It was pretty good with the arugula which kind of cut through the kind of heaviness. We also got the sweet potato fries (since those are one of my favorite type of fries). 

I got the blood orange soda - it was pretty good. But the winner of the night was the salted caramel milkshake. It really tastes like salted caramel. I am a sucker for that flavor. It also came with a brulee marshmallow on top which was pretty good. I honestly don't like bruleed marshmallow that much, but it seemed to be good. 

Overall, it's a pretty good place, but nothing super amazing.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Bison burger. Sunny side. That's what I got, and that's probably what I'll get next time. BECAUSE IT WAS DELICIOUS. From the menu, the sunny side style has "Organic free-range egg, aged white cheddar, caramelized onions, greens, tomato, sweet chili sauce." If you ask me, I'd say this bison burger was juicy and sweet but just the right amount. The caramelized onions were definitely done right. It was huge too! I was so full after this burger that I don't know why I had ordered the fries! 

For fries, we got the trifrecta, which comes with THREE kinds of fries. You've got the normal potato fries, sweet potato fries, and a some veggie fries. The veggie fries were good because they were so thin that when they were fried, they were super crispy. Yum. 

This is a good place for burgers! I wish they had happy hour so that I would come after work but they don't :( it's still a good lunch time spot though! There was no wait when we came here on a Wednesday so our hour lunch was more than enough time!
author: Connie Y.

description: Good burgers (especially the bison), but not worthy of the prices being raised which just occurred. The truffle fries were also good, but were fairly dry and needed some truffle sauce as an option.
author: Amanda R.

description:
High stars for their sweet potato fries-  they were delicious and not too greasy!
The organic vanilla shake was pretty good - very 'vanilla' tasting.  

The 2 stars are for the burger because I've had better for sure.  My sister raved about this place but when she brought me back the burger, it was dry and blah.  I didn't get at all why her whole family said they are the best burgers ever.  Sure they are the healthier type of meat but I just found it to be dry and blah.  Maybe because I didn't have it while there?  Maybe because it needed more toppings and definitely needed cheese? I don't know but wouldn't return to try another.
author: Alexandra C.

description:
Very solid burger joint. I ordred the "French and Fries" with grass fed beef. The burger was topped with gruyere, truffle fries, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, and dijon mustard. SO BOMB. This baby packed a ton a flavor and the beef patty was nice and juicy.

We also got the Fry-fecta to split. It comes with russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack. I particularly enjoyed the zucchini as I've never had it in a similar form before. Their shakes and sodas are pretty darn good as well. A bit on the pricey side, but well worth it.
author: Kevin N.

description: Amazing Bison French and Fries, service is fast in the afternoon, perfect pick up for a late lunch
author: Lucas R.

description: The salad here is absolutely incredible. It's a burger joint that happens to make the freshest salad I've ever had in my life. The ingredients are amazing...pumpkin seeds, pomegranate seeds, huge slices of avocado. I would love to try a burger some time, but I cannot pass up this gorgeous salad. Take a look at my photo and see for yourself.
author: Karin R.

description:
This place is dangerous to live next to, as evidenced by the fact that personal burger consumption in my apartment is up about 800% since moving in. I have the Tejano burger to thank for that: a little bit of kick, some pepperjack, jalapeno relish AND tortilla strips. Equally delicious with beef (the standard and my go-to), bison (even more delicious than beef, but a few extra bucks) and elk (a bit of a wild card - I put it somewhere between beef and bison in taste). 

I've had a few of the other combinations - yeah, I eat here too much I'm thinking - and although all of them have been awesome, it's nearly impossible for me not to get a Tejano. The texture of the chips and the slight kick of flavor are tough to top. Would I eat here this much if I didn't live so close? Maybe only slightly less. This is so far my most cost-effective, tasty and filling option for burgers in the Marina. Throw in online ordering, call ahead orders, spacious and orderly interior, friendly staff and outdoor seating, and I'm even more sold. As an added bonus, the milkshakes are exceptional. Do yourself a favor and add on a salted caramel with your Tejano You're welcome.
author: Taylor C.

description:
Choose your patty (beef, turkey, bison, veggie, elk) & style or create your own burger. Roam offers organic, grass-fed, free-range, all natural patties. They have two types of buns: whole grain or sesame. They also have sides and beverages (beer, housemade sodas and shakes). 

* Bison French & Fries burger ($10.99) http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jyMg59pXe8dADBN1neAOPQ/l.jpg: A tall burger with a very dry whole grain bun, thin patty (not dry but not juicy either, about medium), hot truffle Parmesan fries, gruyere, slices of avocado, sweet caramelized onions, Dijon mustard and tangy watercress. The burger had a lot going on and much of it was tasty but I didn't like the really dry bun, thin patty and the way the ingredients kept falling out. Their beef burgers are juicier. They didn't ask about preferred level of doneness for the burger.
* Meyer lemon soda ($2.49): Housemade, tangy and not too sweet, nice 
* Russet fries ($2.99): Thick cut fresh potatoes, with skin left on. Fries were lightly crispy, not too salty, with a sprinkle of parsley, delicious 

It's a hip looking place with wood tables, bar/counter seating and lights made out of old milk bottles. I wanted to watch the game there but people were waiting for seats.
author: Lolia S.

description: 2nd time here and 2nd time I've had over-the-top service-/meals. Anything on menu can be magically made into vegetarian....and it's homemade- not a fancied up Boca burger. Food is in a plenty.
author: Steph R.

description: The staff here were all so friendly - but the burger? Just meh. I much prefer another place that I find super duper. Parking is awful but that is to be expected. The place seemed to be extremely family friendly if that is your thing.
author: Robin P.

description: Delicious! I highly recommend the Turkey Tejano with a lettuce wrap - it is really fantastic. Also, the kid's size hazelnut chocolate shake is the perfect sweet treat - not too much and not too little.  The hot sauce on the condiment table has a nice little kick if you like that kind of thing.  Yum!
author: Noelle F.

description: I came in here with my girlfriend to have a nice date. I was greeted kindly by the staff and such. The food was meh. Thats all I can really say to it...meh...uber bland and without expression. That would get about 3 stars, but what really ruined my day was the fact that there was this LADY NAMED LYNN just shouting up a storm. She was shouting at all her employees left to right. I felt so bad eating here knowing of the mistreatment of the employees. I cannot believe this lady still has a job there, im not sure if shes the manager/owner but that doesnt matter. No one should talk down other people in such manner, especially in public!!! WILL NOT BE BACK!!
author: Oscar C.

description:
Roam has a simple menu of burgers(beef, bison +2.99, turkey, veggie.), fries, shakes, salads, and drinks. you place order, get a number and the food is brought to you.

flatscreen: sports
music: rock
seating: long communal table, a bar, a bench, and some small tables

eats: classic:(5.99) 100% pacific pasture grass fed,  medium rare
-with butter lettuce, onions, home-made pickles, mayo, tomato,  house sauce, and 
mustard. many other free and cost plus toppings also available
-fresh crunchy veggies and mayo tasted.
-meat red with a tiny bit of juice.  not much taste.
3.5 stars

crumbs
-service efficient
-dining room comfy in dark hues
author: Victor G.

description:
hubs spoke highly of this place.  he said its very good but pricey so its a splurge.

came down here for a quick lunch.
I ordered their veggie burger and milk shake, hubs and I shared truffle fries. 
truffle fries were good...portion a bit small I think.
milk shake was good but I've had better.
veggie burger was different.  very light which was great for me but it needed the earthiness that a typically burger should have.  it was good but it was missing something.

service: good.

place: clean, love the rustic feel to it.  restrooms need a changing station.

expect to have hard time finding parking around this area tho
author: Learnee L.

description:
Awesome speedy burger joint!

Great feel inside. Great ingredients and most importantly a great burger!  

Had the fresh veggies on the side instead of fries which is a nice change of pace.

Will definitely be back.
author: Trevor W.

description:
Great spot. 

This place is fun place - great food, relaxing atmosphere and good times! Creative burgers are fun and delicious! 

Check it out!!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Neat little burger place. One of the best burgers I've had. Ended up getting a French and fries. They have a great menu to create from. Also got the fri-fecta cause all of their fries sounded so good. They were all pretty amazing, the onion hay stacks are a little funky to eat but fun and delicious non the less. Also I had their strawberry soda, that was fantastic, not to sweet and.not to soda-y.
author: Derek E.

description:
I live one block away, and this place is dangerous! Not only are the burgers and fries delicious, but the market salad is wonderful when you're trying to be good. 

Note that sometimes the wait for food can be lengthy. If you're just picking up to go, I recommend ordering online before heading over.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I definitely dig Roam. 

For a lot of people, they want to compare Umai burger with this joint - I honestly think that both are good in their own way.

If you haven't been here its definitely one of those you gotta stop by and decide for yourself. 

I've come back many times and I definitely dig this place.

Its also located in an awesome spot.
author: Joaquin A.

description:
Roam is consistently delicious.  I can confidently say that l have yet to eat a burger better than a Roam burger. 

In addition, almost anyone can eat here, from vegans to carnivores!  Don't eat red meat? They have a great turkey burger. Vegan? They have a great veggie patty. Gluten-free? Get your burger on a lettuce wrap.  That way if you are getting lunch with your vegetarian friend, you have other options aside from The Plant Cafe. 

Other than their burgers, Roam offers some delicious fries, sweet potato fries, and a fried zucchini-onion mix. Can't decide which to order? You can order a sampler of all three. The "fry-fecta". 

Roam provides many healthier spins on the classic hamburger. This keeps me coming back time and time again.
author: Juliana K.

description:
Quality "artisan" burgers.  Grass fed beef (not that it tastes any different on a burger with toppings), selection and combinations are good and appealing. The bun, while in the photos, looks big, it's very soft, has a very slight crunch on the underside and it adds to the burger in a great way. Water, in pint sized glasses is self serve from a big stainless container.  

Order to eat time is only a few minutes, the fries are great and need no additional seasoning.  It was my first time here and I ordered the classic beef with cheddar and egg.  It was excellent and I'd definitely go back.
author: G P.

description:
One of my favorite burger places, and I've definitely tried a few. Roam wins over Umami in taste and value, with a similar trendy burger joint experience. 

I ordered the Sunny Side Turkey burger on the sesame bun. The turkey patty was filling, moist, and well-seasoned. I would definitely order again but ask for the egg to be more runny. Though the name is Sunny Side, the eggs were actually over-easy and not yolky at all. 

The Fry Fecta with the truffle parmesan is highly recommended. I especially liked eating the zucchini onion haystack with my burger for the added crunch.

The restaurant is clean and spacious. You place your order, find your table, and your food is taken out to you. There is a station for utensils and cold water. There are bottles of delicious and seriously spicy habenaro hot sauce.
author: Diana N.

description:
If you can't wait to pay a premium for the privilege of chowing down on mediocre, overcooked burgers in a frat-house, trough-like atmosphere ignored by slap-dash, servile service, this is the place for you! Go get 'em, young titans w/out taste! 

(Ahh, San Francisco, where the f*^k did you go and who drove you there?)
author: Josephine M.

description: Gotta love these burgers. You can make it anyway you want and whichever way that is it'll be the bomb. My burger of choice - beef burger on whole wheat bun, butter lettuce (LOVE butter lettuce! can't find it at any other burger place), tomato, carmelized onion, house sauce with an over-hard fried egg = DELICIOUS!!! Sweet potato fries are fried to perfection served with creamy ranch dressing. The restaurant is really charming with communal dining and friendly staff. I have to knock off a star though only because they don't serve DIET COKE. Damn so close......nonetheless, really love this place.
author: Caye Q.

description:
I can not help but rave about this place and this comes up as one of the best burgers I have ever had. Because of the true artistry that goes behind in making these burgers, I have ventured on to discovering and exploring more burger joints.

And Roam is what started it all! I went with 2 friends whilst visiting SF, we got:
Sunny side
Do your own burger
Chalet

Mine was the sunny side.... and oh my gosh. The first bite I took -- I thought I passed out and have arrived to some Holy Land where only amazing foods are allowed. I squished my burger a little and the creamy yolk burst and slathered its richness throughout my burger. The patty was juicy and succulent, everything it should be. Every bite oozed with flavor from the smokey cheese, sweetness of the caramelized onion, the perfectly seasoned patty, crisp greens, and the creaminess of the yolk just melted everything together. And there was something about the bread that just made it so amazing -- it was soft but still firm on the outside with a subtle sweetness to it. You know it's good when you don't give a dang how messy it gets -- and oh, it got messy. So messy. Foodgasm. Again, again, and again. Oh my.

My friends loved their burgers equally and enjoyed a refreshing Meyer Lemon drink... which got a little syrup-y later.

Best thing about Roam is if you wanted to try some exotic patties, like Elk or Bison, you can!

It's a little pricey but well-worth it. And the most amazing thing was the fact that my tummy felt amazing after -- I did not feel heavy or weighed down, which is what I usually feel like after eating a massive burger, so a great plus!
author: Catherine N.

description:
Roam is absolutely amazing.  I love that you can build your own burger.  Last time that I was here I ordered a beef burger, sunnyside.  The burgers aren't just good due to the toppings.  The patty is delicious and grilled to perfection.  

Also, for San Francisco, this is quite a deal price-wise.  I absolutely recommend coming here for a delicious lunch.  Roam never disappoints.
author: Alyx F.

description:
I had the bison patty served Tejano style.  It was delicious.  It's truly an artisan burger place (better than Umami Burger).  The meat, the bun and Jalapeno relish were a perfect combination.  The corn strips added another texture to the burger.  I'll try the beef burger next time. 

Don't forget to get the Fry-Fecta too.

Come down to the South Bay please...
author: Triple T.

description: An EXCELLENT spot for burgers.  Great variety, including turkey burgers (my favorite).  Incredible milk-shakes as well.  I have ordered many times from Roam and they really execute perfectly on both in-restaurant dining as well as take out.  This is my go-to spot for burgers, although Umami burger is excellent as well.  I'll be back for sure- and I'll be coming for the 'French and Fries' burger!
author: Andy S.

description: Just ok. I'm a plain cheeseburger person and this left a little to be desired. Too much bread and not enough meat. I've heard great things, so may try again.
author: Therese M.

description:
A friend chose this place because he mentioned that his co-workers said good things about this burger joint.

Being a burger fanatic and having my decent amount of burgers from different places, and always wanting more meat (because a girl needs her meat). Sort of lost with the many choices of what kind of meat, toppings and add-ons I could get, just decided on the plain beef patty with the toppings the Tejano came with. (And yes, I butched up the name when I ordered it, thank you VERY much Japanese class!) And I decided to order a side of fries too.

It's not a bad burger, but it's also not the greatest burger I had. Though, I wish I had tried something else besides the standard burger. The fries were decent, fancier fries than fast food places, but at the same time nothing too extreme. Just russel potato fries with a sprinkle of I think was rosemary.

Not a big place, but am willing to go back again and to try another burger.
author: Tom T.

description:
Very trendy and hipsterish environment, promoting organic ingredients and burgers. My friends and I came Friday evening around six; right before the dinner rush. Their menu was brief and straight forward. We were given a choice of beef, turkey, bison, or veggie patty with less than ten different "style" burgers to choose from. I went with the Chalet "style" burger ($7.99) with beef, wrapped in lettuce ($1), and added a sunny side-up egg as an extra topping ($1.50). The Chalet included swiss cheese, cremini mushrooms, watercress, tomato, and their house sauce. The burger was decently sized and extremely saucy and juicy--it was definitely messy to eat. It didn't help that I opt for the lettuce wrap too, so it was dripping everywhere! The beef patty was medium rare, juicy, lightly seasoned, and complemented the house sauce well. I really liked the chipotle peppery hot sauce that they have too. I also tried their fry-fecta, which included potatoes, sweet potatoes, and zucchini onions strings. The zucchini onion strings weren't as exciting as I had anticipated, but they were fresh and good. 

There wasn't much customer service, since we ordered at the counter and sat ourselves, but the lady who took our order was charming and friendly. Our food was prepared and ready fairly quickly too!
author: Lien T.

description: One wouldn't think a burger place would have a great salad, but Roam made me a great salad today. Fresh and perky greens, thinly sliced radishes and carrots, sweet multi-colored cherry tomatoes, and avocado. Yum. Next time I may try the burgers.
author: Eva G.

description:
Not sure if it was because I opted for the the "house-made" veggie patty. But I wasn't nearly as impressed with Roam as the person before me may have been. Usually when I read the term house-made on the menu my expectation goes from ordinary to extraordinary. Unfortunately the burger I received was anything but that, the only thing that gave it some flavor was the herb mayo, other then that the patty was really bland. they use quinoa instead of the traditional ground soy, which makes it extremely soft and difficult to keep the burger together which would have been fine if it wasn't so bland, I mean I'm pretty sure I'm not the only person that minds licking their fingers clean if the food is good but this just didn't cut it for me. 

Three stars because I'd really like to give this place another shot. The service is super friendly, food is brought out fairly quick and the sweet potato fries and great!
author: Madhuri P.

description:
I am giving Roam 3 stars based on my veggie burger that I had. I can't comment on the meat burgers

My husband and I came here last night for dinner and it was ok. It is definitely a more casual atmosphere with a few tables set for 2 or 4, one long community table in the center and bar seating and a few tables set up outside which are under heat lamps. They have a tv so this would be a great place to get a bite to eat and watch a game. They don't have enough seats during those rush hours. People were still waiting for a table even after they received their food. Kind of a bummer

When you first walk in, there is a large menu on the right side. You can pick  you pattie(beef, bison, turkey veggie etc) and then they have a selection of different ways to prepare or you can make your own way. They also have specialty house made sauces, home made sodas, small selection of beer and wine and milkshakes

I have heard so much about the French and Fry way(truffle cheese french fries on the burger) so i ordered the veggie pattie french and fry and a side of the fry-fecta which are zucchini strings, sweet potato fries, and russet potato fries) and a blackberry soda. My husband ordered the beef pattie Tejano way which has a spicy jalapeno relish and and spicy cheese. He is pretty particular about how beef patties are cooked and he said he really liked it.
I did hear that the veggie pattie was pretty soft and fell apart and all of those yelp reviews were correct! The pattie was very soggy, not a lot of texture, not much flavor and made the rest of the bun and fries soggy. A was a bit disappointed. The only flavor i really got was from the truffle cheese.
I think my favorite part of the meal was the sweet potato fries dipped in the herb ranch. Yum!

Prices were ok: 2 burgers, 2 sodas and fries for $30

 I think I will come back and at least try one of the their salted caramel milkshakes with a bruleed marshmallow on top.
author: Whitney S.

description: Consistently good food.  I really appreciate grass fed beef, being able to build your ideal burger.  For a burger joint, the food is creatively offered and the service is always welcoming anf friendly.  Thanks guys!
author: Molly C.

description: I've always passed by the place for a whole year just staring at the food people ate outside. Finally Came here for lunch with my sister yesterday and it did not disappoint. We came around 2 pm so it was pretty empty. We were surprised with the meats they use since we dont see them on a menu often (bison, turkey and elk). However we're both pescatarian, so I got the Veggie Sunnyside and she got the classic veggie. I don't think I've had a veggie burger that good let alone a good veg patty, and the egg was perfect. We also had the parmesan truffle fries which were pretty good as well. They served our food fast, and they didn't give off a snobby vibe (especially since I dressed in sweats and my hair everywhere). They were really nice even though I  had going to the cashier three times.
author: Yvonne N.

description:
I've been here several times and usually pleased with food and service. 
Management must have been out today around 4pm. 2 different burgers with the same outcome.  Pacific blue bison burger so soggy the bun fell apart on the first bit. Also the burger meat was not intact (in four broken pieces) helped the the whole thing fall apart on the second bite. 
5 people standing around talking not checking in with us or asking if our food was made to order.
Ordered a milkshake "with two cups please" of course that didn't happen they were too busy talking to pay attention to the little details. 
Probably won't be back unless I know management is there...
Food tasted good.  Just a total mess. We didn't bother finishing either one. . 
Bummed. . Really wanted a good burger...
author: Mr R.

description: So far, this is my favorite burger spot in SF. They have a bunch of interesting burgers to choose from. The French & Fries is always my safe choice- it comes with a juicy burger patty with greens, truffle fries, avocado, and Dijon mustard. Mmm, sometimes the mustard can be a bit overpowering though and I always forget to ask for it on the side. I also recommend the fry-fecta to share between 2 or more people- regular fries, sweet potato fries, & zucchini onion strings. I've tried the salted caramel shake too, which was pretty good, but not as salted caramel-y as I expected. It almost tasted more like vanilla.. It was still good though. I always tell myself I'm going to try a different burger next time and I always fall back to F&F, but I'm for sure going for a different one next time. I just can never decide because they all sound so good!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Not impressed. 

Pros: The coffee shake and fries were super. 

Cons: Heritage burger -the juicy burger was thin and flavorless. Thank goodness for the giant slabs of bacon. That made it edible.
BBQ burger - super small. i know it had condiments but barely. 

With umami burger within walking distance I won't be back.

Note: Lots of parents with kids love this spot. It felt like Chucky cheese on the Saturday night we went.
author: Nicole W.

description: These burgers are full of flavor. My new burger place now and the zucchini strings were better than the regular fries! Have to try this place out if you're ever in sanfran.
author: Michael K.

description:
I had just gone rock climbing with some friends and we were in the mood for some good food. My friend suggested this burger place and I am so glad she did! This place was very good. I love all the options that they had available for burgers, sides, and drinks. Most of the options are pretty healthy and great for people who have alternative diets. Gluten free buns are available as well as veggie burger options. There really is something for everyone. 

My hands down favorite was "fries" trio with french fries, onion strings, and zucchini strings. AMAZING! Definitely a must if you go. 

While my burger was very good, and made perfectly according to my picky order, the meat was not cooked enough for me. They did not ask how I wanted it cooked, but I did not specify either. Typically I get my burgers medium or medium rare, but next time I go I will probably order it medium well or well done. 

The place itself is kind of small for how busy they are, but luckily we were able to grab a table. The service was also very nice and accommodating.

Definitely looking forward to going again!
author: Lauren C.

description: had the sunny side burger. the egg and chili sauce really make this burger, complementing the richness of the burger meat. I just wish it wasn't so messy to eat. definitely a fork and knife type of burger. also sampled the trifecta of fries, which was mediocre at best. The burgers are pretty great as was the seasonal pumpkin shake, but skip the fries. they're over salted and not that crispy.
author: Sylvia B.

description:
Ok this really is a superior burger place. Choice of several meats. I had elk today. Really liked it. Also have a market salad that was surprisingly good. Oh yeah--truffle fries. Love 'em!
Three beers on tap. Also some wine. The place was packed but it was all good. Just enough  turnover so that there was always a place for someone to sit.  Nice vibe and good music in the background.
Altogether a couple of the best burgers we've had in the city.
author: Kelly P.

description: I love the veggie burger and the sweet potato fries. Salads and sides are great too and always made with the freshest ingredients. This place is busy but staff are courteous and efficient.
author: Sandy G.

description:
My expectations were set high, I hate it when that happens...

Yes this place is great for vegetarians, and for variety, since you have a several patties to choose from, and then the different ways to dress the burger. They take their burgers seriously (as one would assume) thus probably have the tastiest, most multi-faceted burgers in the city that you can order from place not exclusively for sit-downs, but get ready to pay for the gourmet factor. 

I had a Chalet veggie with sweet potato fries: burger was good but I ended up dipping the last half of my burger in hot sauce to flavor it; fries were good but not mind blowing. 

My visit coincided with a group of eight whining children, thank god for outdoor seating - yay for heat lamps!

I am not opposed to coming back and trying something else. If you love burgers, you should give this a try, but if not, I hope this review helps lower your expectations so that if you go, you will be pleasantly surprised :)
author: Lana L.

description:
When you do two hours of TRX back to back, you need something to refill your calories.  And although a lot of booze may do the trick, you'll be on the ground faster than you can say "atomic pushup."

So what do you do?  Grab about 16 layers of clothes (that SF fog is COLD) and head over here for some tasty nibbles.

They have interesting pre- thought up burgers, but if you're like me (weird), you're going to make up your own.  Meat, bread, cheese, avocado, tomatoes, sweet potato fries...all things that make a burger delicious but are a little extra special here. 

Even though it's pretty darn nuts and crowded, I have found the staff to always be awesome.  

If you can get your hot TRX instructor to come with you AND finish your fries, even more awesome.
author: Pam S.

description:
Roam is by far my most favorite burger place; probably because I can customize anything and they have turkey burgers. I do get overwhelmed with what I can do with my burger but the Chalet and Heritage are two great picks. If you can put an egg on it, do it.  Side o' sweet potato fries too please!

Their milkshakes are phenomenal too! My friend and I came in just for the pumkin spice milkshake and we added a bruleed marshmallow on top. Um...YUM. 

Can't go wrong here. Just can't.
author: Cassie C.

description:
Overall, we were unimpressed. Location along Union street was nice, and for a Sunday night we found parking relatively easily. Entered; found the wooded chalkboard-y atmosphere appropriate for the Marina. Clientele was mostly Marina locals. Items on the menu that caught my eye were the sunny side burger, sweet potato fries, Straus milkshakes, beer, and grilled veggies (squash and heirloom tomatoes with cotija cheese).

We tried the sunny side burger with beef which was just OK; personally, I think Super Duper is better all around. The beef was OK; bun was a general sesame seed bun; egg was messy; and overall size was smaller than expected. 

My biggest gripe is the price, although I will say, it's fair given the location. Russet fries ($2.99) with parmesan (extra $0.75) were quite good-- crispy, perfectly seasoned, mildly salty, but overpriced IMO for the small round pan. Organic ketchup seemed unnecessary (organic, really?). Drinks are rather expensive too (soda, although Boyle's, is $2.49 for a bottle). For a burger, fries, soda, and beer, our total was $22, and the servings were maybe 80% what I'd expect from other competing burger joints. We finished with definite room for dessert afterwards.
author: Debora L.

description:
Delicious, definitely hits the spot for the burger cravings. Not much of a wait to get seated, and the food comes fast.

I had a chance to chow down on a Sunny Side Burger. Felt like a Carl's Jr commercial "if it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face". Very messy, got everywhere, but definitely worth it!

Truffle fries are a must also.

Will definitely go back and try something different.
author: Clifford C.

description:
I usually come here after a workout at Planet Granite or a softball game at Moscone Field.  So yeah, usually its when I am really hungry!  

That being said, the burgers are pretty good, and descent sized.  I usually get the heritage with has Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, Herb Mayo.  A solid choice.  The bacon really makes this burger because it is thick and crispy!!!  The rest is just there to complement it. The fries are really good as well, splurge for the truffle parmesan on top.  

A couple of drawbacks...
1.  Its pricey.  A burger, fries and beer will run you $20.
2.  Its typically crowded.  This is the norm for Union street.

Not a go to spot, but definitely a place I wouldn't say no to.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Bottom line, delicious burgers. 

I usually get two, since one isn't completely filling. 
I'm nobody, but I recommend the BBQ burger. 
The Tejano burger is.. interesting. It's like eating a burger/nacho mix. It's.. you know, ooookay. 
If I were you, I'd pass on the zucchini-onion fries or whatever they are. It's just so light and finely cut that it's awkward to eat and it just kinda taste like flavored batter and oil. 

ps. the jalapeno-relish is yummy. ask for a side if you want more and if it's not included with your burger choice.
author: Garland W.

description: We've been here twice now and both times was excellent. Great service and yummmmy burgers! Quality and fresh ingredients!
author: Halina Y.

description:
Umami Burger used to be my go-to burger joint (especially back when I lived in LA), but it quickly became replaced by Roam Burger upon relocating to the Marina. 

I like to keep things concise, so here some key considerations:

Atmosphere: Warm and cozy, though a little small. NOT good for big parties, as spaces are limited and on first-come, first-served basis.

Food: OMG MOUTHWATERING. Where else can you find a high quality, mostly organic/ sustainably raised/ free-roaming burger for $10 (with tax)? 
- Size is generous and filling
- Bun options are gluten-free, wheat, white, etc.
- Patty options are beef, turkey, veggie, and elk & bison (for $2-3 extra)
- Best "flavors" are the Sunny-side, Tejano, and BBQ. HANDS DOWN.
- Get the fry-fecta on the side

Price: great value for the size, quality, and taste

I try to eat healthy most 80% of the time, but when I want to splurge and still not feel heavy/ disgusting after, I go to Roam Burger!
author: Celia M.

description:
Two of us went to Roam's because she lives in the area and because of the reviews on Yelp and were not disappointed in the least. The food was delicious! Service was friendly and helpful.

For those of us used to sitting down with a menu, it was a little interesting to look a big board and choose our patty, then our toppings, then what type of sauces we wanted on it. Then there is the choosing of the sides! The Onion Zucchini Haystack was delish! And the Sweet Potato fries are some of the best I have ever had, tender not overcooked. (After we placed our orders I saw that they did indeed have paper menus available. Ha!)

We both chose for our burgers the following: 
Burger Patti: BEEF - Pacific Pastures 100% Grass-Fed
Style: French and Fries; Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard (Yes, the actually put Truffle Parmesan fries on the burger!!!)

A couple of eh's for me were: 
1.) It was cold outside (47 degrees) and not much warmer inside. Not many people took their coats off to eat.
2.) The bathroom looked clean, but smelled dirty.

I will definitely be back!!!
author: Brenda A.

description:
Roam Burgers is a comfortable little spot that serves up solid burgers. Coming solo or with a big group is not a big problem. But it seems like this place is always busy on weekends. You order at the cashier and they bring it to your table a la number stand. The quality is "artisan" and they aren't kidding. While a couple of bucks more than a fast food chain, the expense is definitely worth it. They serve quality food.

I ordered Sunny Side Burger (Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce) and a side salad. The burger is juicy and semi greasy. Your hands will surely get messy while eating this burger. The sweet chili sauce tastes like BBQ sauce. I really liked the flavor combination and the ingredients really shined. The only negative I had was the burger is a little slip and slidey. The side salad is way bigger than I expected. It's more like a main salad than side. I just wish they dressed the salad a touch more.

I guess I glanced over the part of the menu where you can choose your meat type. On their website it says that you can order either beef, turkey, bison, veggie, or elk (special charge). I love me some bison so I'll be getting that later. I wish more burger places offered meat options like Roam.
____

Solid quality burgers at reasonable prices.
author: Michael H.

description:
Finally got around to trying Roam....anyone offering a homemade veggie burger immediately goes on my list & I'm slowly but surely working my way through! 

Sis & I indulged in the Pacific Blue & the French & Fry 

The veggie burger itself had a nice consistency & flavor. Couldn't really tell what its key ingredients were but there was a beet-red color to it so yeah, I might be safe in saying beets are an ingredient. 

F&F - Anytime you place Gruyere & Avocado on anything, I'm gonna luv it - this was no exception. Mustard didn't overpower. Watercress had a bit of grit.  Boo. 

Pacific Blue - was likewise nicely paired w/ the Blue Cheese 

Salted Caramel Shakes - Delish! 

Fries - Sweet Potato were yummy; Truffled Parmesan were bland & no truffly taste....miss on these! 

While we enjoyed our meal, we weren't completely wowed - plus it's across town from us & our bill before tip was $41....for fast-food-like burgers & fries?!?!  Hmmmm 

So given price plus convenience factors, we'd say.....would come back if in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip
author: Adrienne G.

description:
This is one of those places where it's simply convenient:
good location
fast service
no hassle

But the burgers are nothing special.  I think they really need to consider seasoning the meat more.  I found the meat to be sort of bland.

Umami burger is just down the road from Roam, I would have preferred one of their burgers...
author: Li J.

description:
This is one of my new favorite burger spots!  Service was quick, and they offer a really great variety of stuff!  In addition to all the kinds of burgers with different ingredients in them on the menu, you can pick what kind of meat you want your burger to be--they even have elk!  Whaaaat?

I got a regular beef patty in the "french and fries" burger, which had avocado, truffle parmesan fries, caramelized onions, and dijon mustard in it--YUM! Fries already inside my burger?! You know ya'll used to do that when you got your happy meals as a kid!  The burger had great balance with all the ingredients, and the onions were a HUGE plus inside the burger--not greasy tasting at all, but great on flavor profile.  I could tell that everything inside the burger was quality stuff.  What stood out to me, in comparison to other burger places, was that my bun had sesame seeds on BOTH sides!  Little details like that make all the difference to me.  I was IMPRESSED.

Anyways, since I already had truffle parm fries INSIDE my burger, I decided to try the sweet potato fries, and I added the chipotle maple seasoning for an extra charge.  TOTALLY worth it.  These fries tasted amazing and were SUPER addicting.  Definitely something I've gotten EVERY time I've been back.  I'm hooked!

I've also tried one of the shakes--pretty good, but standard; I'd prefer going to a classic ice cream parlor if I craved a milkshake though--and I tried one of their home made sodas--suuuper refreshing!  I definitely recommend Roam for someone craving a burger without that guilty after-feeling you'd get from eating at a hole in the wall greasy diner.  The quality of the ingredients really makes you feel less heavy and gross afterwards like you would at other burger spots.  I'm absolutely in love with this place!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Roam if you want to, roam around the world...

Don't worry Shake Shack (NYC) I still love you!! But while I was in the area I had to try Roam. Fortuantely, we didn't have much of a wait to order on a Thursday night but it was a bit of wait to get a table but it worked out. I consider this the upscale sister of Shake Shack, because there are more offerings but I think the burgers are better at Shake Shack (!).

I got the classic beef burger and it was good, again, I think Shake Shack's are better. But Roam wins on fries and shakes. The truffle parmesan fries were so so good and the strawberry shake was just awesome. I find Shake Shack's to be too custardy for me. But Roam is slower to get your food to you. So it's a 4 star toss up. Props to the guy who got us water a few times.

Would I come back? hell yeah!!!

Roam if you want to, without wings without wheels...
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Meh, I was somewhat disappointed with Roam. I would give it 2.5 stars if I could.  I was expecting something awesome after reading many of the stellar reviews.

My friend and I walked all the way to the location from the America's Cup Pavilion area and we were ready for some delicious burgers. Unfortartnately, Roam's overall execution was lacking. 

We waited about 5 minutes for an employee to come and take our orders.  We ordered The Haystack (Fries, Sweets, and Zucchini Strings) and two classic burgers with some added toppings. I do like their ordering concept-- we chose our protein  and a style (similar but simpler than The Counter). 

We found a table (nice long community table for socialization). The iced tea I had tasted funky (something wasn't right with it). We waited at least 10 minutes for the food and the place was empty. When our burgers and fries finally came out, everything was "meh" tasting. The sauce was good under the patties, but The Haystack tasted old and oily. My burger was very pink inside, closer to the raw category.

The interior was classy but dirty. We could see the kitchen floor and identified random debris everywhere. The dinning room also felt dirty.

 A meat delivery guy showed up with a huge box of patties trying to squeeze by our table into the kitchen. It took a couple minutes for an actual employee to direct him.

Throughout the whole experience, random people walked in and out of the kitchen (most of them lacking uniforms, making it unclear if they were even associated with the place). They were discussing random personal topics which always makes me feel awkward. At one point, one person walked into the kitchen with a brief case and came out informing a uniformed employee that someone was in the shower and would be at work shortly. 

In summary, Roam has great potential but definitely does not live up to the hype.
author: Jackson L.

description:
Now I finally know what all the other Yelpers are raving about.  Roam was delicious!  I ordered the "French And Fries" beef burger which was divine!  The cheese melted perfectly underneath a small bed of fries that added the perfect balance of texture to every bite.  I also got a Prickly Pear soda(which was pretty light on the sweet aspect) that tasted quite nice and the "Fry-Fecta" which is a must when you love sweet potato, zucchini and onion.  They're all served in the same bowl - brilliant and perfect for splitting.

Check out roam before the masses invade.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Holy burger batman this was delicious!!!!!!! I am not the biggest burger fan. I would rather have sushi any day. (yes, I know the two are night and day but still..I would)

I got the french and fry turkey burger (LOVE LOVE that I can have a turkey option) and boy did it not disappoint. Fries slathered in truffle oil and parm in my samich??? Hell to the yes! The dijon mustard that gives it that great kick and compliments the parm perfectly?? Mother may I!!!! The turkey patty itself was just juicy and not dry what so ever...the exact opposite of what you think of when you think of turkey!! 

We complimented with a side of the fy fecta... the sweet potatoes stood out as the winner! 

Only thing I was not ecstatic about was my raspberry soda. Low on the raspberry side and just bubbles.

Other than that...no complaints. NONE. Best burger I have every tried!!!
author: Michelle I.

description: Had a great burger and watched the Warriors game. Great sweet potato fries and bison burger!
author: Austin V.

description: This food is so good. I live nearby and the smell makes my mouth water! The fries are insanely good too. It can get loud in there during peak hours, but its worth it and kind of makes the atmosphere feel lively. Staff is very nice and helpful. Prices are a bit expensive, but I guess that goes with SF pricing and the neighborhood.
author: Bitsy B.

description:
Amazing burgers! 

fat kid heaven. I had a french and fries burger it was so delicious and gluttonous.
All the flavors I love on a burger and truffle fries in the burger.

Also topped it off with a carmelized pineapple soda--unique and tasty. My friend got a mint chocolate chip which looked amazing, but with my dairy allergy no amount of benedryl would allow me to have one. But would highly suggest trying one from her review. 

the table got a fry-fecta that was just ok. maybe the only thing id skip just cause the rest really feels you up.

i did see someone with a salad after we ate. It looked huge and amazing, but i totally had selective seeing when I ordered and didnt even realize it was an option.

By far one of the best burger spots ive been too. Quick quality food for when your really hungry.
author: Adriana I.

description: Love this pace!  It's always pretty busy, but well worth the wait.  The classic bison is my norm and the meat is so flavorful!
author: Yisel F.

description:
Great spot to grab a quality burger. Nicely located with a clean and modern feel not to mention a friendly staff. You start of by picking your choice of meat like beef, bison, vegetarian etc then comes the style of burger you want. Take a number and the next thing you know it's delivered to your table. 
I tried something new and ordered the bison served up Sunny Side Style. Basically they add one of their homemade sauces and squeeze a sunny side up egg in the burger. I was a tad bit dissappointed when they over cooked the egg as I like the yolk just running down like a mud slide but it was a big hit with my mouth/stomach and washed it all down with a coconut milkshake! Check it out you will not be disappointed.
author: T L.

description: Positive stars for good food- super delicious burgers. Negative stars for service and layout of the restaurant. The place is very crowded and you end up having to sit very close to the people next to you. Not great for having a conversation or a date.
author: Karen D.

description:
In my mission to continue exploring San Francisco's best hamburger creations, I decided to check out Roam Artisan Burgers.

I must say that this was another example of where I would like to have half stars.  But I rounded them up to four stars.

They have an easy and basic ordering system.  I placed my order at the counter, took my number on a stick, and found a table.  Like anyone obsessed with writing food reviews, I selected my seat based on best lighting for my flash deficient phone.

Heritage Burger (Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, Herb Mayo)

This was a good burger.  I think it was even a good + burger.  I do not think it was a great burger.  The core ingredients were all of high quality.  This is what tipped the overall score to four stars.  For some reason, the burger did not come together in a way to meet the sum of its parts.  I even added some of the zucchini-onion haystack to it.   Would I eat this burger again?  Yes, definitely.  Not only that, but I would thoroughly enjoy it.  Would I go across town again to get one?  Nope, nada, wouldn't do it!   Pearl's, Gott's, and Mo's are all closer.

http://tinyurl.com/8yat8k4

Fry-Fecta ((Russet Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, Zucchini Onion Haystack))

This was pretty good.  It would be nice if there was a smaller size for one person. I enjoyed the haystack the most.  The fries and sweet potato fries were both decent.  In both cases though, many of the fries were very short.  This made it difficult to pick them up and dip them in ketchup.  

http://tinyurl.com/7c3bahk

Dagoba Chocolate Shake

Unlike John Travolta in Pulp Fiction, I've had lots of $5 shakes.  I know $5 shakes.  This was no $5 shake.  Well, it was.  But, it should not have been.  This was, by far, the smallest $5 shake I've ever had.   It was also overly sweet.  The chocolate did not really come through.  There was just an overwhelming sweetness.  If you know me, and you are reading this, get up off the floor.  Yes, you did just read that I said something was too sweet.  Don't worry, I am not going to be writing that something had too much bacon.  BTW - this was more of a spoon shake than a straw shake.  I do NOT consider that a negative.  (Disclaimer - I've repeatedly referred to this as a $5 shake.  To be fair it was actually a $4.99 shake.)

http://tinyurl.com/7kaqxju

The ambiance is clean and functional.  I found it to be a comfortable room to enjoy a burger.  It is not warm and cozy but not quite cold and industrial either.  When I arrived, it was relatively empty.  I was surprised by this.   It did start to pick up.  Of course, it is the Marina.  So, there was the obligatory table of two guys next to me discussing how much money they make, buying condos, and commuting to Hawaii.

The service was laid back and friendly.  It was maybe a little too laid back.  The guys at the counter had a little bit of that my dad bought me a Porsche but makes me work for gas money attitude.  But hey, they were friendly enough.   The food came out in good order.

Overall, this is a pretty good burger made from high quality ingredients.  It just misses that X factor of a burger that makes you go holy cow.  No pun intended.  Ok, maybe it was intended.  The side was good.   The shake overpriced.  Oops I almost forgot.  They have Boylan's soda.   If I was hungry and walking by with a hankering for spending $20+ on burger based grub,  I would stop in again.
author: Mark D.

description:
When comparing burgers to all the other great choices in the City I dunno if it's apples n oranges when it comes to Roam.

They're known for their bison burgers but I like the traditional burger more.  Nice and juicy with caramelized onions and white cheddar.  This is one good burger.   I also really enjoy the house sauce.  Overall just a nice quality burger (very much like super duper for all you super-duper fans).  

I wouldn't say this is my favorite burger in the City but it's definitely on my top 5 and a must try for those in search of quality cheese burgers in the Bay Area.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Why must I be such a sucker for anything with BBQ sauce? 

The BBQ burger; a beef patty, white cheddar cheese, BBQ sauce, caramelized onions, Jalapeno Relish, and Oil & Vinegar Slaw. 

The burger was juicy, the cheese was melted, the bun warm and toasty, the Jalapeno Relish was nice and spicy, the oil & vinegar slaw was nice and sour which didn't let the sweet BBQ sauce over power everything... a great balance! Nothing was overkill, and all the flavors meshed - I enjoyed every bite. The burger itself was a little smaller than I expected, so I ate the whole thing up! (Usually, I cut my burgers in half and save the other half for later!)

I tried the Sweet Potato fries which just reminded me I'm not a fan of sweet potatoes... so don't take my word for it! I was a bit disappointed in the Salted Caramel milkshake cause it looked and tasted like a Vanilla shake. 

3.5 stars for the burger and the other half is for the variety of sauces, shakes and sodas. I'll definitely be back!
author: S Y.

description:
One of the best casual restaurants in the Cow Hollow/Marina/Russian Hill area. Roam is comparable (maybe better) than Umami Burger. 

Amazing burgers- I recommend the French & Fries or the Sunny Side. They have great meat options, from beer to turkey to elk to bison. And if you're looking for fries- get the sweet potato fries with chipotle maple glaze. Amazing.

Finally, the staff there is awesome! Always friendly, social, and in great moods. Love coming to Roam!
author: Geoff R.

description:
We found this place on Yelp while wandering around the Union Street Fair and good lawd - a deliciously juicy burger - what more can you ask for? 

I chose the Tejano beef burger, which includes pepper jack cheese, jalapeño relish, avocado and tomato and the boyfriend had the Sunny Side beef burger which - yup you guessed it - has an egg and caramelized onions. We shared a side of fries and enjoyed the meal outside. 

The style of the place is order at the counter, get a number and have your meal served to you at your table. The women that took our orders were friendly, chatty and helpful with the menu while the servers/wait staff were efficient in refilling waters and taking our plates away. 

Highly recommended for anyone needing a burger fix in the area!
author: Stacy H.

description:
When I first walked in I was overwhelmed with the noise level and amount of people crammed into the restaurant. I also had trouble reading the menu. It's on the right of the line to order so you can't really look at it while waiting in line. Horrible set up and caused some line-order confusion.

Anyway, I ordered the BBQ burger and the fry-fecta. The burger was super good!! My only complaint about if was that I wasn't asked how I wanted my burger done and when I received, it was nearly rare. If you're not going to cook your burgers thoroughly, at least ASK your customer if that's ok.

The fry-fecta was REALLLLY good!! The standard fries were great. The little fried zucchini string things were good too but kind of hard to pick up and eat... I typically don't like sweet potato fries at all but Roam's sweet potato fries were ok. I would have been really happy with a big bowl of the standard fries.

Overall this place is cool and has good food but it's very loud inside and very cramped (don't bother eating here if you like your elbow room).
author: Randy C.

description: This is a nice low key burger joint. I had their vegetarian burger which was tasty and juicy. They have good beers on tap from micro breweries. Their farmer market salad was crispy and their fries were delicious as well. Prices are in the high end if you take into account that it is not a real restaurant. However, the burgers came out quick and it is definitely a place I would recommend if you want a nice and fast burger.
author: Rasmus E.

description:
I'm a big burger eater....and while I maintain that Kitchen Story has the best burger I've ever had, Roam Burgers is damn good! 

Had attempted to go to a different burger joint (Bistro SF Grill) for a Friday lunch on the holiday weekend, but it was closed so ended up here. I've been wanting to go for months. SOO glad the other place was closed. 

I had a Bison SunnySide, and we ordered the Fry-Fecta basket of all their fries. Also split the shake of the month which was some hazelnut DELICIOUSNESS. The burger was phenomenal! Falling off the bun juiciness. 

One of my friends has a salad and he said it was really good.

Can't wait to go back!
author: Chloé M.

description:
The second best burger in San Francisco. (First is Monk's Kettle)

This is my go-to spot for a good, cheap burger. It's consistently just great. 

Best burger there? The Tejano.
author: Jessie L.

description:
I have a warm spot in my heart for Roam, it's where me and my then amor met. He loved milkshakes (that's why he dated me!!! get it, get it, I love Kelis jokes) and I love food, so matchmade in Roam heaven.

I'm the girl who orders her burger with no bun but still gets fries haha. The burgers here are juicy and well worth the $$, fries are great as well.
author: Cristelle J.

description: Food came out wrong and the girl working was very nice and super on top of things (receipt says her name is Romina). I just wanted to leave feedback saying she is a great server, and is very nice. Food was good, just came out wrong.
author: Stefani O.

description: I don't eat a lot of burgers, but when I do it's usually at Roam. Food comes out quickly, the burger is soft, the bun quality is high, and the fries are addictive... not sure what else you'd be looking for at a burger spot. They also have beers like Anchor Steam which go perfectly with your burger. The staff at the counter is always a-ok, though the bussers have been prickly on rare occasion.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
My roommate has been all GET ON A BUDGET and I am like NO. I really need to do that s- but I am sooo bad at it. What I'm good at? Spending money on food. Case in point, went here last night with my friend Steph. I had the turkey slider salad and the fry-fecta... for 17 bucks. YEAH. I KNOW. Gahhh.

The turkey was overcooked but still tasty. The butter lettuce in the salad with chopped herbs was a nice change. I topped the salad with the zucchini and onion straws and that was a delicious decision. 

There were ONLY white people here.... because there are only white people in the Marina... which is why I don't go to the Marina... so... yeah.
author: Emily D.

description: My favorite place for burgers in SF.  Very fresh, lots of choices, wonderful sides.  It doesn't get any better than this.
author: Andrea G.

description:
I have absolutely no idea how and what they make the veggies burger out of - maybe they're made out of beets, maybe out of radishes, maybe out of some strange organic vegetables they grow in Roam Artisan land.

Whatever it is... damn, can I have that triple-sized?

Absolutely delicious; if all meats tasted as good as the veggie burgers made at Roam Artisan, the only use for cows and pigs would be as adorable pets. And the idea of that actually sounds pretty spectacular.
author: Mandy C.

description: Food was great and came out pretty quickly but hospitality was almost non existent. They had baby broccoli as a special that day and it was really good. Not what you'd expect from a burger place but definitely worth a try!
author: Katherine K.

description:
I was really craving a good burger today and the first thing that popped into my mind was Roam. My friends and I used to go here almost each week last summer.  My all time favorite burgers have to be the French and Fries, the Chalet and the Sunny Side. Today I ordered the French and Fries burger, with a side of fries and I used the house sauce as dip. The burger was delicious as always, but I felt like the dijon mustard was a little bit overpowering today.  I also ordered the seasonal soda, Blood Orange and it was so good, you have to try it before they change it again. 

I recommend trying to find a seat before you even order your food and having someone your with save it for you, because the place gets full and makes its pretty hard to find a place to eat. 

Next time I go, I will be a bit more adventurous and go for the bison.
author: Sheree C.

description: One of the best burgers I have had in a long time. This place was packed but service was fast and friendly. I had the beef pacific pastures 100% Grass-Fed classic style with zucchini onion haystack. The burger was delicious and the perfect portion. I also had a ginger lime soda that they make in house and was refreshing.
author: Danny M.

description:
R oam delivers with well-made gourmet burgers and sides
O utstanding beef patties, well-seasoned and juicy
A nd the selection of fries are tasty
M ight be a little too pricy for my liking, but the food is great

A h, the Chalet burger is very nice
R eally liked how the watercress enhances the burger
T he swiss cheese and sauce gives it a nice gooey texture
I  didn't care too much for the French and Fries burger
S tacked with Truffle Parmesan Fries, it's a cholesterolic nightmare!
A ll the fillings made the burger a bit overwhelming
N ot a bad burger to split with a friend

B unch of fry options here -- russet, sweet potato, or zucchini onion
U ndecided? Get the Fry-Fecta combo of all three
R usset Fries are your standard -- add truffle oil to enhance them
G ood Sweet Potato, but I've had better
E asily the best is the Zucchini Onion Haystack
R ight texture, right taste -- only wish it were easier to eat, though
S alted Caramel Shake is wonderful, but a bit pricy for the size
author: Anthony N.

description: Trifecta of burgers, fries, & shakes!  Lots of options, and prepare to indulge.  I no longer have the metabolism of my younger years, but I couldn't resist eating every last bite because it's oh-so-good.
author: Riz W.

description:
The tejano burger was amazing and a great combo of flavors - I was afraid it would be a little too spicy, but it was perfect.. The crispy chips gave fantastic texture, and the ranch sauce kept it sloppy and mild.

I didn't order a side dish (sigh) b/c I was by myself and thought it would be too much food (and if you knew me - you would think that was pretty funny).  But I think I coulda/ shoulda gone for it b/c even though the burgers look large, the bun and the meat are light not heavy belly bombs - if that makes any sense.

I really wanna try Umami burger this weekend so I can do a comparison without too much time going by between the two.
author: Amy W.

description: Came in here based off of the yelp reviews, and it was well worth it!! I give it 4 stars for sure!! I had the bison burger BBQ thing was so damn good and the perfect amount. The sweet potato fries were a good side order as well
author: Joseph G.

description:
great burgers ! 
sad dining room unless you manage to seat outside, so better to pick up during busy hours 
orders for pick up are hit and miss depending on who picks up the phone. some people are truly great others are quite rude and would benefit from a little training.
author: Alex D.

description:
Are you ready to embrace your inner Californian?
Roam on over to Roam for a fancy burger in a laid-back setting.
Yup, simply order at the bar, get your number, then sit back and prepare for some true Californian idealism:

I love their grass-fed beef burgers.  But you can also get free-range turkey, elk (sometimes), bison & organic veggie burgers.  Lots and lots of interesting toppings if you want to build your own (you are a unique and special avocado snowflake!)

French fries?  Sure, you can opt for the standard french fry. Ooo-rrr, you can do it Cali-style & try the parmesan truffle fries (my fave), sweet potato fries, zucchini sticks or even put the fries in the burger.  

Beverages range from wine, local beers, fancy milkshakes (salted caramel = yum!), to the homemade sodas (ginger-lime all the time!) and kombucha.

Counter servers look like they like their jobs and are sunshiny friendly for no particular reason.

Surfs up, hippies have money and it's almost Earth Day.  What're you waiting for?
author: Ravena F.

description:
hmmmm....this is a tough review for me because I LIKE the concept but there was some really GREAT food but I think I was let-down by the restaurant arrangement and fast-food like feel for gourmet burgers.

We arrived and realized this isn't a sit down spot, it's an order and find a place to sit when you have an opportunity.  We arrived at 830 and this place was packed.  We waited in a not so long line and ordered the fry-fecta and the Californian beef burger.  They gave us a # and then waited patiently for a seat....there were four of us and it looked like everyone in their seats had literally just sat down or were waiting for their food...  5 minutes.... 10 minutes.... NO SEATS OPEN!  finally after 15 minutes a couple leaves.  i'm pretty annoyed because we want to EAT! and our food is being prepared with nowhere for us to sit.  sighhhh

finally the four of us squeeze into the faily table where we're sitting in an arrangement of a parallelogram because we can't find a set of 4 seats with pairs facing each other.  it's awkward and uncomfortable which kinda ruins the entire eating experience.

butttttt if i try to ignore the service/seat yourself type environment i think that the burger was overall very hearty.  it's large, juicy and had all the toppings i was craving.  the fry-fecta was also very unique and i liked all the combos and shoving my face with fries/zucchini onion strings and sweet potato fries all at one time!

i think if they changed the restaurant seating stye i would push this place up to a 4 star.
author: Sandy L.

description: A tasty burger place. I ordered the french and fry style burger which was super juicy. I also had the fries which were pretty good but I should have had extra topping on it to make it super good. I wanted to get a milkshake but decided to get it another time when I want to bring my girlfriend. The mint chocolate milk shake looked hella good when other people were drinking it though.
author: Jason L.

description: This restaurant is amazing! I loved my burger, it was bacon patty and a lettuce wrap.  The restaurant was cozy, just the right size and, a little backround music, also the lights are just the right dimness.  The only con is there is no parking! But I would definitely recommend this place for a cozy family dinner. The fries are great, there are even sweet potato fries they are great ! I would recommend this place for someone who wants just the right amount of juiciness and skinniness (the patties are SKINNY)!  I want to come here every time I want a burger! It is an awesome place to come to so come!
author: Kirk K.

description: Really great burgers! If you have a big appetite (or are stoned) you probably need two, because the size of these burgers are between a typical burger and a slider. They may be a bit small but they pack a wallop with the taste! The fries were crispy and the drinks were tasty as well. Would recommend  One of the best burgers I've had in the city so far.
author: Bruce W.

description: Decent but not amazing. We ordered 2 Classics with cheddar (overcooked) and the fry fecta. Regular fries were good, sweet potato and haystack were cold and the haystack was frankly inedible (greasy and cold). I'd rather eat in-n-out. Would come back here if friends wanted to but for just me, I wouldn't bother.
author: Amber F.

description:
It's ok..  Definitely have had better. 

We had the "Classic", which should really be renamed AIGHT, because it was just that, alright. Patty was neither flavorful nor juicy. womp womp...
Fry-fecta - fried zucchini so thin it was only crisps, russet potatoes and sweet potatoes. Good, but kinda underwhelming with a name like that.
author: My C.

description: Roam if you want to, and you should want to.  What a difference almost a year makes.  The last time I was here in June of 2012, me and five friends walked in on a Saturday afternoon without having to wait and the place was half empty.  That's no longer the case.  Returning to the scene of the crime this past Sunday after Escape From Alcatraz tri, the joint was filled to the gills with a line of people at the counter and others just waiting to pounce on the next available spot to sit.  The word is out and Roam is really that good. I had the Chalet Burger (mushroom and swiss) again, but veggie style with Russet fries on the side and both were fabulous.  The veggie burger tasted like it had a tomato base to it, giving it an Italian meatball taste, without the meat. The fries were not greasy at all, but light and just the right crispness.  The friends I were with had eaten there for the first time the day before and were more than happy for a repeat visit before we left town.  If you're in town, give Roam a try--you won't regret it.
author: Terri C.

description: Got a recommendation from my hotel that this was a good burger joint. The classic burger I had was the best I've had for awhile. Good atmosphere and friendly staff make this the best dining experience I've had in San Francisco
author: Dakota O.

description: Just kill me and bury me in a roam burger and a Blue Apron coffee milkshake. The food is amazing and I loved the Tejano burger. The texture and crunch to it was absolutely superb.
author: Sarah Y.

description:
I have not had a better burger in San Francisco.  Perfectly cooked, juicy, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. Personally I recommend the BBQ burger, it has a wonderful compliment of flavors and at the same time the BBQ aspect of it isn't overpowering.

Do yourself a favor and make the trip to Cow Hollow.
author: Brooks J.

description:
Came for an early dinner with some friends of Mr. Piano's, and I'm happy to report that the veggie burger is confirmed egg-free and highly likely to also be vegan given its apparent complete lack of binders. (I'm a vegetarian with an egg allergy, so I only really asked about the egg content of the veggie burger.)

I got the veggie burger a la French & Fries, and probably should have realized from the price of the side of fries that this did not mean that the burger came with fries on the side, but that it came with a couple of fries jammed INSIDE it. Needless to say, I was pretty disappointed with this, as I don't enjoy fries inside of my burgers or wraps, but I ate it anyway (the patty would likely have not survived me attempting to fish the fries out of the burger in one piece), and it was pretty good overall if a little difficult to eat because it was falling apart. If a crumbling burger is the price for knowing there aren't any weird things in my food, though, I'll take it! I really wanted fries, too, but at that point I didn't want to go back and order just fries, so that will have to wait until next time. I did, however, get a kombucha with black currant, and that was pretty nice.

Let me tell you about the bathroom, though! Darkest. Bathroom. Ever. It very seriously reminded me of the photo processing dark room from a college class, and I actually accidentally turned OFF the light when I went in there because I thought that surely it was so dim in there that the actual light was not on, but sure enough, that was all the light that was provided. There weren't any dead bulbs, either! It's baffling why they'd want the bathroom to be so very dark (I mean, it's a dark colored bathroom on top of this), and the surprising darkness made me a bit nervous even though I've never had any fear of darkness before. I half expected the shady lights to flicker and maybe a monster to come oozing out of the mirror, and this was during daylight hours! It's strange and possibly suspicious to say the least, but hey, if you've got a flashlight with you or have good dark vision, you'll be fine.

The combinations of ingredients are pretty fun-sounding (as long as I get something that doesn't come with fries jammed inside of it), and I think I am definitely down to try this place again when I'm in a better mood to begin with, as trying to find parking in the vicinity to eat here left me with a splitting headache. This place is definitely okay by me!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
The Roam on Union is run by some pretty great people. And their veggie burger is absolutely tops.

My only gripe is that if you order over the phone and then get there and see this long line, you feel like a jerk cutting the line to pick up your order. They should have a sign above one of the registers that says "Pick Up Phone Orders Here."
author: Paul C.

description:
Great burgers, my favorite is the BBQ burger. Burgers are typically cooked medium-rare, which is my favorite temperature, so that's great for me. Their menu is concise and entirely delicious. Drinks are good and reasonably priced as well (whether you're going for a beer or a home made soda). Living a block away from here is difficult because ordering online and strolling over to pick up my food is way too convenient. 

Consistently good quality, recommended.
author: Lauren P.

description: I have to say, I was a bit disappointed. I had the Sunny Side with a veggie patty (and aged white cheddar, an organic free- range egg, caramelized onion, regular. And sweet chili sauce. I wanted to be wowed, but I was  only satisfied at best. The egg was cooked over hard, the burger was tasty but not very flavorful (even with hot sauce and ketchup). The veggie of the day (butternut with kale, parmesan, and pepita pesto) was quite good--the bitterness of the kale was balanced out by the perfectly-cooked squash, and the saltiness of the cheese complemented it well. The Fry-fecta was good but unremarkable. The zucchini/onion strings were hard to eat and not particularly worth it. I'm usually really into sweet potato fries, but the regular old French fries were my favorite. I had the black currant kombucha to round out my lunch, and that stuff was intense! Just the way I like it--not too sweet, pretty darn fermented. I'm up for giving Roam another try, but it certainly didn't knock my socks off...I expected a bit more.
author: Dara M.

description: I was so incredibly pleased with my experience at Roam. Love the casual, urban ambiance! Ironically, my friend & I didn't get burgers--we had the seasonal vegetables & farmer's market salad. They were both SO GOOD. The vegetables were roasted perfectly with olive oil & Parmesan cheese & basil. The salad was light & refreshing while still filling. Definitely coming back to try one of their famous burgers!!
author: Lindsey A.

description: Best $10 I've ever spent on a veggie burger ever! It's really hard to find yummy veggie burgers but this one I really loved! It's made with brown rice, quinoa, a bunch of spices and some other things but it was amaaaazing. I got it Tejano style which I loved! The jalapeño relish is soooo good. Customer service was really great here as well!
author: Cat M.

description:
I LOVE this place. The sweet potato fries are AWESOME (and I'm addicted to this fried varietal like it's crack). The veggie burger isn't one they just pick out of the freezer. It's made from delicious quinoa and is oooh soo yummy in my tummy.

The shakes..well...even if you don't like shakes you have to try the caramel sea salt one. HEAVEN! Yum.

The lack of seating plus the weird antsy feeling of "when are people leaving vs uggh, people are waiting for me to leave", kind of sucks but otherwise I love this place. Getting it to go is also a good choice!
author: Cassy R.

description:
I really like the concept of this place! Yay for grass-fed burgers. I'm normally not super picky about where my meat comes from, but these burgers were delicious! You can choose what kind of meat you want and what style...or you can build your own. 

I went here last year around the time that they opened. The owner actually came up to our table, struck up a conversation with us while we were waiting for our food, and let us sample some of the beers they had on tap! 

We also shared the fry-fecta: russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack, keyword: shared! It's huge, but a nice treat to go with your burgers.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
YUM!!! I wan't to go back to norcal just for these burgers.  I'm not the biggest fan of burgers but I enjoy a yummy cheeseburger here and there.. My friend recommended this place when we were in the bay area for the weekend.  I love their different combinations. 

I've only been there once.. and the next time i'm in the city I'll definitely stop by again if I can.. I tried the tejano and sunny side. both delicious.  They can get kind of messy though so grab some napkins!
author: Jessica H.

description:
Came here on a Wednesday evening with the boyfriend and the little brother and to my surprise this place was actually packed. Luckily a group of people were leaving so we were able to get a table! If a place is packed on a weekday evening it has to be good, right?

The menu is on the wall, you have your choice of meats and then you select a style. I went with the French and Fries with beef and a vanilla bean milkshake (milkshakes are made of organic ice cream, I believe). We didn't wait for our food for long and all of our burgers came out at the same time, thank you! I hate when someone hasn't gotten their food and you don't want to be rude, so you wait until they get theirs. -_-;; 

Now onto the star of the review, the burger! The burger was so flavorful, I can honestly say that it was the best burger I've ever had. The patty was cooked medium rare and had a very nice and juicy flavor. What added to the burger and helped set itself apart from other burgers I've had, were the truffle fries that were stuffed in between the burger. =) YUM! We also ordered the sweet potato fries, which were also very good!

The service was good, the people working that evening were friendly and polite! Something that caught my attention were the lights. Look up at the lights and look at what's surrounding the bulbs, JARS!! 

Btw, there isn't a picture of the burger because, I TOOK A HUGE BITE INTO IT WHEN IT CAME OUT and then realized I forgot to take a picture!! 
=[

I rarely give restaurants 5 stars and with that being said, like what Terminator said, "I'LL BE BACK." Soon! =)
author: Heather C.

description:
I was less impressed by the service I got at the cash register, the cashier boy was overly flirtatious to the woman who ordered in front of me, which took MY time, & when it was my turn seemed like he could care less about why I was standing there in the first place. I recognize that level of professionalism can happen anywhere & doesn't necessarily reflect the quality of the restaurant, but unfortunately that was my first experience with Roam Artisan Burger. 

I ordered an asparagus salad for some reason & it was delicious for what is was. My friend ordered a turkey burger, it was meh. I loved the hazelnut chocolate shake, very high in flavor & calories. Overall we weren't impressed, probably because of the service we received as our first impression.
author: S G.

description: Absolutely love the French & fries burger and  my fiancé can't get enough of the Chalet burger. Don't forget to wash it all down with a salted caramel shake. Yummy deliciousness!! We will be back!!
author: Charlene D.

description: My hubby and I visited San Fran in April and ate here after an unexpectedly long travel day.
