The fry-fecta is a great appetizer to share since it comes with fries, sweet potato fries and a zucchini onion haystack which is very lightly battered and shoestring style. 

Then to top it all off, I nursed my delicious Blue Bottle Coffee Milkshake which was an awesome combo of dessert and coffee. It gets a bit busy but they're pretty quick about turning orders around. If you're feeling especially adventurous, sit outside under the heated lamps and watch the ridiculous and entertaining Marina nightlife unfold before you as you tuck into your artisan meal.
author: Faith Y.

description: Delicious burgers, milkshakes & fries!  (All the healthy stuff lol) Their salads looked good, too, but I wasn't in the market for that tonight! We sat out front & our food was brought to us in no time!  We took a cheap Uber ride over, then walked around the shops on Union street after dinner.   Definitely worth it!
author: Christina M.

description: I usually am pleased with the service here that's why I go to this specific location and not the other one..  but today's experience had me scratching my head. I order my food to go then go sit on the waiting bench. Next to another white guy waiting for his food. One of the employees come bring his food right to him. Looks at me and smiles. Cool.. I wait. I wait. I wait. Then he comes running by me with a plate in his hands and see my number stand and goes "oh I left your burger there on the counter because I couldn't find you".. WHAT DA FUCK???? MIND YOU I HAVEN'T MOVED NOT ONCE SINCE I SAT MY ASS DOWN!!! SAME PLACE I WAS WHEN HIS HAPPY ASS SMILED AT ME. BULLSHIT.. my burger is FUCKING COLD BRUH!!! Debating on ever returning..
author: Deo E.

description: Yum yum yummy yum!  So good! Me lovey so so much.  I love Roam.  Everything is fantastic.  I'm not at vegetarian, but I sometimes order the veggie burger because it is delicious.  Honestly, this place is awesome!
author: Graham D.

description: Loved it. My bison burger on what bun was fantastic even enjoyed the fresh house salad with red vinaigrette dressing. Our food came out fast and correct, can't ask for much more.
author: Constantine T.

description:
I'm upset that I never came here when I lived in SF! This place is great.

Hubby & I walked in on a Friday evening to a busy place, but still had plenty of seating available. The order-taker, Paige, was totally sweet. We chatted about it being our wedding anniversary recently, and she comped one of our homemade Meyer Lemon Sodas! 

We both ordered the veggie burger w/ different toppings. The veggie burger is AMAZING. It was filling, but not heavy, it had a distinct smoke flavor, the veggies were fresh, and the bun was soft. 

We also ordered a side of Russet Fries which were the perfect combo of crisp & soft, and finger-lickin salty. 

Meyer Lemon soda was a great alternative to the sparkling water I wanted but they didn't have. Crisp & refreshing.

The best part- everything we had was vegan!!

Perfect way to end our anniversary trip :)
author: Valerie R.

description:
Had lunch with a colleague today at Roam...was in The City and couldn't stay away.

I had my perennial favorite, the Elk Burger.   While it was delish as always, I couldn't help but to notice unusually strong urine smells near the street-side of the restaurant.   I actually said something to the cashier who replied "you must be confusing it with the gas smell from melting marshmallows".     No Madame...wrong.    I have a sense of smell like a bloodhound (and a sensitive palate in tow)....I know the smell of homeless / idiot Marina punk piss.    It's nothing like petroleum exhaust....sorry.

Major turn off, hence 3 stars.
author: Max K.

description: Love the place! Everything from the set up to the food is great. Always enjoy their seasonal veggies options!
author: Sofia K.

description: Great stop to get a quick burger. I went on a Monday, so it wasn't too crowded, but still had a good number of people. The menu was simple and I ended up getting the "classic" burger with elk instead of beef. It was really good as you could tell the meat was fresh and super juicy, which would be super evident in the way the juices flowed onto my hands onto the plate. Aside from being messy it was definitely super tasty and delicious. Now I really liked the burger, but I would be just as happy if you put an in and out burger in front me of me and that is why this joint does not get the elusive fifth star. One complaint which has nothing to do with the place is that it was absolutely impossible to find parking and remember people this was a god damn monday for christ's sake. If you end up craving a burger, don't feel like paying a ton for Umami, and can actually manage to find a parking spot.. come here!
author: Mitchell L.

description: Terrible for pricing but really good for flavor. Our group was almost $100 and that didn't include drinks, we had 7 people. And 2 shared a burger. All food tasted great. The service was really good, the people are real friendly
author: Thomas P.

description:
I can't get enough of the tejano turkey burger....Its so amazing. i go here for a casual bite with friends often. Nice, clean, friendly and TASTY. 

My recommendation; TEJANO w/ TURKEY & TRUFFLE FRIESSSSSS
author: Heather H.

description:
Good food, good service however they have got to add some ventilation inside.  I was there on a warm day and it smelled like BO inside.  No fans, no air conditioning.  Definitely couldn't eat inside and fortunately found a table outside.

Please get some air inside - if you did, I'd give you 4 stars!
author: Christina B.

description: Most overlooked salad in SF, yes SALAD! Eeeeeeverything is delicious but as someone who doesn't want to eat burgers and fries every day Roam was still a regular hangout for me- Market Salad with Quinoa trio all day!
author: Jamie E.

description: Never had bison until now! I got a bison butger heritage style and wow, the burger was so juicy it literally leaked through the paper it was wrapped it! Loved the bun also. It was crispy around the edges and buttery. My mom ordered a BBQ style beef burger and that was just as good. The beef was cooked perfectly and all the flavors just were perfect. Lastly, ordered the fryfecta which included the regular seasoned fries, sweet potato fries, and the onion zuchinni haystack. Super yummy!! Definitely recommend this place
author: Holly P.

description:
I usually only eat turkey burgers when I'm feeling bad about my over-indulgent existence on this planet.  I know, drama!

But last night, I had the best turkey burger ever!  Why was it so good? 
- Probably the crunchy, truffle parmesan french fries sitting inside the burger (you may need to re-read this... I said TRUFFLE PARMESAN FRENCH FRIES).   
- Or the carmelized onions.  
- Or the fact that I felt healthy just because of the avocado and extra greens.  
- Tip: I switched the mustard for ranch.  Ooh ranch.

Love the atmosphere, decor, and staff... PLUS, it's "100% grass fed, free range, all natural"... you get the point.
author: Anh D.

description: I order the Heritage with lettuce wrap and sweet potato fries. Awesome meat! Awesome place! Awesome everything! You arrive, order and go seat where you wait for your order. Service was fast and very good!
author: Joao S.

description: Pretty darn good Burgers. I saw this place on the foodnetwork and they said this place has the best turkey burger ever. It's pretty good! Get it with fries and avocado on the burger. What's pretty cool is that they have different meats as well. Beef and lamb. I recommend this place for a causal lunch or dinner date.
author: Jesus B.

description: My friend and I were looking for a place to grab a bite to eat before heading to the beach nearby with our dogs. They offer outdoor seating with heaters so that was nice! Their offerings are pretty simple here. Choose meat from beef, turkey, bison or veggie. Then choose style of burger. They had a few choices; I got one that had fried egg and sweet chili sauce. Then you pick your bread: sesame, whole wheat or lettuce (for those watching your carb intake). I also got a cup of their house made blood orange soda, which was delicious. And my friend and I shared the fry-fecta! That was really good, and even better when sharing. Like that was not enough food, I had to go back to order a cup of blue bottle milkshake with a bruleed marshmallow. That topped it off perfectly and I left one happy camper!
author: Cindy T.

description:
Now this is what I call a burger. 

There are so many restaurants in SF which are claimed to serve the best burger in the city, and I think Roam is a true contender. The prices are decent for what you get, especially if you end up getting a specialty meat like Elk or Bison.

I got the Sunny Side Bison Burger, which is everything that I love in a burger: tender, juicy bison meat with a (must-have) sunny side egg. I forget what else was even in it, because that's all I really care about. The flavors were awesome and the runny egg yolk made every bite explode with tasty goodness.

I ordered the Fryfecta, but the cashier misheard me and I ended up with just the truffle fries. The truffle fries were okay, but I wish I got to try the sweet potato fries that everyone talks about. 

All in all, Roam is definitely one of the best burger joints I've tried in SF.
author: Roy C.

description:
I was super excited when Roam came to the neighborhood. It is always packed and must know how to read the menu before ordering. Enjoy the selections of meat (add an egg on you burger, you won't regret it!) and condiment options. My one complaint will be, the bread doesn't hold up well to a medium rare burger! You must try the trio fried basket and any house made soda. Oh, the shakes will hit the sweet tooth spot. 
It is loud and small inside, not made for a family outing. There are is a good amount of seating outside, that doesn't ease the mini chaos of noise from the inside.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I am not a Burger person but I could totally eat these Burgers everyday! I am so excited that they are opening a 2nd location just blocks away from my office... 

For all of you watching your carbs as I am often doing try getting your Burger as a lettuce wrap! It's still yummy!
author: Jamaica S.

description:
Came here after spending a bunch of money next door and still being hungry. Big success.

I had: Elk burger with truffle fries. Yummilicious. And a beer to round it up.
She had: Veggie burger on a veggie bun, which was really a lettuce leaf. She liked it until she took a bite of mine, and then she understood that I had won.
We shared: Fryfecta. All 3 kinds of fries (potato, sweet potato and onions) in a plate. Great idea!
author: Pablo D.

description:
Roam got a visit from the San Francisco Burger Blog:

http://sanfranciscoburgerblog.tumblr.com/

Roam is doing a great job of making awesome, affordable burgers that taste amazing, with some fresh, quality ingredients that don't feel like you're slumming by eating it. Go! Eat there!
author: Drew H.

description:
I was here today, around 6:00 pm, and it was packed to the gills!   It was probably that the second semifinal football game was on, Pats vs. Ravens.  Anyway, I gave my friend my order and then hover and manage to snag a small table for the three of us a few minutes later when a lady and her kid got up.  She was very nice about it too and I tried my darnedest not to look at the table like a hungry wolf. 

We sat down and the food came back shortly, delivered on a plate in a paper wrapper for the burgers or in a little metal basket for the single order of fries.  The burgers are certainly a good size, and the fries are a standard size portion.  I got a heritage burger or such which was bacon, cheese, lettuce, tomato and I can't remember what else.  I scarfed that thing down though and it was a nice burger.

The menu is burgers, fries, and drinks.  There is 100% grass fed beef, bison, and two other choices I didn't really look at, I think chicken and something.   You can choose among the classic, some other options, or build your own burger.  You order and pay then they give you a number.

The inside is clean with a modern but homey look in that the tables as in the tables and chairs are simple.  There is a bar made of California walnut at the bar!  The owner happened to be there as I was admiring the wood and chatted up my friend and I a little bit.  She told us about the establishment and the wood used to make the bar, neat!  She also said they just opened a new Roam.

The only thing to ding the place on was the crowd.  However, I bet just about every other night it would be fine.  This night when the 49ers were playing it was a bit crazy.
author: Lisa R.

description: Great Lunch! Everything was perfect. People are kind and very efficient. Drinks are prepared with chemist precision .
author: Manny G.

description: First time here. I'd read some good reviews and they were correct. We got our food to go and had to walk a few blocks in the evening. This let the fries get a bit cold but the burgers were well wrapped and held their temperature better. The burgers were very tasty. Loved the carmellized onions and you get really tasty bacon flavour from the first bite to the last. Give it a try.
author: Dale S.

description:
I'm conflicted about this place.

The setup, decorations, and seating are all good; the service was quite good overall, and the food was excellent.  I chose the basic burger with a lettuce wrap instead of either bread choice.  Everything about the burger was great starting with the meat being tasty and properly cooked.  The sauce, greens, and other veggies included were all a perfect match and very fresh.  On the surface this is a top eating experience that is quick for a fast meal and has enough space for a small gathering.

Because I come across as very gay how people react to me is kind of a test.  After serving me the chef told the waiter near the kitchen door that when he came out with a lettuce wrapped burger and looked up he immediately knew who had ordered.  Big laughs for all.  The faggot ordered his burger wrapped in lettuce, get it?  This is the kind of thing that other diners might miss, but it gets so tiring.  Like they couldn't have waited a couple of minutes or gone behind the little swinging door?

This is going a bit off the deep end, but arguably this attitude is endemic in this neighborhood which is not exactly the most diverse place in the whole city.  Mileage will definately vary there.

Anyway, awesome top-notch burgers, but the staff may not acknowledge the value of being nice to fops so be careful eating here while blatantly gay.  You have been warned.
author: Christian M.

description: Burger was not worth the $13 or the wait. Two bites into eating my burger, it fell apart. Would not recommend this place at all
author: Hannah R.

description:
So I went here after visiting the Union Street Festival yesterday. A friend of mine had gone there before so we went yesterday so I could experience this place. Since I have been a pescatarian for the past 3 years and having just returned to chicken in the last three months, I wasn't exactly sure how I would do at a Burger joint, but you know me... I try anything once.. possibly twice ;-)


First thing I thought was rather cool was the menu style. You choose your meat, then the styling of your burger, and any additional sides. I ordered the Turkey burger "Classic Style" and ordered Cremini Mushrooms and aged White cheddar. I also order their "house sauce on the side". 

Another thing I thought was a plus was when I said I wanted water, they let me know there was water in the condiment area. When I went over there they had stacks of full sized pint glasses and a large barrel of water sitting in ice. It looked so refreshing and cold! I also like that they gave me a glass and didnt subject me to plastic cups as most places do. 

The food came out fairly quick and the burger was amazing! I didnt feel super heavy afterwards and the flavor was delish! My friend ordered the chocolate shake and was in Heaven. Everyone seemed to really enjoy their burgers!

The only reason for 4 stars is the seating arrangement is VERY uncomfortable. In order to maximize serving capacity, there is hardly no room and too many tables. With me being almost 6 foot tall, I kept getting bumped, pushed, and I couldnt even get close to the table and had my knees all over the other people dining with me! (Good thing they were gorgeous so it wasn't too inconvenient :-)  )  

Other than that, great place, good food, great patrons!
author: Joy W.

description:
In the immortal words of Samuel L Jackson:
"Now that is a tasty burger!"
Also the shakes are great.
author: Dan M.

description:
Want a quick burger? Get it a Roam. Good artisan burgers with rapid fast service. The price is just a little high but the quality of food makes up for it. The buffalo is not worth it and little too lean. Love the ambience.

Docking off one star because it could just be a little cheaper.
author: Christopher K.

description:
I have been for a place with organic burger and BEER for a long time. 
I am so glad I found you ROAM. I love their burgers, and the options (lots of them). Another thing I love is their sampler fries, the sweet potato so good, and the zucchini is as good and the portion is really good. We shared. But the best thing I love about this place is that they have organic beer, I love beer with burger and now I can get both of them organic. The seating area is very good, and lots of napkins.
author: Nina Z.

description:
Amazing veggie burger! Very unique patty, quinoa?! delicious! This place has been feeding me dinner on Sunday evenings for the past month, will this become the norm?! 

my friend who loves a traditional beef burger prefers the quinoa burger hands down any day!
author: Kiran J.

description:
I went back again recently and they've fixed the slow kitchen problem! Yay!

Now the only drawback is that everyone else has figured out how awesome they are and now it's that much harder to snag a table.
author: Dani D.

description:
If you're like me, and hamburgers are your pass-time, then Roam Artisan Burgers is a MUST-GO spot for you!

Very artsy pub-style burger joint with the cashier situated directly in front of you when you walk in. The menu is on the right hand wall and the chic spot offers a whole bunch of different creative burgers with a variety of meats including beef, turkey, bison, and veggie. For me, it was a tough pick between the Pacific Blue (bleu cheese burger) and the Tejano (jalapeno-infused burger) with beef. I ended up getting the Tejano, which was a nice burger with avocado, jalapeno relish, pepperjack cheese, and crispy white corn stripes (similar to fritos but not as hard). It was a very delicious burger that isn't like anything I've ever tasted before-- crunchy but not too hard and needless to say, very VERY flavorful. Definitely coming back to try the bleu cheese offering next time. You can also design your own burger which is nice but I figured I would just leave the burger-crafting up to the professionals.

We also got the Fry-Fecta which comes with the zucchini onion stack, fries, and sweet potato fries. The seasoning on the sides were a little salty but I'd probably still eat it if it were in front of me right now.

Bottom line: Great neighborhood burger joint with a unique twist to some classic burgers and sides. Already planning my next excuse to come out here to try some more.
author: Jerry Y.

description:
Not bad but not entirely impressed. Maybe this review is slightly bias b/c I wasn't too hungry. I ordered the beef with some heritage combination? It was alright. I think they had some ranch sauce, cheese with bacon strips (my usual order). It was good but it wasn't like WOOOW! 

Will I come back? Maybe.
author: Lily W.

description:
Four of us went to Roam last night to check out the burgers.

Short story: We all had really great burgers. They weren't the BEST burgers we've ever had before, but they were definitely above average. I would put them on par with the burgers from Barney's, which is actually not too far from Roam.

For sides, you can get fries, sweet potato fries, or a "zucchini onion haystack." If you're awesome, like we are, then you can get the fry-fecta, a combo of all of the above. We got the fry-fecta, but the zucchini onion haystack is probably the dumbest item I have ever ordered at a restaurant. It's impossible to eat, has no taste, and crumbles in your hands. Skip that. But the sweet potato fries were good... Also, I like that you can pick your patty: bison, beef, turkey, or veg. As a last negative, I don't like their indie cola bottle thing they serve. It didn't taste as good as Coke, and I probably paid 50% more than I would have for a normal brand.

Negativity aside, the burger was delicious. Skip the fry-fecta. Enjoy.
author: Kevin H.

description:
UPDATE: I went again, ordered the beef burger rather than the bison burger, and... It was delicious. No complaints about the taste, great burger. It's still more expensive than I'd expect, but my only advice would be to avoid the bison and you'll have a great burger.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:
Let's go over the good points first: The fries were pretty awesome.

The downsides far outweigh that, however. I paid $17 for a bison bacon cheeseburger and fries. They didn't ask how I wanted it cooked (bad sign), and for the price, I was expecting a good-sized burger. What I got was barely larger than a fast food burger, with a generic, meh-tasting bun. I like a dripping pink bison burger cooked medium, and this did not taste like bison. Frankly, the meat tasted like frozen cafeteria hamburger. It had that weird twinge you get from the frostbitten patty you forgot about in the back of your freezer. You know, the one you regretfully turn to on a night you're too lazy to get take-out and you're out of better options, like cereal.

On top of that, they charged me for the bacon part of the bacon cheeseburger, but failed to put the bacon ON the burger. That's a pretty important component of a bacon cheeseburger.

UPDATE: I had reached out to Roam about my experience, and they have handled it very professionally. I'll give it another try, and update my review if it's a different story now.
author: Andy R.

description:
Tried the sunny side and the pacific blue burger. Both were okay and the meat was cooked well but the buns were a tad soggy. I liked my side more than my burger. I got the fry-fecta - a combo of russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini strings, and it was delicious. It was also a good size and would be enough to share with 1 or 2 people. I also enjoyed my salted caramel shake with a bruleed marshmallow on top. It was quite tasty and I'm glad I splurged to get the marshmallow but then the total was $5.99 for only 12 oz.

If I enjoyed my burger as much as my sides or everything was a little cheaper, I would bump this up to a 4.
author: Alice J.

description:
Maybe I ordered the wrong thing off the menu. I got a BBQ Beef Burger and was overall unimpressed. I tried what others ordered and surprisingly the Tejano Turkey Burger which was A LOT tastier. But I only got a bite and was stuck with my burger. 

The one dish that everyone was right to recommend was the FRY-FECTA. A bowl of the house fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini onion strings! For the 4 of us, we had two orders of these and that didn't even seem like it was enough. 

Let's hope they don't disappoint on a future visit.
____
Jan '12 Health Score - 89
For larger parties dining in, you're at the mercy of the diners before you. If they outstay their welcome and decide to continue their conversation while noticing there's a line of paid customers all waiting to sit, you can't do much but have an internal tantrum.
author: Dennis L.

description:
This could be a great burger joint although the burgers suck. 

I went here on a weekday in the late afternoon and was delighted by the disproportionate amount of cute blond girls. I made my way up to the counter and was looking forward to a great burger. 

I ordered a burger with house sauce, pepper jack on a whole grain bun. I was asked if I wanted it "pink" or not. I like the pink and was looking forward to a tasty burger. It wasn't even moist, it was dry and boring. If not for the high quality beef and great sauce there would be no reason to go back. 

The kind woman behind the counter deserves three stars and the appearance of the restaurant is great but they don't know how to cook, yet. I'll be back in a few months.
author: Justin S.

description:
Say hello to Burgermeister's fancier Marina cousin - and I say that in a very good way.  Both make damn good burgers, but like a stereotypical Marina girl, Roam really gilds the lily.  (Unlike a stereotypical Marina girl, however, there's a lot of substance to these burgers and they don't bleat, "I'm soooooo drunk!" every five seconds.)

The burgers here are solid and satisfying, but with more options, including elk and bison burgers.  For an extra 75 cents, you can flavor your fries with truffle and parmesan or maple chipotle (both excellent).  I'm partial to the Heritage burger ($7.99), with butter lettuce, fontina, bacon, herb mayo, and caramelized onions. 

Everything tastes fresh and it's hard to stop eating when you're full.  Just one more bite...
author: Jennie K.

description: I have to admit that I was rather disappointed by the place. I had the classic burger with Gruyere and shared a Fry-Fecta. The burger was average. The bun was a bit too dense and the meat not all that juicy. Honestly, I can't tell the difference between this and a burger at a random fast food place. As for the fries, I've had much better and they didn't taste very fresh. The ginger-lime soda was good though. Might go back and try their shakes since it's what all the other reviewer rave about.
author: Alice W.

description:
They say that everything they have there is organic.
I really liked the food there and thought the prices are fair.

Try the Tejano, it tastes better than it looks
author: Mohammad A.

description: Very impressed.  I love a good burger as much as the next guy.  This place really steps it up a notch.  Offering not only beef burgers but also Bison & Elk.  Wife and I both had the Elk Bbq and it was very juicy and super tasty.  Elk meat seems to have much lighter flavorful taste than the beef.  Easy to miss but worth the stop.
author: DAve W.

description: Was flipping channels yesterday and saw this place on "Best Burgers". They highlighted the turkey burger with the French and fry toppings. The place looked good and the burger looked amazing. Since we were in the city today for something else, my hubby surprised us by parking on Union and telling us we were going to try Roam. Menu is simple - pick your meat, toppings etc. hubby has the bison French and fry, daughter had the turkey French and fry and I just had the original beef burger with cheese. 2 orders of their truffle parm fries and 3 milkshakes (hey when in Roam!) everything tastes very fresh and healthier than your normal burger joint but it still wasn't anything to really write home about. Best thing I ate was the Brûlée marshmallow on top of my milkshake! And then to top it all of with a $70 price tag makes me think I can wait a while before we go back.
author: G R.

description: Super friendly staff, super delicious grass-fed burgers, and yummy non-gmo rice-oil fried fries. I love the Tijano burger (although I personally don't like pickles so gotta eliminate the relish). Their hot sauce is also amazing. The homemade shakes are crazy yum. They use real salted caramel from bi-rite so you know it's gonna be good. I am now addicted to burgers and shakes now, which was not part of my New Years resolution.
author: Joy C.

description:
I work out at the Crunch a few spaces down from Roam, and over the past few weeks I had noticed a lot of people coming in and out, so I realized it was open :) 

I honestly had no idea what kind of restaurant it was (honestly, by the name and heavy use of the color red I thought it was an Italian restaurant), but one day after a workout I decided to walk by and check it out. The first thing I noticed was everything on the menu was VERY reasonably priced. I also liked the fact that the menu is generally pretty simple (burgers, fries, shakes, sodas), but for what they do offer there's a variety. 

I got a to-go order and I went with the Tejano burger, which has pepper-jack cheese, avocado & jalapeno relish as well as the zucchini onion haystack (yes...I chose this over the fries because even though they were still fried I told myself i was eating "vegetables"...lame I know). The burger was fantastic! Great flavor and cooked perfectly!  I didn't notice on the menu how big the burgers were before I ordered, but I figured at $6.99 at a "fancy" burger place I was gonna be getting something slightly bigger than a slider. Not the case. The burger was good size and had lots of goodies on it! 

I really liked the taste of the zucchini onion haystack, but I really wasn't sure how to eat it. It comes in smaller pieces so it's a little difficult to eat with your hands...next time I'll use a fork...or try the sweet potato fries! 

A couple things that I wanna try the next time I'm here (and there certainly will be a next time) are the artisan sodas (the prickly pear & pineapple sound intriguing) as well as some of the shakes! 

I got a to-go order and considering the place was busy, I didn't have to wait terribly long. This seems like a great place to dine in before going out the bars for the night (they serve beer & wine as well)!
author: George A.

description: chalkboard menu...short saturday lunch line...counter order and take a number....classic burger $five.ninety-nine, beer $six and wine $six.seventy-five...self seating and waiting...burger delivery...nice fluffy sesame bun...but, bit too much bun?...two top buns!....bun to meat ratio heavy on the bun...i like big buns and I cannot lie...you other brothers can't deny...that when a burger comes in with an itty bitty patty...and, a round thing in your face...i can't stop staring...where's the beef?...sip of wine to fill...a standard pour third glass...no luck in gluttony...stealing few fries to fill...wasn't sprung on roam artisan burger...
author: Hen A.

description:
Amazing burgers!!! I'm a vegetarian so I should also say they have amazing veggie burgers. My boyfriend has tried multiple of the real burgers and he raves they are delicious. 

This place is on the other side of San Francisco from where I live but it is well worth the long bus ride to get here. My favorite burger is the Tejano burger. The Fry-fecta is delicious and I love the variety (can be shared between 2 people). The milkshakes are very good and made with quality ice cream from a farm that treats animals very well. 

You should definitely try this place!
author: Saralee L.

description: I know they close at 10:00 so I did my best to make it there in time.  And I did, 9:58.  I tell the girl I want to order a burger to go.  She says they are closed.  So I say, it is not 10:00 yet.  She says, yeah but I already closed my register.  By that, she agreed it was not yet 10:00 and admitted to closing early.  I went the opposite direction from going home to make a stop there.  What a waste of time.
author: Henry C.

description:
Roam slings some very good burgers. Thick, juicy and messy with tons of options, assuming you can navigate the menu in time to place your order. First timers to the restaurant, like me, may feel a tad overwhelmed.

The place was packed when we went there with a young and hip crowd. The seats turnover fairly quickly, though, so the wait won't be too bad.

Roam has a decent beer selection too...for San Francisco.
author: Matthew W.

description: Had a hankering for a burger after I worked out. Granted I shouldn't have eaten a 2800 calorie burger after burned only 150, the taste was worth it. I added an egg cause it sounded like a good idea. It was.
author: John B.

description:
One of my new favorites in the city. Really, really great, high-quality burgers and fries. I have nothing bad to say about Roam and am so happy that they're opening a 2nd location on Fillmore in the summer 2012! Can't wait.

Styles of burger to try:

French and Fries (w/ Parmesan truffle fries, avocado and caramelized onions) $7.99
Hickory (w/ bacon, caramelized onions) $7.99
Build Your Own starting at $5.99

Sides:
Fry-fecta (regular fries, sweet potato fries and fried zucchini strings) AMAZING 

I can only vouch for the beef and veggie patties but both were amazing. The beef was perfectly cooked and juicy. They also have bison, elk and turkey burgers. The buns are soft but don't fall apart. 

Ordering is easy - walk in, look at the menu, order at the register, grab a # and find a table. Service is quick and tables turn over fairly quickly.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: I feel like this is a knock off version of Super Duper burgers. Except their burgers are thinner, and less favorable. Only if I try my hardest to taste the turkey burger I had, I can sense a hint of turkey. I guess the plus is that its healthy. But the burgers are kind of small and not that filling but is pricier as well? But this is a good review. I would come back , just not frequently.
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description: I stopped by here tonight for the first time with a friend. I wanted to go to Umami but she said I should give Roam a try. I got a classic cheeseburger and was pretty impressed. The meat is organic 100% grass fed and you can tell by the taste. It just has a really nice, crisp, clean taste to it. The servers were really cool and friendly. Overall I really enjoyed the place. I'll probably come back again and try out a different kind of meat, as they have a pretty wide variety to choose from, including elk and bison.
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
I really liked be able to choose the kind of meat, bread and all the ingredients that you want in it. The place was crowded and noisy but at least the service was good and quick. The price was fair, so I believe it's a good place to try at some point.

Overall, I was happy with the burger but not too good enough to make me become their regula
author: Inma R.

description:
I am addicted to this place and really don't enjoy any other burger at this point.  They just seem to get it perfect.  I really enjoy their milkshakes and sweet potato fries.  I tried the fryfecta last time but couldn't finish it.

I can easily eat a burger by myself but have also split one on occasion and found it sufficient.  Hmm, might have to go tonight...
author: Jennie M.

description:
LOVE the gluten free buns and beer! Hat's off to Josh for helping us allergy peeps here in the Marina! 
Always friendly staff with lots of smiles! Also love the fact that I can sit out on the patio with my dog- they even bring him water!
author: Jeanette L.

description: Great place. Stopped in because we were in the neighborhood. Great custom fries and burgers
author: Jacqt B.

description: I really liked this place. I loved the options of protein and the burgers were yummy!
author: Mona R.

description:
Seating can be a premium. I came in on a Tuesday night and actually saw one couple who had received their food, except they were still standing looking for a seat holding their order number placard. Thankfully we were able to nab seats quickly after ordering, but I can see it being a problem during high traffic hours.

I got a french and fries (fries in the burger, gruyere, dijon mustard) in a lettuce wrap, my accomplice got a sunny side (fried egg, sweet chili sauce), and we shared a fry-fecta.

The burgers were delish. Not earth shattering, but tasty and really satisfying. Cooked at a perfect medium rare. Ask for more well-done, we didn't specify and got a bit of pink in our burgers. Made from high quality ingredients, and you can tell. Rather messy, so be prepared. Definitely hit the spot. Would like to go back to try the bison (+$3) and the elk (+$2).

The fry-fecta was interesting. The original fries were good. The sweet potatoes fries were great. And the onion/zucchini strings were excellent, although I don't know if I could have gone with an order exclusively of them. Definitely very tasty.

I'm between a four- and five-star rating for this place. It'll require additional research.
author: David C.

description:
" I wasn't two bites into Heritage $7.99 when I realized Roam nailed it. 
What got us into the mess we're in today, the worst burger since the Great 50's, is the same grotesque capitalism cum corruption we shoved down the throat of the Third World since the end of World War II. (Yes, the Third World's elites were cheerfully corrupted.)

We, and the rest of the West, learned the trick of selling unneeded infrastructure, poor-services, Monsanto's growth hormoned beef--stuff that could never benefit anyone other than the people who lined their pockets. And yes, Perkins is right, the international economists and press were handmaidens to the thievery."

OK, I give up, this is a copy from Robert Baer Reviews Hoodwinked. 
I used his line because it sounds like mcdonalds in Japan and China.

Btw, let's talk about the burger.

The juicy burger patty cooked perfectly, doesn't need any seasoning
To me, good burger have to be simple
If you need seasoning, it's not a good meat
Great sesame bun, love it
Smoked Bacon was thick, crispy
Fontina was a great supporting, it wasn't over powering

Butter Lettuce was layered so nicely, I felt great sharp crunches threw the great juicy burger for every single bite.
 
Fresh Tomato
Caramelized Onions and Herb Mayo was giving good kick to the last bite

What a KickAss Burger!
I was lovin' it.

Good service.
I like the reasonable pricing.
2 bathrooms, super clean.

I've heard about the Shake.
*SALTED CARAMEL SHAKE w/ Bruléed Marshmallow, $4.99 + $1 Bruleed Marshmallow
Sounds so good, I wanted it so badly.
But I couldn't.
Only because, even though fat free, I have be a good shape to have that because i am so sure that it will be a big A bomb for my stomach, gets instant #-2, right there on the table, I mean, I don't think I can make it to men's room.

I'll be back to have the Sunny Side and the shake, and bring a porta potty right next to me.

I wonder why 2 bathrooms.
author: Nobu K.

description: Great burgers, although a bit on the soggy side. May be hard to find seating during busy hours. Some of the tables are a bit wobbly which can be annoying.
author: Moby K.

description: Had two beef burgers, one Classic & one Sunny side - both very fresh and filling! Absolutely delicious. Paired them with Russet Fries with Parmesan cheese dusted throughout. Pretty good!, nothing crazy special. For drinks we got the Ginger Lime soda. To die for!!! And an eggnog shake. It was the perfect blend of spices and creaminess! Will come back when again when visiting the city.
author: Nicole B.

description:
My boyfriend and I cannot get enough of this place. Very high quality ingredients and ORGANIC! We come here at least once every two weeks. The fry fecta and milkshakes are a MUST. 

...I'm drooling just thinking about it:p
author: Cris R.

description: I really liked the options here, the space, the price. The whole shabang was great. It was nicer and better than Super Duper. Bison, baby: double the protein, half the fat!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Been to ROAM quite a few times now and have always enjoyed my meals there.  I cannot say I ever enjoy my hike up Gough back to Pacific Heights afterwards, a telltale sign that the food filling and always satisfies.

This place has good variety in their burger menu (including a make-your-own-burger option), TVs (so you don't have to miss the game ... although I probably wouldn't come here with the explicit purpose of watching a sporting event), and awesome sweet potato fries.  I have not tried their milkshakes but friends who have do rave about them.  

The place is pretty casual but I mean it's Union St so occasionally you're of course gonna see some girls dressed to the nines.  I'm not sure what an artisan burger is exactly but the name alone makes it seem a little more classy than whatever you'd find at like a Johnny Rockets.  The space is kind of small but I can't remember ever having  to wait for a table (they have a few big communal tables, which is always kind of fun) and they have outdoor seating as well, I believe with heaters.  

I like a lot of the establishments on Union in theory, but sometimes the crowd gets a little too yuppie / bro / douchetastic / [fill in adjective here to describe the atmosphere we both know all too well] for my taste.  ROAM benefits from (a) being a little farther east and (b) not having become a bar in earnest.  They serve alcohol, but to me it's always a restaurant (ie unlike its next-door neighbor Brick Yard, I wouldn't ever go here just to drink).  I find this refreshing about ROAM.
author: Molly B.

description: Came because Gamine was packed and we were much too hungry to wait 1.5 hours.. But this place was def already on our radar. There was a constant stream of ppl through the doors and we were lucky to snag a table outside. I got the French and fries burger -- juicy, flavorful, oh so tasty! Wish it were just a little bigger maybe, would recommend getting one of their interesting sides for sure to supplement.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Meat eaters: everyone seemed to be raving about their burgers; bison, turkey, or beef - have at it. 

Vegetarians/Vegans: per the menu, house-made veggie burgers are organic, gluten free and vegan. They just failed to mention that you should run the f*ck away. Their veggie burger was the ickiest, slimiest, piece of crap I've ever tasted. And... it wasn't cheap! 

Possible redeeming quality; they had this zucchini onion haystack that was awesome (and the only thing I could eat since I tossed the pink chunks of what was supposed to be my meal). Also, the Boylan diet soda kicked ass. 

I'm giving a 3 since I know their main clientele isn't vegetarians. It's just too bad they offer us something so inedible.
author: Heather H.

description:
No line...no waiting...wait!  They had to wait for us to s-l-o-w-l-y give them our order for 4.... :-)

The 2 gentlemen were great...but then, we've never had a bad burger here...

Red raspberry soda was yummy...better than my meyer lemon...next time...
author: Barb L.

description:
The title of "best burgers" by Zagat is a high expectation to live up to. And it definitely is! 

Firstly, ALL the burgers are good. Just read the description and order to your heart's content. I had about half of the burgers on the menu. 

Second, go for the Zuchini ring or the regular fries. The sweet potato fries are no big deal. 

Overall the food is very fresh. The meat in the burgers are of highest quality and you can really tell! Not to mention all the other ingredients and stuff that come along with it. Even their ketchup and hot sauce taste better! 

I've tried Umami Burger and 4505 Meats, but Roam still has these guys beat by a good margin. Next is Super Duper!
author: Justin L.

description:
I like their burgers....good juicy...great tasting....actually...I almost feel guilty but I keep coming back...hmmm....
Sometimes the staff is a bit moody...but I am not a stickler to customer service unless someone is rude....I like their non commercial sodas...nice change!
author: Alex W.

description: The Tejano was delicious! I was very pleasantly surprised by the white corn strips they were a great pair with the ripe avocado. This was one hell of a burger! The truffle & parmesan russet potato fries were yummy, but a tad too truffle-ly. Not enough to stop me from chowing down! My boyfriend got the Sunny-side with a bison party which looked great, but I didn't try a bite because I was in love with the Tejano I ordered!
author: Navjot K.

description:
To all the men in my life (and some women) who complain about how slow I eat - I say HA!

Yesterday, I was in and out of here in 30 minutes!  And I ate EVERYTHING!

Yesterday was 'Rents Day for me, and as we sojourned to the Frisco Cow Hollow area, Pappy started whining about hamburgers.  He wanted McDonald's.  I thought in my head "Hell naw!", and luckily Mama Yow decided to treck along Union Street for a burger joint instead of walking all the way to the wharf for bad fast food.  We happened upon Roam, and so happy that we did!

The prices were reasonable, the decor quaint, the servers wonderful, expedient and smiling.  And the food - DELISH!  I swear to you that I scarfed my burger down in no time flat.  There was no time for talking here, else my food might run off.  Mumsey and I got the classic, sans cheese, and Pappy got the same with.  We all loved our burgers from first bite; even Paps said it was really good, and he's hard to please sometimes.  Perfectly sized, the meat was masterfully seared, and the buns were tasty.  The fries were superbly prepared and extremely tasty too.  What's more, they have Anchor Steam on tap.  What simple city girl would not love this eatery?

The only downside is finding a place to sit if you're a party of more than two.  Should I ever find myself in the neighbourhood again, I'm going back.  Yum-o!
author: Lorrayne L.

description:
After finding this restaurant listed in a "top San Francisco restaurants" article, and reading a few Yelp reviews, I decided to check it out. I was in a major burger mood today, and I was majorly hungry.

I got the beef BBQ burger. I asked for the burger to be medium; it came out somewhere between rare & medium rare. VERY pink. I prefer little to no pink in a burger. This was a big turn off for me. The BBQ sauce was so lightly flavorful, and the other flavors of this burger worked so well together, I was pleasantly surprised. But IMO unless you're at a top tier restaurant, eating raw meats is pretty unsafe. And especially meats like turkey, bison, & elk that are served here, these need to be cooked through to kill off any bugs. I try not to eat raw meat very often. Carpaccio at a good Italian restaurant is one rare exception. And I'll eat a medium-rare steak on occasion at a really good steak house. And sushi. Other than that, I try to cook everything thoroughly.

The Fry-Fecta (great name) gave me a chance to sample their different fries. I liked the sweet potato fries. The zucchini onion haystack had a very nice flavor, thinly cut spirals of fried veggies, gently crunchy on the outside, sweet & soft on the inside. The russet fries are what you're used to. The diced parsley gave a nice color & fresh taste & aroma to the whole bowl of fries.

I tried the mint chocolate chip shake w/bruleed marshmallow. The shake was relatively thin (I wish it was thicker; maybe a frozen glass/mug or some cream would help?), but tasty, & the tiny chocolate bits sprinkled over the top were quite good. And the bruleed marshmallow was a great touch. A marshmallow braised over the top of a triangular cookie of some type. This worked really well with the shake. I ate that first actually.

I also got an agave soda. It's effectively an italian soda. A unique flavor. It wasn't amazing, but good.

The restaurant was busy when I got there, but the waitstaff quickly worked through the line. The server quickly brought my drinks, then my food.

I understand that the restaurant is using a lot of sustainable ingredients, which I'm all for, that's part of the reason I decided to try it out. And the price of each individual item seems reasonable. But it's amazing how fast you can blast through $26 in this place.

This is a good restaurant. It's not a great restaurant. I wasn't blown away. I think I was most disappointed over their glossing over how I wanted my burger cooked. If you are the type of person who would get angry & return your food over something like that, then this is not the restaurant for you.

Usually I have an easier time reviewing restaurants than this. Either a restaurant is great no matter the cost, or good for the value, or bad for the value, or just straight out bad food. It's not great, and it's not bad, so I can axe out those two. I think the problem is, do I feel I got a good meal? Other than the burger not being cooked the way I wanted, yes. Do I feel I overpaid? Yes. I feel I ate a good meal, just not a $26 one. I know the value of a dollar, I know how long I have to work to earn one. I'm not wowed by what I just ate for the money I spent. I don't mind paying a lot for a great meal, I just don't think this was it.

BTW, this part of SF has a lot of stores, bars, and food, and lots of people walking around. It's fun for people watching, but parking is a PITA.

I'm on the fence about this place.
author: Adam M.

description:
I went here with some co-workers a few weeks ago and it was gooooo-oooood. I'm not the biggest fan of the Marina but I will definitely come back just so I can eat another burger. I ordered the Chalet (Swiss cheese, Cremini Mushrooms, Tomatoes, and Watercress) with turkey and it was probably the best turkey burger I've ever eaten. It was juicy, flavorful, and filling! 

I took off one star because I'm not a fan of having to order fries in addition to your burger. Price wise the burgers are about $8+ which is definitely not bad for these gourmet bad boys. Oh and they were just featured in Zagat's Top 10 SF Burgers which is pretty rad!!
author: Grace C.

description: Love the French and Fries with a veggie patty.  The shakes are incredible as well!
author: Rachel B.

description:
The burger is "A-OK". 
The people were very nice.
I will definitely come back. 

A little more detailed:

I like to keep it simple the first time I try a burger place so I just ordered a burger with mayo and swiss. I figured I judge a burger the way it is first and not with all the fancy stuff on it. The burger was mediocre and I didn't find it very special. The people there were very nice. My ordered got lost, but afterwards, they brought me out my burger right away and the lady (maybe the manager?) gave me a $10 gift card which was extremely nice of her! 

I will definitely come back to try this place again and load my burger with toppings next time and update my review.
author: Jeff C.

description:
This place is pretty good. I came here with a group of friends before getting ready for the 49ers game. Cool types of burgers, including bison, and decent prices.

I just got a regular burger. It was delicious, haha. Perfectly cooked meat, and they have a great house sauce. We as a group also had the truffle french fries and the sweet potato fries, both of which were absolutely delicious. I would definitely come back here again.
author: Tiffany C.

description: They have really won back my loyalty. Have eaten a bunch more times and it's been super fresh. I'm a fan and will be back.
author: Eric M.

description:
This place is amazing!

I love how you can get exactly what you want and aren't limited on toppings because you want a veggie burger!

Just a heads up - the veggie burger is red with quinoa.  It looks a little like raw beef so may throw you off!

I ordered the veggie burger tejano style ( jalapeno relish, avocado, tomato, white corn strips, and herb ranch) and I can't wait to go back to get it again!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
One of the best burger joints in my opinion. The menu is on the wall and you can choose to make your own burger and toppings or choose some of the delicious presets. They also have salads as an option if you don't want to eat a burger. There are interesting choices of meat on the menu like elk and bison. They cost extra and honestly both taste like beef. I mean, the only reason I would order those options is to say "hey guys, I ate an elk for dinner." I had the french and fries while my friends got the heritage and the sunny side burger. Everyone liked it, especially me. Oh, the truffle parmesan fries were unfortunately forgettable.

Don't miss out on their milkshakes. If you feel like spending the extra dollar, I think you should get the brulee'd marshmallow (+$1) to supplement your overpriced milkshake ($5 for 12oz or $6.50 for 16oz!!!). Super sweet milkshake but unbelievably tasty. The marshmallow was amazing and it sits on a delicious and flaky wafer. 

Ended up spending like $17 bucks on myself but it was an experience. Cheap for just a burger, expensive when you add anything else. Still freakin amazing though.
author: Ryan L.

description:
The fries were the saving grace of my meal at Roam. Roam...grass fed beef, how cute. 
You order and get a number. Then you wait for your drinks? Refills? Not a chance. 
But the burger...well it was rare. It was not medium or medium-well. It was red all the way through except the outer layer, and even it was gray at best.  I thought about returning it, but it was crowded and unless I wanted to speak with a bus boy, or the person taking orders (and deal with a line) there was really no recourse. 
Also, a top notch burger place should grind their own beef. My patty was machine formed for sure. It looked like an Omaha Beef burger. 
There is NO way this is a four star restaurant. 
If you go there, tell them how you want your burger cooked!
author: Billy F.

description:
It was a choice between Roam & Brick Yard for an afternoon rendezvous with my tummy...  I went with Roam burger as soon as I saw their french fry menu.  

I ordered the parmesan truffle oil french fries and complemented that with a classic burger with grilled onions, cheddar cheese, and a "please hold the pickles" request.  

OMG!!  The burger was so juicy.  The bread was nice and fluffy and it soaked up all the flavor, but stayed completely in tack for the duration of my meal.  I enjoyed every single bite of the burger and every last piece of the fries.  The other burgers that sat around me looked just as yummy.  

That saying that Carls Junior uses.. "If it doesn't get all over the face, then it doesn't belong in your face".. Man, this stuff does that saying justice.  

Perfect portions.  I was fully satisfied.  Oh!  And they also make housemade sodas.  I'm not into the carbonated beverage kick, but the person next to me was enjoying their blueberry soda very much!
author: irene u.

description:
One of the crowdest burger place i've ever been to. says alot about this place. But i think it's not only the healthy, organic factor (grass-fed beef, free-range turkey, and get this, home-made pickles), but the delicacy of that small space, from the bar to the water dispenser and the kid friendly stuff, oh and the wrapping ;D But i think what really hits home is the creativity of the menu.  

My boyfriend ordered a Tejano burger, jalapeno topped with pepper jack and tortilla strips, say whatt??! I ordered the Chalet, first time having watercress, and it definitely adds a tint of freshness and texture to the burger, but taste, not so much. Mind you that you can also create your own burger (: i got a side of sweet potato fries too, it was super tasty (:

If i do go back, i would definitely try something with Bison, and season my fries with truffle parmesan or fresh herb, and a salted caramel shakes ('cause the one at Birite is sooo good)
author: Lizi F.

description: I have such mixed feelings about Roam. On the one hand I never feel particularly satisfied after eating there, but on the other hand I keep coming back because it is super convenient to where I live in Pac Heights. I'm vegan and their veggie burger is just not that interesting; it's made out of quinoa and beets which means it falls apart...a lot. (Make sure to ask for the burger without house sauce as I believe there is dairy in the sauce.) Their russet fries are pretty good.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I got an altered version of the "French and Fry".. It was great, BUT it was so rich with the gruyere and caramelized onions that I could only eat about 3/4 of it.

Their truffle parmesan fries are delicious and perfectly fried.

We did have a little experience.. My guy's burger didn't come so about 10 minutes after I got mine I went up to ask them about it. And when they realized his order had gotten lost, they took care of it right away. The manager brought out his burger to apologize and gave him a gift card for next time to make up for it.

Very impressive customer service!

Overall, I felt like the burger itself is nothing special but with all the great toppings they have, it's easy to make a tasty burger!
author: Allie E.

description:
Went in yesterday for lunch after walking the picket line...  I'd been wanting to try it out and it was worth the wait.  

I ordered a custom burger:  Buffalo, cheddar, grilled onions, and house made pickles.  The burger was perfect.  Really liked the flavor of the house made pickles.  My friend had the Chalet burger, which she said was awesome.  We shared the fry fecta.  The sweet potato fries were glazed with a chipotle sauce and were the best on the plate.  The regular fries were coated with truffle/parmesan mixture, a little salty for us.  Loved the zucchini/onion strings but would have liked them cut a little thicker.  Really liked the fact that the beer made it to the table before we did.  

I will keep this place on my SF burger list.
author: Kim A.

description: The BEST burger I've ever had and to put that statement into perspective: my son and I have played amateur burger connoisseurs for years, taste-testing the burgers at each  restaurant we visit.  He now lives in SF and brought me here. Now I must have a Roam romp every time I'm in town (like today).
author: Anita C.

description:
Definitely one of the most enjoyable burgers I've had in quite some time. I ordered the classic beef burger ($5.99) and split the fry-fecta (zucchini onion strings, sweet potato, and russet) with my 2 friends. Their menu also offers homemade shakes and sodas, and vegetarian burger options. This place gets pretty packed. I suggest trying to find seating before you wait in line to order if you're dining in. I came around 6 on a weekend and it wasn't very busy, but about half an hour later it was completely packed with people sniping seats all over the place.

I'm coming back to try the turkey burger and possibly a homemade shake if I leave room for it!
author: Ashley D.

description:
Fry-fecata.  I know, right?!?  Three kinds of french fries, it's almost too good!  

Roam is a great weeknight spot if you want a quick dinner.  Don't let the line discourage you; the tables turn fast enough and the service is speedy, too.  And friendly.

Honestly, all the burgers are great: you can't go wrong with any of them.  I like to get a lettuce bun, not because I do paleo (hello, fry-fecta!) but because that huge burger plus the bun is just too much food!  The seasonal vegetable side is usually tasty, as well.  

Oh, and how could I forget those homemade sodas?  If I'm not drinking a Boylan's, then I'm drinking one of the house sodas.  I don't have a favorite, I get a different flavor each time and each one has been delish.
author: Julie H.

description: Great burgers and fries.  The zucchini onion stack is awesome.  We also loved the salted caramel milk shake. Definitely worth trying if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Zoran L.

description:
OK. I'm back and this time I'm giving Roam Artisan Burgers its very much deserved 5 star! Last night I picked up 2 different burgers: The Chalet and The BBQ. I also picked up sweet potato fries, a coconut milkshake and blue bottle coffee milk shake. The shakes were DEE-LIH-SCHOUS!!! Thick and creamy and the flavors on each were amazing. Worth every penny. 

I picked up all of this to go and after driving 20 mins back to the dogpatch and another hour before I was actually able to eat the burgers, I was absolutely certain that the burgers would be a soggy, gross mess. I nuked them for 30 seconds while still in their wrapper to warm them back up. Opened up the wrapper, took my first bite and was shocked. The burger was still juicy, bun soft and not soggy, toppings still in tact and not a broken, soggy mess. The sweet potato fries were delicious, but didn't hold up too well on the drive home, which was to be expected. 

Absolutely love this place.
author: Jen D.

description:
Burgers are cooked well. Juicy and well seasoned.
Sweet potato fries were yummy 

Shakes are a bit pricey. I had the strawberry and it was really good. A bit far for me though. 

This place reminds me of Super Duper in downtown SF.
author: Erica L.

description: right priced and gourmet burgers, fries and shakes.  Fresh brewed ice teas and a daily soda.  perfect affordable option in the Marina district
author: Michael S.

description: Simply the best Elk burger i ever had. And kombucha black currant  was to die for . Will be back many many more times. thanks everyone for doing such an amazing job.
author: Alena P.

description:
I have to admit, their burgers are delish! 

I stumbled upon this joint randomly while taking a day trip to San Francisco Any place with the words "artisan" and "burger" mushed together in a name is worthy of trying out at least once just to see if the place lives up to its name after all, right?

Upon entering the space you immediately think this place is going to be full of hipsters because of the industrial décor, but, surprisingly, there was a good mix of individuals eating there... businessmen, gym-rats from the gym a few doors down, even the snooty lady with the Louis Vuitton and overly-large sunglasses was sitting in a corner spot of the restaurant. The place was a good size and the tables weren't too squished together so you had enough elbow room to really dig into your burger a-la Adam Richman Man vs. Food style.

Served cafe-style, you order once you enter the restaurant and a waiter brings your food based on the corresponding number they give you once you order. I ordered the Sunny Side burger with a regular beef patty, though they do serve alternate meat options such as a Turkey, Bison, or Veggie burgers. Also, I got a blood-red orange soda and spent a little over $10- which I think is expensive since I didn't get fries- but, hey- it's suppose to be artisan right? Thankfully my friend ordered sweet potato fries so I was able to try them without shelling out even more dough.

The Sunny Side burger was ahh-maze-ing. Even the presentation of the burger was delightful- each layer stacked perfectly on top of one another- bun, grilled onions chopped up and melted together with cheese, sunny-side-up egg, tomato, topped with fresh arugula and finished with the sesame seed bun.  You could tell they were serving top quality beef because the burger patty was resilient when you bit into it and, while fatty, delicious juice dripped down from the burger, the meat was still perfectly intact and not crumbling to pieces after you took a gargantuan bite out of it (seriously, it's one of those burgers you have to practically dislocate your jaw just so you can get your mouth around it, but not complaints here!). The taste was even better than its physical appeal. Everything was fresh- not a wilted leaf or soggy tomato in any bite! You need to try it for yourself.

Okay, to be clear... I loved the burger. If I lived in SF, they would have my continued business just based on the quality of their burger alone. BUT, I want to say the service wasn't that great, the blood-orange soda was almost painful to drink, and the sweet potato fries were- JUST- sweet potato fries... nothing too special about them.

 You know... you go into an artisan burger joint and expect to get artisan service. No, the person to took my order simply asked what I wanted and scooted me away- no smile, no personable conversation- mind you, I was the only person in line! Really? For the $10 I spent for a burger and drink in addition to the $2 tip I just gave you, you should probably be a wee bit nicer to your customers. Luckily, the bus boy who wiped down my table was friendly enough to smile. As far as the blood-orange soda, YIKES! Do NOT go there... it was almost like drinking what I believe Orange Glo cleaner would taste like- very acidic to the point where it burns going down. SMH

Like I said, I would definitely go back to Roam Artisan Burgers simply for the delicious burgers; however, everything else at this joint just wasn't so great. Perhaps that's why they called it Roam Artisan Burgers instead of Roam Artisan Restaurant because everything aside from the burgers was pretty mediocre.
author: Emily B.

description:
If you're looking for a DELISH turkey burger...Roam Burgers is the place to be!  I recommend the tejano turkey burger with pepper jack cheese, jalapeno relish, avocado, tomato, corn strips and ranch dressing...it doesn't get better than that.  The jalapeno relish gives it a nice kick.  Don't forget a side of truffle parmesan fries and to top it off with the flavored soda of the week.  

I gave it only 4 stars because parking is hard to find and the place is small so try to keep your party under 5 or you'll end up having to sit at separate tables.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Possibly the best food I've had in the city since moving here almost 5 months ago. Don't get me wrong, over 70% of my food ventures here have been delicious, but this was the kind where I was literally speechless until I was almost done with my entire burger.

I ordered the Sunny Side Bison Burger (minus the sugary onions because I have a thing against mixing my sweets with my meats). OMG. Again, speechless. Eggs and bison - two of my favorite things smashed together. Brilliant!

My girlfriends and I shared:

* Brussel Sprouts with Parmigiano Reggiano & Chili Flakes - tiny, crispy, perfectly flavored brussel sprouts. I could probably eat an obscene amount of this if they ever decided to have some sort of AYCE deal. Yeah, I know. It's not going to happen. Just wishful thinking.

* Sweet Potato Fries - super tastey, but not as special as the brussel sprouts.

* Onion Haystack - delicious and much thinner slices than you'd expect. It was like eating potato/vegetable chips, which felt more like junk food than an actual side dish. Nonetheless, this is very good, very different, and definitely something you will consider smashing into your already ridiculously delicious burger.

This place is soooo good. I will have to figure out how to make room in my stomach for their milkshakes next time.
author: Amaryllia L.

description:
There GREAT!  People working here seem happy and eager to please.  The burger selections and add on's are cool and this place ain't too pricey considering the location.  I loved the French burger and needed the fuel as I had a lot of running around to do and knew I would burn it off.
Lastly the Blue Bottle shake was screaming good.
I'll be back.
author: D B.

description: Came in to make a to-go order. Paid for it while the guy was distracted. Didn't get a number (didn't know I needed a number) or a receipt. The manager and two other employees harassed me and interrogated me when I didn't have a number. Took long enough for the food to get cold. Worst experience by far on union street. Terrible customer service.
author: Greg N.

description: I had the best burger ever here! Their blue bottle coffee shake was awesome too. They have a decent selection of milkshakes. Their tejano is one of my favorites. I want to try all their burger combos. We had their Fry-fecta which is delicious. I love their Zucchini Onion Haystack, which is my favorite in the fry-fecta, but it never hurts to have sweet potato fries and regular fries. Their artisan soda is also very good. This is my new go to place when I can't decide what to eat. I want to take all my friends here to try their awesome burgers. :) Can't wait!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Decent burger made with high quality ingredients at a fairly reasonable price for San Francisco. Struggled to give even 3 stars through for a few reasons: both of our burgers were cooked to well-done, burger looked like it was assembled by a child (had to reassemble them before we could even try to eat them, and lastly we ordered the Trifecta of 3 different types of fries.....the regular fired were great, the sweet potato ones like warm and the haystack was a cold mess we could not even eat. For literally half the price I would argue an In 'n Out burger is every bit as good and their quality is much more consistent.....I would not oppose eating here again, I just wouldn't make any effort to.
author: Brian K.

description: This place is awful. It is completely overpriced and the service is horrible. After waiting 20 minutes for a seat and then another 30 minutes for the food, my order was wrong. Also my burger fries and shake was 26 dollars. Crazy especially considering it is just average burger and the patty is very small. Very disappointed save your money and go elsewhere. Super duper kills this place
author: Neil S.

description:
Had the veggie burger in a lettuce wrap and really enjoyed it.  It was healthy and fresh-tasting, and not too expensive.  The paper wrapping the burger was a nice touch, too.

Very clean and pleasant dining area as well.
author: Jane D.

description:
The boyfriend wanted to do "date night" a few Fridays back- but our romantic date night was overturned by the gajillion errands I needed to run in order to be ready for a weekend away. Thus, we ended up at Roam for a quick dinner (not to mention- hamburgers are the boo's favorite!)

Roam is a cute little spot on Union Street in which you place your order and they bring you your food. The boyfriend ordered the Elk Burger- which me mentioned was rather delectable. I ordered the turkey burger with white cheddar, avocado, and lettuce. It was good- but it certainly doesn't stand out among the rest. We also ordered the 3 fry types- and I recommend you save yourself. Just go with the Sweet Potato- they are by far the best!
author: Annalise F.

description: Delicious burger! Tip the guys at the counter; they're working hard! They have a nice beer selection, as well.
author: Frank G.

description:
This place was great!

I'd give it a 5 star if the burger had out-shined its deliciously fried appetizers. Seriously, that fryfecta was no joke. Burger was definitely great quality, but when I left it was the sweet potato fries I was thinking about.
author: khoi p.

description:
This place was great! We called in our order, the lady on the phone was really nice & helpful even after our order got a little complicated. (ordered for 5 people)

I really enjoyed my burger. grass fed beef. butter lettuce. quality! We got our order to go and it was still good even after the 20 minute drive back to my cousin's place. Sweet potato fries were good. It was all good. Totally recommend this place & will be visiting again next time we're in SF!
author: Jen K.

description: Just went here for the 2nd time, and the 2nd visit was just as awesome as the first. Very friendly staff, trendy décor & fun atmosphere! Also met the owner Josh on this past visit, real nice & down to earth guy! The burgers here are absolutely delicious! Last time I was here I ordered the Tejano burger with Bison, very tasty! This time around I had the French & Fries with Elk, hubby ordered the Sunny Side w/beef (my new fave, definitely ordering that next time) and a friend that was with us had the Hertiage w/Elk! We all took turns passing our different burgers around the table & also shared the Fry-fecta ...all were absolutely beyond yummy! Cant stress enough how AWESOME this burger place is & so happy to hear that they are opening another one in Lafayette soon!! If ever in the area, do yourself a favor & try it out...You wont be disappointed!!!
author: Kimberly P.

description:
Three words: French and Fries

I was hooked from the first bite; everything worked so well together. The addition of house-made pickles was just mind-blowing!

This is not your average burger; Roam takes it up a notch by ensuring that their sources are 100% natural and grass-fed. I was pleased to know that my beef patty wasn't drowning in preservatives, fillers, and whatnot.

French and Fries included: Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions (I opted out, since I'm not a huge fan of onions), Watercress, Dijon Mustard.

The watercress was a nice touch, it definitely packed a punch and was a great alternative to lettuce.

It was so good that I didn't think about how many calories I was consuming for once.

The sweet potato fries were decadent and perfectly crisped.

It's a bit pricey, but what do you expect? First off, it's located on Union St. in San Francisco, the patty is all natural and grass-fed, and their ingredients are not your typical shelved pickles and red onions.
author: Juliette R.

description:
Service: The cashier was very friendly, personable and worked well under pressure. She was the only one behind the counter, she would have to be the barista/bartender/milkshake maker and deal with the line of people who want their burger. She did exceptionally. She told me it would take a bit of time to make my shake, instead of not informing me, which I know some people tend to do and make it in their own sweet time. So I was very grateful.  

Food: I had the beef burger, french & fries style with a traditional bun. It was DELICIOUS. I loved the mixture of flavors, although it did fill me up and I had to give half to my boyfriend. I definitely would come back and try their other styles. My boyfriend got a bison burger, sunny side style with traditional bun. I had intended to take a bite or two, but my boyfriend found it to be so yummy, by the time I wanted to take a bite, it was already gone...  
Fry-Fecta: I love variety, I go to buffets for variety, not quantity. So the fry-fecta was perfect! And the seasoning was awesome, so good on my tongue. I couldn't finish it all, so I had to get a box, and it was still so damn good hours later...  
16 oz Coconut milkshake with bruleed marshmallow: Definitely tastes like real coconut, very refreshing, great with a burger. I shared with my boyfriend. It was enough for the both of us. And the cracker with the bruleed marshmallow was an excellent small dessert.  

Atmosphere: Very casual, a little cramped sometimes. The furnishing exudes high class hipstery, but everything else feels very casual and easy going. But I prefer this setting more than Umami burger, where you have to have your whole party with you to be seated.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
good food, BITCHY girl at counter, the only one that doesn't wear a roam shirt, and dresses in business casual. Dark hair. 
Anyways, consistently every time I go in, she's just a tart to deal with. Slow and condescending. I know I'm in the Marina, but COME ON, burgers are supposed to be happy times!

I'd go there more often if she didn't have such an attitude- good burgers and sweet potato fries! But honestly, when I see her working I turn around and go elsewhere. I know its harsh, but I just can't hang with the neg vibe.

The rest of the staff is super sweet,  love going in when she's not there. I'd say something to the manager, but unfortunately I think she IS one.
author: S B.

description:
Not a simple burger place and fortunately Roam can deliver on its intentions of being fairly inventive.  

The shakes and house-made sodas are excellent.  

Typically I eat fries only with salt and pepper, but truffle and parmesan was even better.  I don't like sweet potato fries but those who do tell me they're good.
author: Mike H.

description: Brilliant burgers. Beef Tejano is amazing in every bite. My friends ordered French and fries burger, which was not that great. Ginger Lime agave sweetened drink is refreshing too. Would visit again.
author: Balu V.

description:
I think a good burger is a work of art, particularly one that doesn't need extra ketchup. It's all about good toppings and good quality meat. 

My favorite thing to do at a restaurant is ask the people that work there what to order. So when the cute cashier recommended the Tejano, I said DONE. 

Tejano turkey burger was SO delicious. The combination of jalapeno relish, pepper jack, tomato, avocado and ranch dressing was perfection. It didn't need any extra condiments... not even salt for the avocado. My friend also ordered us the "fry-fecta" which is a basket of regular fries, sweet potato fries and onion strings. I definitely don't need this much food in the future, but I enjoyed all three. If you are going to force me to choose a favorite I would mayyyyybe say sweet potato. Maybe. 

To top it all off I got a Blue Bottle Coffee milkshake... go broke or go home, right? More like roll me home. I am so full, but so satisfied.
author: Molly S.

description: When I asked my boyfriend how many stars I should give Roam he replied, 29. It is delicious. Maybe it was because we were hung over, maybe not. But it was delicious none the less, and we will definitely be coming back.
author: Dee Dee C.

description:
With avocado, white corn chips, tomato, ranch, pepperjack, and a 100% grass-fed beef patty altogether, the Tejano burger was so amazing, I'd say it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. I loved the texture of the beef and how soft the patty was to bite into. I was really able to taste the difference in comparison to most unworthy beef patties I've consumed in my lifetime. 

Roam is perfect for a quick and casual lunch. It wouldn't be a bad idea to bring a large group of homies here if you could get your hands on the big communal table inside. With the benches, it reminded me of a cafeteria table, but more refined. Anyway, I can't wait to return to try all the other burgers.
author: Bets Y.

description: Pretty cool little neighborhood burger joint. The Yelp pictures looked amazing so when I was craving a burger, I knew where to go. Their list of specialty burgers is awesome - normally I choose to build my own burger but they all looked so good I was able to just pick off of the list. I ordered the heritage burger, which has bacon, caramelized onions, fontina, lettuce, tomato, and herb mayo. I also got the truffle parmesan fries and a prickly pear artisan soda. The burger was pretty amazing, but a tad on the greasy side, I think partially because there were a ton of the caramelized onions. It was also huuuge, and I devoured it within 15 minutes, which proves it's deliciousness. The fries and the soda were really good, but it didn't really taste like pear. Overall a really good meal. The service was also good...it was a Thursday night and had a decent line at the counter but the person that rung up my order was super friendly. I would have given Roam 5 stars, however my meal was $17! I know this is San Francisco and everything is expensive, but jeez. Despite the cost, I can't wait to go back to try one of their shakes!
author: Emma B.

description:
This place came highly recommended by a good friend, so I was excited to try it. The menu looks great with awesome modular DIY style parts. I got the veggie burger, sunny side style. Sorry to say that the patty was quite mushy and the caramelized onions just got lost in the mush. The veggie patty at Super Duper Burgers is crispy and better.

The best part here was the zucchini onion haystack! We got the Fry-Fecta with truffle parmesan, and it was great. We weren't able to finish it amongst three of us - it is quite a bit.
