Their beer was good and their house artisanal sodas were alright. If the patty was better here, I'd come back to try it in other styles, but for now I might just go back to Super Duper.
author: Chinmayi B.

description: Yummy burgers! I love that this place uses grass fed beef for their burgers. Also I love that they use Straus grass fed dairy for their milkshakes. I like the fries and sweet potato fries here as well. When I came here I got the pacific blue.
author: Nicholas S.

description:
Big juicy savory burger and delicious pumpkin spice shake in a crowded fratboy vibe place. My friends say that the sauces drown out the burger meat flavor. I say it's just right for this style of burger. I loved it! I'll try the bison and elk burgers next visit. 

While Umami burger serves tiny unadorned burgers for anorexics, Roam serves robust saucy burgers jampacked with various ingredients. My vote goes to Roam.
author: Frankie W.

description:
Don't go here expecting a typical american hamburger. This is a HEALTHY burger. No burger juice dripping down your hands into your lap, or grease to wipe off your face. Sometimes, I think that's what a burger should be. 

BUT. 

I had the Tejano. Super fresh tasting, great texture and taste in the patty, and the toppings paired really well together. And I enjoyed it a lot. 

They also make their own sodas. Definitely order the meyer lemon one! 

Prices were fair. You get what you pay for. I'd rather have something good.
author: Diana H.

description:
The place seems to be a modern version of a family burger joint. Think much cooler, with a casual edge, much better design and yummy yummy food. You will not find dingy lights and greasy tables.

The beer is a bit on the expensive side though so you may be saving on the burgers but if you add drinks it gets expensive.
author: Laura T.

description:
This is my favorite burger place is the city.  

The sunny-side burger with the fried egg is absolutely delicious.  And, the truffle oil fries?  Hell yeah.

And, it's not expensive!  In the Marina?!

FANtastic.
author: Andrew L.

description:
When shopping on Union Street this is my go-to place.

Fresh. Tons of choices. Turkey, beef or buffalo I ALWAYS choose beef, but love the choices for my friends and in case I want an extra patty (I have been known to order two)

AND they  have Kombucha and Blue Bottle coffee, my two (legal) imbibes of choice! And for the soda drinkers: Boylans!

A great choice to the neighborhood. Plus they handle the crowds well. Always critical when I need my protein fix!
author: Dani K.

description:
In all honestly, I wish I could give this place 6 stars. Do I really need to go into how amazingly delicious the burgers here are? How they produce such amazing flavor combinations that are just beyond mind blowing? My absolute fav burgers here are the Tejano and the Sunny Side -- MMM MMM GOOD.

And please - it would be an absolute sin if you went here and didn't order the Russet Fries with Truffle Parm seasoning to go with your burger. Those are truly a gift from the universe.

Or if you're not hungry, come here, grab a beer and catch the World Champion San Francisco Giants on TV. My other favorite to-do :).
author: Sara K.

description: Was looking for Vegan burgers in SF and found Roam.  The burger was very tasty but had trouble staying together.  Will definitely be going back to try another combination.  Good fries, but steer clear of the onion/zucchini strings.  Too difficult to eat and lacking flavor.
author: Jon L.

description: Food is natural and scrumptious. Not a burger you'd feel too guilty about later. Please get the zucchini onion haystack. You'll regret it if you don't!
author: Francesca M.

description:
Tasty, but leaves you hungry like Chinese food.

I don't know what it is.  Four of us had our load of delicious burgers, sampling of fries, and beers.  Alas, a few hours later, we were hungry.  So just a fair warning.  That or maybe we're just piggy.

Very tasty burger.  Am keeping my eye on that blue bottle shake they offer.
author: Christine K.

description:
Fries were good especially with the added Parmesan truffle. Burger was fine not outstanding. Interesting combinations. If I was in the area I would go back but wouldnt make a special trip to go back. 
By the time you order fries drink and burger it's a little pricey.
author: robbie l.

description:
Finally spending time with my two guys. Coming from Academy of Arts and Science, we were famished. We were guided by of course Jenny. She recommend Roam. 

Great choice - Yes I must add very artisan, the burgers very unique combination and different to the palate. I remember when my dad took me to McDonald's. I would put my fries inside my cheeseburger. I know no comparison. I ordered the FRENCH AND FRIES yummy in my tummy. The burgers were juicy and the truffle fries were crunchy and tasty. 

What was a :( ... 
when I walked in - at my height level on the board menu was the burgers. I only noticed that on my yelp app they had shakes. I was like what, when, where and how come I did not see it. 

Since then I have been craving a shake that comes with the brulee marshmallow. I will be back and that will be the first thing I order. HA!
author: Jay B.

description: Delicious!  get the BIson Burger for sure! with white cheddar
author: Michael A.

description:
Roam Burger is really ruining it for me. 

I live in the Marina, one of the places in the city with abundant dining options -- and yet I keep coming back to Roam.

The place is convenient, has excellent service and the world's most perfect burgers. The meat is cooked medium rare and is the juiciest burger patty I've tasted to date. All the veggies are organic and fresh and has a really good crunch once you bite into it. 

And while I do love their burgers, I'm a sucker for good fries, and the truffle parmesan fries are SO good! I think next time I go I'm gonna have to have two sides of that coz I always steal from my boyfriend's plate! lol

Jack Chen, Yelp Elite if you read this, don't worry. I will take you here one of these days! :)
author: Mariel F.

description:
New fave!  Love this place for all the options.  Simple or gourmet they have what you're looking for.  

My girlfriend and I were able to cross another one off our list...we shared-
French & fry with a beef patty - da bomb!
Fry-fecta - must have
Blackberry soda - yum
Mint chocolate shake - good, but I've had better
Glass of white wine 
All for $33...not bad!
author: Meredith K.

description:
I'm a sucker for burger joints, especially fancy burger joints.  And this one certainly meets the criteria for it.  

This is not a formal, sit-down restaurant (so I can't really judge this burger next to my favs at its sit-down restaurant counterparts).  It's kind of like an even more upscale Asqew Grill where you order at the counter and get a number.  I don't mind this though - it just means we get our burgers as quickly as possible, which we did! 

I was here for dinner on a Friday night after work and while it was super packed, we were still able to find a place to sit.  I ordered up the French and Fries burger with a side of sweet potato fries.  The sweet potato fries were nothing special but oh god was that burger delicious!  

The meshing of the truffle fries, the gruyere, the avocado, and the taste of wholesome organic beef were to die for!   Overall if you're looking for an awesome, gourmet burger for less than $10 in a casual dining environment, this is the place for you.  I will be back again for sure.
author: Jean A.

description: This place saved me and my family. We were super hungry and looking for a place to eat. Our lyft driver recommended us this place, and it fit us perfectly. Quick well tasty burgers. The combination of all three sides was very good. Thank you! :)
author: Peder L.

description: I kept it simple and tried a regular bison burger. The sweet potato fries were crispy and ketchup/water was self serve. The burger was quite juicy and was actually the first time I tried bison. I definitely need to eat more bison, or roam's burgers in because the tender juicy meat mingled with my taste-buds putting me in a euphoric and silent state. I may or may not have shed a tear of joy. Put on a deep voice if you're under 21 and want a beer ;) but hush hush.. and i advise against it because the beer prices are not listed but I am pretty sure I calculated mine to be around 9$. No bueno. I am without a doubt coming back here for a burger. Maybe I will try the elk variation next time. Also gluten free bread options is a plus.
author: Shaun C.

description:
Yum Yum.

Yum - French and Fries $7.99
Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, subbed Dijon for Herb Mayo. So delicious. The truffle fries, who would have thought?! and watercress has converted me to its deliciousness. SO satisfying. 

Yum - Fry-Fecta. Fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini haystack. YES.
author: Nicolle M.

description:
Burgers are making a run on the town.  Urban burger, Burger Joint, Marlowe, Trueburger, Super Duper, burgers on gourmet restaurant menus (Spruce, NOPA), ...seems like the claim to fame is at an endless competition.  And so where does Roam fit in you might ask?  It's pretty high up there.  I still find NOPA burger along with NOPA's environment quite attractive, Roam makes a good presentation as well.  With blue bottle coffee shakes, an impressive treated wood bar, and a menu that is both versatile yet offers simplicity for those that just want a goddam hamburger and bun, yah.....Roam is a spot.  (not "the" spot, but "a" spot)

On my most recent visit, I had to go to get everything on the menu.  I had the Sunnyside (comes with a fried egg...my favorite) with an added avocado...mmmm.   And of course, we had the Fry Fecta with a blue bottle coffee shake.  All really delicious.  Burger was juicy and the popped egg dripping along the meat and soaking into the bread was phenomenal.

yes service is congested and the guys running around with the burgers may forget your extra topping of avocado, but hey, its a burger bar really.

Overall, good food, good vibe, and I'll definitely come back.
author: Vincent K.

description:
there are several things I don't do/hate doing with my food. 

1) I hate messy food. it will honestly ruin a meal for me if it's too difficult or messy to eat.

2) I don't usually finish my meal [I don't waste it either though. I eat half and then eat the other half an hour or two later]. 

my rules went completely out the window yesterday, that's how freaking good my burger was. 

I saw this spot on yelp and jumped at the first chance to go out and try it. Paul and I both had Monday off, so we trekked on over. Parking was a breeze, and we walked into a very clean, modern space. The girl at the counter was very friendly and helpful, and we both got elk burgers. He ordered the sunny side, and I had the heritage. we also got the fry-fecta, which is a combo of the regular fries, sweet potato fries, and fried zucchini and onions. seat yourself, and your food comes out shortly after. 

the burgers are HUGE. and since there are so many toppings, it's messy.... and I don't even care, because it's DELICIOUS. the elk has that distinct flavor that game meat has, but it was seasoned so that it wasn't overpowering. the herbed mayo and bacon on my burger gave it awesome flavor, and Paul's burger tasted completely different--that's a good thing. I hate when all the burgers or dishes pretty much taste the same, they really take the time to craft their burgers to give them distinctive tastes. 

yes, I finished my burger. I couldn't not finish it. this may be bad, because all day I've been thinking about how good it was and when I can go back. I love how you can create all these different burgers, and it seems this place tries to make as much as they can from scratch [including soda. WHAT?!] Definitely a great find!
author: Angela L.

description:
I've been here a few times and while I thought the Elk burger was pretty tasty, I really had a good point of reference dining here first then heading down the street for a follow up burger at Umami. Roam's meat quality is high but the patty is too thin and therefore doesn't really allow for a medium rare preparation. The toppings and bun are super tasty and artisanal, but the real treat happens to be the truffle Parmesan fries. Perfectly crisp and seasoned. The house made caramelized pineapple soda tastes like a grilled pineapple and was perfect to cut the richness of the burger. 
Overall I love the vibe and I wouldn't kick the burger out of bed for being a little too thin for my tastes, but after trying Umami down the road I'd probably make that my first stop with Roam as a close runner up.
author: Stacy T.

description:
I am not from San Francisco and I was staying in the neighborhood so naturally I looked to Yelp to guide my choices in food.

Grabbed a burger to go.  Good burger, quality ingredients - Chalet.

Would definitely eat here again when I am in town.  Hopefully next time I have an opportunity to sit down.
author: Jon C.

description:
I have been here several times and the food has never disappointed.  I usually order the Pacific Blue with two bison patties.  A dinner here can be expensive, the meat and the burgers overall are great.  The bison meat here is very high quality and very juicy.  The fry-fecta is great if you're interested in eating all three items; otherwise, an order of the sweet potato fries is very satisfying.

Even though a dinner here is expensive I feel like its money well-spent because the quality of the meat is exceptional.
author: Marvin P.

description:
Wow.  This place is awesome.  I get their veggie burger and customize it the way I want it.  The veggie patty is made in-house and I have yet to guess its contents, but it sure is tasty.  The condiments are crisp and flavorful; the buns soft and fresh...and don't get me started on the fries....dang.  Heavenly.  It seems you can't go wrong.

Portions are adequate and the ambiance is comfortable and hip.  It gets busy in there, but the people you're rubbing elbows with are, by and large, happy, chatty, individuals who are also enjoying this excellent establishment.  

Check it.
author: Elise H.

description: Great burger! Juicy and delicious. The gluten free bun was good quality. Definitely spent more than expected- my boyfriend and I each ordered a burger and shared the frifecta for about $31, no drinks.
author: Louise B.

description: Only sampled the Chalet burger, but it was enough to make me wanna go back for more. Burgers are on the smaller side, which is perfect for me.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Susan C.

description:
ROAM.  Have heard so much about it on the burger blogs and on Yelp but hadn't had the chance to try it.  K and I finally made it down there on a recent Thursday to try it.  

Roam tries to keep its menu pretty straightforward.  Burger with beef, turkey, buffalo and you can either select your toppings or choose from their suggested combinations.  Since it was our first time there, we decided to choose from their selections.  I had a French and Fry Burger (Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard) while K had a Heritage (Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, Herb Mayo)  The prices were very reasonable for a high end burger place in the Marina.  We also ended up with just the regular fries and a monthly special milkshake (chocolate nutella) which tasted exactly like nutella with a milkshake.

We sat down with a number and waited patiently for our burger.  We got our ketchup from the station while waiting and it was interesting that they had organic Heinz ketchup!! it tasted the same as the non-organic though.

When the burger finally came out, it was delicious.  The balance of the fries with the mustard was great.  The burger was juicy and moist.  K was very happy with her burger too, the bacon was cooked to a perfect crisp with plenty on the burger.  The carmelized onions were sweet and yummy, and I usually don't include onions on my burger but Roam's were amazing.  I consider myself a burger lover and think burgers are great when you can't stop eating them.  You continuously down the burger without thinking because of how great it is and this is one of those burgers.

The fries were perfectly crisp and tasty too.  Overall, Roam didn't disappoint.  The place is not very big and filled up around the time we left.  Parking isn't the easiest in the world but weekdays are manageable in the Marina.  I expected the crowd to be a little snobbish but there were a lot of families there.  

Overall, a great burger place for a great burger.  I understand the raves about Roam and will definitely come back when I have a chance.  I still need to compare the place to Umami but Roam def did not disappoint.
author: Brian C.

description:
This place is awesome. Minus one price because I think it is an expensive In n Out, but damn good.

The burgers are yummy, and you can get a basic burger, which I love. Lettuce, Tomatos and Onion if you want.  Yum Yum Yum.

Their french fries are legit too. 

And last but not least, milkshakes. I don't like milkshakes, never understood what they were all about. Now I know. Their salted carmel milkshake is delicious. I've also had strawberry which was very good.

This is a place where you order at front and they bring food to your table. You get your own utensils, ketchup, mustard anything else you need. Good beer selection, but I thought it was a bit steep, about $6-8 for a beer. And you are already paying close to $9 for a burger.

Overal this place is super good and I will be coming back.
author: sierra s.

description:
Let me just say that Roam Burger in no way contends with the Umami scallop and pork belly burger, but if you're going the traditional beef route I'd say Roam Burger is the way to go. 

After recently going semi-pescatarian, my desire for beef has skyrocketed through the roof. The solution? A delicious ROAM burger. When my friend suggested we try it, I was a little miffed. Here we are in the Marina, home to UMAMI BURGER, and we're going to go elsewhere? Ok...

But Roam Burger was amazing! I got the French and Fry which had cheesy truffle fries IN the burger, so I had a little taste of my fav from Umami. The meat I had was juicy and cooked perfectly and the carmelized onions and guacamole complemented each other perfectly. YUMMY.

It's so cool how they offer you different meat options. My heart told me to go beef, even though my head was screaming for the healthier turkey option. But where else do you see bison burgers? Now, bison is not my thing, but I applaud Roam for putting it on their menu. 

I'll admit, after my burger here, I was still a little hungry, but that could've been because I'd been depriving myself of delicious beefy goodness. My friend (male with a voracious appetite), however, was full. 

I anxiously await the next time I decide to break from pescatarianism and chow down. I'll be at Roam, with a juicy beef (not turkey) burger and a side of cheesy truffle fries. :]
author: Michelle Q.

description:
I recently was introduced to the burgers at Roam and I have got to say that they have one of the best burgers in the city.  I got a free-range turkey Tejano without white corn strips and I added jalapeños... oh my.  Amazing burger.  I will definitely be craving Roam next time I am in the city.  The sweet potato fries were also a tasty addition to the burger.  I was pretty surprised with the prices... I was expecting it to a bit more expensive due to its location in the Marina.

Also, I loved the atmosphere and casual yet chic theme going on at Roam.  I feel that the food in a restaurant is greatly influenced by how well an establishment is taken care of and the attitude of the employees.  Roam was very clean, and the employees demonstrated that they really cared for the restaurant, as they spoke very highly of the different options available.  This all reflects positively on the owner, management, and the food itself.
author: A K.

description:
Best Burger I've had the Elk served French and Fries style with
Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard was rich in the very best way, the Traditional Beef Burger served Sunny Side was delicious too!With organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce, heaven.  I drink a lot of Armold Palmers and theirs was perfect! Also tried out the The Fry-Fecta (all three)Russet Fries,
Sweet Potato Fries, and 
Zucchini Onion Haystack, I will be back!!
author: Marina Z.

description: Yummmmmmmmmy!!  Had the classic burger with swiss cheese and a side of sweet potato fries. Whatever they use to make their "house sauce" which is drizzled inside the burger is pure goodness. Yes, it can get expensive if you put a lot of add-ons and order a ton of sides or milkshakes. I ate here with my husband and for our two burgers, a side of fries, and the free unlimited water, our bill was just under $20. Very reasonable, and super delicious. We shall be back!
author: Elaine W.

description:
The Sunny Side Bison Burger was hands down the best burger I've ever had. Definitely recommend this place for any burger lovers. Overall food was good although the truffle fries and Umami is still a my favorite. 

This is definitely worth checking out!
author: John P.

description:
Choice of meat patty:
routine beef, turkey, veggie; 
or try bison, elk.

The elk is tasty,
unexpectedly fishy
but interesting.

Get the Fry-Fecta.
Three types of fries in a bowl.
Russets, sweets, onions!

TVs for sports games.
Airy interior space.
A casual spot.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Now with bacon!!

On my last day working in this neighborhood, I had to go to Roam one last time.  I never really look closely at the menu as I know what I like having tried them all.

Upon closer inspection, I saw something new, and don't know how long it has been there.  It's called The Heritage.  And it has bacon!  And Fontina cheese, caramelized onions, tomato, and lettuce.  I had to add jalapeno relish, as usual.

Why didn't I see this before?!  I just might have to find a reason to head across town for lunch again.
author: Michael M.

description:
The waitress brought gravy instead of barbecue sauce for my cheeseburger.

Long story short, you're all invited to the wedding.
author: Farzan K.

description:
One of the better burgers in town, for sure! I know meat is the star when it comes to enjoying burgers, but I have to say that the buns here are so amazing! Fragrant, toasted just right, not too soggy from too much sauces or spread, perfect!

On my first visit here I chose the French & Fries with Turkey... with an order of the Fry-Fecta (shared with others, of course). The boyfriend had the special meat of the day--Elk. Everything was great, and I'm looking forward to the next time.

The turnover was surprisingly fast on a Friday night as well; we go a table pretty easily and the food arrived shortly after. As a side distraction you can watch the staff guy bring out an exorbitant tower of clean drinking glasses every so often... not sure how he does that without having them pummel over onto the floor. Mad skills!
author: Andrey C.

description: Simply THE best burger in San Francisco bay area - bar none. I was their opening event a few years ago and was hooked sampling it all. It's not an ambience place. It's clean enough and they put some thought in to the look of the place, but it's crowded and loud and a lot of turnover. There's a bar and a few tables - but it's about the food. They have a zillion toppings, you pick what you want, beef, bison, etc... they have fries and sweet potato fries, strauss organic shakes -- but the BURGER is the reason to be there. I get the classic with cheese, swap carmelized onions for raw on a whole wheat bun. (condiments are organic too). They claim to use "pastured beef" only, which means not only are the cows organic, but they don't eat soy and corn, but rather grass, bugs, etc.... super duper, zuni - brazen head - lot of notable burgers and even a few other organic - but Roam is #1.
author: R A.

description:
Thank you thank you for grass fed beef burgers! I don't mind paying more for quality ingredients. Doubling up on the patty, especially if you're going bun-less, is highly recommended.

Sweet potato fries are a nice treat and the slurp I had of the salted caramel milkshake was to die for.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Great, great burgers. Great additions to the burger. Good beer. 

Would get five stars but Roam is a bit overpriced.
author: Brooks D.

description:
Finding a good turkey burger is often tough going. They are often too dry, or seasoned poorly, or just plain not good.

I've been to Roam several times over the past year, but last night was the first time I'd tried the turkey burger. And...wow, I am a fan! 

I'm a pretty simple burger gal -- patty, a few fixings, bun. No cheese, not a lot of sauces...in short, the flavor of whatever meat I'm eating needs to stand out. The turkey burger here at Roam fit the bill perfectly -- seasoned well, cooked so that it maintained its moisture without feeling like it was undercooked in any way, and held together while I was eating it (no crumbling!). 

As if this wasn't enough, the butter lettuce, excellent house-made pickles (and I'm not a pickle fan!), house dressing, tomato, and sturdy yet soft bun just further enhanced the experience. 

Had I not WAY overindulged on the FryFecta, I would have agreed with other posters that you can leave this place without feeling like you cheated or too full. 

Their beef burgers are also delicious, but the turkey sealed the deal for me. 

The place has been doing well, seemingly since opening, so be prepared to wait a little bit for your food. Even on a Monday night it was rather crowded. It's well worth it!
author: Annie F.

description:
This review will be super simple.  I got a French and Fries burger and regular fries.  The regular fries were ok.  I didn't hate them, but I also did not love them.  The burger, however, was loaded.  I subbed the mustard for mayo and elevated it even further.  

It's quick service like a Panera and, yes, you will shell out about 10 to 12 dollars for burger and fries, but its the Marina.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
If ROAM was burning, as they say, I would throw a hanky over my face and rush into the flames like a hero.  

I would go directly to the fridge and grab a patty or two.  Then I would likely wait in the burning building engulfed in flames at the amazing walnut bar just long enough to say goodbye, let the patties cook to medium rare, add some jalepeno relish and perhaps an egg, and then make a dash for the street.  

At that point I would likely have no eyebrows, or hair of any sort actually.  I would perhaps have hoards of onlookers gawking at me as if I were the actual burning man on the playa.  

But I would also have what may be the best burger in San Francisco.
author: Brad C.

description:
My sister picked this place out to try after reading the reviews online.  Came here with my parents, BF, sister, and my son.  You walk up to the cashier and order your food, they give you a number to place on your table, and they bring the food out to you.  It's a seat yourself restaurant and the seating is limited.  Not many places in SF offer a kids menu, but this place does which is a big plus.  So the way it works is, you choose your meat (beef, turkey, bison, or veggie) then you choose your style of burger OR you can totally create your own with whatever toppings you want.  I choose the beef french and fries burger (Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard).  My BF got the beef sunny side (Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce).  We had the burgers as is, no substitutions.  We wanted to try it the way it was supposed to be made.  And WOW these burgers were sooo good!  My son completely scarfed down his kids burger.  We all shared the fry-fecta which is all 3 - russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack.  The burgers were cooked perfect and were not greasy.  We also tried one of their shakes - salted caramel with a bruleed marshmallow on top.  The shake was thick and creamy and not super sweet.

I am definitely coming back to this place.  I want to try some of their other burgers, maybe even bison next time.  And they are reasonably priced (cheaper than Taylor's Refresher aka Gott's Roadside).
author: Charlene P.

description:
Scrummy burgers!

I came here with a veggie friend and she really liked the veggie burger, which was homemade and very hearty looking. I got a beef burger which was delicious, plus I appreciate the fact that they use grass-fed beef instead of the usual rubbish. We both had the wholemeal buns too which were very fresh and tasty, as well as a side of the sweet potato fries (glazed with chipotle something) and broccolini with lemon, chili and parmesan. Both sides were great, plus we left feeling pleasantly full but not overly-stuffed (not typical following a burger!).

Staff were a bit meh, plus you order at the counter. I thought it was reasonable value for what we got, especially considering the quality of the ingredients.
author: Ciera M.

description:
I've only been here once, but it was enough to come in here and give them a solid 4 stars.

The burger was magnificent. I was walking down the street thinking I'd cook lunch at home when I read the words "Artisan" and "Burgers" together... The world stopped for a second and next thing I new I had a burger in my mouth, and I was SO happy about it :)

I wish the same experience on you! haha If I come to this place a couple more times and have a consistent experience, I'll up the rating to 5 stars.
author: Gerardo C.

description: Went here with a group of friends, and sat on the patio with dogs in tow.  They were super friendly and provided good suggestions when I had a couple of questions.  I loved that they had various meat (and non-meat) options.  I had a turkey burger and it was very good.  Unlike others, I wasn't very impressed with the fries- they use truffle oil, which always tastes a little musky to me.  Great bottled drinks.
author: Melanie R.

description:
That French & Fries burger is pretty damn good!

They don't do the whole well, medium well, medium rare etc. scale, just pink or not pink. But the burger came out super juicy! 

Perfect bun vs. patty ratio. Great flavor, everything. Next time I gotta try their shakes and fries on the side.
author: Faffy L.

description:
Oh take me to Roam
Tasty hamburgers' home...
Where I gorge on a burger stuffed with fries
Avocado, gruyere
sauteed onions with care
It's a wonder what $15.00 buy(s)...

Okay okay that was a stretch (Home on the Range will never be the same again). I stumbled upon Roam when I was looking for a quick and tasty bite on Union Street and I went in with no expectations.

I zero in on the French and Fries burger in less than 3 seconds: 
Show me truffle parmesan fries and you will get me every time. Watercress, avocado, gruyere cheese and caramelized onion with just a kiss of dijon mustard and you have the perfect burger. The toppings don't overwhelm the burger. You can still have the beefy deliciousness of the patty. 

While I did eat quickly as I had to run somewhere, I will definitely be back as I am still dreaming about my french and fries... 

The place was pretty quiet at 6 pm on a rainy Tuesday night but it began to fill up around 6:20 or so...
author: Karen K.

description: One of my all time favorite burger joints! You can't go wrong eating here. Do keep in mind, however, finding parking in this area and getting seats requires patience...mainly on weekends, especially when sunny.
author: Hala S.

description:
Incredible burger, messy and delicious, with a myriad of options to make it unique.  The fries are great and you get several options for toppings.  They have a good beer selection, only do gourmet sodas, and they offer an actual $5.00 milk shake.  
I had the BBQ burger and loved the Oil and Vinegar slaw that comes on it.  We shared an order of the truffle parmesan fries, which was good, because the order is big.  We even ended up leaving with a chocolate shake, but to paraphrase "Pulp Fiction", It was a good shake, but I don't know if it's worth five dollars.
All together a great lunch and I recommend this joint.
author: MK W.

description:
Milkshakes made with Straus nonfat froyo. Burgers made from all-natural bison and topped with organic ketchup. Both amazing for taste and sustainable purpose, and perhaps available together nowhere else.

You are invited to visit us world. We welcome everyone.
author: Jason B.

description:
To keep it real, I've been boycotting the Marina for quite sometime now.  It's a little expensive, everybody's dressed the same, the club music is pretty lame, and finding a group of down to earth people to hang out with in this area has eluded me during my 6 years in this city.  So when a friend of mine told me I had to try this place out, and I looked online and found out where it was located, well let's just say it took me an additional 4 months to make it over here.

Everything I tried here was stellar.  The fries (spiced with fresh herbs) were fried just right and not greasy in any way.  The burgers were filling, and the ingredients were high quality and layered on the burger with finesse and skill and in a balanced ratio (I'm all about appropriate ratios when it comes to burgers and sandwiches).  My homemade ginger lime soda was fabulous.  The prices were pretty reasonable considering the location and quality of ingredients.  Despite my lactose intolerance, I wanted to try their shakes, because that's how yummy they looked and sounded.

I'll definitely be making a trip back to the Marina for this place.
author: LaSha G.

description: All the meat is grass fee. Burgers are available as beff, Bison, or Elk. I had the bison burger, and it was prepared well, and excellent. The thin fried zucchini and potatoes is a great mix, and hard to stop eating. Fries are available prepared several ways, and they were very tasty also. Please was busy and we had to wait in line, and wait for a table. It's small.
author: Bill S.

description: Best burger in the bay area. period.
author: Beril Y.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't too busy (until I ordered and sat down... then the line was out the door). 

Easy peasy ordering style. Order your type of burger meat and style of meat or just create your own. Sit down with your number, and they will bring it to you. Reminds me of Super Duper except you have to wait for your number to be called and pick up at the counter instead. 

Tried the Tejano burger which was Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch. It sounded really good in my head ... and it lived up to the hype. Delicious. The burger was juicy. The burger patty was a little thin for my liking, the girth of the burger was made up of the other ingredients. There's an option to order a double as well. 

Tried out the Fry-fecta. We weren't fans of the sweet potato fries, but the russet fries (with truffle parmesan) and the zucchini onion haystack was quickly gobbled up. 

I'll be back to try that salted caramel shake which sounds like heaven...
author: Jeannie L.

description:
The best burger in the Marina!

I don't think there was a time that I had a bad burger.  I've tried almost all patties and they are all juicy and flavorful!!! My favorites was the grass-feed beef, Elk and turkey patty. 
I love the fact that you can customize your burger.  There are so many toppings to choose from. 
My favorite combinations so far is:
-Turkey burger in "French and fries" style which is Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Caramelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard. HEAVEN!

- Beef burger in "sunny side" style which is Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce

-Elf burger in "BBQ" style which is Aged White Cheddar, BBQ Sauce, Caramelized Onions, Jalapeño Relish, Oil & Vinegar Slaw.

Overall all the burgers are great!  If you're a burger fan, this is the place to visit!
author: Ying F.

description: If you're looking for a burger wrap this place is awesome.  The quality of the meat makes the burger worth it and they use perfect butter lettuce leaves to wrap the burger in.  Perfect for you low carb skinny bitches (myself included).
author: Joey S.

description: Roam burgers are hands down the best burgers I've ever eaten in my life! The are SO fresh and the meat is cooked perfectly. Perfectly juicy. This goes for the beef, turkey, and veggie burgers. The vegetables they dress the burgers with are wonderfully crisp and the house sauce is divine. Never have I ever been able to eat a burger without cheese or ketchup or a bun but at Roam, I crave my burgers this way! What I mean is, the house sauce is so good that you don't want to cover up the taste with ketchup and they have a lettuce wrap option instead of your standard bun. Normally I would stay away from a lettuce wrap because my biggest pet peeve is when food breaks, but they have figured it out! They use big pieces of butter lettuce. It stays intact. Not to mention the garden salad is my favorite in the city so far, and I love the additions of a three slider kabob you can get with it. The shakes are on a whole new level. Nutella milkshake?! I don't think I need to further explain...if you haven't been there yet, GO!!!!!!!!!
author: Kelsey K.

description: 3.5 stars for this place!!  My boyfriend and I came here last week and the burgers were pretty damn good.  I got the heritage burger with thousand island and the jalapeno relish on the side and it hit the spot.  I felt the buns were done well and the beef and the bacon was cooked well.  I liked the casual atmosphere and communal atmosphere here as well.  Definitely coming back to try the other burgers.
author: M. T.

description:
Roam offers a variety of burger types, including your standard cow, turkey, veggie, but they also have bison and elk. Never having had an Elk burger I picked that, just to see what it was like. The place is set up to order your food at the counter and get a table number for them to bring the food to the table. It was very efficient, and the fact that it took a little while made me believe each was cooked to order.

In addition to the burger types, they also have a variety of "add on" options, like my selection, Sunny Side which feature an Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce. It was pretty delicious, specifically the chili sauce and onions. The elk burger itself was good, not fantastic. I would probably pick a regular burger or bison in the future. 

The other great thing here are the fries. As long as your not alone, get the Fry-Fecta which is russet fries, sweet potato fries and zucchin/onion haystack. The best were the sweet potatoes, but the other were tasty too.

Overall, the food is priced fairly, with specialtiy burgers around $8 and fries 3-4, or the fry fecta for $5.50. They also have a selection of draft beers, bottles and other drinks. Id recommend it if the other restaurants on Union are super crowded and you are craving a burger.
author: Evan H.

description: I dream about the Tejano burger. The other burgers are great too, but the Tejano is salty, savory goodness that I can never pass up when I eat at Roam. The buns are soft enough to nicely hold in the toppings and the fries are good as well. Can get crowded, but I've never had to wait too long for my food. I much prefer Roam to Umami burger, but I think it depends on what type of buns/toppings you like.
author: Brooke T.

description: Amazing burgers bursting with flavor! I usually get the Veggie (house-made organic) Tejano style burger. If I am feeling healthy, i will get it with a lettuce wrap and it is just as good! They also have great sweet potato and zucchini onion haystack fries.
author: Megan B.

description: The burgers here are amazing. its not too small not to big. the patty is nice and juicy and it tastes so ... delicious? cant really put it in words. i had the classic  because i couldnt decide on what i wanted... my bf had the heritage because there was bacon. we enjoyed the burgers but the fries were also good we got the fry-fecta! got to try it all. hmmm yum loved their fries. the zucchini onion haystack was interesting. nice and thin and super crispy! OOOO and their MILKSHAKES!! I love me a delicious cup of strawberry milkshake. It doesn't disappoint! i wish it was closer to my house so i could eat it on the daily ...
author: Kristina L.

description:
Soooo delish. Similar idea to Hubert Keller's Burger Bar inside Macy's in Union Square, with fancy build-your-own burgers and gourmet shakes, but seriously 1/2 the price.

I had the French & Fries, with parmesan-truffle fries INSIDE your burger (mmm) and my friend had the BBQ burger. Both were huge, tasty, and hilariously messy. Get 10 napkins per person.

We also split the salted caramel shake at the recommendation of the cashier, and it was the perfect compliment to the 8,000 calories we'd already consumed.

Set aside an hour after eating for the food coma & nap that you'll need, and enjoy!
author: Kelly B.

description: I came here with my best friend and being good girls on a diet, we ordered the French and Fried burger, the Heritage burger, all three types of fries, the vanilla bean milkshake, the chocolate hazelnut milkshake, and a raspberry soda. Everything was good, but I have to say that the shakes are amazing. The French and Fried burger was my favorite over the Heritage, and the sweet potato fries are really yummy too. Definitely a good place to grab a burger in SF.
author: Sheeva G.

description:
BURGER WAS AMAZING.  I got the Tejano with no jalapenos, and it was to die for.  I gave one less star because the beers are $6-8, which is kind of ridiculous.  We also ordered the Fry-Fecta (there were 3 of us), but we only ate about half of it because we were so into our entrees.  Fries were okay, but definitely not something to write home about.

We went on a Tuesday night and were able to get a table after about 5 minutes of waiting.  I will definitely be going there again.
author: Sena S.

description: Stumbled upon this place through yelp after a 10 mile day of hiking and walking around the presidio. I loved the atmosphere and I can only imagine when it's a warm day and you sit outside...ah. I had the truffle fries, which were pretty good..my girlfriend got the mint chip shake, which was also admittedly very good (and I like how they portioned them..because maybe it's just me, but I can never drink an entire 32 ounce cup of a milkshake which seems to be the norm everywhere else) but my BURGER THO. It was probably the most amazing burger I have ever had in my entire life. I'm not joking. I got the one with the egg (maybe it was called the sunny side up or something) yes, all 3000 calories I burned off, I gained in one meal. But it was so worth it.
author: Asia W.

description:
I'm gonna give her some mustard. Bitches loves mustard.

Came to Roam for my birthday lunch as I was craving a burger and have heard a lot of great things about this place. Ordered the French and Fries burger w/ a beef patty and my fiancé ordered the same w/ the elk patty. We also got the sweet potato fries and shared a salted caramel shake w/ two bruléed marshmallows. 

Yum! My burger was cooked to perfection (medium rare) and the shake was great (salty and slightly caramel-y, not overly so). The sweet potato fries were magical, and the marshmallows were a wonderful, gooey end to the meal. 

There were a couple downsides, however. The elk burger was over cooked (ordered medium rare) and there was too much mustard on my burger. Now, I love mustard...we have several varieties in our fridge...love it...but the burger had so many other flavors (truffle fries, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, gruyere, beef...) that I wanted to taste so the overwhelming amount of dijon was a slight disappointment.

Still, there was nothing left on our plates...so...yeah we'll be back.
author: Tysen C.

description: Been wanting to hit ROAM for a while now. I must admit it lived up to my expectations. We split a Heritage Burger with beef and added an egg and a side of truffle fries. Everything was delicious. Oh man and we had a chocolate mint chip shake that was to die for. They even use Straus Milk which is from when I live at in Petaluma. I was highly impressed and look forward to devouring another burger there soon. Good stuff, we will be back!
author: Michael B.

description:
One thing you need to know about this place is that you have to find your own seating. So when it's busy, you'll be standing around stalking the next group of people who are ready to leave. 

What I like here is that you get to customize your burger, everything from the choice of bun, meat, toppings, and cheese. You can add as much toppings as you like, it's $1.00-$1.50 more. As you can imagine, the price of a burger can easily be over $10 depending on what you want on it.

The shoestring zucchini is not that great. It's so thin, that you don't taste the zucchini, only the fried batter. The truffle fries were OK, the aroma and taste of the truffle were mild, I like it a bit stronger.
author: Jun W.

description:
delicious!!!

the burgers are super juicy and flavorful, and the sweet potato fries are pretty bomb. they've got some unique offerings. i went with the BBQ though...the sauce was perfectly tangy.

the best part of my meal, though - salted caramel shake!!!!!

not crazy about the order-at-the-counter process because there was a confusion about my fries order, but oh well.
author: Caroline I.

description:
Holy deliciousness. I've had very good experience with burgers in this city, and Roam is no exception. Really really good burger, on the healthier and less greasy side of the burger spectrum. 

I had the Pacific Blue and my friend had the Heritage, and we scarfed them down before really even touching our Fry-fecta basket of fries. I don't even really know what watercress is, but it was good! Perfect size to fill you up if you get a side to go with it. 

Not a lot of drink options that I could see,  but the setup is nice. Some booths, some tables, some outdoor seating. If you want a fancy burger this is it!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Burgers were good - flavorful meat and not overcooked. Appreciated they were still a bit pink. 

Fry-fecta was not as good as it first seemed it would be. Zucchini was flavorless and I think I'm over the whole sweet potato fry movement unless they're really great (which they weren't). 

It was busy, but not so busy that I should have had to wait 15 minutes for my food to be brought out. My friend, who ordered at the same time, had already finished before I event got my burger.
author: Jory M.

description:
5 stars for the stellar food, minus 1 star for the cashier's unnecessary attitude. 

I went on a Thursday night with my girls all excited to try this burger place that we've been hearing rave reviews about. I ordered the Heritage burger which was so impeccably made. The bacon just draped on the sides of the burger, I loved it! 

The only downfall is, one of the cashiers gave us major attitude and rolled her eyes at us throughout the transaction. I'm sorry you had to work on Friday night, but I didn't order a burger with a side of attitude, so please keep that to yourself.  The other girls working that night were very sweet and the food runners were very helpful as well.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Food: Maybe it's the beers I had before we got to Roam, but I thought my burger was awesome. The meat was juicy, the flavors were simple but complex and the zucchini string haystack was a different but still good modern take on the traditional onion strings. A lot of creative burgers but none too overly complex that it removes the joy of having a burger. 

Ambiance: Simple modern barn/warehouse feel.

Service: Order at the counter but burgers came out fairly quickly.

Price: Under $10 or $15 with a beer.

Overall: Great place for a burger and beer in the Marina.
author: Binh D.

description: This burger was the most amazing burger I have had ever! It's so simple but so flavorful! Also there truffle fries are a must have! Must try if your craving a burger in San Fran!
author: Fiona S.

description:
Ok, so the 3 star review may be a little harsh. It's probably like a 3.5 star but Yelp won't let me do that (maybe I'll write a second review with a 4 and see if they let me average them out). Anyway, considering Umami is only a few short blocks away, I would definitely prefer to spend my money there. The Roam burger is decent, but just doesn't blow me away. 

I will say, however, that I tried the salted caramel milkshake and it was pretty bomb. I may have to return if I ever feel like I need a quick, 500 calorie injection of deliciousness.
author: Mike P.

description:
My fast food dream!  

Deliciously indulgent gourmet burgers, without the overly indulgent proportions.

Meats are free range, grass fed, organic - juicy and flavorful. I get my patty medium rare. Prefer elk to beef and bison.

French fries are garnished with fresh parsley and shaved gruyere, or truffles and parmesan. 

Toppings range from the standard tomatoes and lettuce to watercress, crimini mushrooms, herbed mayo, jalapeno relish, applewood smoked bacon, fried eggs... the selection is fantastic!

The drink menu compliments the food perfectly - creamy milkshakes, beers on tap, local sodas or Kombucha Botanica sparkling tea.
author: Sabrina F.

description:
I don't know if it gets too much better than Roam.

I am very concerned about what I eat, particularly when it comes to meat. Roam is amazing in this respect. Everything is organic, even their Heinz ketchup. Their beef, elk, bison, and turkey are all grass fed, free range. And honestly, for that kind of quality, their prices are not bad. You can get a regular beef burger for six bucks. If you ball out and get a double bison burger with all the fixin's you're around 14 bucks, but still.

Their sides are excellent. Sweet potato fries, broccolini, and other good veggies. They also have a very decent selection of beer, and delicious milkshakes.

Every time I go here, I leave feeling totally satisfied, and 100% guilt-free. Isn't that how it should be?
author: Nick B.

description:
Jesus H. Christ this was a good burger.  Grass-fed...those are the two words that lead to deliciousness.  Plus, the bacon is ALSO natural (whatever pigs eat?).  The place is more cafeteria-like with a decent bar -- they serve Fat Tire in cans.  Cans!?  Ok, thats cool -- and gets pretty packed.

I almost felt ashamed to be eating something so good -- and I was by myself so I pretty much put my full attention into devouring (key word) my burger.  Whatever, nobody in there knew me.
author: Jon M.

description:
Grabbed a burger with a few friends. Super crowded, 5 of us to this tiny table. I forgot which burger I ordered but it had bacon in it. It was alright, the meat was cooked just how I like it but there wasn't enough kick to the burger and it was super oily. By the time I was finished with my burger, there was a pool of grease large enough for me to soak my fries in.

The onion fries were pretty good though and my friend told me the shakes with the roasted marshmallow were "to die for". So maybe I will give it another shot next time and tell them to "hold the oil".
author: Wilson T.

description:
Quality local farm fresh food that is absolutely delicious! 
My husband and I love this place.  Even my old trainer at the gym recommends them as it's a healthier version of a yummy food splurge.  My only wish is that their bacon was nitrate free.  Other than that we have no complaints about this place!
author: Rebecca S.

description: Knocking a star off my initial review. For some reason they can't seem to properly cook their turkey burgers anymore. Forget about receiving your turkey burger "cooked through" or close to it. You'll only get pink, lukewarm meat. I sent it back twice and then just gave up since I didn't have all afternoon to help them get it right. The manager apologized and was nice enough to give me a gift card. I left hungry and disappointed though :-(
author: 1 D.

description:
Oh it's so good. I had the french & fry and the fried onion and zucchini haystack. And a salted caramel milkshake.

The burger: Perfect, a little messy, the caramelized onions were maybe the best part. They tasted like french onion soup on your burger. Honestly I couldn't really taste the fried which is probably good, because the gruyere was more important. 

The fried bowl of deliciousness: So thin and light, I couldn't even tell if it was onions and zucchini and it somehow didn't feel greasy. Ask for some ranch and drench it!

The shake: A $5 shake even John Travolta as Vincent Vega wouldn't question.

The girls working there were nice. It was quick to order and for the food to come out. Good ice water. The only thing wrong with this place is that it's on Union Street in the Marina.
author: Alex M.

description:
If you want a burger - GO HERE!!!!

Amazing burgers, extremely well done.  Great fries and really really good sweet potato fries - THEY KNOW HOW TO MAKE SWEET POTATO FRIES!!!

Gets a bit crowded, small restaurant, but if you dont mind sharing a table with a stranger its a great spot.  

Order at the counter and they bring it to your table.  Good beers on tap, interesting decor inside.

3 small tables outside, nothing great,  but does offer that option!!

BEST BURGER SPOT I HAVE BEEN TO IN A WHILE!!!!
author: Jorge C.

description:
I love my new neighborhood. Especially when I get to try places like Roam. Had just finished a kickass yoga class and needed to refuel. Had read about Roam in one of the SF magazines and knew they had veggie options. Needed something quick and casual as we were still dressed for yoga. 

Great menu. Lots of options to choose from and easy to make subtractions or substitutions without any drama. 

We both had their homemade veggie burgers, one was the Tejana with Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avacado, Tomato, White Corn Strips and Herb Ranch and the other was the Classic with Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Onions, House-Made Pickles and sauce. Yum yum yum. We both agreed that these were by far the best Veggie burgers we had ever tasted. I will definitely be back.
author: Heather L.

description:
Good food, and vegan/vegetarian options too...came here with a diverse group of six and we all found food we enjoyed. The agave sweetened sodas and sweet potato fries were great.

Major Con: I lightly tapped the glass that I had my agave sweetened soda (delicious!) in and it fell over and shattered. Minutes later, another girl dropped a glass and the same thing happened. They need stronger more durable glassware...
author: A. P.

description: Five stars, because it's ALWAYS good and satisfying and not $16. The Tejano is my official favorite, and the tri-fri plate is a must.
author: Gina P.

description: I ordered the Bison Burger, French and Fries style. Comes with truffle Parmesan fries in the burger. The best combo I've had so far on a burger. Almost ordered one to go just to have later but no room on a motorcycle to carry it. The mint chip shake was great, didn't have a fluff like other milkshakes do. This place is a must if you love burgers.
author: Christian S.

description:
The haystack and the amazing shakes (get the marshmallow on top!) are top-shelf and I like their healthy approach to burgers. But, if you order the different types of meat, additional patties and add-ons, the price can climb big-time. One thing to note: The turkey patties are nearly inedible. They are tasteless and can best be compared to construction paper.  I saw some reviews here saying people were shocked when their burgers came pink inside. They explain it to you at the counter, if you want it well all you have to do is ask. So many people write lame reviews. If your burger is too pink, send it back ands quit whining. 
Also, the space can be tight when they're crowded and the service sloooows way down when they're packed as well. When I go in there during the week, I can get my order within 12-15 minutes. Last Saturday I went there and I waited 35-40 minutes. Just so you know.
author: ed A.

description:
OK, when I go to a place like this, I always put it down to:

1. Did I enjoy the food (this has nothing to do with big portions etc)?
It was good, not fantastic. I had the salad with the patties, and it was not the off the box greens as far as I could tell which made me happy. The patties were quite oily though as if they had been cooked twice or sitting in oil which I didn't like, and a bit overcooked.

My partner in crime had the veggie burger and he gave it a 4 out of 5 and a 5 out of 5 for the meyer, agave soda so he was happier than me with his food.

2. How was the service?
Hmmm... points for improvising a container to get my dogs some water.
Also, points for the busboy for being pleasant and smiling. If I could tip him alone, I would.
Points taken out from the woman behind the counter who took our order, and when asked if someone could clean the dirty table for us, came out huffing and puffing and clearly not happy with us. Darling, you are a cashier, not a chef.

It was trendy and fun and the fries were Awesome.

I'll go back in a month or so to see if I feel any better for it.
author: Mirto H.

description:
Overrated and overpriced. Every Burgermeister is better.  Pearl's way outshines and nearby Polker's does a better job on the burger with full table service at a lower price.

After hearing some fairly positive things about Roam, I decided to check it out for myself. Ordering was similar to most other burger joints, where you place an order and the food is brought to your table.  The menu is basic burger fare with a handful of pre-designed burgers and a build your own menu. 

My first beef (pun intended) was with the upcharge for Bison -- an extra $2.99!!  Hey, Roam, it's only a 1/4 lb burger, that makes the upcharge for buffalo $12/lb.  Ridiculous. And what's up with a 1/4 lb burger -- that might be big for MickeyD's, but a sneakily undersized burger for an "artisan" burger joint.  

My next beef was that the patty was quite thin -- I guess it has to be to make a 1/4 lb stretch to the size of the bun -- and cooked medium to medium-well. With a burger that thin, it would be nigh on impossible to get the burger insides warm and keep it just medium-rare.  :( 

The fixings on the burger were OK, but not outstanding and the burger itself (per above) really wasn't all that good. The sides were tasty (had regular fries and sampled some sweet potato fries).  The beer menu was a bit limited and no prices shown for their selection of bottled beers. Imagine my surprise when the cash register rang up $8 for a 12oz bottle of Dogfish.

With the pricey specialty beer and the excessive upcharge for bison, my jaunt to Roam took almost $25 out of my pocket, for a so so burger.  :(  Next time, I'll roam down to Pearls...
author: Tom Y.

description:
Weekly Cheat Meal Alert!

Rating: 7

Dish(es): Sunny Side Bison Burger and Fry Fecta

Review: One more time, the same problem.  Amazing look and presentation, but bland taste.  

Burger was big and moist, however the taste wasn't completely there even with the amazing ingredients (sesame buns, fried egg, gruyere cheese, house sauce, caramelized onions etc).  Still enjoyed it though.

On the fry fecta side, the sweet potato fries were very average, onion/zucchini fries were swimming in oil.  Regular fries were good.

Cheat meal well spent.
author: Athlete W.

description:
grass fed beef is the way to go on these burgers

tried the bison but it is a bit tough and gamey

tri-fectal fries order is good

like their home made soda 

caramel salt shake with burned marshmallow is OK
author: X B.

description:
This place offers great stuff on and with the burgers but the meat is just ok and you can't get them to cook it any less than medium well.  Fries and Sweet Potato Fries are very good.  Strauss Creamery based Milkshakes are the highlight.

Their new outpost in the Eastern suburb of Lafayette is a very welcome addition in that town.
author: Clarke H.

description: Excellent burgers. Great selection of proteins from the good quality grass fed beef, turkey burgers, veggie burgers, and my favorite bison/buffalo burger.  On the last time I visited, they had Elk patties which sounded interesting.  I like that you can build your own burger with your favorite/fresh toppiongs.  The organic ketchups and hot sauces are great too (over by the water pitchers).  They also have a decent selection of beers on tap and bottle, and serve wine and milkshakes !!!
author: Dan M.

description:
Seriously hung over from NYE, needed/craved some burgers and fries within walking distance. Jumped on Yelp and found this place about 4 blocks away.

Really rates a solid 3 1/2 stars. Dinging 1/2 star for the bun. Doesn't support the burger very well. Had the heritage burger with elk cooked medium with just a touch of pink.. Loved it. Elk was soooooooo good. DH had their classic beef burger cooked medium rare. Said was good also but same comment about the bun. Don't want a "bigger" bun, maybe just toasted.Noticed later that could have ordered a whole wheat bun. Both were cooked perfectly.

Also had the Fry-Fecta which is russets, sweet potatoes and a zucchini/onion haystack. Was tasty. Liked that the fries were neither too skinny or too thick. As Goldilocks says, they were just right.

Unfortunately, I'm getting used to paying a pretty penny for burgers of decent quality. Our meals without drinks was $23. Not TOO bad. The elk is a $2 add-on. Saw some salads go by that looked good. 

Next time I'll try their shakes. If those are good, I'll probably up the rating to 4 stars.

Restaurant is small but I wouldn't consider it tiny. Has one long communal table in the middle then room to seat about 20 other people (including outside) then can seat another 8 or so at the bar. Speaking of bars, they also serve beer/wine which is cool but was so hung over, couldn't even partake. Service was personable enough and even though it was packed got our food relatively quick.
author: Eastsac G.

description:
Short 'Script: Marina trendy, overpriced and lacking of meat, but fresh good ingredients put together well.  Order at the counter.

I think basic issue and why I cannot give it 5 or 4 stars, is because frankly it is overpriced. The patty is small, and the burger flavor is so so. 

Otherwise I guess everything else here is pretty good.
author: Steven C.

description:
Nothing particularly special about the burgers here, though it's a convenient place to get a quick fix for us Crunchers and/or close by neighbors.

I had the double bison. It was actually pretty good meat - not gamey and seasoned well. The bun was nothing special - kinda reminded me of a Big Mac bun complete with the sogginess that results from too much sauce/burger juice penetration. The house sauce is tasty, though, so I guess I shouldn't complain too much.

The seasoned vegetables are a bit misleading. I think the menu says something like a mix of kale and butternut squash with pumpkin pesto. I think I maybe had one and a half small pieces of kale and squash that was seasoned with too little salt and too much parmesean. Didn't like it with the pesto either. 

Perhaps if I try the sweet potato fries with truffle parmesean my opinion of the sides and maybe the overall burger combo experience will improve. Next time; stay tuned...
author: Marie A.

description: A great place for a tasty, plentiful , and hot hamburger with great service. The minute you walk in the door there's a menu on the wall that appears to be intimating but yet descriptive. If there was a test afterwards on the various burgers offered here I would flunk it. So, that's where the person behind the counter comes in and makes some detail suggestions, which was helpful to us. The burger I had ordered was delicious and cooked just right.  The overall environment was great to carry on a simple conversation with our dining party. The milkshakes where also delicious, and they went well with the Fry -Fecta which we had ordered. Overall, great place for some eats that are reasonably priced, and if you don't like the company least the meal will be tasty.
author: Kurt C.

description:
Sooooo satisfying.

While I appreciate some of the finer burgers in the city at places such as Spruce and Garibaldi's, the major problem with these spots is that they are (especially Spruce) fine restaurants. And honestly, when I'm craving a burger on a Friday night when I do not have a sitter and am going to be stuffing my face at home, I do not want to shuffle through the valets and high society in my comfort wear to pick up a lame to-go order. I just don't. I also don't want to spend $20 on the burger. Okay, I may be exaggerating, but not all that much.

Roam hits that "I'm craving a burger beyond In-n-Out" spot better than any place I have personally encountered in San Francisco. Please do not tell me that Burger Joint and Barney's are legitimate contenders. Barney's is only good for the shakes, and Burger Joint is good for nothing, really, except a fluorescent-induced headache.

I enjoyed the French and Fry burger sans cheese - a great idea to put fries on a burger since I remember doing this as a kid - and had three varieties of fries amongst friends to nosh on (truffled parmesan - russet, chipotle maple - sweet potato, and a less remarkable but still good herb something or other). When all that was done, I was thrilled to still have room for a salted caramel shake. That, to me, defines perfect portioning.

I will definitely be back - a lot.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place for a while, but it never seems like a good/healthy time to eat a burger.  Well, on my birthday, what better way to splurge.

I had the french and fries with bison - DELICIOUS.  Juicy without being overly greasy.  I felt full but not gross.  We also had the blood orange soda, which was good but not too sweet.
author: B. Y.

description: Went because of the reviews by others. Ordered the classic with cheese and truffle fries as a base comparison to other joints. Burger was juicy and the pickles were tasty. Place has a nice vibe. It was just okay. Disappointed from the hype. Wish I had tried Super Duper instead.
author: Phil O.

description:
It was my birthday and I didn't want anything fancy just a really good burger. Boy did I find the right place. Service was simple and quick just what you want in a burger place and the food was great.

bb
author: Ray B.

description:
My boyfriend an I split a veggie burger, normal beef burger, sweet potato fries and a side salad (had to get in those veggies!). The food was tasty and prepared well. It took a long time to get our food but they were pretty busy that night. My favorite item was the veggie burger. Veggie burgers can often be bland and dry, but this one was delicious. Not to mention, they use beets in their patty so it gives it a pinkish tint...almost looks like a real burger.

The only frustration I had was the lack of seating available. People were hovering over tables like vultures waiting to scoop up and eat their prey. Even when we did find a place to seat it felt cramped and people kept bumping into my chair. 

My suggestion is to order to go or try to go during their "downtime"...not sure when that is though.
author: Holly F.

description:
I work down the street from this cute yummy burger joint and I CANT GET ENOUGH. Technically I should give them one star off, because I've gained at least 5lbs since I started going, but I wont because everything I've had has blown my effing mind. There French and Fries burger is too die for, i slowly melt with each bite. There milkshakes are yummy ( i suggest salted caramel). I've even had a burger with a fried egg on top and it rocked my world. I can't say enough good things about this place. Yea parking in the area is eh, but its SF...get over it :) 

Staff is friendly, give it a shot.
author: Dani J.

description:
This place was BOMB! I made my own burger: veggie patty (which is by the way the best veggie patty I've ever had in my life), with onions, lettuce, a free range egg, and oil and vinegar slaw on a whole grain bun. It was fantastic! 

The wait was not bad at all. It took 5 minutes for me and my friend to get a table on a Saturday afternoon. The food came out pretty quick as well...I'd say it took about 10 minutes for them to make it. 

Worth the money. I would definitely come back to this place again.
author: Ashley M.

description: Great burgers (a lot of different variants), fast service! Best option for burgers on Union.
author: Wilhelm F.

description:
The things I like: Simple menu, quality ingredients, nice people (you don't get service per se because you order off a board menu, but the staff are very friendly.)

Onion and Zucchini stack are off the hook. Lightly fried, not greasy AT ALL. Perfect. Sweet potato fries are also delicious. We got two burgers, Elk and Bison. Tasty but not memorable. 2 burgers, two fried sides and two beers for $45. For that price, I'm not craving a repeat but it was worth trying.
author: Celeste R.

description:
Forget about the burgers, it's all about the shakes With Bruléed Marshmallow! I highly recommend you get a burger with YOUR SHAKE. 

I also ordered two beers at the bar for a total of $13.00 + tip! It's a gourment burger restaurant so I paid the price. The the zucchini onion haystack was not my favorite. The zucchini got lost in the process. Maybe I was thinking zucchini sticks too much.
author: johanna a.

description:
A-OK to Good describes my Roam experience. 

I like their food politics, the kombucha and "homemade soda" on tap, and their many options. We got a huge market salad, Fry-Fecta, and a BBQ bison burger. The blackberry soda in particular was fantastic, and I say that as someone who typically doesn't bother with soda. Salad does not play second-fiddle in this Meat Palace: the farmer's market salad was loaded with goodies and provided a welcome balance to an otherwise heavy meal. The fries were as good as other reviewers promise, although I suggest sharing with more than one other person. We found ourselves in the spot where we needed to choose between wasted food or a stomach ache. 

Surprisingly, the most underwhelming item was the burger. The meat was juicy but a little bland - perhaps it needed some salt? And the bun was somewhat soggy upon arrival. Perhaps this was because of our menu choice - BBQ sauce could account for the lack of meaty oomph and bun crispness - so I'll need to try them again to render a verdict.

3.5 stars.
author: Monica S.

description:
I don't know if I came on an off-day or what....but the texture of the veggie burger was unacceptable.  The flavors were okay, but wow -- what a mushed up mess.  Pretty disappointing.

Our chocolate shake was tasty, and the bruléed marshmallow was admittedly pretty special.  But at $8 we left feeling sort of robbed.
author: Kathryn B.

description:
Totally digging Roam.  

Always make my own burger...great selection of meats (or veggie - if youre into that kinda thing) and toppings...I mean...everything is better with an egg, right?  But - no bacon!?  Really?? **Update: They do now have bacon...I stand corrected.  Time to go get some eggs and bacon on my burger!**

Good fries but dont love the onion straws.  

Great place for a casual, reasonably priced burger and a beer.
author: Ken S.

description:
Love this place!!!

Where do I begin?!  The ambiance of this great new spot located on Union Street is rustic yet warm.  As soon as you walk in, you have plenty to look at and you feel the inviting energy from the staff that greet you warmly every time.

Roam has found a great balance of giving perfect portions that aren't too heavy of quality organic dishes.  From their home made sodas that are made with mostly locally grown, organic extracts to their sweet potato fries, you really can't go wrong.

I am not of the carnivorous type, so I opted for the Quinoa Veggie Burger, which was one to really write home about.  Between their fresh whole wheat bun and home made nutrient filled patty, I was greatly impressed!

This is great place to enjoy the outside seating on a beautiful San Francisco day while having some real "feel good" and "taste good" food.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Service sucks
But the "Pacific Blue" topping of blue cheese and carmalized onions is to die for!!!
author: Elias M.

description: Thought the sesame bun was too much. Next time will try the gluten free. Truffle fries were Delicious. Overall good not great, 5045 burger is better
author: Coba C.

description:
Delicious!

I had a turkey burger BBQ style and it was delicious! The bread got a bit soggy but that happens. I also ordered the seasonal vegetable which was brussel sprouts. They were very tasty - lots of fresh parmesan cheese and chili flakes.

My only regret is that I did not get the pumpin spice milkshake. Next time for sure!
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Roam is another delicious burger joint on Union Street.  If I went to Umami Burger and couldn't wait for a seat, I would just walk on down to Roam to satisfy my burger craving.

8pm on a Saturday and the place is packed.  It's one of those joints where you place your order and pay, then they give you a # on a stand, and basically say "good luck on finding a table."  That's when you and everyone else scan the whole restaurant with a eagle eye, looking where people are at with their meal, hoping that they're just about done.

The food...
French and fries beef burger:  The patty was cooked perfectly.  It was juicy with the right amount of pink.  The truffle parmesan fries was a nice addition as a starch component.  The fresh avocado and the nicely caramelized onions completed this ultimate burger.

Tejano beef burger:  Although this burger has two ingredients that should add a bit of a kick, pepper jack & jalapeño relish, I did not taste them at all.  So don't expect any spice from this burger.  In any case, still a good burger.  The white corn strips added a nice texture and gave it a crunch.

Salted caramel shake:  Not too thick and had the right amount of sweet to it.

Instead of fries, we ordered the seasonal veggies which was Chinese broccolli.  Yes, I know, you're saying veggies with a burger?  I guess you can say it's a way of being kinda healthy while eating a burger.  But hey, they were good!  They added some grated parmesan cheese which actually works with these veggies.

$30 for 2 burgers, a small shake, some veggies, and two happy stomachs.  It was worth every penny.
author: Suzi K.

description: Burgers at Roam are delicious! You pay at the register and then they bring the food to your table.  The wait is never long, which I love and everything I've tried so far has been very tasty! The staff is always friendly and always greet you with a smile which is also a plus in my book.
author: Ashley L.

description:
I've been here twice already and both times were just okay. The first time I came here, I ordered a Veggie burger and I couldn't remember what special it was, but I remember not enjoying it and that's all I need to remember! The patty is quinoa based and I thought it would be like a soy protein boca burger like patty. Nope. The patty was dry and tasteless. 

The second time I came here, I ordered the burger with eggs in it with Turkey patty. It tasted much better and my egg was actually oozing with yolk :) It was yummy but for the cost of the burger, seems more plain than yummy:(

I feel like its wayyy overpriced for a burger even though its organic and high quality ingredients. A burger is a burger guys! I guess I'm only negative about this is because my boyfriend wanted In-n-Out instead of Roam and by the end of our meal, I wish I had listened.
author: Connie C.

description:
Ho.ly.shit.

Definitely coming back here.
author: Alexandra C.

description:
depending on what time of day parking is easy or difficult.

LOVED IT!  Grass fed beef.  You can also get Buffalo, Turkey, or Elk.  

Choose your cheese it costs extra.  The milkshakes are incredible also.  Like in Pulp Fiction, THATS A 5 Dollar 12oz milkshake!

It can add up quickly though.  But enjoy!
author: Bing D.

description: Went to Roam with some friends a few weeks back. The meal was great and priced moderately but I feel like the hype set my expectations higher than normal. Their milkshakes and fries were fantastic but the burgers were not mind blowing. I like the concept of the grass fed beef and the fresh milk so I'll be back but just don't set your expectations too high or you might be disappointed.
author: Mike T.

description:
Absolutely bangin' burgers.

Sis and Broil had just landed and we were all a bit hungry for some dinner action.  I mentioned burgers and since they were just returning from feasting on Seafood all week long, they were ecstatic.  I did a bit of research previously and Roam popped up in the results of being a highly rated burger joint.

We loved the many meat options such as Bison, Turkey, Veggie and grass fed Beef.  Even though it isn't mentioned on-line, I remember seeing on the restaurant menu the mention of Elk for an up charge.  Two of us opted for Bison which carried an up charge of $2.99 each. 

I decided on the Tejano which comes with Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch.  Usually when I enjoy a burger there is a moment where despite the toppings it already has, I would dip it in some ketchup and mustard.  I just love the mixture of the two condiments and a good burger in it.  From the moment of my first bite to the savoring of the last bite I was in total bliss.  The three of us were quietly admiring the burger choices made and enjoying our spoils.  We shared a Fry-fecta which comes with a zucchini onion haystack and Russet and sweet potato fries.  The counter guy suggested a dipping sauce which lightly topped all three.  Russet and sweet potato fries were the favorite, the latter forgettable.  Total for three burgers with upgrades, a shared side, two beers and a soda was somewhere over fifty five bucks.  A little steep but the food and time spent was excellent.

Nice spot with woody decor.  Love the bar, I believe the bartender was stating it came from a solid piece from the trunk of a tree found in Sonoma county.  Created by a local wood worker.  

The place is popular so seating is hard to come by as the night draws on.  You order food at the counter and receive a number to place at your table.  Most tables suit fours and the center of the space is filled with a large communal table which could suit a party of up to twelve.  I would suggest not sending folks ahead and saving tables as most do not do that and it'd be frowned upon.  Also if you are a parent, it is obnoxious to bring double wide strollers in here.
