Saw this drunken father trying to push a stroller with baby in hand between the bar and communal table without maneuvering seated folks.  It made for an ugly situation.  Since the place is uber popular, the weeknight drew in some sexy in the city types.  If I was a local, I'd probably swing with a wing-man and stop in for a bite and beer often.

If you love burgers, you'd better bookmark it.
author: Jacob J.

description:
AHMAZING!
My boyfriend discovered this place on Yelp last week when we were vacationing in San Fran and I am so happy he did.I got the original veggie burger and it was one of the best ones I have ever had ( I've had a good share of veggie burgers). We ordered the parm fries and they were soooo delicious. Everything melts in your mouth and the prices are super reasonable. If you love burgers you have to stop by this place next time you are on Union St!
author: Kolbie R.

description:
I checked out Roam with a girlfriend and between us, got a good cross section of the menu.

The food,
Burger: definitely decent; lots of ways to customize to taste by choosing your meats and toppings. With regard to 'doneness', you can request the burger be cooked two ways, 'pink' or 'not pink'. That worked for me, though. The toppings were fresh and the bun deserves notice, it's really good! The result is definitely better than your average fair but it didn't blow me away, either. It's a decent burger.

Fries menage, (three different kinds of fries, russet, sweet potato  and zucchini): here, I wasn't impressed. They're cut thin so they feel greasy, especially the zucchini which amounts to fried shredds - I guess the ratio to 'crisp edge' to 'potato middle' is just too great for my taste.  They didn't sit well in my stomach, and don't hold the heat very long.

Milkshake: Awesome. I got the Blue Bottle Coffee one. It's nectar. I agree with another review below, a wider straw would be a great idea.

House pear soda: also delicious, bright, crisp and refreshing. 

Overall, I'd go back. The decor makes eating there fun and the sandwich was definitely good.
author: Mark N.

description: Juicy, yummy burgers that you can pretty much customize to your liking.  There's really nothing unique I can say that other positive reviews haven't already said.  I highly recommend the chocolate chip mint shake!
author: Jess H.

description:
Solid food, but I can't give it more than 3 stars... 

On the first trip I had the bison burger BBQ style The burger was very tasty and the BBQ style components went great together. However the printed menus showed a .99 up charge for bison and when I went to pay it was 2.99 more. As others mentioned the patties are very small, which make this insanely overpriced. Buffalo is $12 more a pound?! WTF

Sweet potato fries were solid. Crunchy on the outside and light and fluffy inside. Beef burgers are very tasty as well, but underwhelming.

Over $15 for a burger, fries and a drink without table service and with food that still leaves you hungry doesn't work for me. 

Yes I love Cow hollow and union street ( I do live on Union), but I'd much rather go to Polkers if i'm hungry and craving a burger.
author: Mike K.

description:
Maybe it's because I haven't had sugar in two weeks, but that salted caramel milkshake threw me into a major swoonfest. Remember when you were a kid and you would dip your fries in a vanilla milkshake? No? That was just me? Well, that's what this milkshake was like. A Wonka-like combination of sweet and salt. 

The veggie burger (which is what I actually came to try), was...alright. Better than your defrosted veggie burger but does not come close to topping Herbivore's. The truffle parmesan fries were good, but not mind-blowing. 

I am rarely in this neighborhood, but I won't forget you, milkshake. You are worthy of a pilgrimage.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Went for a burger with a friend after gym ( crunch next door )

She got regular burger with something spicy.  ( yum )
I got the Bison. ( super yum )
And sweet potato fries.

The seating wasn't that great - wish it was a little more comfy, but the food was great. One of my favorite burger places.
author: ThuZ W.

description:
My coworkers and I came here for Friday lunch. I had the Create your Own
 where I choose the beef patty- Pacific Pastures 100% Grass-Fed & added a few toppings (choice of traditional sesame seed or whole grain Pacific Coast Bakery bun).  $5.99 

-Organic Heinz Ketchup
-Butter Lettuce
-House-Made Pickles
-Aged White Cheddar(add $1)
-Cremini Mushrooms (add $1)
-Sweet Potato Fries $3.49
author: Stacey L.

description: Burgers.....mmmmm!!!  Their menu is creative (my personal fav is French & Fries), the staff is friendly and attentive, and I love that bison is an option. It's healthier and has a much higher iron content than beef. The only thing I'm not a fan of is their sodas.
author: Nicole W.

description: Loved the turkey burger. Thought the bison was too earthy/gamey. Fries made up for it though the milkshake was tad sweet. Love the ambiance. Only blocks from my house; I will be back!
author: Vipul H.

description: I can't say enough good things about Roam. The sweet potato fries are so perfect, I can't even. The burgers are awesome, the ambience is sick, the people are nice, and the overall vibe is so damn chill. There is nothing about this place that isn't great.
author: Verna J.

description: Best burger and sweet potato fries in the city. Not a 5 star meal, but one of the most satisfying in the city!
author: Emily K.

description:
Yummy burgers and fries.

Came here for lunch and ordered the Chalet Burger (Swiss, Cremini Mushrooms, Watercress, Tomato, House Sauce) with beef.  My bf got the Heritage (Applewood Smoked Bacon, Fontina, Butter Lettuce, Tomato, Caramelized Onions, Herb Mayo) also with beef.  The burgers are just the right size, and you still have room for fries and a shake.  We also got the Fry Fecta (russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack fries).  I liked the zucchini fries the best of the three.  Nice and thin.  I also got the white peach shake which tasted alright.  I've had better though.

The decor of the restaurant is cool too, and you get free water from a barrel dispenser.
author: Joycelyn L.

description: Roam Burgers serve the best burgers in the city!  I've been in here at least 6 times in the last 30 days.  The burgers here are practically custom.  You choose the bun, the meat, the condiments, all at a great price of under $8.50.  It costs slightly more for elk or bison, which I haven't tried yet.  But with tiny burgers costing about $12 down the street at Umami, this place rocks!  The burgers here are 50% bigger than Umami's and 100% more juicy and flavorful.  Their sweet potato fries are so delicious too!  My favorite burger styles here are bbq, chalet, and sunny side (minus the sweet chile sauce though).  With the added convenience of online ordering at their Union Street location, I just can't stay away!
author: Gloria Y.

description: Burger was bloody red (supposedly medium) so I only ate the edges and threw it out. The tri-thing onion strings, regular fries and sweet potato fries was good, but not worth the wait to get a seat (for 1). I don't plan to give it another try when there are much better places out there for burgers (Wood Tavern in Oakland comes immediately to mind).
author: Heather M.

description: Hands down, the best Veggie burger I've ever had.  I don't know what they put in it, but it's heaven in my mouth.  Even my friends (who are not vegetarians) sometimes get the veggie burger...it's that good, trust me!
author: Jake H.

description:
I have only ever had their Veggie Burger, but it is awesome. 
 
It's bright red, homemade and is definitely not trying to pretend to be meat like other veggie burgers. It's so yummy! Some of my meat lover friends love it too. 

Sweet potato fries on the side, and I'm a happy lady. 



.
author: Katie I.

description: One of San Francisco's best burgers, this burger truly represents San Francisco's obsession of using fresh organic ingredients. I really commend this place for its quality of meat and they way they cook it, which is juicy and full of flavor. For those that know me and have read my other reviews, you already know I love my blue cheese so the Pacific Blue is my automatic choice, but I will also stand by the Tejano as a good second option. I've tried the other burgers that I really love from this place but not a fan of the way they make their caramelized onions because it ends up really soggy messing up the bun as well. Pair the meal with the fry-fecta to get some variety for your sides. "When in Roam!...."
author: Limuel G.

description:
Honestly, I haven't had a turkey burger so good all year long. The turkey just dissolved in my mouth. And not the soggy, crumbly dissolution, but the warm, melting, flavor explosion. The sweet potato fries and zucchini fries were awesome too.

Gourmet burgers for a decent price, chill attitude and good food. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Vishal A.

description: It was just OK! Not great, but might try again one more time to see if it leaves a better impression.
author: Priyank D.

description:
I stopped in for lunch last week and had an Elk Burger and a kombucha (they have it on tap, seriously....how cool is that?). That was more than enough to make this caveman happy. 

For burger lovers, foodies, and the paleo crowd, this place has it all. They really know how to make a great burger and I highly recommend the sweet potato fries to accompany any meal.
author: Rob M.

description:
Went back to Roam while on business and was very interested in how the place has changed from the opening year which was when I last visited.

So for the record, it still rocks the casbah! I was solo so I bell'ed up to the Bar and was early so go my order in quick. As they got busy, another server rose from the kitchen to help keep people happy. I think it's one of the owners - Lynn? Anyway, she was so fun and spent time making me feel like I was at her home. I may go back just to see her - she is like a magnet the way she interacts with people. I was hopeful it was because she would agree shag me, but I'll need to put in some more time. I'm sure she gets asked out all of the time as folks drool over the burger and her - she's sexy and she knows it...

Back to the Burger and stuff. She made me a desert that I reluctantly agreed to and I almost lost my shat - it was that good. burned a homemade marsh-mello on a wafer and added to a milk shake. She can feed that to me anytime.
author: JW U.

description:
This is quickly becoming one of my favorite burger places in SF.  The burgers are delicious.  The original burger starts at 5.99(but don't worry, the burger is good, with good ingredients.  When i want just a nice snack to hold me over for a while, I get the original.  However, last time got the Sunny Side which has a fried egg and spicy sauce.  They also have a menu where you can build your own.  Also, the sweet potato fries, regular fries, and zuccini/onion haystack are perfectly cooked.

This place is legit.  Cheap food, plenty of accesories for your burger, and good quality food at that.  Also, it is in a cool neighborhood.
author: Rob B.

description: My fav burger spot, everything is organic & ingredients are high quality
author: Evelyn Z.

description:
I finally managed to make a fact-finding trip to Roam last night, and it did not disappoint. I went the make-your-own route and doubled up on patties, protein addict that I am. The texture was great, and the meat was still pink despite the thickness of the patties. Bonus point for an especially well-crafted pickle chip.  I also decided to spoil myself with sweet potato fries, and felt well rewarded for my recklessness. 

I consider myself a burger connoisseur with go-to spots ranging from In N Out to a few of the criminally fancy variety, and Roam had joined the pantheon!
author: Gabe R.

description:
I found the BEST burger in SF and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg..it is a major trek from the mission, however. 
I love the fresh ingredients and the fact that they have  combo kids meal and strauss milk shakes. burger tasted fresh ground and the french fries reminded me of when I used to eat McDonalds (more than 20 years ago at least) but the healthy version.
LOVED
author: shanestar h.

description: Friendly service, good beers and wines on tap...and really enjoyed the fries with truffle parmesan.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Listen up people, you'll want to try this one! 

They put truffled french fries in one of their hamburgers. For those of you familiar with California Burritos (see my review of Santana's) this is the hamburger version. And it's topped with avocados and Gruyere. If you don't love this one, there's something wrong with you.

Sweet potato fries aren't too shabby either.
author: Kelly C.

description: Came here Friday night with some friends. Parking wasn't that hard to find but that's probably because I got lucky with finding a spot right in front. When we came in around 7, there wasn't a line but after we ordered, there was a constant line. I got the beef sunny side which was like an orgasm in my mouth! Very flavorful and wasn't dry at all. The egg was made perfectly and literally burst in my mouth after one bite. It was a messy burger... or I'm a messy eater... either way, it was delicious! Shared the fry-fecta with my friends and I did not regret it! All 3 fries were delicious, hot, and had a nice crunch.  I've never had zucchini fries before this and it was good. The only gripe I had about it was that it was so thin that eating one piece just required so much work!!! Maybe I'm just a pig... but if I wasn't sharing, I would have gotten a fork and just devoured the whole thing! I also got a blue-bottle coffee shake and that was delicious. I've never had blue-bottle coffee before (don't judge me) but if that's what it tastes like, I've been missing out!!! Overall, the meal was delicious and I definitely recommend it as a destination to try. Place was clean, you order your food at the register, take your number, and wait for your food to be delivered to you. Will definitely come back and try the other burgers... maybe the elk or bison next time!!
author: Johnson S.

description: They make a mean burger. Love the fresh, creative toppings and non-beef options.
author: Jessica G.

description: Solid and creative burgers! Tastes great and plenty of one off options on the menu to choose from. I wanted to give this place 4 stars but after comparing it to other burgers I have had from specialty burger restaurants I settled on 3 stars. I guess it just didn't wow me.
author: Mike B.

description: Had the French and fried bison burger. Looked delicious but it lacked flavor and was just ok, nothing mind blowing. However it was very well prepared and juicy, but just not worth the $12 price tag.
author: Scott W.

description:
They do what they do, perfectly. 

This is not your humongous burger place... 

It is as if someone took a fast food burger and made it amazing and somewhat healthy.

The flavors and textures of their burgers are perfectly balanced. I can't wait to try every variety they have, but for now I know I can get a juicy and tasty burger with some excellent fries, right down the block.

I am craving this place right now. SF needed a casual spot to eat some yummy food without breaking the bank. 

You need to check this place out for yourself. Tasting is believing + where else can you get soft serve and Kombucha with your burger?

I do wish they would show their menu online instead of making people download it to see it. Not good.
author: Claudia O.

description:
GREAT selection of burgers!

They also have a super yummy salad that you can get with 3 mini sliders on a skewer which is perfect for a lighter selection. 

I will definitely be back to try more of the menu.
author: Alison M.

description:
good if you are in the area and want a good burger, fries, and shake.. but i wouldnt go out of my way to go back there.

what i tried:

* blue bottle coffee milk shake - was a bit too thick, you have to wait for a good 10 mins before its "drinkable".

* classic burger - pretty good  although the meat was a bit pink (i agree with other reviews)

* sweet potato fries - definitely get it with the maple glaze, i got it without and it just wasnt the same.
author: Melody T.

description:
Any gourmet burger joint that offers homemade veggie patties is a winner in my book. I can't stand it when a restaurant tries to pass off some frozen disaster as a meal worth spending $10+ on. Needless to say, I was very pleased with Roam's veggie option. I ordered it topped with aged white cheddar cheese and avocado. The sauce they put on it was awesome and tasted a little like what In-n-Out puts on theirs. The lettuce, pickles and tomatoes were crunchy and fresh. I ordered it with their sweet potato fries and a chocolate milk shake. The fries were pretty standard but the milk shake was delicious. It was so rich, though, that I could only drink a little bit of it. 

The only downside to this place is that it's small and cramped. Finding a table can be challenging and it's hard to maneuver around without bumping in to somebody or running in to a chair. Also, it's not for the budget-friendly. My burger, fries and milkshake came to $16...! It was all worth it but I won't be able to come here as much as I'd like because I can't be frequently spending that much $$ on one meal.
author: Julia N.

description:
This place crushes it. Absolutely, unequivically crushes it. I could easily eat here 7 days a week. I'd be 800 lbs, but I could do it. The burgers are out of this world. I've had all but the veggie, and would recommend the bison. I also highly recommend getting it as a Sunny Side (the egg takes the entire thing to a whole new level.) The buns are also awesome. Don't try to be all healthy with the bun though. The sesame is way better than the whole wheat. Fri-fecta, YES!!! Don't question, just do it. You can, however, get away with splitting it between 2 or 3 people. And lastly... Blue Bottle Coffee Shake. Don't you dare! WHAT?!? Yup! I did!
And I'd do it again! Blue Bottle Coffee Shake!!! I'm pretty sure it's what dreams are made of... Also a good chance it's a key component to building a rainbow. At least, that's my guess.

Bla-DOW
author: Jamie N.

description:
The menu is simple:  Sustainable meats and produce.  100 percent grass-fed beef, free-range turkey, all-natural bison and an organic veggie burger.  Straus Family Creamery organic milkshakes, house-made sodas, local beers, wine and Kombucha.

The people were very friendly.  We were there on a night the owner was there, so they were probably on their best behavior, but it seemed that they were just naturally friendly.  This isn't easy to accomplish at the tail end of the evening rush, which is when we were there - so kudos.

I ate the Sunnyside bison burger medium rare and it was one of the best burgers I have had in CA.  It was meaty, juicy and the flavors mingled beautifully.  I also enjoyed their Sweet Potato fries and a local brew.

I seriously eyed the Straus Creamery milkshake, but had to pass.  There were folks throughout Roam who were thoroughly enjoying them. 

The one downside to ROAM is that it is loud, loud, loud.  They could easily put something up on the wall to deaden the sound a bit.  And, the burgers are worth it.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
My friends and I had just finished up the Ghirardelli Chocolate Festival and we were in SERIOUS need of protein to counteract all that sugar, so I suggested Roam!

What I like about this place is that they have different styles you can choose for your burger, BUT if you're picky you can also Create Your Own (WhooOoo!!) I've always opted for CYO because I don't like condiments, I favor certain kinds of cheeses, and avocado is a MUST for my burger.

Well, I decided to change things up and I chose the Sunny Side style for my turkey burger! It was YUM!! Except it could've used avocado. HAHA
OK, but really, it was good! Plenty of egg, plenty of cheese, and those caramelized onions!! Oh baby.
My friends got the bison burger and the veggie burger and they both liked theirs a lot too! We all shared the zucchini onion haystack. That was OK, but the sweet potato fries are better!

Service here is always good! Sometimes it takes a while to get a server's attention for the bill or for more water, but that's during the busy times. This time after the chocolate festival, it was pretty empty, so no frantically waving was done!

I am always down to go to Roam! I have yet to try their shakes!!
author: Kei H.

description:
Definitely feeds the craving.  

I do want to come back for the Elk and Bison burgers.  
I went with the French and Fries which was delightful, but maybe I should not expect much for service.  It's just every time I needed anything, the cashier was texting or checking her phone or moving her car.  I guess I shouldn't expect more, in reality they do not offer service.  So why should I expect it?  Just baffled, thats all.

Maybe its best that I get take out and drink my own wine at home.
author: Au C.

description:
For years, the East end of Union street has had a definite need for a solid burger joint. The thing I appreciate the most about Roam is being able to eat good quality food at a very affordable price point. It takes what everyone loves about In-N-Out, a simple but tasty and inexpensive burger/fries/shake, to the next level by offering grass fed and organic ingredients. Awesome concept, Josh!

Roam's biggest challenge is mastering the logistics of supplying the ever mounting demand. It's not an easy task to marry fast food efficiency with wholesome and delicious results. They've taken steps in that direction already by simplifying the ordering options i.e. burgers are served "pink" or "not pink". No LA Story half caf decaf with a twist high maintenance orderers can hold up the line. For now, I recommend coming at off peak times or being ok with waiting. Seating is first come first serve, but take out is an option if the dining room is too mobbed. 

PS - The salted caramel milkshake is m-a-g-i-c!
author: Rebecca O.

description:
The burgers hit the spot!  I had the beef Sunnyside which comes with egg,  white cheddar, and caramelized onions.  While incredibly tasty, the onions could've been more caramelized.  I also happened to try the shakes, white peach and another flavor that I forgot, and I wouldn't bother with those.  A bit too sweet and artificial tasting.  Also really thick if you like that.  

Love the rustic decor and long tables too.
author: Christine L.

description:
Roam = yum

Such a great meal, got to build my own burger and the truffle parmesan fries were delicious. 

I am definitely going back here!
author: Rachel R.

description:
I'm a burger guy. Whether it's a double double from In 'N Out or an $18 fancy pants burger from Wayfare Tavern, the combo of meat, cheese and bun does it for me every time. Roam does a great job of combining artisanal ingredients with a casual setting while still keeping prices low.

I had the French and Fries burger ($6.99) - truffle Parmesan fries, avocado, Gruyere, and Dijon mustard on a bison patty (add .99) I really liked the flavor combo but the thin patty got lost under so many ingredients...next time I'll make it a double for an extra $1.99.

We also split the Fry-fecta ($4.99) which is a combo of sweet potato fries, russet fries and zucchini onion haystack. This really sounds better in concept than execution...none of the fries were warm enough and the zucchini onion haystack was overwhelmingly salty.

I love the casual, order at the counter atmosphere...we arrived at 6:30pm and the restaurant was pretty empty but by 7:30pm there was a line out the door. We bellied up to the bar and service was friendly but once the line started it was hard for the cashiers to deal with both taking orders and serving us...it might be a good idea to have a dedicated server for the bar instead of having the cashiers manage both.

Overall, a solid four star experience. I plan on coming back and roaming my way through the rest of the menu! (I'm looking at you, milkshake)
author: phil h.

description:
Only. Ok.

I have been a few times, keep trying different stuff, but just always leave a little underwhelmed.

The burgers that I have tried are never especially jucy.

They are fine. Give it a try, because you might have a different experience, but I'm just at OK with them.
author: Jason H.

description: I took my husband, god sons and a friend visting from Glasgow here.  It was wonderful.  Great atmosphere, juicy burgers.  Relaxed, casual, but refined at the same time.  The fries were great too.  Will definitely be returning.
author: Donna B.

description:
A true 3.5 Stars.

In a city full of burger contenders, Roam's going to need to beef up. A welcome addition to the neighborhood, it rests comfortably on Union Street and furnished properly for an after work brew and burger.

A casual, open space, the decor is inviting and simple.

After placing our order, we rested upon a sun bathed table on the front patio. A cold beer never tasted so good.

Roam allows you to customize your burger and the freedom to build is intriguing. Starting with a bison patty, I moved to have the "French and Fry" style which tops the burger with Truffle Parmesan Fries, Avocado, Gruyere and Dijon Mustard.

Healthy chunks of Avocado give the burger weight and the truffle fries add gentle texture. A delightful combination of flavor. Where the burger falls off is the patty.

While the creativity of toppings can elevate a burger, the patty truly defines it's legacy, and the meat here just falls flat. While 100% grass fed, the patty lacks depth, size and weight. 

Fish + Farm, Street and Spruce still sit atop the mountain of elite burgers in SF. 

Roam is a great spot, laid back and a fun place to catch up with friends, especially with Brickyard next door. Their Fry-fecta, a heaping plate of sweet potatoe fries, zucchini onion strings and russet fries with a cold one is definitely worth a trip here.

However, when it comes to knocking out my burger craving, I'll have to opt for another SF burger heavyweight.
author: Mike K.

description:
Roam's name could be short for "Really good, decently priced burger". I ordered the Truffle French Fries burger and the waitstaff asked me what kind of meat I wanted. I had no idea that anything besides USDA beef was on the menu..he offered both Elk and Bison. I opted for the Bison and was pleasantly surprised! It was really lean, flavorful meat...vey similar to the best burger I've had in Sao Paolo, Brazil. The sweet potato fries were an optimal choice too. Seating was a bit tight when we arrived but people came and went quickly so that didn't end up being an issue.

I left full...and happy. :)
author: Morin O.

description:
They really do make good (& cheap) burgers. Their Sunshine (w/ egg) was delish! Salty & greasy but yummy! The sweet potato fries make me happy. 

It was loud, and not exactly a dining experience, but the burger was damn good.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Nice burgers! Had veggie burger Tejano style and French and fries style.

Next time would like to try the sunny side style.
author: Kavita A.

description:
Met some out-of-town friends at Roam for an early Sunday dinner:  4 adults, 4 kids, in around 5:30.  

Overall, a great value (8-dollar burgers that come with a lot of toppings if you want them, or you can create your own), good beers (Racer 5 and Anchor on tap), and lots of high-quality menu items to keep people of all ages happy. 

I had the Beef Heritage burger: think BLT burger with caramelized onions and fontina cheese - I liked it, and next time I would consider paying the up-charge for a double (2.99).  I think that means I liked it and I wanted more of it.  Grass-fed beef?  Yes, please.

Fry-fecta (sampler) - definitely worth it, though I thought the best fries were the zucchini-onion "haystack."

Artisan Veggie side dish: tomatoes and baby squash roasted and topped with parmesan.  Pretty good and makes you feel better about having burgers, fries, and shakes.  

Missus/kids had turkey burger with lettuce/tomato/mayo and were pleased.  They also enjoyed the salted caramel, vanilla and chocolate milkshakes. No complaints by my recollection. 

All in all, a nice dinner out, made even nicer since it was extremely kid-friendly.  We did get lots of furtive-but-still-stank-eye from numerous patrons that came in around 7 PM since we basically took over the biggest communal table in the dining room.  Whatever, people.  We don't get out that often with the whole family and when we get to a place that takes good care of us, we camp out and order lots of food and drinks (Did I not mention Racer 5 and Anchor on tap?  How can latchkey parents not love that?!) And we leave early, so everybody (eventually) wins.

We'll definitely be back when we're in the neighborhood. Would like to try the bison, and other specials (they had Elk yesterday but I wanted to go with the beef burger my first time in).  This is a cool spot and I am happy to spend my money at Roam.
author: Aneesh B.

description:
While this place may not necessarily have the best veggie burgers I've had in terms of the actual veggie patty, you can't beat the toppings. The veggie patty is purple and tart and kind of "earthy" tasting. It's not bad, it's just not the highlight of the burger. 

Anyway, I got the French and Fries, which came with truffled parmesan fries, gruyere, avocado and caramelized onions. Unlike most places, they don't skip on the truffle oil - you can totally taste it. The sweet potato fries and zucchini string are great as well. 

i didn't get a milkshake, but I wished I had once I tasted a friend's. They have awesome flavors like salted caramel, Dagoba chocolate and white peach. They also are open to mixing different flavors together in 1 shake. 

I will definitely be back here.
author: Shreya O.

description:
I always crave for juicy burgers! 
 
I got the classic burger (hamburger) and it was sooo juicy. Patty cooked medium rare with a crunchy bun.

Best burger I've had in SF!
author: Linda L.

description:
I rarely dream about meals, nor do I find myself fantasizing about going back to particular restaurants.

Roam is one of my few exceptions.

The Sunnyside burger is hands down one of the best burgers I have EVER had in my life.  What's not to love?!
Beef = Good
Caramelized Onions = Good
Fried Egg = Good

Then with the Fry-Fecta and a brew on the side? Heavenly.  I will NOT be roam-ing anywhere else for a burger.  Hehe.
author: Laura C.

description:
THIS is what a burger should be. The organic beef is so tasty and they offer dozens of choices for dressing your burger. (I like the blue cheese) Try the Fryfecta - it's a winner. Not to be missed: the house specialty craft made sodas that change weekly. I've tried the blood orange, blackberry and blueberry.

Parking here is a pain, be sure to bring plenty of quarters. 

We enjoy the food here so much that this was where we came for a burger when we got back from Europe.
author: Monarch B.

description:
Liked it A Lot. But just didn't love it. Highly original veggie burger. Tasty. The beef burger felt a little undercooked and hasnthat "all natural" flavor that takes some getting used..... Grass fed versus traditional corn fed. Grass fed better for you but may not taste the way your dad's frozen burgers on the grill tasted. Service great, courteous, professional staff. I liked the buns. I will be back despite the 4 stars. Oh yeah...... Impossible to park.
Plan n advance or walk or bus to this location.
author: Michael H.

description:
Although I could do without the Marina clientele, the burgers were delicious. Possibly a bit over-priced, but still good.

I realized a lot of my food stops are when I'm famished and will eat just about anything. Yelp doesn't really come into play. But we did sort of search Yelp and the area for what we wanted and we were happy to come upon Roam.

The burger and toppings were quality, which is always nice and not always standard. The shakes looked delicious, but were too expensive for my wallet.
author: Inga B.

description:
Came here hungry after ballet class. I love different kinds of burger meat, ie. ostrich, buffalo, etc. so this place fit the bill. They also have an amazing Elk burger which you can do "Sunnyside" with an egg in it. But since I am on a special diet for the month, I went with the salad with a string of mini Bison patties. It was a mix of delicious greens of all different textures, cotija cheese, avocado, tomatoes, grapes, and a side of ranch dressing that tasted homemade, which I devoured (not sure why I even ask for it on the side anymore, I will eat every last drop anyway). The cute little bison patties were perfectly done and just slipped off the skewer. They were a perfect compliment to the salad. 

I am thinking about my yummy salad as I type. I am also thinking about the White Peach Milkshake that I didn't order... next time.
author: Amy D.

description:
Here's what you do:
1) choose your burger-- beef
2) choose a style or create your own-- chalet
3) add some fries if you're up for it-- friends got fries with truffle parmesan and fries with lemon chive
4) order

The burgers here are petite but delicious. The truffle parmesan fries were much better than the lemon chive. Next time I come I will get the veggie burger, try their sweet potato fries and milkshake!
author: Eugenia G.

description:
Their burgers are a'ight....
Their russet fries are decent ...
Their chocolate shake is really really good...  Go there for one now!

Best part... it's inexpensive and they take amex!  Woohoo!
author: Sofia H.

description: Drove from Los Angeles to San Francisco to take my nephew there for his 21st birthday. The turkey burgers and the bison burgers were awesome.  Worth the 7 hour drive. Try the natural sodas. Very, very good. Atmosphere is casual, and the staff is very nice and helpful when it comes to choosing what you want on your specialty burger. The place is not as noisy as other bistros so you're able to enjoy your conversations more. Importantly, there was plenty of free parking around the corner in the more "residential" area. I highly recommend this place especially if you like burgers.
author: Valerie C.

description:
A man should find which of the following sexy for a women to eat:
a) Burger and fries
b) Sandwich
c) A salad 
d) None of the above

Answer: a, duh. Unless the consumption stereotypes are wrong. But for this review we will say a!

Every time I pass by this place, there are always people in gym clothes eating there, hmm people must really dig these burgers after an intense workout.I usually go for the meat/turkey burger, sweet potato fries, and a coconut/vanilla shake for $18, only I think its way too pricey. The service is a bit slow, but It's a chill place to stop by anytime of the week and have a light burger with fresh ingredients.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
The half-mile walk in 40-something degree weather didn't help, but what I expected was not what I got.

As a fan of Southwestern flavors (does not equate to being a fan of Bobby Flay), I ordered the beef Tejano burger.  Unfortunately, I feel that the burger was not representative of what the establishment is capable of.  I've read rave reviews and the website looks fantastic (maybe just great marketing?), but the burger I had was weak, to say the least.  The properly cooked juicy patty could not fully compensate for the lack of heat in the supposed jalapeno relish, the tomato that was a few shades shy of red, and soggy tortilla strips/buns.

Additionally, the zucchini onion haystack was a lot less playful than it sounded.  I felt like I ate pure oil-drenched batter with minimal amounts of vegetables.

I've been meaning to drop by again some day, but it's hard to move past that first experience.  But if i do come back, I will definitely opt for the fries instead.
author: Nick W.

description: Best burger.  But must have the fry-fecta. Regular fry,sweet potato and zucchini onion.   And don't forget the chocolate shakes. Yummy
author: Cheri B.

description:
After viewing this establishment on the Food network we decided to give it a try.

It is a premium priced  establishment with a fast food set up. I find this extremely annoying, as  any food that requires a temp, deserves a check back by waitstaff.

Maybe the establishment would make more money if they had a waitstaff, we would have gotten a second round of drinks and or would have split a shake... but to wait on an ungodly line  twice, no thank you.

The food was tasty and the ingredients should be applauded, grass fed beef, bison , turkey, Strauss farm creamery... that being said, why not match your ingredients with stellar service.

The three stars should be 5 as the ingredients ( the foundation  ) are good, the presentation and or execution lacking.

My husband upon leaving after spending 25 per head for 2 burgers, "a carafe" ( really 1/2 carafe) of wine and a split side, said" I'm still hungry"...
he's not that big an eater...don't think this will be on our regular list of stops.
author: tery c.

description:
That "classic" bison burger was pretty darn good.  My gf and I split one, (minus cheese), and also the Farmer's Market Salad which was also delicious.  

I've only had bison once before and since it's suppose to be leaner, and us girls want to watch our girlie figures, bison is the way to go.  It was quite honestly one of the best burgers I've ever had or I was really hungry.  The salad was huge and could easily be split up 3 ways.

Minus one star because I hate the ordering system.  If they're busy, it's near impossible to find somewhere to sit.  We were lucky and got there right before the rush, around 7pm.  But after they give you your order and take away your number, you're pretty much on your own.  If you want something additional it's really hard to get help; you're pretty much left there to fend for yourself or you have to get back into that nasty line. 

The decor behind the "bar" is cute but all of the other walls are bare and boring.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
When I raved and ranted about how amazing Roam's Tejano burger was to a friend who was born and raised in the Sunset, I felt that I had deserved a badge of honor for being the newbie who showed a San Francisco lifer the city's best burger. 

One good friend, two Tejano burgers and the Fry-fecta = perfect Saturday lunch.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
This place makes really good burgers. I want to try them all.

We had the Burger with the fries in them and I had to share it with my girlfriend. Next time I'm going to eat the whole thing

Burgers were well priced too so you don't feel like you're overpaying.
author: Eric A.

description:
A place that will serve an egg on a burger has already won me over.  Offer sweet potato fries on the side, and I think I've found my soulmate.

As a vegetarian, I'm stuck with the veggie burger (and the salads, I suppose, but I'm not a big salad fan--imagine that), but there are enough topping choices that I feel like I'm getting something new each time.  I always appreciate one that's made in-house, and not something you can grab in a freezer case at your local supermarket (gardenburger, anyone?).  It's more crumbly than I'd like--though, I know that it's common with these types of grain burgers.  The reviewer who mentioned it as being quinoa-like in texture was spot on.  It also has a mexican flavoring to it.  Bottom line:  it's definitely not bland.

Others I've taken here enjoy the bison and the beef.  I've heard raves on the turkey, so I doubt you could go wrong with any of the meats.

As far as beverages, they could not have picked a better creamery to create their shakes with than the local Straus.  The dairy is thick and delicious, with a variety of flavors to satisfy anyone's palette.  The marshmallow brulee and graham cracker topping is a great addition.  I've curbed my soda intake, but I'm curious to try their agave sweetened artisan sodas.  The Mothership wheat beer turned out to be a light and refreshing treat after a run.

The space is modern, with a custom wood interior to include panels and tables (one, being communal).  Outdoor seating makes for great people watching, botox and BMWs cruising down Union.  Sometimes it's just fun to sit at the bar, especially when a Giants game is on. 

I seemed to have been making a once-a-week pilgrimage to Roam since they've opened, and short of an empty pocketbook, I don't see any reason not to continue to do so.  For such high quality food, prices are more than reasonable.  The staff are friendly and patient, handling the influx of customers seemingly well.  The owners are receptive to any problems/issues.  Custom orders may make for easier screw-ups, but they do what's necessary to make it right.

Not even a month old, they've got their kinks to work out as every new business does.  But they're on the right track, and I hope to see them continue successfully with more locations to come.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Ok for me, this is the best burger I have ever had. I am now addicted to their  burgers and eat there nearly once a week! I get the 'Sunny side', it is so flavourful, the buns are perfect, everything is perfect, food doesn't take long at all to come out either. I can't recommend this place enough, if you haven't tried it and are a fan of burgers (even if you aren't you will be after you try this place!), this is defo the place to eat. x
author: Courtney L.

description:
The burgers are interesting.  They're not the best, but certainly not the worst.  I didn't like the truffled burgers--too much dijon.  I do like the one with egg and caramelized onions.  Slightly sweet.  Pretty good.  Sweet potato fries are standard.  The price may be reasonably cheap, but it won't leave you feeling full.  That could be just me.  I often have servers walking away after my order because they assumed I ordered for both my bf and me.  "This is all just for you?" they ask.  Why doesn't anyone believe that I can eat what I order.

Anyway....

The burgers are small and interesting.  You get the option of pink or not pink.  I prefer medium rare and it's not an option here.  For the area, the price is decent.  

If you want to have a conversation here, sit outside.  It's loud.  The service has been all over the map.  The first time I went, it was super.  The 3rd and 4th time, people were not so nice.  

I'd give it 3 stars.  So why 4 stars?

BECAUSE THIS LACTOSE INTOLERANT IDIOT (me) KEEPS GOING THERE AND ORDERING MILKSHAKES TO GO.

Yeah, my stomach hates me.  But their milkshakes are so damn effing good.  I like the strawberry, Tahitian vanilla, and the chocolate.  OMG.  DROOL.
author: Tangerine L.

description:
Let me just say that I love Roam.  I love that it's 2 blocks away from my place.  I love that it's affordable, good food.  I love that they have some unique things to choose from.  And I love that it's just an overall great experience.

The food is solid.  Burgers aren't necessarily anything mind-blowing (I feel like it's hard to make any burger THAT good), but they are tasty.  They have different ways to dress their burgers up, so pick how you want it based on how you're feeling that day.  The bison burger is my personal favorite of the meat options thus far.  The fries is where they excel... you can pick from 3 different types (regular, sweet potato, and zucchini onion) along with 3 different "seasonings".  I was surprised to find that of the 3 fry-options, I fell in love with the zucchini onion haystack... seriously, zucchinis and onions!  Of the seasonings, I tend to go with Chipotle Mayo, but the Truffle Parmesan is tasty too.

My only complaints with Roam are minor (and not enough to take the star-rating down to 4)... they don't really answer the phone when busy for call-ahead orders, the menu is in an awkward spot (you have to crane your head backwards when at the register), and the seating layout is a little weird in the front area.  Other than that... simply excellent.

R eally happy to have a new neighborhood favorite
O rder the zucchini onion haystack!
A ffordable and tasty food
M eat options include turkey and bison
author: Kenny L.

description:
On a recent trip to San Fran, I was staying at a friends place who happened to live a couple blocks from Roam. We went here right after my flight landed and it was the perfect quick delicious burger I was looking for. So much so that went back a week later before my flight home.

I strongly recommend either the French and Fries or Pacific Blue burger. I'm more of a blue cheese fan, so I liked that one more, but they were both great. 

Make sure to get the sweet potato fries as well. I probably could have eaten 3 orders of them.
author: Jared D.

description: I constantly look for great burgers and have been to many "artisan" style burger places.  Be far this place is the best...especially if you are particular about the beef being grass fed.
author: Rene G.

description:
Conveniently located near my fabulous eyelash lady, I was super excited to see that a burger joint that meets my criteria was only half a block away.   I've been twice now and have chosen 3 stars until further testing. OK maybe 3.5.

Pluses: 

#1  Bison on the menu.  I am a *huge* buffalo fan.  Light tasty meat, but my medium rare burger came medium.  Maybe I should ask for it bloody next time.  

#2 Yummy sweet potato fries that don't taste like they are out of a bag (sorry Burgermeister)

#3 Salted caramel Strauss Family Creamery milk shakes.  Yum.  I made the mistake of making my first one with frozen yogurt.  Not a good combination.  Second was made with soft serve ice cream....perfection in a cup.

#4 Atmosphere.  I really like the space.  A chandelier made of various size Strauss Bottles with Edison lightbulbs , makes the DIY'er in me drool. I am usually there during the day, so I cannot say anything about the crowd that eats there.

Minuses:

#1  The Straws.   Why would anyone serve you a shake with a straw that is a little thicker than a coffee stirrer?  I should not have to turn red and make fish faces to sip my shake.  Really Roam, get new straws; there are plenty of compostable straws that are normal size.

#2  Price.   When you look at the menu, it seems fairly priced and then you start adding toppings.  Before you know it, lunch for one is 23 bucks.  FYI the menu online says the bison burger is only 99 cents more...in restaurant it is 1.99 dollars more.  They need to update their online menu, intentionally or not, it is false advertising.

#3 Staff.  A mixed bag of peeps.  Most are  well seasoned servers/counter peeps; attentive, computer literate, fast and polite .  I got the brush off by one woman on my second visit and the "look" while I made her stop counting her tips to take my order.  If she was a waitress at a restaurant  I would have been a little more agitated, but really attitude taking my order?  Oh yeah, it's Cow Hollow and I don't look the part.

For the most part, I enjoy Roam.  The food is definitely made of good quality ingredients, now if they could fix the straw issue ASAP, I would go back more often.
author: Monika S.

description:
If you want a REALLY great burger....you might want to go to Zuni, Bix, or even Perry's down the street.  

If you're looking for something decent, fast, and inexpensive, you should go to Roam.  

It pains me to say it, but I had the Classic Burger and it was good, but not really any better than going to In & Out.  It was cooked perfectly (Medium Rare), but kind of boring.  Next time I'll try one of the specialty burgers made out of bison and maybe I'll change my opinion.

I also tried the sweet potato fries, side salad with vinaigrette, a glass of draft wine ($7 for a decent Sauvignon Blanc) and a milkshake (chocolate).  All were good, but not anything special.

The decor is of the "industrial" variety with one long communal table and several smaller tables.  Along with this type of decor comes NOISE.  It's almost impossible to carry on a conversation without raising your voice, so be prepared.

This is the type of place where you order your food, you're given a number, and then a server brings your food out to you.  The people who took our orders and delivered the food were nice and friendly, so I'd be back to give it another try and see if I can get the score up a notch.  

It should be noted that I live in the neighborhood, so I can say that I might be back.  However, if I weren't in the neighborhood, I wouldn't make it a destination spot.
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Was in San Francisco last week and a friend that lives in town recommended this place.  Being vegetarians, we're skeptical of veggie burger, because they're usually a garden burger or a morningstar black bean burger, but decided to take our friend's recommendation.   We were doing the touristy thing of riding the cable car and got off at Union St. and walked down.  The restaurant is small, but only one word can describe the veggie burgers and food...phenomenal!!!  I ordered the French and Fry and my wife ordered the Tejano.  We also ordered the Fry Fecta as our side.  Both burgers were great and you could tell these weren't the usual frozen veggie burgers, but scratch made patties.

This place is great for vegetarians and highly recommend the burgers and definitely get the Fry Fecta...you won't be disappointed
author: Sach D.

description:
A gourmet Burger that is filling, I would definitely disagree. 

First and foremost parking around here is the worst. There is neighborhood parking, which you have to get lucky or you can choose the garage which is 1  1/2 miles away. Luckily, I found a parking spot in twenty minutes. 

Concept wise it was pretty cool. Community tables and unlimited water from a jug, classic. 

We ordered the double meat French and Fries burger, the regular Heritage burger, and the Fry-Fecta fries. The French and Fires burger was cooked perfectly but it was not filling enough. It was flavorful and juicy but I think the fries made it too salty and the burger needed more cheese. The Heritage burger was very rich. The bacon was over the top and it wasn't as good as the French and Fries burger. The Fry-Fecta fries were alright. The best were the sweet potato fries, the maples on the fries were terrific but we were unable to taste the chipotle in the sweet potato fries. The Zucchini Onion Haystack was bland, while the truffle Parmesan russet fries were lacking a wow factor. 

In the end, eating eighty percent of all this food was disappointing. I was still hunger and I left unsatisfied. I liked the concept but there needs to be more food for an average person like me.
author: Pete N.

description: If you like burgers good atmosphere and music then this is the place in cow hallow / marina to check out.
author: Patrick P.

description: One of my favorite burger spots in the area.  Can get a little pricey for just a burger, fries and a beer but once in a while that's okay.  Will definitely continue going back.
author: Kevin C.

description: Best Burger I ever had... I got Bison with wheat bun! Less quilt and maximum taste.. Their gluten free bun is also awesome!!
author: Ray G.

description: We had eaten here before and absolutely loved it. We came back again while in town to celebrate my wife's b-day (her request). When looking at Yelp,  I saw someone else's  photo of a Vegi Sunnyside Burger. OMG! Wow! Best veggi burger ever. The egg and the sweet chili sauce combine to make some serious magic with their unique Vegi burger recipe. Well worth another visit!
author: Stan S.

description:
Roam is a cute little trendy place.   The food overall is pretty ok, although nothing special to write home about.  Shouldn't this make a 3 star Leon?  I mean, it's basically ok, right?  

WRONG, there is a certain something that will get a place a guaranteed 2 stars no matter anything else.   This goes something like the following dramatized encounter.  

Innocent Customer:  Can I have a custom burger with beef, roast peppers, and steak sauce on the side?  
Waitress Girl:  Ok
(time passes)
(time passes)
(burger comes)
(there is house mayo sauce on the burger, which was listed no where on the custom burger menu, and there is extra steak sauce on the side)
(Ok, no problem, I will just go talk to them and get them to bring me the burger with no sauce. )
Innocent Customer:  Hi sorry, I ordered this with steak sauce on the side, not house sauce on the burger.  Could you please take care of it for me?  
Waitress Boy:  Okay, no problem, we'll make you a new one!  
(1 minute later)
Waitress Boy:  Look, here is your burger!  Enjoy.
(There is a new bun, but the burger patty is clearly the same one as before, only slightly wiped, as there is still remainders of the mayo sauce on the side where the napkin did not touch.)
Innocent Customer:  FFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUU

Two stars.
author: Leon K.

description:
what i ordered.... classic with beef and cheese, fry fecta(fries, sp fries and zucchini onion haystack)

place was a fastfood with a twist, you order the food at the cashier get a number, sit down then they literally drop the food at your table (and it wasn't the tip hungry cashier).... yup! no hi, no bye.

burger was ok....good in size, meat tasted nothing out of the ordinary, was seared right but not coarsely ground and the aged cheddar cheese which was an extra was so thin, kraft sliced cheese put it to shame.  fries were hard, sweet potato fries were good and those fried shaved zucchini onion were very good but kindda difficult to eat.

ambiance... bad (nice decor  but the place was awfully dirty, sticky floors and smelled like a damped bar. restroom was like a porto potty at the end of a bay2breakers race)
service... bad (it started ok with a smile then went south when she looked at my reciept and found out that i did not put any tip on it, i never tip a cashier except for an exceptional act. the tip goes to the folks that drops the food at my table.)
cost... $(fair)
author: Gors P.

description:
I've never been big on burgers, having lived in NYC for 15 years trying here and there, happy, but never impressed. But, but, the burgers here make me want to go back to church and thank Mr. Jesus.

One star taken for the recent price raise. Now it seems like every burger is one dollar more, I am cheap so this is not acceptable.
author: C J.

description:
Yummmmy burgers! Had the French and Fries - lovve the gruyere cheese and the fries inside my burger.

Never had elk or bison burgers before but will have to try it next time - lots of gourmet options and great service - wound up talking to the waiter for a couple of minutes and he was happy to provide recommendations. Would definitely come back here.
author: Lisette P.

description: Really yummy burgers. I had the Tejano burger with the turkey patty and LOVED it. I am normally a beef kind of girl, so getting turkey was wayyy out of character but I couldn't have been happier. The meat was flavorful, which is sometimes a problem with turkey. My friends all got the French and Fries which was also good (I had some) but I preferred the Tejano. The sweet potato fries were amazing, but I personally really loved the Russet fries with Chipotle Maple -- do this!!!!
author: Shruti N.

description:
Went here for lunch with my boyfriend.

Walked in, liked the laid-back vibe of the place and started scanning my options. I saw organic this and grass-fed that along with an extensive list of burger customizations that got me so excited I felt as if the menu was fluffing me up to prepare for a porn shoot.

I ended up choosing the grass-fed beef burger with just white cheddar and house sauce since I'm one of those cake-eating veggie haters. My boyfriend had a bison burger with an added fried egg - also without veggies. Our shared nutrient deficiencies is one of the main reasons why we work. We both loved our burgers and raved about the seemingly simple but incredible sesame seed bun. 

We split the fry-fecta which, in addition to being a solid pun, is a delicious trio comprised of russet, sweet potato and zucchini/onion haystack. Also had a strawberry shake with a brûléed marshmallow on top that is absolutely out of this world. So much so that it makes a $4.99 combination of ice cream and milk seem completely reasonable. 

The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because, like most others have commented, they have two major problems - can't seem to properly cook a burger according to their 'pink or no pink' guidelines and have a hard time getting orders right. 

Both of our burgers came out with veggies haughtily spread out over the patties. I sent mine back and, not surprisingly, it came back seconds later after everything had been scraped off. Not a huge deal but still a little irksome.The huge offense though - both of our 'no pink' patties were nearly raw in the middle. It was a little too dark to notice and I was a little too hungry to care but I'd be concerned to go there in the future and trust that my meat was cooked properly.

But the bottom line is that Roam has immense potential. My boyfriend and I talked to the owner, Josh, about these issues before leaving and he was completely receptive and appreciative of the feedback. I probably would've gone back anyway, but I feel much more confident about their ability to iron out the wrinkles knowing that there's at least one person there who really cares about the quality of the food.
author: Aubrey O.

description: Top 5 burger restaurant.  Wide variety of toppings, ingredients are fresh and delicious.  I try to eat here every time I'm in SF.   Please open a restaurant in OC!
author: Justin K.

description:
My friend and I decided to give Roam a chance on our way to Quiz Night at The Bus Stop. We weren't disappointed. When I went to pick up our order, they had a little mix up in the kitchen and it took a little longer for myself and the lady in front of me to get our food. The woman who took our orders served us up with some free beverages. Mine was a sparkling prickly pear drink, which made my impatience level decline fast. What great customer service!

My friend and I both opted for the classic burger and shared fries. It was delicious and the perfect amount of food for me. My boyfriend may have required a larger burger, but if guys get a whole order of fries with their meal, they should be good to go. I will definitely be back to try the Fry-Fecta.
author: Carrie C.

description: When you are craving for a good, old fashion, I can't think of anything else but having a hamburger, go to Roam. What's even great about Roam it takes the "guilt" out of guilty pleasure. Bison burger is organic. They serve Kombucha (ON TAP), and you can add watercress. That's right anyone can add lettuce, or spinach (yawn). @ Roam, watercress is actually an option. If you don't mind feeling guilty? I confess, their French fries with truffle parmesan cheese is so good, makes you not want to share with your own boyfriend!
author: E ..

description:
I love this place... good burgers!  I like the turkey burger with blue cheese and grilled onions.  I even tried the Buffalo... but still not sure about that not that it wasn't good - it's just a Buffalo.

Hope it stays open - Union Street is hard place to keep things open.
author: Jodi B.

description:
I'll be honest.  I really really liked the food.  I like to eat local, I like burgers, and I like fresh ingredients.  What I don't like is screw ups, and even though they tried to correct them, it was done in a way that makes me not want to come back.  

/Begin rant

Here's the deal.  I came here on Tuesday and last Sunday.  My girlfriend and I can be slightly complicated when it comes to ordering.   However, the most difficult that we are is saying no bun.  We don't eat bread so we prefer it protein style.  

This is a burger place, there are toppings that you add to your burger. however of the four burgers I have ordered here every single one has had a mistake.  

Twice I have ordered the burger with egg.  The first time it didn't come with the sauce, or the sautéed onions.  Second time it came with just no sautéed onions.  This is straight off of their ingredients except for the fact that I didn't want a bun.  

My girlfriend ordered the regular burger (sans bun), adding avocado, sauteed onions, pickles and asking for no tomatoes.  The first time, no avocado and no pickles.  Second time their were tomatoes, no avocado and no pickles.  It took them coming out with the burger three times before they got it right.  

They then gave us a dessert for free, even though we don't eat bread or sweets.  

I understand that their are growing pains, however if you really wanted to keep my business you should have offered to pay for the meal or give me some kind of gift card, or something.  A free dessert (something that we wouldn't eat anyway) just doesn't cover it.  

The worst part is the food is great!  I want to eat there!  But I can't when the service is that bad. 

Lastly, it took nearly 30 minutes for the burger to come out on our second time there.  It was 3pm on a Sunday.  I can't understand why it would take that long no matter how busy they are.  I could've killed the cow myself and cooked the burger in a shorter amount of time.  

/end rant
author: Nick H.

description:
A cool place to grab a relaxed lunch while shopping on Union, or a great nighttime locale to down a burger before some beers next door. Pretty trendy, but super versatile spot that appears to cater to regulars from Union, Marina, Russian Hill, and Pac Heights.

It can be a little expensive for lunch, but definitely a great burger. I love that you can pick your patty, so even when I order the same style over and over again, it's a different meal every time. 

The beef is by far my favorite, though. I make a special trip to Roam on those 'I need red meat' days.  It is 100% Grass-Fed, and - being from the midwest - I can tell a quality burger. This is it. It FAR surpasses those burgers out there that claim to be "100% This" or "Kobe Beef That." 

Also, the burgers are super filling, but I can always eat an entire bag of Fry-Fecta afterward - so delishhhh!!
author: Nicole U.

description:
This place should be 4 or 5 stars.  If you pair artisan and organic with burgers and shakes, I'm interested.  If you are able to do this for a reasonable price, I'm really interested.  Despite the overflow that I've seen coming out the door in the previous days, we decided to give it a go.  It was reasonably quick, and we were able to find seats at the bar right after ordering.

The milkshake was awesome.  Kinda small, but just the right size for what it was.  Burger was also quite tasty, didn't blow my mind but was pretty good.  My accompaniment enjoyed the mini 'veggie burger' topped salad, which definitely fell short.  The veggie burgers seemed more like scoops of quinoa salad, whats up with that?  Also got the fry-fecta!  Great name.  Poor execution.  Sweet potato fries were good, normal fries were meh, zucchini sticks or whatever else were included were weak.  They are shaved too thin, and seemed to have too much batter.  

But this place really did have great attention to detail and I really like what they are trying to do.  From how they sweeten their drinks to their dedication to 'humanely' raised animals and organic dairy.  Thumbs up.  I'll be back, and hopefully they fix the kinks and this place gets a few star upgrade in my book.  Definitely a possibility!

Update- still 3 stars.  I just can't get over the fact that they just ask if you want it "pink or not pink?".
author: William B.

description:
I really like the food here.  Their burgers are great and the fries are good too.  And, I love the shoestring zucchini fries!  It's only a couple of blocks from my apartment.  

So, what's with the three stars?  This place is EXPENSIVE!  A beer, burger and fries runs about $15-$20.  That's just a little more than I'm willing to pay for burgers and fries.  If the prices were knocked down a couple of bucks, I would raise this to a four maybe even five star rating.

That said I do still come here from time to time and I would recommend it as a place to go for good burgers.  However, just keep in mind what you're getting yourself into price-wise
author: Ted G.

description:
Let me break down my lunch here, for just one sec....

Bison burger.
Sunny Side (aged white cheddar, carmalized sweet onions, sweet  chile sauce).
Sweet potato fries (with truffle parmesan).
Salted caramel strauss family ice cream milkshake.

Is your  mouth watering yet? Holy man, this is not only great hangover food, but delicious GUILT FREE (because everything is either organic or so delicious that you couldnt possibly regret putting every morsel in your mouth)!
I know there are many burger places opening up around the city now a days, but the prices are so beyond reasonable. ranging anywhere from $6-10
I will come back here not just again, but (honestly) once a week, that is if my waistline allows it :-)
author: Jenn H.

description:
Wow this place is awesome. It has been a few weeks since I experienced Roam, and my mouth is continuing to water thinking about my burger. 

We went here as a pit stop at Union Street Fest, and to my surprise it wasn't utter chaos...well at least to my drunken eye. 

I believe I ordered a bacon, ranch, and cheese burger (my finest drunk taste buds were making the order for me) with a side of sweet potato fries. 

There were about 6 of us at the table and once we got our food, not a word was spoken until we were done 1 minute later inhaling this delicious creation.
author: Katie H.

description: I've eaten here thrice and have never had a bad meal.  I've had the beef and the bison burgers and the fries are definitely worth it.  Enjoy.
author: Dale K.

description:
Finally an affordable and tasty burger joint in the Marina! 

They use fresh, locally grown vegetables. For each burger, you can pick 100% grass-fed beef, housemade veggie burgers, free-range turkey or BISON! Love it! 

I had the "Classic" with medium rare beef. I had to add Gruyere cheese which was $1 more. Who passes on cheese, let alone Gruyere??? EB had the "Chalet" with beef. The patty was juicy and flavorful. The artisan sesame burger bun was slightly toasted and held the burger very well. 
We each ordered a side of Russet Fries and Sweet Potato Fries. They were both seasoned to perfection. 
When I have a burger, I need a shake. They have THE best selection of flavors...EVER! Organic Straus Family Creamery Shakes...Oh My. They have Blue Bottle Coffee flavor, Salted Caramel, Dagoba Chocolate, Tahitian Vanilla Bean, Matcha Green Tea.... I had the vanilla and was delish. It was thick and filled with hundreds of tiny vanilla bean. 
The ambiance is cool and rustic. You may need to speak up a bit to have a decent conversation. Since it is their opening month, there are still some kinks that need to be addressed. It can get crowded during peak times and be ready to wait for a table. It is worth the wait. This place is attracting a ton of people. Serving beer and wine will tend to have people linger a little longer at the restaurant. SO my only advice for the restaurant is to have more seats. 

Roam Artisan Burgers is the new, COOL kid on the block. 

Josh S., the owner of this fabulous restaurant, is super nice, friendly and hard-working. (I saw him busing tables). Congratulations on opening up this restaurant. I recall you telling me about this venture a few years ago. GO BRUINS!
author: Molly T.

description:
Decent burger place.  It's well priced, great artisan sodas (Meyer Lemon was yum!) and shakes.  I had the veggie burger wrapped in lettuce and it was decent, although  a little thin.  We also had the three types of fries, which were good, not great.  The zucchini/onion ones were a bit strong on the ranch flavor.

All in all, a good place with lots of choices to mix and match meats and toppings.  I would try again.
author: Christine G.

description:
Excellent lunch there today. ..and with so many new burger places in town, I wasn't expecting anything special.

Three things I especially loved:

1) The zucchini/onion haystack was incredible -- thin strips of the two veggies, very lightly dusted in something I couldn't identify (cornmeal?), and then flash-fried. Result: a totally light and non-greasy version of a dish that's all to often heavy and greasy.

2) The Blue Bottle shake -- yummmmmmmmmm.

3) The portion size. Imagine having a burger, shake and part of the "fried veggie" side dish and feeling satisfied, not stuffed. The shake and the haystack portions looked small, but proved ideal.

Great food.
author: Tom R.

description: Great burger, the bun seemed like a store bought bun, not a fresh baked in house. But all the ingredients were fresh and the fries are crispy and amazing. The sweet potato fries with the truffle oil were delicious. Can't wait to go back!
author: Alejandra O.

description: Would never go back. Was not a very good burger and the reason it's priced like it could be a good burger is because they use all that organic meat/veg etc.. The burger itself was just not that flavorful and why do they only have white cheddar btw? Anyhow: expensive experience and not very good. Was cooked all the way through and pretty tiny/like a quarter pounder. For me go big and juicy or f*CK that. The fry fecta was just ok too but the zucchini fried things kinda dumb-on burger great idea by themselves wtf am I supposed to do with these? too thin . Umami burger better but overrated too
author: Monica H.

description: Roam Burger is really quite good. They have a nice little selection of burgers made from high quality ingredients. I particularly enjoyed the mushroom burger. Bonus points for their hot sauce collection... I loves me some hot sauce on a burger. I wouldn't say it's the best burger I've ever had, but it's definitely good.
author: Casey M.

description:
Roam makes good burgers, has a nice beer selection, and a fun vibe.  They also have a very interesting menu with emphasis on food that is healthy and tasty.  Staff are high spirited.  Neighborhood is fun central on Friday and Saturday evenings, weekend days as well. 

Some downsides:  seating can be tough, noise level high, fries are frozen not fresh, and the wines "on tap" are, well, a very poor advertisement for the notion of having wines on tap.  (You can do better!).

I would give them 5 stars for intention and 3 stars (so far) for execution.
author: Art A.

description:
Overall rating: Solid 3 stars

Food: The quality of the food here is really good. The meat is fantastic, the fries are delicious and bun for the burgers are yummy. My complaint here is that when I go to a dedicated burger joint, I expect at least a 1/3 pound patty. I believe they us a 1/4 pound patty, which is fine until you see the price that you pay for it then you feel like you're a bit ripped off.

Price: This place is a little on the pricy side. The quality of the food is good but I think they need to be realistic about their prices. 

Location: Roam Artisan Burgers is in a great location with parking all around. There are also a ton of great shops around so it's a great place to get a quick bite and be off shopping!

Cleanliness: The place is very well maintained and nice decor.

Overall: I would go back but probably not my first choice for a burger joint.
author: LAIKA K.

description: Get an individual shake and don't share they ARE AMAZING!!! (coconut flavor is spectacular)
author: Juan S.

description: I loved this burger spot!  You can order your burger exactly how you like it   They have all types of different meat and topping options as well as vegetarian options. The burgers are seasoned perfectly.  Definitely one of the best burgers I ever tasted!
author: Gretchen R.

description: Excellent burger joint in the Marina. I went for a BBQ style beef burger. The meat itself was ok, but the real winners were the onions and slaw. These took this thing to the next level. We came around 8 and had to wait a few minutes for a table, but it was before our food came so no big deal. I can't wait to come back and try some of the other styles.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
First of all, get the fry-fecta--russet potato, zucchini onion, and sweet potato fries--what more could you ask for?

I LIKE that you choose the patty and then the "style" of the burger. There's a lot to choose from in terms of what you want on your burger (and if you're still dissatisfied, you can customize your own). They also work with some interesting animals, like bison, elk, and ostrich.
BUT if you're not a huge meat eater like me or a vegetarian, you definitely won't be missing out by getting the veggie burger. I was a little skeptical when I saw pictures on yelp that showed a red-colored veggie burger. I couldn't see how that could possibly be appetizing, but when I got it, I was blown away. I STILL have no idea what was in it, but they made it taste unusually like meat. It's like getting a meat patty without the added grease and guilt. 
ALSO, I tried some of the mint chip shake, and it was delicious. Super thick and creamy--if you like melted ice cream, you'll love this. This is one of those many times when being lactose intolerant seriously blows. 

I DO NOT LIKE, however, the seating process. I usually have no problem with ordering up front and self-seating, but when you're a popular establishment with a small space, you end up with a lot of customers waiting around for a large enough table. I definitely DO NOT recommend this place for large groups!
author: Veronica L.

description:
The trendy wood accented interior of Roam Burgers masks a simple blue collar burger. Upon entering the restaurant you order a la cart from a simple well organized menu. The food and drinks get delivered to your table, however, your on your own for the condiments, napkins, and utensils. It was not all that busy and most of the tables were messy, the staff was disorganized, however, I'm sure once they get rolling this kind of stuff will get ironed out. 

The food was creative and tasty. I had the sunny side burger complete with an egg and my wife ordered a French burger that came with fries on the inside. The meat was cooked well and not overly greasy. The sweet potato fries were excellent when ordered with a maple glaze. 

The Mothership Wit from New Belgium brewing accented the food really well. The beer had a light body with a citrusy acidic aftertaste that complemented the meal. Good burger at a reasonable price, might return if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: bart b.

description: My most common craving has to be burgers. Gah, I want them so often. But since living in the bay, I really haven't found my go-to burger. Sure, there's super super and pearl and if you want to make the trek into tourist territory, I will never say no to in n out. And of course, there's not a shortage of some good, gourmet burgers but I just want that classic, medium rare, juicy, pickle slathered burger on a nice bun. I FINALLY found that at roam! I got the classic with no onions, extra pickles, white cheddar and their oil and vinegar slaw. I couldn't be happier to finally have a burger to satisfy my constant burger cravings.
author: Brittany V.

description:
Freaking awesome spot. My top burger place in SF. Here's some highlights why its the bottle on the top shelf...

-Best veggie burger in SF (get the Tejano). By far. Not even close. Even meat eaters will love it. 
-Best fries (both Sweet Potato and Regular). 
-Second best selections of dipping sauces, falling only slightly below Taylors err Gotts Roadside. Their herb ranch is especially superb. 

I could go on, but the gist is that everything I've had here is really good. I haven't tried the shakes, but that's next on my list. The salads also are good and a hearty-sized.

The only rub on Roam is that sometimes its hard to get a seat. If you come with a buddy or girlfriend, you may have to tag-team: 1 person orders the food, 1 person stakes out a spot. It can get crowded, but there's a reason for that...good food, good spot, and a good (often attractive) clientele.

Definite 5-star spot! So yummy.
author: Rick P.

description:
I've eaten at Roam 3 times since their opening, it's kind of hard not to considering i work RIGHT across the street. i feel like roam is really hit or miss. the first time i ordered from them over the phone they said my order would take about 15 mins and that they'd call when it was ready, 30 min passes and i still haven't heard from them. luckily i was busy with clients myself so i didn't mind.  

the second time i had their french and fries burger. no complaints there! that burger is delicious!

3rd time i ordered their fry fecta; sweet potato fries were excellent so were the regular fries but the zucchini and onions were a bit on the greasy side. 

TIP: when ordering take out from roam, i'd ask for their sauce on the side. they pride themselves in the "non greasy" burger which is great but their sauces can make your buns a little soggy.
author: Elle T.

description:
The burger was okay but it was the fries that blew me away. I am normally not a sweet potato fry person, but my sister insisted we order them with chipotle maple and I ended up eating most of them! 

The burger is smaller then most "upscale" burger places, but that is probably a good thing. Large glasses for water, clean bathrooms and tables and a great atmosphere!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
This place is tasty.  

Having hit them up several times since they opened, the burgers are consistently good, the fries are done right, and the beer and wine always satisfies.  I'm a big turkey burger fan; most burger joints will usually offer one as a token nod to those of us who watch our girlish figures, but manage to f* it up bigtime by grilling the crap out of it and failing to use - say it with me - sea-son-ings.  Roam does it right, and I respect the hell out of them for it.  Their seasonal milkshakes are awesome too.  (note to Roam ownership, if you're reading: please, please bring back the white peach ones?  For me?) 

Oh, and great ambiance, too.  Good place to hang out and watch a game.  

It's one of our favorite Thursday night 'I don't feel like cooking' spots.  Only downside is that parking sucks.  But it's Union Street....I guess I shouldn't expect too much!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Beat burgers in the world  if you go to roam buglers try the tejano and the BBQ turkey whit bacon it's the best
author: Ricardo T.

description:
Went here on a Friday with some friends for a quick bite.  You order at the register then they deliver the food to your table.  Considering there was a big group of us, our burgers came out in a timely manner and all at once.

Food and drinks at the table included salted caramel shake (yum!), blood orange soda, sweet potato fries, French and Fries turkey and beef burgers, and someone created her own burger.  

I enjoyed my French burger which was stuffed with truffle fries and oozing with gruyere cheese. A solid place to grab a gourmet burger.
author: Care T.

description: I had the turkey burger, BBQ style and it was delicious!  The burger was juicy and the veggies were nice and fresh.
