The staff was very friendly as well and made it okay that I was indecisive.  The space is a little on the small side for such a popular restaurant so be sure to share a table if the need arises :).
author: Alisha B.

description:
My brother took me here my first night in San Francisco and it was awesome. The restaurant has an informal fast-food feel, but the food does not. We all ordered the french and fries burger. 

The burger was amazing. The flavors were incredible, and the texture of the fries offered a nice a crunch in every bite. The avocado and gruyere gave it delicious creamy flavor as well. The only reason i can't give it 5 stars is because of the patty, it was too thin and it's near impossible to make a burger medium rare when it's that thin

The fries were good, the sweet potato fries were thin, crisp on the outside, and soft in the center.
author: TheBiggestJuiciestPiece A.

description:
Yum! Im a vegetarian and I love going out with my friends to eat. I am not friends with any vegetarians so where do I end up? At a burger place oh no! But to my pleasant surprise this place has the best vegy burger I have ever tasted and I have tasted many. 
I love how you can chose your style and create whatever you want. It was so so good! I found out that the vegy burger is gluten free and if you are on a strict gluten free diet you can order it on a lettuce wrap instead of a bun. I liked the bun though! 
Oh almost forgot. I also found out that they are a very sustainable business. They compost nearly everything and all the wood in there is re-purposed. The light fixtures had cleaned out glass milk jugs over them.
author: Laura L.

description: This place has beef, turkey, veggie burgers and is an awesome lunch place.  I give the burgers a 5 star but the fries I give a 2 star.  I'm a traditionalist and prefer no "accent" flavoring on fries.  This place puts green flakes and flavor on the fries, which just doesn't cut it for me.  I'd definitely go back again for the burgers, just wouldn't order fries the second time around.
author: H. H.

description:
i could eat here practically everyday - i am really digging their turkey burger....yum! the sweet potato fries are pretty delicious as well. My girl friend and I went here last night for burgers and wine, for less than $40, it was a delicious meal (still it was a burger lol).

Also, something that was pretty cool was that the Food Network was filming all day there apparently featuring their bison burger. I think I'll have to ask the boyfriend to try it next time so I can sneak a bite. The people from the Food Network said that they had tried practically the whole menu and everything was delicious...which I couldnt disagree with! Love their organic (yet still incredibly tasty bites). We will be back again soon!
author: Michelle N.

description: Maybe the best burger I have ever had. Casual atmosphere and good prices.
author: Katie R.

description:
Stumbled upon Roam Burgers while looking for dinner on Union St.  A great find!

I had a Heritage Burger with turkey -- they were serious about caramelized onions and the smoked bacon, 2 big pieces, made the burger very yummy.  The kid's menu was simple but ample for my 4 year old.  He particularly enjoyed the salted caramel shake (a kid's size split 3 ways).

We also ordered "off the menu" -- a bison burger with individual toppings which came to $12.  Very yummy but a little pricey.  So better to stick to the menu options.  :-)
author: H C.

description:
Sunnyside Bison Burger. Boom.

WOW - the best burger I've ever had! I have brought 5 different friends here with 5 very different taste buds - they all thank me for introducing them to burger heaven.

I'm a big fan.. please don't ever shut down!

Oh, and I'm always amazed a the fact everytime I enter, there's a line to order, but I  always seem to find a place to sit down and enjoy the burger by the time it's ready.
author: Emily L.

description: Very reasonable prices. I got the sweet potato fries and the French and Fries burger with all the free extras like lettuce and tomato. Very good. Pretty small place though. So be prepared for a short wait!
author: Madeline S.

description: Elk burger! Never had one before, but it is better than any other.  Salads and fries of all kinds are very good. The self-service format leaves something to be desired, otherwise I would have given 5 stars.
author: Tim C.

description: My husband and I visited San Francisco for the first time and had received a few recommendations for Roam since we're vegetarians. The veggie burger did not dissapoint. It was amazing. I think even a non-vegetarian would enjoy it! It had an incredible taste unlike a regular frozen veggie patty. That paired with french fries and the blood orange soda - perfection. Definitely recommend!
author: Alexandra P.

description:
After going with his coworkers, my fiancé was determined that I try Roam.  So- last Friday afternoon, I met him at his work and we headed to Roam in Cow Hollow.

We got there at noon and there was no line whatsoever.  I ordered the French and Fries (beef) and he ordered the Classic (Bison).  Both burgers were terrific!  They're just the right size and you can tell that each ingredient is carefully selected and fresh.  He described it best when he said - "it's a gourmet burger that actually feels good for you".  You're not stuffed after eating a whole burger, but you're delightfully full.

Their zucchini straws are the best of the three fry option (we shared the fry-fecta) - although all three are very good....it's just that you can get a good potato fry or sweet potato fry anywhere.  

I had the house-made Meyer Lemon soda and it was a perfect lemonade-type companion to my burger and fries.  

By the time we finished our burgers, the line was out the door - so fair warning - come at 1pm and you will be waiting awhile.

We even waited in the line to get a shake!  Albeit, I did get the non-fat frozen yogurt (salted caramel) shake - but it was still awesome!  They caramelize a house-made marshmallow and float it on top of the shake on a mini-(house made) graham cracker.

Seriously, they're painstakingly paying attention to detail here.  Every single item in this restaurant considers the environment impact - they have their own wine (organic, sustainable I'm sure) on tap - since kegs of wine have a lower impact than individual bottles!  That's attention to detail in my book!

It seems like they just opened so they're working out the kinks...but if you want to get a seriously delicious burger that you won't  feel bad about eating when you're done - go to Roam!  Just go by noon/12:30 or after 2 on a weekday to avoid the rush ;-)
author: Heather L.

description:
The house-made veggie burger was blood red, but I swear it was from beets and not actual blood! It was delicious and hearty, and tasted like a bean-y sloppy joe (my idea of veggie burger heaven). The fry-fecta (zucchini and onion strings, russet potato fries, and sweet potato fries) and ginger-lime-agave-sweetened soda were delightful. But the shining star of the evening was the salted caramel milkshake. You read that right: salted. caramel. milkshake. Might I add that you can get a bruleed marshmallow on that ess for an extra 50 cents? 

I can't help but feel like somewhat of a wiener queen when talking about fancy-pants burger-fries-sodas-and-shakes, but whatever, they're good!
author: Tate B.

description:
So after the owner kindly contacted me so soon after I posted my review and apologized, I wanted to update.  I realize that the entire restaurant shouldn't be criticized when it was just a couple of the workers that ruined my previous experience.

That being said, their food is pretty good.  Loved the fry-fecta!
author: Jane N.

description: I love Roam! I've had both their veggie burger and beef burger and both are delish.  I always get the Tejano style, I want to try other ones too but the Tejano is just SO good!  The fryfecta is the way to go and can be shared. Finding a table at night on the weekend can be hard, but I think it's worth it. Whenever friends come into town this is our go to place to eat! If burgers and fries didn't make you fat I would eat here every day!
author: Lacey L.

description:
I'm not much of a burger person but I'm glad they serve quality meats. No HMO or other chemical poison/crap the food industry mass-produces.

I'd go here again but lots of deterrents: price, parking, yuppie-area.
author: Jay L.

description:
Roam Burgers is an interesting place to get a tasty, healthy burger, with the "just-got-out-of-pilates/yoga" crowd.  So much so that Lululemon should consider partnering with this place and distribute their product line here.  For the money, these Artisan Burgers were a fair value.  The atmosphere is relaxed, and the food tasted fresh.  They've also got a list of delicious shakes, but I didn't get a chance to try 'em. 

As a fair value for tasty eats, this place is good.  I would definitely come back to try their other items here if I were back in this neighborhood.  Neither the food nor the value seem to jump out at me as extraordinary.  3-stars it is.
author: Leo C.

description: Very delicious high quality organic burgers for a low price with delicious french fries. Even the milkshakes are organic.
author: Jaffer K.

description:
A yummy juicy burger, while knowing in the back of your head that it is made of healthy stuff, a good combination for me.

You can choose your meat (beef, turkey, bison, veg) and then one of their pre-sets like BBQ or Tesoro, or build your own. I could probably have any of their choices and be happy before I had to make my own. My first was a BBQ turkey burger, and it was so much juicier and flavorful than expected.

I'm not a fries eater, but the regular, sweet potato, and zucchini strings all looked delish, and the veg special, a roasted butternut squash with kale and pesto was a great addition.

Roam is casual and inexpensive, and was packed even on a Thursday evening at 9 PM. We had some trouble finding a table and ended up putting five around a mini two-seater, but it is what it is.  

I was impressed with how fast the burgers and food order came out, despite a full house. The servers also regularly stopped by to clean off dirty plates and such.

The immediate experience was a 5-star but after discussing with dinnermates, there is room for improvement like with condiment selection and seating so giving a four today.

Burger plus veggie special $13 (I think burger by itself around $7-8)
author: Aki N.

description:
I had Roam for the second time in 2 days.  Yes, that's right..once last night and once again for lunch.  Maybe it's finals week and Roam happens to be in the vicinity of the Starbucks I study at or maybe it's the fact that Roam actually has some tasty burgers....whatever it is, it's working for them! 

I had the classic burger both times.  Just plain and simple, topped with butter lettuce, tomatoes, house-made pickles (outstanding!), chopped onions and typically a "house sauce" (but I got ketchup, cause me and mayo based sauces don't get along).  Yes, the burgers are a little on the smaller side, but they are reasonably priced, and probably the portions that we're supposed to be eating...instead of the double portions most other restaurants serve.  If you're a hungry man, you won't be happy with the portion size, so either don't come here or order two.  Luckily for me one fills me up, so I'll be back to Roam for my burger fix!
author: Nita K.

description: Came here on the last day of our Frisco trip. It was a nice place for our final meal in the city!  The burgers were really good! I had the tejano ( I think that's what it's called) with a bison patty with the sweet potato fries and a artisan prickly pear soda. The fries were ok, the soda was awesome!  I wish I could buy the stuff @ home. I gave them 4 stars because the seating really sucks and there outdoor heaters didnt work. I don't drink, but it looked like they had an outstanding selection. I would definitely go again!!
author: Anthony G.

description:
A really good, really cheap burger place that makes sure the burger has a fresh hamburger bun. And there are lots of burger choices to pick from. The fry-fecta is great, though would have liked a sprinkling of cayenne on the sweet potato fries. And that mixed green salad with vinegarette - so good. They have chilled filtered water or you can get organic soda or a shake. My friend is a Diet Coke addict and she loved the organic diet coke. The shake flavors looked amazing. Lucky for us, we filled up on food otherwise a milkshake would have been for dessert. 

Sitting at the tables outside when the weather is warm cannot be beat. On Union Street, there are lots of stores and shops for a post-meal walk. After a meal at Roam, you'll need a walk.
author: SFer O.

description: Great place to stop for lunch when wandering down Union St. Vegetarian burger and fries were really yummy and service friendly and efficient. My friend and I came in just after a big group had ordered but even then I didn't have to wait long at all. Thanks Roam!
author: Amy T.

description:
I'm on a never-ending quest to find great burgers in and around SF.  

I went to Roam for a late lunch, ordered a double cheeseburger, Classic style, Fries and a bottle of soda.

The burger definitely had the distinctive taste of grass-fed beef.  The burger was good but there was nothing (beef, cheese, bun, veggies) that brought it up to great.  The bun was bigger than I would have liked (soft, squishy hamburger bun, Please) and didn't seem to be toasted.  The patties were cooked more than the medium-rare I requested but were still hot and juicy.  The pickles which were house-made are good.

The fries were lukewarm and were a total disappointment.  Shame they would serve fries that weren't freshly made.

As a burger destination, Roam has a long way to go.  As a place to grab some food and hang out, Roam is A-OK.
author: Mitch E.

description:
I had lunch at Roam today for the first time.  So disappointed in the burgers.  I had the turkey classic and the burger tasted as if the animal had been in the field too long. Not fresh tasting at all.  Very dry as well.  Very poor tasting.

Just as worse as the burger,  is the fact that  the bill came to $27.00 and change for:
2 burgers
1 sweet potatoe fry
1 cola

Are you kidding???
author: Anne B.

description: I ordered the French and Fries burger with a turkey patty and gluten free bun. Probably the best burger I've ever had! Turkey usually tends to be a bit dry, but at this place, the turkey patty was just as juicy as beef! I didn't miss all the fat. LOVE that they have gluten free buns too! I can finally enjoy a burger again!! My friend ordered their truffle fries, which were good but not great. Get them on the French and Fries burger instead. I'll be coming back here very regularly.
author: Catherine C.

description:
The Heritage Burger was so F' ing amazing that I forgot to put in ketchup! 

Truffle Fries were okay...but did I tell you how perfect the burger was?

Don't get me wrong, I do love a messy, all over your face, burger but this one was pretty special.

I think I'm breaking up with Pearl's for Roam!
author: D. Miguel G.

description: Their house-made sodas are delicious (highly recommend the lime-ginger flavor). I traditional bison burger was amazing.
author: Antonio V.

description: Amazing!! Milkshakes were stellar. And I love the organic ingredients and grass-fed beef!
author: Natasha D.

description: We were at Brickyard watching the games last night, but I am not a fan of the food there so I was so happy that we decided to walk over to Roam to enjoy better yummy food.  We both ordered the amazing Veggie burger.  I had the classic and we shared the french fries. We were completely satiated and were all smiles when we went back to watch Curry & Thompson do their thing against the Nuggets... amazing game!  Too bad Panda didn't run fast enough... but Giants definitely made an effort to beat the Diamondbacks:)
author: Myra M.

description:
A burger bar where quality trumps quantity.  Grass-fed beef is but one of the alternative proteins available for your buns.  Order your choice of creative, fresh ingredients from the menu board, pay your tariff, and take a seat.  Food arrives within several minutes (not fast food, but good food fast) - just about the time you've finished your first pint of micro-brew. 

The one miss is the grated and fried zucchini, which gets soggy too quickly and tastes mostly of the cooking oil.  But given the talent behind this new eatery, I doubt this defect will last for long.

Overall, this is a family-friendly recipe destined to be a neighborhood favorite.
author: Dave C.

description: Burger was kind of dry... And charred. I wouldn't recommend the tejano burger, even though it's the only "spicy" one on the menu--and it doesn't even come to that. They only have cane soda and the burgers are 8 dollars or more.
author: Kelsey H.

description:
Thank GOD for Roam!!!!!!

If it wasn't for their turkey trio salads, I would be many many many pounds heavier. 

They add avocado to the salad and the dressing is done just right.

Beware, you will become addicted :-)

Staff is aways friendly and ready to make your experience just that much better.

Love you guys!

Keep up the good work Josh!!!!
author: james p.

description:
Hamburgers are great, with the exception that I ordered it without pink. The first time it was bloody, the second time it was bright pink but not dripping. I've learned... Go to smash burger. 
I ordered online, the website said it would be ready for pick up at 8:15. I arrived at 8:10 they hadn't even received the order.  It printed while I was talking to the cashier. I paid.   they said 10 minutes but it was busy so I was understanding that it might take longer, until a person three people behind me ordered from the Menu and got his food before me.  

Hamburgers are tasty, service is the worst.  I'd use profanity but yelp would not pot. I try to support local business. We live on union but ill go to Smash Burger next time I want a burger!
author: Bert C.

description:
Hello sweet potato fries- you are amazing! Oh and the milkshake... good thing Roam is located pretty much next door to crunch fitness as I enjoy a burger, milkshake and fries! At some point I will stumble into Crunch and will need at least 12 hours on the spin bike to work off this hearty meal! 

Roam is cheap - for the marina/ cow hollow but it is soooooo great to have a place you can order at the counter then eat there or take it to go. And you can get a quality meal for $10 or less! I LOVE IT! That special sauce that they use on their Burgers is quite tasty! 

New favorite burger place in San Francisco- good thing it is just 2 blocks from my house. Well that might not be such a good thing as I will need some more check ins at Crunch Fitness!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Just tried this place for the first time the other day, and whoa, shoulda tried it sooner! Their gluten free buns are AMAZING. I had the Heritage with turkey burger and every bite was better and better. Add truffle parm fries and you have a winner.
author: Lindsay W.

description:
I am editing my review to add that the manager did email me and apologize for his workers behavior.
I also didn't realize I had a message in my inbox until know.  I really appreciate his message and even offered to comp my food, which is unnecessary.  I didn't come back in here until recently, mostly because of my experience, but did go back and was pleasantly satisfied by the friendly attitudes and good customer service.  Thank you for turning my opinion and making me a fan again :)









------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

It's really unfortunate because I really want to like this place.  The food is amazing!

I've been here 3 times now and the first 2 times were good.  I tried the veggie burger tajano style... wow!  I was surprised by the veggie patty, expecting something that resembled more of a beef hamburger, I got something beet red and really seedy. Different, but in a good way.   It was amazing.

I changed it up the second time and got some kind of french fry burger.  It was pretty good and stuffed with spinach.  Once again unexpected but definitely in a good way.

The third time I went in here I was pleased to see there was only myself and a couple in the restaurant.  The first 2 times it was packed and I had to fight for a table and service was a little slow... good but slow.  The bus boys were really on top of their jobs.

The girl working the register was actually texting on her phone.  Yea... I go on my phone at work but not obvious and in front of customers.  Whatever.  But the thing that pissed me off is I stood right in front of her for at least 20 seconds while she ignored me and sat on her phone.  Not even joking.  Then when she finally looked up and acknowledged me (meanwhile with a total stinkface... which I've learned to brush off lately as I get it ALL the time in the Marina... ALL the time.  Get over yourselves.. you're not that great) and with a slightly "holier than thou" tone to her voice asking if I was ready to order... stopped herself mid sentence... then informed me "actually... he's going to ring you up" and mumbled something about her boss texting her and walked away.
So her coworker sees me standing at the register awkwardly and asks if I've been helped yet.  I inform him I haven't and he actually gives his brainless coworker an awkward "why the hell aren't you doing your job" look while she walks out of sight.

Very nice, he helps me out and puts in my order.  Meanwhile this girl who came back into sight is just standing around not really doing anything.  I sit down and wait for my delish burger.  Meanwhile she's finally doing something and making my milkshake.  She walks it over to my table and I look up from my phone to thank her and before I can even get the second syllable out, never even stopping to put my shake on the table, she slightly throws it at me, and continues to keep walking, and only acknowledges my gratitude with a snarky half smile.  

What a _____!

They need to fire this girl.  For realz.  I witnessed her make a total ass of herself the rest of my unpleasant stay by flirting with her coworker in a pathetic and desperate manner, goof around unprofessionally, and make herself sound like a complete idiot.  I honestly could not tell by the way she was talking if it was a joke or not.  She was talking like valley girl that for a second I thought she really was joking and doing it on purpose... but then I wasn't so sure.

And what amazed me was while she continued to text on her phone and other girls walked in, she put the phone down right away to help them.  I'm not trying to say she was hating on me... but it really seemed that way.  And keeping your guests guessing and even making them feel uncomfortable and unwanted (even if that was never the intention) is NOT a quality you want your restaurant to have.



I work off tips.  And I'm a big tipper because of it.  And people really underestimate me.  I'm not trying to have a Pretty Woman moment here...

But I'm sick of SOME people in this area who think they are better than everyone else, and this girl personified this.  (and I know not everyone is... it's hard for me to stereotype because there are awesome people who live out here and I meet nice cool people here everyday... but when people like THIS GIRL are around, it's really unfair that they have to uphold the negative reputation)

I am definitely going back because the food was pretty good and the service the other times have been decent, and that Mexican chocolate shake was like... WHOA!!!!

But I hope businesses check their yelps so they can see where they need to improve.  I know for a fact reviews can help or hurt a business.  So by putting this review up I am hoping they take care of the problem...




Or at the very least... this brat checkity-check herself before she wrecks herself.

Keeping it hood, even in the Marina
author: Kelly N.

description:
I'm so glad they have outdoor seating because I got to enjoy my burger AND the beautiful sunny SF day.

The Sunny Side burger was well executed with an overall "sweet" flavor to the burger. I like sweet things, so this burger was damn good.

The Truffle Fries burger was good, but I found a little too salty.  The good part was that back at work, every time I licked my lips, I could still taste the truffle fries :)

Definitely get the Fry-Fecta. But if not, the zucchini onion haystack is a must! I've never had anything close to this before and man, I devoured these. Thin, fried, curly, crispness. That's what it is!

Service- Quick. I was in and out within 30 minutes.

Parking- a b*tch. this area sucks for parking. a lot.
author: Patrick P.

description:
Turkey burger was pretty effing great. I dare say the best I've had. Fries were mediocre. Seating was straight up awful on a Friday night, but maybe I should've expected as much. 
Oh, and good thing I wasn't paying..tad pricey.
author: Addyline L.

description:
I had the Tejano turkey burger and found the meat to be bland although the tortilla strips added a nice crunch and the sauce that had a nice spiciness. All in all it was ok.
Those zucchini haystack strings were way too salty and  greasy, too bad because it was a nice concept. They did have a roasted veggie special for $5.50 but I did not want to have so much, but in hindsight it might have been a better choice, wish they had a smaller portion.
Burger $6.99, zucchini strings about $3.   prices seemed fair for what you get.
I went in at 7pm on a Thursday, and no wait at all.
author: Bill B.

description:
Mmmm... such yummy burgers!

I'd say that I grab a burger here at least once a week.  Any burger/style combination is a winner, but so far the best combination that I've come across is the Turkey burger, Tejano style!  It will make your tongue wet  ;-)

Also, get the sweet potato fries!  And a beer!
author: Orlando L.

description: Excellent burgers,  clean meat!! It was so good went back to get a second burger. Service was genuine,  especially on the floor!
author: Sasha L.

description:
3.5 stars

I decided on the bison meat pattie inside of the heritage burger. It was very juicy and tasty my only complaint would be that it was a little bit over seasoned. The truffle fries were solid and had the great truffle aroma you would expect but with the burger being overly seasoned it was just too much salt. I really liked their prickle pear hand crafted soda and the fact that they make it with agava instead of sugar is wonderful. I would go there again if I was in the area.
author: Greg T.

description:
not really worth it for the burgers at least. I went today and just got a burger thinking $7 should get me a decent sized burger with good toppings. I wasn't really interested in spending money on junk fillers like french fries et al. when it showed up I swear I adjusted my glasses to see if they were somehow making it look smaller. they even asked if "pink" was okay, but the beef patty was so thin that 60 seconds on the grill would've made it well done.

bottom line: go to Pearl Burger if you want a yummy, filling burger for the same price or Burger Bar for an expensive, fancy, artisan burger.
author: Coffee ..

description:
Tiny, "non-artisan" burgers, that are terribly over priced. I suggest Acme Burgerhaus instead. 
Okay if you are hungry and in the area but not worth a 'drive to'.
author: ubaid d.

description:
Everything I've tried the two times I've visited this restaurant has been excellent: fresh, flavorful, and high quality ingredients cooked to perfection. I had the bison barbeque burger, sweet potato fries with truffle parmesan seasoning, a basic elk burger, and the pumpkin shake (seasonal). I would highly recommend each.

Can't wait to eat here again next time I'm in the city! It is the only burger restaurant I like to frequent because it is so near home-made, so fresh, so tasty, and so natural (some organic ingredients, etc). Plus, where else can you order an elk burger?
author: Lauren P.

description: Servers at the counter are unenthusiastic & look pained to be there. That aside this is my favorite restaurant in the city. I'm vegan so I go for the veggie burger on a wheat bun (classic style, no sauce). The veggie burger is home made & unlike anything you have or will ever taste. So good. The fries are perfectly cooked, as well. Everything is just done amazingly there's really no other way to put it. Eat here. They have a pretty extensive menu for a burger place.
author: Jess H.

description:
The burgers and shakes here are fantastic. I had the bison burger with egg and cheese with a side of fries to go with my chocolate shake. I had high expectations after reading other reviews and this place did not disappoint. 

The only thing is that you need to get there early because it fills up fast and it's a tight fit around the tables. We showed up around 6:30 and there was no line. Within a half hour of our arrival there was a line out the door. 

Can't wait to go back next week before we head back to Seattle.
author: D M.

description:
I wouldn't even choose burgers for a meal option....but my goodness this place is amazing!! They even use rice oil to make their french fries (Thank you for not using soy oil!!) They always accommodate my allergies and make a yummy meal. Yay for restaurants that make simple food taste great and use excellent quality ingredients. The sodas are so awesome too! You must try them all
I've only ever tasted the turkey burgers. I thought they were great. I've heard that the hamburgers need more salt...
author: Sara B.

description:
I probably eat here once a week and, with one or two exceptions, have consistently had good burgers. 

I like to describe this place as upscale fast food: a bit more expensive than other quick eats, but with food quality to match. I tend not to order burgers at normal restaurants anymore because I know I can get a cheaper, and better burger at Roam. My boyfriend eats the classic every time whereas I make a special concoction of house sauce, cheddar, raw onion, and avocado. We are boring and tend to order the same thing all the time, though I keep meaning to branch out (especially with their great selection of meats).

For all you veggies out there, I've been with a few vegetarians and have heard that the veggie burger is fantastic.

One more thing...truffle fries...YUM.
author: Amy F.

description:
Dear would-be restaurant owners,

The economy sucks, and the San Francisco restaurant scene is overcrowded.  We San Franciscans are starting to buckle under the weight of leading the California food revolution (sorry LA) and are losing our patience.  Truffled mac and cheese, small plates, tapas, crudo, raw, cooked, parboiled, artisan cocktails, artisan cocktails, artisan pickles, organic, farm fresh, local, big named chefs, husband and wife teams - we've supported all of your wacky trends and now just want a decent plate of food for under $20.  Is that too much to ask?  

So, here is the trick: just do one thing and do it well; grilled cheese sandwiches, cupcakes, burgers, who cares, but stick to your guns.  It's ok, have some faith, we'll like it.  Have a nice staff that realizes it is there for us, and not the other way around.  Don't gouge us on price.  Don't have some crazy ass ordering system that requires us to wait in more than one line to get, or pay for, our food.  And, for the love of all that is good and holy, get some noise control.

Because, here is the thing: if you follow these easy pointers, girls like me, who are often accused of being overly critical (ahem), will still give you three stars even if your food is mediocre.  For instance, the bbq burger can have flavors that kind of run together (fully caramelizing the onions would be great); the veggie patty can completely fall apart and be a bit bland; and the fries can be a bit cold.   Stick to your guns, though, and add lots of extras: house made sodas, delicious shakes, beer and wine on tap, nice people, and you'll be just fine.  

xoxo, the City by the Bay
author: Pammy C.

description: Sorry guys-I had a bison burger on Fillmore Street-rubber like patty and gamey.. I have had them before in your Marina location and they were so much better. I live in Pacific, so I was happy to see you closer to me, but now I am turning off Roam... Had to take a couple stars away.. sorry, you have to offer really good, not ehhh?
author: Kirk M.

description: This joint is awesome. I had bison. Also brought a smile to my foodie gf so that is also a plus! Now my credibility skyrocketed!
author: Michael C.

description: I ate the best burger of my life here. The cashier was very helpful as we were tourists and never had a roam burger before.
author: Kimmy D.

description: Pretty bad burger - basically some pink mush, ratio of bun to burger about 5:1.  Beer, fries and service were good.  Ordered two burges same except one medium well and one medium, when they got delivered server said "one regular.  Other one regular."  They were both way undercooked.  In my book, not much excuse for poorly prepared burger - there is not that much too it pretty simple, just cook the burger!!
author: Glenn S.

description: Roam Burger, you had me at Tejano. The Tejano is so good. The chipotle spicy mayo, the tortilla strips inside the burger, the avocado. My mouth did a dance for joy. So good! Casual atmosphere and our food came out pretty quickly. Good for to go orders as well!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
great burger, but expensive.

came here the other day for a burger, glass of wine, and an iced tea and spent 25 bucks.  expensive.

the burgers start at 7.99 or so...then you have the option to have a different protein, pick your bun, then customize everything from choice of veggies to different sauces...

being that i love blue cheese, we opted for the blue cheese burger and had it made with a bison patty instead of the grass fed beef patty.  ordered it on a wheat bun, with a fried egg, 2 thick cut pieces of bacon, caramelized onions, some greens, and bbq sauce on the side.  did it taste great? heck yeah.  so many different flavors going on in that thing...id easily eat one everyday honestly...but then reality hits me and reminds me that in fact, if i ate this everyday, id be hella broke...like i said in the beginning...expensive.
author: Kyu L.

description:
Just grabbed a late dinner here with a friend who was visiting in town.

- Turkey Sunny Side burger: Pretty delicious, nothing OUT OF THIS WORLD, but a good sized burger that's hefty and satiates that burger craving

- Best thing ever are the artisan sodas, my friend got the pineapple which was SO REFRESHING tasting, and I got the ginger lime which was the same

Only minor details that bugged me were that 
- there were no knives available 
- the place was packed at 8pm on a SUNDAY night, we ended up sitting outside

I definitely want to go back and try their sides and the other sodas. So not my number one burger joint, but I want to go back to try the other items (including their shakes).
author: Jung-Ah Y.

description:
This is a great place to go if your girlfriend really doesn't like burgers.  The burgers here are good, but very small.  They have to be something like 6 oz.  My girlfriend told me that even she could eat 2 of them!  They have a great selection of meats, from buffalo and beef to turkey and venison, all super lean.  I asked what the mix was of the beef, and they said it was 90/10 which is incredibly lean.  You don't get the juicy beef taste with these burgers but you also don't get that sick feeling after eating greasy food.  It's a trade off. The patties are also VERY thin, which doesn't help in delivering the beefiness either.

We also got the Fryfecta.  The sweet potato fries were great.  The onion things weren't very substantial, and I think it was more breading than onion. They would have been good on top of a salad. The regular fries weren't too crispy, similar to In n Out fries.  

We ordered shakes too, and these blew us away.  We got the salted caramel shake and the dagoba chocolate shake.  Both were phenomenal, though very small portions.  All in all, regarding the portions, given the price, the portion size is reasonable.    

Service was great.  You order at the counter and they give you a number.  They bussed our table quickly too.  As a lot of the other reviews say, this place fills a much needed niche for Union Street, a cheap, quick burger place.  Admittedly the location isn't ideal, but at the end of the day, this place gets the job done pretty well.
author: Adam E.

description:
Ate here with a friend at the end of the US -Ghana match. Me and a lot of friends in the neighborhood were excited about this place opening on Union. Here are the deets...

Roam is a build your burger place, meaning, they number out your order, 1 -what kind of patty, choices beef, turkey, buffalo, etc.;  2 -style of burger, Classic, BBQ, French Fries, etc.; and 3- bun, white, wheat. Its kind of cool that they have all the different of choices. 

First note, none of the burgers come with sides, so after ordering our burgers, Turkey, Classic on white and Buffalo, French Fries on wheat we each ordered sweet potato fries. 

For their fries they have different seasonings that can be added for an additional 50 cents. I ordered the maple sugar on my sweet potato fries. 

Total $22.

Was it worth it...i guess. When the food came out  it was awkward looking with a normal sized burger on an average-sized dinner plate and our fries neatly placed in a small paper concession container you might see used to serve tater tots at a minor league baseball game. Those two items took up less than 2/3rds of the plates with the other plus third empty...Maybe its the American in me, but i dont like empty space on my plate until i'm finished eating. 

The burgers were very yummy. Each patty was similar in size not large enough to create the juicy burger affect, but enough to know youre eating a burger.  My the buffalo burger french fry style was very flavorful. I thought seasoning worked and happy i picked it. My friends turkey burger Classic was surprisingly good. The turkey meat was seasoned well. The sweet potato fries were blah given the cost. I can't believe they charged 50 cents for the maple on the fries, completely a McDonalds-like upsell. 

Anyway, its a new place and with all of the combinations i definitely will be going back.
author: Jason J.

description:
I quite like you, Roam, and here are a few reasons why:

+ Commitment to grass-fed beef, humane, open-pasture turkey and bison meat, and local ingredients
+ Variety of "styles" (I'm a girl who loves fancy toppings)
+ The Fry-Fecta (with the zucchini haystack being the standout)
+ Good portions (you'll leave satisfied and not feeling like an FA)
+ Good service

Here are some weird things about you:
- The options for cooking are "pink" or "not pink" - but I really feel there is a wide spectrum in between.  Why can't I specify?

Here is something I must have next time I come:
+ Salted.  Caramel.  Milkshake!

It's tough to convince the bf to trek out here for a burger when he's a die-hard fan of Polker's, but I have a feeling I'll be able to swing it every once in a while :)  In other words, I'll be back.
author: Allison B.

description:
I am happy to see a new burger place in the cow hollow area. I am happy they use grass fed beef. What is not great is the burger preparation. 

If you are going to tote yourself as a legit burger joint, please know how to cook them. I ordered a cheeseburger medium rare, and what I received was a well done hockey puck of a burger. 

I am inclined to give them another chance, but its hard to pay 7 bucks for a burger when they can't even get it right. In their defense, the fries were pretty good.
author: Sean R.

description:
This place rocks! I consistently have the experience here of eating a burger and saying "Damn, that was one of the best burgers I've ever had." I won't claim to be a total burger connoisseur that has tried every burger in the city ... but of those that I have tried, this one wins - hands down.

The thing I've been especially impressed with is that I've ordered a Bison Burger every time I've gone (mostly the "Tejano" style - which is so awesome I can't seem to get away from it even though I keep meaning to try other styles) because I was trying to keep it "lean" for the wedding diet I was on (dismiss the fact that perhaps a burger shouldn't be on a wedding diet at all). Every time I've had bison in other places, it was always too dry and a bit of a let down ... but I just ordered it as the healthy alternative. Roam let me have the best of both worlds!

My girlfriend ... excuse me, my wife! ... swears by the Farmer's Market Salad with turkey burger mini patties in the salad. Now that the wedding has passed, I'm looking forward to hitting up Roam again to try all the various burgers and perhaps even one of those amazing looking shakes.

To top things off, I had an incident recently where I called in an order for take-out and my order ended up not getting in the system amidst a busy rush. When I went to pick it up, the owner was sitting at the bar and overheard the situation as they apologized and said they would make my order right away. The owner stepped in, comped my order, got the order rushed in the back (he even went back to check on it directly), and chatted me up for a bit while I waited and was a super cool guy. Rest assured, I already knew the food was awesome (and worth the wait) and now I know the focus on customer service is there as well.

Solid place. Legit burgers. Check 'em out ...
author: Kevin S.

description:
My burger was the worst part of my meal. 




Ok now that that has settled in I hope you have better luck than I did. I took some friends from out of town to this place so I was crossing my fingers that it wouldn't disappoint. I got a turkey burger with a fried egg and a couple other toppings but there was a ketchup-y DISASTUH on my tray. The wrapper was soaked in ketchup before I even attempted to peel it open...it just pulled apart in a drenched mess. Every bite I took squirted ketchup onto my tray. Gross!!! I can't even believe that I finished that abomination considering I hate American ketchup (actually I ended up not eating the bun to avoid much of the ketchup).  All my other friends didn't even have ketchup on their burgers. Riddle me that. 
The onion/zucchini fries were fine and my iced tea was ok as well. Food was pretty overpriced. More of a 2.5 star place but I sat outside and it was a comfortable and I always enjoy eating outside in SF whenever it's comfortable.
author: Amber R.

description: The burger was prepared just right. They didn't over cook it. My friend had the bison. It was very good. The drinks are refreshing too.
author: Ammala B.

description: on Sunday at 11:30, not too crowded and so avoided the loudness others have spoken of.  Got the beef classic "pink" with pepper jack and russet fries.  $9.29 with water.  Burger is a bit thin, but I felt fairly full after the meal.  But I think many would require the $2 upgrade to the 1/2 pound version unless they got a beer or shake to augment.  Quality of bun, meat, and all condiments were excellent and I enjoyed the fries as well, though they originally brought them to me with garlic which was quickly rectified.  Nice cheese on burger.  Good tap water jug and nice glasses.  A solid addition to the city's burger selection.
author: Marc S.

description:
this is the most affordable burger this side of the city. starts off at $4.99 for a classic. get outta here!

the quality is good, the space is real cool looking with reclaimed woods and metals, and it's very easy on your wallet.
author: Ameer N.

description: Love, love, love the turkey burgers here!  I like the classic (butter lettuce, tomato, homemade pickles, and house sauce) plus pepperjack...so good and not dry at all! Regular fries are yummy, too.  Decently priced.  Can be difficult to find a table, but I hear there's another branch opening on Fillmore (near Fraiche - super excited about this!)...so we can spread the love.
author: Joyce L.

description:
I LOVE this place! I love that I can go big and get an amazing burger with an order of truffle and sweet potato fries BUT if I also want to be good I can get any specialty burger veggie and protein style and I don't feel as bad. 

Everything is so fresh and made to order. I think this is one of the best burger places in SF. I also love that they have kombucha, great way to wash that burger down!
author: Sue-sue M.

description:
I am lovin this lunch with the TB...so he is working down by the Fillmore area and there are a lot of good eats there...he said that he will have burger for lunch at Barney's this morning.

When he called, I asked if he can also bring me a  cheeseburger. Before you know it..he said that he is 10 minutes away. And this is how it works for us, he brings the food and i bring the drinks...in his case it is usually Vitaminwater that I purchase from the Deli near my work.

So we shared this Blue Cheese Burger with an awesome, shoestrring vegetable fries on the side. It is sooooo good.

Next time he is in the area I will ask him to get that for us again.
author: Malou C.

description:
Great food, creative combinations.  Loved the fry-fecta...I really want to go there again however the cons have kept me from returning.

Cons: Way too loud.   I had to scream at the top of my lungs to the cashier.   She couldn't hear my order and made mistake.  We were both literally leaning forward as close as possible trying to hear each other.  No seating guaranteed...I'd rather wait for a table and be served than place an order and hope that a table is free by the time my food is ready.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Great burgers, great fries, great service!

Just one thing: I'm pregnant, and the burger was SO PINK, I thought it was a salmon burger. (pregnant people must eat all of their meat well-done, which is sad for me.)

Just on a safety note: If you are taking a child, pregnant person, or older person here for a burger, ask them to make it well done. Dept. of Agriculture says to cook all ground meat thoroughly due to the risk of bacterial growth in ground meat. (I hate sounding like your mother, but these are some of the things you learn once you begin to create life- LOL)

I had to take mine apart and put it in the oven at home to cook it all the way....
author: adrienne l.

description:
I'm always down for a good burger and this place is one of them.

I ordered a burger with aged white cheddar with all the fixings and a side of fries.  The burger was cooked right and cheese slightly melted the way I like it.  Also I got the chance to nibble on someone's zucchini onion strings, next time I have to get a order of that too with my burger.   I don't know where they get their buns, but it was hella good, not too big not too small, it was just right.

A nice place to catch the game too.
author: Calvin H.

description:
Yum!
My new favorite burger place, great burger, fresh and plentiful lettuce, tomatoes, pickles (delicious), etc...Excellent sweet potato fries dangerously close to my apartment.
author: Agent F.

description:
Where do I begin??  I'll start by saying I loved the look of the interior of the restaurant.  Very nicely done.  And the staff behind the registers also left a nice impression BUT then there was the food...

Two of us went there on Saturday, both burger lovers, both foodies and both regular diners around the city.  

We ordered  The Classic burger with pepper jack cheese and a specialty burger named the Pacific Blue which had bleu cheese, caramelized onions and arugula (sounds good but it wasn't).  BOTH burgers came out VERY over cooked and dry (both were ordered "pink"), the thin, fast food restaurant style meat patties had NO flavor,  the Jack cheese on the classic was bland,  the tiny bit of caramelized onions on the pacific blue gave no flavor and the buns where either over buttered or just simply greasy from the griddle fried burger patties.  

All in all, granted the Classic was only $5 and the Pacific Blue was $7, but being cheap is no excuse for being poorly prepared and using bland ingredients.  I'd gladly pay $2, $3 or even $4 more PER burger and actually have a well made, flavorful burger. 

Shame...  I was SO hoping for a solid burger spot in the neighborhood.  Still waiting for one.
author: A R.

description:
We (2) had the beef tejano, beef blue cheese, sweet potato fries with chipotle maple topping, haystack with parmesan topping, and pineapple soda. All the food was pretty yummy and recommendable. The soda was only okay, and didn't really go that well with the food. 

Portions were plenty, we didn't finish and took some home for late night snacking - yay!

The price came out to $25 which is okay considering the quality.

We'll be back.
author: Felix B.

description:
Looking for Burgers that are not the ordinary meatloaf slapped between a bun or even worse from an 'assembly line'? Well, we were looking for exactly that and found it!! 
Great: try Bisonburger and add the Gruyere cheese - killing good! The shakes are wonderful! Personally, I am not so happy with the fries so I simply leave them away. 
Folks are always nice, interesting choices to add on but NOT cheap!
Enjoy
author: Rolf H.

description: Got the bison bbq burger and it was good, but not fantastic. It's a heavy burger, but small, which I liked. Also tried the hazelnut chocolate milkshake which was very good. I didn't feel gross and overly full after eating either. My favorite burger place is still True Burger in Oakland.
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place is great! I had the vegetarian burger and my boyfriend had a classic burger and we were both impressed! They also serve AMAZING sweet potato fries. I just wish they delivered.
author: Crystal M.

description: I lube burgers. This place is good. I like the interior and the menu. I had the french and fries, i thought it was really ok. The fries didn't add much flavor, but good texture. Boyfriend had the sunny side. SOOO much better. Absolutely delicious. This is what I'm coming back for next time. Also, delicious is the zucchini and onion haystack and they had a special shake with nutella. mmmmm.
author: Irina S.

description: Roam Artisan burgers are dynamite, straight explosive in your mouth.  Had the Tejano and it was stupendous.  It seems like the combos of fresh ingredients in their burgers are all just right, there's contrast and ascension of taste.  Fries are delicious as well, in string form and w/ sweet potatoes (Fry Fecta).  They also got Blue Bottle shakes...a meal just got serious w/ that.  Only knock I have is an entire meal can add up to $20 here, which is pretty hefty for a burger.  Definitely one of the top 3 burger joints in SF - joining the company of 4505 Meats and Grumpy's.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Pros: Good selection of burgers.  Bison burger and turkey burgers taste very good. Sweet potato fries are excellent. 

Cons: Slightly pricey and a bit of wait.  Order ahead of time to avoid the line! Parking is tough...
author: James J.

description: Yuuum!  This place has some of the best burgers around!  I am taking off one star because this location is smaller than the other one so it's always a little tough to find a place to sit. I love their sunny side burger.  It has a yummy egg with great sauces on it.  Their salad is ok, not as good as their burger and with a lot less meat.  You must try their sweet potato fries with chipotle maple.  Really good.
author: Dulce F.

description:
The veggie burger is one of the best I've ever had. I have been here around 5 times and I find it is best Sunny Side style (with an egg, greens, cheddar cheese, and carmelized onions) 

I like the atmosphere here too, I often come in and sit by myself at the bar. This place has become a regular spot for me!
author: Hillary P.

description: Great burgers...options to get items gluten free...this place is awesome...and despite me accidentally ordering and prepaying at a different location, they honored my order and didn't make me double pay...great customer service!
author: John M.

description: Some of the best burgers in town. My favorite is the Pacific Blue meat burger. The fries are great too.
author: Albert S.

description: Love this place. Decent food in the marina. Bout time!!! Great staff, good grub!!
author: Erika C.

description: Kid size mint chip milk shake hits the spot with the veggie burger, French and fries style
author: L H.

description:
Worth a trip across town?  Yep.

Sometimes you eat a burger and fries and feel totally gross and stuffed afterward.  If that happens, you are not eating at Roam.  The food here is fresh and delicious.  I only wish it was closer to home.

We stopped here on a Sunday night with one meat eater, and me.  The veggie burger, which is more like a mound of tasty quinoa goodness on a bun (with any burger toppings you want) was awesome.  Having a good veggie side is something you never get at a quick service burger spot - and they nailed the seasonal veggies.  I also loved the sweet potato fries.  Hearsay says... the bison burger was good to the last bite.

We also tried the kombucha (on tap!  yay!) and kiddie-sized shakes.  A perfect end of dinner treat - salted caramel?! Blue bottle coffee?!  Hooray.

The restaurant was clean, the staff was super friendly, and if life ever takes me to the Marina again, you can find me at Roam.
author: Gretchen S.

description:
this might be one of my favorite burger joints. it is no harry's, or fish & farm. it is very, very san francisco. fresh ingredients all the way. 

so far i've tried two: sunny side and french & fries. sunny side was quite amazing, running yolk dripping down, soaking the burger adding just that yummy egginess. french & fries didn't sound too appealing at first - but was a perfect pairing of all the ingredients. that mustard had a really nice kick.

everything is FRESH! including the fries. we accidentally got an order of sweet potato fries with maple syrup on top. sounds a bit much? not. at. all. best order mistake ever. all the flavors were enhanced!

definitely don't let the size full you - it is packed with juicy goodness, without over-feeding (for a 6' tall man). highly recommend!
author: Fiona S.

description:
3.5 stars.  Had a BBQ bison burger - the flavors were amazing, but the coleslaw they used made the bun so soggy (it was wet all the way through when it came to the table - I like juicy, but that's almost unappetizing) it fell apart immediately.  Also, I understand it's "only" $7 but I expect more than a fast-food size patty at a restaurant.  

Zucchini strings were too thin to taste like anything but batter.  Next time I'll skip the fry-fecta and go straight for the sweet potato fries, they were definitely the standout.
author: Katie P.

description:
This place has a few flaws, but the damn tasty food and fairly low price is leading me to gladly overlook them.

The burgers are simply fantastic.  So far I've had a Turkey Sunnyside (do not mock egg on a burger until you've tried it!) and a beef original with cheese.  Both were absolutely delicious, with just a dab of comforting grease to let you know that it's there.  The fries are salty and fantastic, and the side salad was surprisingly vibrant and flavorful!   The portions are just perfect for lunch, though could be a little small for dinner.  

My main complaint, which isn't new, is the painfully slow ordering process.  I don't understand how it can possibly take so long to process orders.  Not only is the long wait annoying, but you only need to be about 6th in line to be forced to wait in the doorway or outside.  Fortunately, service is pretty quick once you place your order.

Big thumb's up for Roam!
author: Mitchel H.

description:
I REALLY wanted to be in love with this place...especially since I wouldn't have to ROAM far for a burger...being that I live 2 steps away.

But it was a little less than love at first bite.

My BBQ burger was a little disappointing...creative, but I felt that the slaw overpowered everything else on the burger.  I ordered the sweet potato fries with some seasoning on them, but found that they probably had a sprinkling of flavor (if that) on them.  Seriously? If you're going to charge extra for some flavoring on your fries, you should really actually PUT that flavoring on.

To add to it, my food was overall at room temperature.

And hello, can we get a chicken burger up in here?!?!?

Plus, while sitting at the bar waiting for my food, there were like 4 staff members there just standing messing around, and making s'mores with the marshmellows they weren't using to top their milkshakes.

Well, if you want your milkshake to bring the boys to the yard...you should really strike up conversation with your customers given that you're a new business in the neighborhood.

I'll give them one more try, but that's really because I live here and I want to like it that bad.

But let's be real...for a BOMB-tastic burger, roam over to Chestnut street for Tipsy Pig's burger.  Or as Kimberly B. says, Perry's just down the street.
author: Vince S.

description:
Only been here once, but had a great experience.  Food was good, cashiers were timely, and the price was right.

The hype is not undeserved.
author: Zack K.

description: I'm impressed, really great burger. Had the Classic with white cheddar and a side of sweet potato fries. The burger was actually the perfect size and reasonably priced (unlike some other establishments that insist on charging over $10 for a sloppy mess). The patty wasn't very thick but still was juicy and had a great char. I'll definitely be back and curious to try the bison and elk to see how they compare...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Given all the mixed reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect.  Since it's in my neighborhood, I decided I had to try it.

I ordered the classic with cheese.  It was cooked perfectly.  The second I started eating it, I couldn't put it down and ate it in 30 seconds.  It's not a huge burger but it's super flavorful and juicy for a $6 burger.  The meat, butter lettuce, tomatoes, etc, all had a great flavor...probably because it's organic.  My boyfriend loved the burger too.  We ended sharing another burger because we are big eaters.

We also ordered the Fry-fecta.  The fries and sweet potato fries were crispy, warm, and not greasy.  The onion/zuchini strings tasted great at the first bite but got a little greasy after the second bite.  I'd stick with the fries next time.

All in all, I'll be back to this place!
author: Shelly W.

description:
My parents were in town and wanted something no fuss - "let's just go grab a burger or something".  I'd heard friends talking about this place at a party and so we decided to give it a try.  

Place was much cooler than I'd expected - great, mellow, but tasteful decor - sort of industrial log cabin with a big natural wood bar, as well as a cool communal table in the middle for multiple (or larger) parties to share.  

Menu had lots of interesting choices.  I tend toward vegetarian and saw that their veggie burger was made in home - a nice change from the standard Boca or Gardenburgers most people stash in their freezer and deep fry.

Everyone said their burger was delicious - mine included.  Had the "french and frie" (?) style - truffle french fries (on the burger!), gruyere, arugula and dijon...gooood stuff.  

French fries - of which we got two orders of the mixed (ie: 3 different types of fries in one order) - were good, but not out of this world.  Sweet potato (seasoned w/ chipotle maple), regular (seasoned w/ truffle parmesan) and then sort of shoestring zucchini and onion (? can't fully remember).  Seasonings cost an addt'l .50, which felt a little steeper than necessary, but given the quality of the food (I think everything was organic, etc), the number of choices and the location, it was still very reasonable and we all left happy, full, and with a new go-to spot for dinner (and lunch).

P.S. One of the owners was there and even made the rounds to check in on us, which I thought was a nice touch - I always like when owners are invested enough to spend time in their own restaurant getting to know their clientele.  Props to Roam.
author: David M.

description:
Twas a blessing from above when I found out that not only are they opening up a new bar across the street from me (Brick Yard) - but a burger joint as well. 

I tried Roam on the first day with much enthusiasm.  Went for the standard burger, which was 'meh, ok' - I wrote it off thinking it was the first day they were open and they're still figuring it out - at least the interior is cool.

Where this restaurant really made me a fan (and earned themselves 4 big ones) was when I tried the turkey burger the next time.  Much can go array when preparing a turkey burger, but somehow they found a way to retain the juices (much juicier than the regular burger). A tip of the hat to Josh and the gang.
author: Mike F.

description: My boyfriend was craving a hamburger for his bday lunch, so since Umami burger was closed we strolled into Roam Artisan Burgers.  He ordered the bison patty with the french and fry style and I ordered the turkey burger with the chalet style.  I tried a bite of his and I'll admit, it was pretty juicy.  Mine was more on the lean side and I loved the mushrooms and sauce that accompanied my turkey patty.  We also shared a mint chocolate milk shake which was pretty damn good!  All in all I would come here again..but Umami's burgers still remain the winner in my heart.
author: Kristen T.

description:
My experience at Roam was better than decent. I was on my own, and would not recommend this place for solo eating adventure. The crowd is young. I overheard a really young couple (20?) talking out of their asses - and while I loved the music (Stones), it wasn't quite loud enough to drown out their nasaly voices. I'd say Roam isn't great for a first date as it's loud.

The food was good. I liked the "build your own" burger idea. My beef, jack, grilled onion and bbq topped burger was delicious. I LOVED the butter lettuce, but I wish the bun had be toasted - it fell flat and was a little cold. 

Decent beer selection and delicious fries. Roam is also really reasonable $-wise.
author: Christy D.

description: The burgers and fries are amazing. But I wasn't really a fan of the shakes.
author: Abigail K.

description: First and last time.  I ordered online and everything was completely wrong.  I asked for no pink, cheese and onion with mayo and mustard on the side.  I got all pink burger, no cheese and lathered in mustard and mayo.  The only thing they got right was the onions.  Wonderful.
author: M P.

description:
Burgers were juicy and tasty - caramelized onions a must. Good selection of cheeses and toppings to dress up your burger to your liking. The Fry-fecta - fries, sweet potato fries and thinly shaved zucchini and onions 'haystack' were good and not greasy. Tip - put the zucchini/onion haystack between the bun and meat - YUM. The order takers were nice enough and the food came out fast.

Lastly Parmesan Truffle Fries - need I say more?
author: Edwin V.

description:
My boyfriend and I we're roaming around the Marina trying to find some place to eat dinner, when we found ROAM.  I had heard about the place from a few co-workers and had wanted to try it! The line wasn't bad at all and so we decided why not? 

The menu is amazing.  You can build your own burgers and the fries and milkshakes are the best! I'm a veggie so I chose the grilled cheese with sweet potato fries.  The grilled cheese was cooked on a regular bun with a white cheese that was perfectly melted.  Delish! My boyfriend had the classic cheeseburger and he loved it.  It was a pretty big cheeseburger (they use high quality ingredients, which is always a plus).

The wait wasn't too long for the food considering the place was pretty busy.  I thought it would be hard to find a table, but we ended up snatching a couple seats on the long communal table.  The atmosphere is perfect if you just want a chill dinner or lunch...basic Marina crowd.  If you go, don't forget to check out the milkshakes.  By far the best milkshake I have ever had.  We had the pomegranate blueberry and it was the perfect consistency for a milkshake. The house-made sodas are also pretty good, not too sweet (and I never drink soda).  We had the ginger soda and the lime one, pretty interesting, but the taste is refreshing.

The prices are just right too, it was about $25 dollars for the bf and I.  We will definitely be at Roam again in the future...I want to try the dessert and veggie burger!
author: Cherie A.

description:
Stopped in for a bite post world cup madness and was not disappointed. I had the cheddar bison burger and truffle fries, was delicious. 

Service was fast and friendly, will definitely be back again.
author: Alisa S.

description:
I have seen this place a few times and always wanted to try it. The menu is full of interesting and delicious-sounding burgers. We finally got the chance to try it and I'm pretty disappointed. Really, this is a 2.5 star review. 3 for the food, 2 for the service. 

When we ordered, I was told I could either have "pink in the middle" or "not pink in the middle". Apparently "pink in the middle" equates to medium rare and when I asked if I could have it medium she said, "well, we can try but when it's busy we either do it pink or not pink." Um, okay, for a burger place, that's kind of ridiculous. It took FOREVER to get our food - about 15 minutes for our drinks and probably 30 minutes in total for our food which would have ordinarily been probably not a huge deal but it wasn't very busy. 

As for the food, I'd give it a 3 overall. My fiance's burger (he ordered the French and Fries) was actually pretty tasty. However, he asked for pink in the middle and it was definitely cooked all the way through. I ordered the BBQ burger but there was hardly any coleslaw (just about a tablespoon) and the bun had the tiniest smear of BBQ sauce which you couldn't even taste when you ate it - I had to ask for extra. Additionally, my burger wasn't even close to being medium. It was very, very, very medium rare (closer to the rare side with a good sear on each side). You could tell that the burger and all the fixings were high quality and a lot of it tasted good, the proportions were just totally off and it was improperly cooked. 

Overall, it wasn't a great experience. I don't think that I would return on my own accord, but if someone suggested it and really wanted to go, I don't think I would protest horribly.
author: Jess B.

description:
Burgers, a name that includes "artisan", and organic milk shakes: Roam had everything it needed to earn at least 4 stars and I so wanted to go there. But I just can't. 

Granted, the food was GOOD: my salad's greens were fresh and tasty, and the bison beef on top was cooked just right and was definitely yum. My friend's burger was also cooked just right, juicy and delectable, and the accompanying salad perfect as well. And I have yet to indulge in the Straus Family Creamery organic shakes (with frozen yogurt as a guilt-free option) boasting such tantalizing flavors as the oh-so-SF salted caramel, Dagoba Chocolate and Blue Bottle Coffee ...I think this is definitely where the "artisan" part starts to come in...

The problems? 

* Loud -  feels like a high school cafeteria, to the point where the glass of wine with dinner feels a bit incongruous.

* Small portions - sacre bleu, that is prob the coup de grace preventing the 4th star from happening. Someone who goes to a burger place by definition is not a demure eater - isn't that a safe assumption? Alas, the burger was SMALL...and my bison burgettes were almost appetizer (as in micro) portioned...

But the shakes are siren-calling me back for another shot, and if they blow me away as much as they are setting me up to be, I may revise. 

I mean...Pomegranate Blueberry...Tahitian Vanilla Bean...methinks Abraham Maslow may need to come up with a new hierarchy!
author: Diane B.

description:
One of the best Burgers in SF. If there is a better one, I don't know what it is. The menu reads like the Counter except at Roam you order at the counter. Ironically, at the Counter you order for your table.

The Burgers come half wrapped in paper to keep yourself clean which is a nice touch, cooked the way you like it, high quality meat with multiple meat choices, so many sauces and combinations to choose from. My favorite is the delicious shakes you can order with it. Num num num
author: Mike T.

description:
BEST burger I've had in a looong time! Must get the sweet potato fries with maple glaze. Blue bottle coffee milkshake was deliciously sinful. Mmmm! Can't wait to go back and try another burger!

Great mellow ambiance that is perfect for a casual meal.  Everyone there is also really friendly and welcoming. I'm glad this place came to the Marina---there's nothing else like it!
author: Mel A.

description: I've been very happy with the burgers here.  They are tasty, and the pricing is great.  The decor inside is very nice, and the service is solid.  The place can get a bit busy, but it's not unmanageable and I've always gotten my food here in a reasonable amount of time.  Overall I can't find any fault in them, and the product(delicious burgers) are top quality!
author: Yan L.

description:
Had The Classic with beef. I had really high expectations for the burger, as I seek out pasture-raised beef for its flavor, leanness, and lower health/environmental impacts, but the burger tasted just okay. It was good, but not incredible.

What was incredible was my milkshake--the salted caramel shake made with f/f fro-yo was one of the most delicious things I've ever had in my life. Not too sweet, a little tart from the yogurt, oh man, my salivary glands are watering just thinking of it. Worth a visit just for the shake!

The gal at the counter was very friendly and patient with my indecision. The restaurant itself is a very casual cafe. Lots of hard surfaces, so it can get loud if there's a full house. Prices are very reasonable. 

I'll definitely give it another shot to sample the bison burger and the turkey burger.
author: Jeanie S.

description: Will def be going back to this place. Great burgers, great location and great service. Love that you can make your own burger or choose one that they have already created. The fri-trio was pretty good too. Not too sure that I would get the zucchini fries again but everything else was great.
author: Melissa O.

description:
Am not a burger person (mostly due to the awful quality ingredients they're made with), but my first experience with this place is winning me over.

Had the bison burger and was lean and flavorful, with a bun that was not mushy or artificial.  Fries were crisp and not oily (yeah!), and although they were having problems with the kombucha tap so I couldn't taste it, the pineapple soda was outstanding.

Excellent new place on Union street, hopefully the start of a new trend.
author: Mike B.

description: I came here for the second time last night and again ordered their veggie burger, BBQ style with white cheddar, caramelized onions, BBQ sauce, and slaw. My dinner companions and I shared the fry-fecta (good enough for 3!) and I had the ginger lime soda to drink - just perfect, not overly sweet. This spot is a nice alternative for the area; great food at a reasonable price.
author: Tina A.

description:
Food: Got the classic cheeseburger. It was tasty but the patty was small and thus the flavor of the grass-fed beef didn't really stand up to the bun, lettuce, sauce, cheese, etc. It was good, but not great.

Also got the Fryfecta. The potato fries were good. The zucchini/onion fried things were kind of nasty. Just greasy breading with no substance. I can't imagine these are very popular.

Service: Uh, no. Ordered burger without tomatoes...it came with tomatoes. Ordered a shake... it didn't show up. Asked for the shake again and waited... it didn't show up. Asked a third time just as I was finishing my burger and fries, and finally it appeared. They didn't check on me once during my meal or seem to care much about my presence after I ordered. Pretty lame.

Can't say I'll be recommending the place to people. Can't say I'll be back. I'm pretty forgiving, but the whole experience was just rather mediocre and there are better places to spend my time and money. Yours too.
author: Jeff N.
Christopher L.

description:
This is a well priced place, nice ambience and solid.  I went on day 6 of it opening.  My gripes:
1.  Burger - not much sauce, they need to clarify at the register if you want it red or not (which they didn't ask and only when I went to order another burger and specifically asked for medium did the person say I could do red or not.  maybe a cashier error).  The burger seemed less greasy than your normal burger.  The 1/4 lb is just too small and 1/2 lb too big so this Goldilocks would request a 1/3 lb burger.  The burger was ok - really just ok.  I had two of them - the BBQ and the regular one.
2.  Shake - YUUUUUM.  Chocolate shake was awesome.
3.  Sweet potatoe fries - decent.  They need to do what Pacific catch does and cinch the deal with that yummy wasabi sauce or something else besides ketchup.

This place is good and people are hitting it pretty hard right now so I wish it were bigger bc you order and then have to stalk people for their seats when they leave like it's Christmas time in the parking lot of a mall.  I hate that.  But I guess it just means it's popular.
author: Deal G.

description:
it was a weekend and the pretentious faux-riche were poncing about in the pretentious little tennis bubble of their pretentious neighborhood with their unecessary gaggle of spoiled rotten, loud, pretentious spawn screaming and crying and oblivious to the fact that a few quiet people may have just wanted to have a seat and enjoy a burger and a pint in an un-pretentious place called roam.

it was busy, yes but theres no need to complain, our food came out in a timely fashion and was on point. i had the "heritage"....id have to say that this burger has stood out  in volume. it was deeelishisss.

ill go back. just when the marina folk is scarce. hard to enjoy good food around shitty people.
author: aidan m.

description:
Dangerously Delicious! Seriously hands down best burger I have had in SF....and I have had many! 

Casual yet classy interior, super friendly service focused staff and the prices are more than reasonable considering the quality!

Only downside is this is only a few blocks from my house which will not help from a temptation standpoint!
author: Wendy W.

description: So So Good!!! I wish could go back for more.    If you love burgers, then this is the place to be.   The selection varies from turkey, beef, bison to  veggie with multiples styles available.   I personally had the beef with the french and fries style which includes a load of carmelized unions with french fries.   The burger was absolutely fantastic!!   On the side got the zuchinni/onion string haystack which were super crispy and delicious.
author: Bernard L.

description:
I've been wanting to try out this new local burger spot on Union Street. I was meeting a friend for a quick dinner and catch-up, so we decided this would be a good time to try it out. I had the "French and Fry" which has great flavors but I'll agree with other reviewers that the beef didn't blow my mind, the patty was just OK. There are plenty of other burger spots in the city with juicier meat, but for $7 or so it hit the spot. The staff was very friendly but my one main reason I give 3 stars instead of 4 is the atmosphere. The restaurant was SO loud, we were sitting at a small 2 person table but could barely hear each other and had to keep yelling across the table. It's a small place but the layout just makes it so noisy.

I'm planning on coming back with other friends wanting to test it out so hopefully some of these kinks will work themselves out the longer this place is open.
author: Sandy G.

description: Be prepared to enjoy one of the most delicious turkey burgers.... We had the turkey Tejana and French and Fries. The shake tick and fresh. But the service is a far different story, you will fight for attention, napkins or any semblance of customer service. You will get none. Next time I will try orders to go.
author: Mario J.

description:
Honestly, the size of the burger reminded me of InAndOut - for about 3 times the price. I guess I was expecting something the size of Barney's burgers for that price ($5 w/o sides or extra toppings). And it didn't even taste as good as InAndOut's animal style. It's just beyond me why a place has to charge $5 for a small burger... aren't we in a recession??? Too bad the wharf is so far away. 

We tried the Truffle Parmesan Russet fries - better than that other place, but not by much. All in all... I may go back to try some of their more 'exotic' foods. By the way, the Fri-fecta of fried things is a whole plate - enough for a few people. I'll be trying that next time if I'm with someone.
author: Michael G.

description:
So I don't know about grass-fed cows and organic ice cream, but whatever this place is doing, they're doing it well. 

I got the classic (beef) burger with Swiss and caramelized onions. The burger came out a bit messy, but for some reason, my bread didn't get super soggy. The meat was super tasty and the whole burger was just delicious. 

My boyfriend got bison, which I forgot to taste. He didn't think it tasted that different from regular beef, so that's something to consider. Bison is a bit pricier. 

Fries... we were told to get the fry-fecta and I'm glad we did. Regular fries were perfect, sweet potatoes fries were a dream, and the onion/zucchini medley was just amazing. My boyfriend wasn't into the latter but trust me, they're so good. They don't even taste like onion and zucchini, really. 

Side salad was really good as well. It's just a bunch of greens and a vinaigrette but I really enjoyed having a little something fresh on the side to tone down the burger and fries. Not to mention the greens tasted like they'd just pulled them out of the ground. 

I also tried one of their sodas. Which they make themselves or something. I would skip the lemonade one. It's not lemonade, but it's some kind of lemon flavor. Which you can barely taste. I suppose if you'd like a fizzy drink with a hint of lemon, that would be something for you to try, but I felt like it was a bit of a waste. 

Lastly, their shakes. I got the chocolate shake with the marshmallow and damn. That shake was delicious. And I'm not a shake person. The marshmallow is way overpriced but you need to try it. It's a sweet treat. 

Service was pretty good. Price is the only issue... Two burgers, fry-fecta, side salad, soda, and a shake = ~$50. I mean, we did get a bunch of items because we wanted to try the place out, but it's not exactly cheap. I would definitely say it's worth it though. 

Overall, loved the food here. Will definitely stop by again.
author: Sydney E.
