description: Got a double today with swiss and it was off the hook good and so are the fries and racer 5 to wash it down.
author: Chris D.

description:
As a recovering vegan I make it my business to find the best burgers in the city & at long last, my long hours of research have paid off! Roam is the best :) 
I had the Tejano burger (beef - no bun) and it was delicious. It was cooked to perfection and had the perfect amount of pepperjack cheese (nice and thinly sliced) melted over it, as well as avocado and these little crunchy corn tortilla strips. It also had a jalapeno relish (which had a nice kick). Absolutely delicious!!  
However, I ordered a side of Russet Fries and was disappointed - they were too salty and I could only eat a few.  The kombucha is good, too :) 
Roam is the only place where i get my iron fix these days !!
author: Owl B.

description:
I've been here twice and have enjoyed it each time.  

The fry frecta is something people need to start doing more and it's great to see these guys do it.  It is even better when the fried items actually taste great.

Burgers are not huge, but just the right size.  No - you can't get bacon on your burger from what I remember.  However, all the other toppings are actually pretty great.   Prices are low for the neighborhood as they hit a certain range that is minimally filled.  Where else can you go and get a burger for under $6 with tax?
author: Simon Y.

description:
Finally reviewing all my usual spots. Staff and I grabbed late lunch here today. I usually don't eat burgers, but today was a must!  I usually sit outside on the patio but today was a to-go order.

A few favs:
Chalet (minus the bun please)
Sunnyside( same as above)
-truffle fries
-swt potato fries
 I still need to try the mexican shake! maybe not this season...lol

**Love catching up with my friends here. Afternoon or Night
author: Lola D.

description:
Adding my vote on the Roam vs. Umami debate: Choose Roam!

I like both but I thought Roam's custom burgers had more mouthwatering descriptions.  Also, somehow they keep their patties just as juicy without leaving the bottom bun completely soggy and dissolved, as my Umami burgers tend to do.
author: S L.

description:
The competition is on for Best Burger in the Marina and Roam is bringing their A-game. 

Truffel Fries = Food Crack
author: Lindsay G.

description: Wow, these are the BEST burgers! They have 100% grass fed and free range turkey, which is great for both my husband and myself since I don't eat red meat but he does. The 3 combo fry plate - sweet potato, onion cucumber and the regular are all yummy too. 5 stars all around.
author: Amy V.

description: The food here is great! Sometimes it's a bit crowded, sometimes it's noisy and it ain't cheap, but, it's worth it!   Why? Because of the juicy, tender and high quality meat :)
author: Lauren B.

description: Just go. It doesn't matter if you like a basic burger, a bison burger with a fried egg on top, or a veggie burger with avocado, ranch, tortilla strips and cheese, Roam shells out some of the best burgers around.
author: Mark A.

description:
Forever on the search for the city's best burger, this was next on our list. We went on a sunday afternoon, there wasn't much of a line and we even scored a table facing the TV, they only have one, but still it worked out well since the football game was on.

I ordered the heritage, minus the mayo and instead with dijon. It was great, the onions, thick bacon, cheese, all tasted good. The roll was pretty good, definitely softened up with the juicy burger, but still held it's shape. My husband got a regular cheeseburger. We both enjoyed them well enough, but don't think they'd take the slot of the city's best burger. We got a side of fries and liked the parsley on them, but they weren't that great. I'd prefer slightly thinner, but overall, I think it was that they weren't quite cooked enough, or they had been sitting long enough that they were still warm, but not piping hot and crispy. I did get a chocolate shake which was very good.

Overall, a solid burger spot, but not our favorite.
author: Lauren M.

description: Starting to get really sick of the spotty service when ordering online. About 50/50 chance they'll mess up an order (at least for me) when ordering online. Just picked up my burger and didn't check until I got home and realized they left off the toppings I asked for. Get it together Roam!
author: Joe D.

description: We can always count on Roam to make a tasty burger. The price is right and I think it's a lot better then the more expensive option down the street. One less star because sometimes service is done without a smile and can seem less then friendly.
author: Kari D.

description: Favorite burger in SF. And that's saying a lot. Picture perfect. Consistent. Beautiful interior. A Burger Institute. Bravo.
author: Nelson C.

description: This place didn't really impress me. I have been on a burger mission in San Francisco trying all of he places recommended and I left Roam feeling... underwhelmed. The food was good, don't get me wrong. Its worth checking out, but I probably wouldn't go back.
author: Shanna T.

description:
After writing a review for Umami Burger, I felt the need to write about their nearby competition.

You walk in, you order, and then you grab a seat.  Sometimes finding seating can be a little hairy, but burger joints generally allow for fast turnover.  Their selection of meats is great, from "regular" grass-fed beef to turkey to veggie, but they also feature bison and elk.  Then you get to choose from a plethora of toppings, including fried egg!  I had the truffle burger the first time, which unfortunately is so inundated with truffle oil that I could've been eating cardboard and it would've still been delicious.  The second time I came, I had the classic bison burger, which is now among my favorite burgers of all time, juicy and great meaty flavor without as much fat.  Be warned, these burgers tend to fall apart on you, as the sesame seed bun cannot contain the combo of juicy meat and sometimes slightly damp produce toppings.  The sweet potato fries offer a mixture of crisped outside and soft sweet inside to just crispy bits, kind of like what happens when you get to the bottom of a carton of McDonald's fries (I find this to be a good thing).  The truffle parmesan over their regular fries is a great combo, not overwhelming like the burger.  The zucchini onion haystack really needs to be eaten with a fork and is the least memorable of the 3.  The artisan sodas are also delicious, and I look forward to trying the elk and milkshakes next time.
author: Gene C.

description: The sunnyside burger is the best burger in SF. Order with a beer and sweet potato fries.  It can get crowded on weekend nights. Tables outside are perfect for rare warm nights.
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
My friend Paul told me to come to Roam because of the great quality but it has recently been lacking in customer service. I repeatedly told them what I want knowing the menu well by now and they still did not make it correctly. Upon asking if everything was correct at check out, the person helping me said they think so and if it wasn't that I could walk back in to get it fixed. I don't have time to walk all the way back if it is not correct.

Returned back to find there was no sauce that comes standard with the burger I ordered and no condiment making it an extremely dry burger. Roam usually gets it right but has been truly lacking on attention to detail lately
author: Adam Z.

description: HOLY MOLY! One of the best burgers I've had. Maybe it's because I've been craving a burger for the past 23 years, but the bleu cheese burger hit the spot. I think it's still hitting the spot a week later. The fries trio didn't do me any favors, but it's OK, because if you give me sweet potato fries, you already get brownie points. Loved it, would definitely revisit in a few weeks when the craving hits again! YUM!
author: Camille T.

description: I discovered Roam last week after being in the city for 3 years and it is absolutely my new favorite spot. I went twice in one week that's how much i loved it. I got the Turkey burger Heritage style and of course couldn't pass up the fry-fecta. All of it was so delicious and i am absolutely not a burger person. I highly recommend this spot and the wine on tap is probably one of the most genius ideas i've ever encountered. Amazing!
author: Carly G.

description:
Best burgers in the Bay Area - hands down.
I can't leave the city without making a stop at this burger heaven.
In fact, it's completely worth a trip to the city just to come here.
author: Angela P.

description: Place is overrated. Burgers are expensive and they always seem to squeeze a couple expensive beers out of their customers as they wait for their burgers. Not a cheap grab and go spot. Umami crushes this place for what is a similar price point. In n Out serves a better burger as well despite all the toppings Roam provides
author: Dave C.

description:
Just back from Roam for the third time...AND SO NOT A CHARM!

Let's start with the COMPLETELY WASTED GUY that was allowed to sleep/pass out at the table outside RIGHT NEXT TO THE ENTRYWAY.  Many of us in the restaurant were concerned and the woman next to me told an employee....nothing was done- and GUESS WHAT?  HE PROCEEDED TO VOMIT ALL OVER HIMSELF AND THE ENTRYWAY.

Before he vomited, in my haste to finish my dinner before he did, I encountered a HAIR in my Classic Burger....absolutely a most disgusting experience from beginning to end.

Roam, you need to step it up:  
1. Don't allow folks who are clearly SO OUT OF IT to take up valuable space in your much coveted restaurant.  There is no room for the rest of us, let alone some drunk idiot.
2. Quality control, folks....just saying-in a town that knows how to do food right, you need to pick UP your game!
author: Kathryn J.

description:
The Good:
Sweet Potato Fries and the shakes

The Average:
Burgers

We had the Tejano and the BBQ.  Both are filled with a lot of different flavors but the sauces on both overwhelm the whole burger.  

The carmelized onions on the BBQ dominate the taste of the BBQ burger.

There is so much sauce that you end up not tasting the meat very much and this should be a burger more than anything else.  Can't lose sight in that.  

The thoughts and inspiration are there but it fails in the execution.  I feel if they just toned it down just a bit, it would be an excellent burger.
author: Mark K.

description: The salted caramel shake with a bruleed marshmallow was one of the most amazing things I've ever had. It was seriously delicious. The burgers were good, especially the Heritage burger. They were made even better by having delicious truffle Parmesan fries beside them. The ambiance was cool and the employees were friendly which helped since there was a wait. Overall it was a fun, casual place to pick up a good burger.
author: Kari G.

description: This location has it down right. Service is efficient and the food is consistently good. House made, substainable, grass-fed, free-range, organic, "mindful" ingredients. You get what you pay for/ Favorites are the vegetarian/vegan burger (probably the best in town), turkey burger, sweet potato fries. Seating is a challenge and you feel like people are hovering over your table so it's a bit of a quick meal.  Hope they open a location in the Richmond or Sunset district!
author: M.D. L.

description: LOVE this place. I literally crave the Pacific Blue burger. Also amazing are the Tejano and Sunny Side. Who thought of an egg on a burger..? All the fries are perfectly crispy, although I'm biased toward sweet potato fries in particular. Beef burgers are cooked medium/well with some red still showing to make it perfectly juicy. Tried the side salad last time and it was just the right amount of dressing, although lacked the cheese & avocado I saw on the regular sized salad. Awesome beers on draft, milkshakes look amazing although I haven't tried one yet. And they have blood orange soda as a special. All in all creative fresh ingredients, basically no wait, serve yourself water & condiments. It can't get any better as a first stop before going out on Union.
author: Natalie H.

description:
Great place for burgers.  If you are a true burger lover, you must make a stop to Roam Artisan Burgers.

Great food, good prices, friendly staff.  The only downside is the difficulty in finding parking, but then again that is the case in all of Marina/Cow Hollow.
author: Darrell K.

description: One of my favorite burger places in SF.  Big fan of the heritage burger.  High quality ingredients, cooked well, and great price.  The onion rings kind of taste just like batter, so I'd stick to the regular/sweet potato fries.
author: Jerry W.

description: The sweet potato fries are the BOMB! Oh, so are the burgers
author: Rosalba V.

description:
If I'm going to have a burger, it sort of has to be a great burger.  It's a special occasion and one that I approach with reverence as well as ritual.  Last night was one of those nights.  
Hats off to Roam for seemingly applying the same principles toward making a burger as I do toward eating one.  I wasn't sure exactly how/where to start and the menu doesn't clearly specify how things work but I got an orientation from one of the friendly busers (is that a word?) and he was most helpful, as was the guy who had just enjoyed the Bison Tejano and couldn't recommend it more highly.  The buser agreed it would be a good choice so I dove in on faith and was not disappointed.  
Here are what I consider the highlights to this experience: 

1.  The burger was a civilized size.  I was a little worried that I'd get some gigantic thing I couldn't wrap my mouth around but no ... it was a perfect size making it easy to  get a proper bite which includes the perfect blend of bun (both the bottom and top) meat and delicious avocado, pepper jack, ranch love.  Oh my.  The flavors melded and came on slowly in my mouth, multiplying little by little until BAM!  I had to  pause for a moment and experience the sensation that took over my entire body.  
Ooh, there's a kick front he jalapeño jack! Mmm creamy love from the avocado.  Yes, yes yes juicy goodness of the ranch mixed in with Bison.  Whoa.  Very nice.  
2.  Bison is delicious.  I was afraid it would be gamey - I can't do venison at all.  Bison is nothing like venison.  Hurrah.  And I understand it has less fat so that's a bonus. 
3.  I ordered the regular fries to go with my burger.  They were okay, but clearly overshadowed by the burger.  Again, portion size was proper.  If I am served a bucket load, I eat a bucket load, regardless of quality so I appreciate a little portion control on their part since I can't manage that on my own.  
4.  I knew my burger dinner at Roam was destined when I scored a spot right out front.  I felt very Doris Day.  This has nothing to do with Roam per se, but still a highlight.  
5.  Decent prices for excellent quality.  My go to spots for burgers:  Nopa, Absinthe Chez Maman & Marlowe.  All more expensive.  

Lowlights
1.  The cashier was not as enthusiastic or friendly as the buser.  When my friend arrived and ordered his burger, the cashier could have easily up-sold him on fries but neglected to point out that the french burger only has a few fries between the bun, not an actual side of fries.  Customer service is super important in a town with so many wonderful options.  
2.  Not a strike against Roam but I didn't get a beer or milkshake to complete the trinity of decadence but I'm sure either selection would have been great.
author: Wanda P.

description: Good hamburger and fries and Pabst blue ribbon to boot
author: Kevin C.

description:
This place really isn't that spectacular.  

The burger was good, but not the best.  The first letdown was the way you ordered.  I am not a fan at all of anyplace that  makes you pay first; especially a place that sells alcohol.  There is nothing more annoying than a mobbed place where you have to wait in line every time you want another beer, or another bottle of wine.  Here, you can't even get a bottle of wine, and the 'carafe' of wine they sell you for more $$ than two glasses of wine gives you less wine than ordering two glasses of wine.

I ordered the Heritage, minus the caramelized onions and with a Bison patty.  My wife ordered the Chalet with a Turkey patty.  We both split the Fry-Fecta, which is a combination of Russet Fries, Sweet Potato Fries, and a Zucchini Onion Haystack.  

When ordering, I asked for the Bison burger to be medium rare, to which I was told matter-of-factly, all burgers with the exception of Turkey are cooked medium rare.  Apparently, the cooks do not know this; mine didn't even have a hint of pink.  Even though it wasn't done to my liking, it was still juicy, and it still tasted good.

My wife said the Turkey burger was nice and juicy and the flavors worked well, but was still average.

The Fry-Fecta was possibly the star of the meal.  Neither the Russet nor the Sweet Potato fries had much seasoning on them, but were twice fried, which was a plus.  I imagine the lack of seasoning is intentional, so you pay $7 for one of their special seasonings.  The Zucchini Onion Haystack was awesome; though it would be better with a thicker shoe-string cut.

You know when you go someplace starving and you swear you just had one of the best things you ever ate.  Unfortunately, that didn't happen here.  

We came, we ate, we left, and we'll probably forget we ever tried the place.

2 Burgers, 1 Fry-Fecta, 1 Carafe of Wine = $53.00
author: Shane C.

description: We had dinner here after 8pm on a Monday and it was still busy. We had a "sunny side" burger and a "heritage" burger, both of which were delicious. The heritage's bun was a little soggy, but not overwhelmed with grease. The 9.25 price per burger is right on. My husband had the blood orange soda-- yummy! And we split the zucchini onion haystack, which was okay but I wouldn't order again. Service was friendly and prompt.
author: Aaron L.

description: ROAM was a chance I was willing to take. When we entered, my heart melted at the sight of the meat options. ROAM you had me at Grass fed Beef and Elk. I ordered a Heritage Bison Burger and was super happy with it. It wasn't the "best" burger ever, but still a pleasure to try. I still want to try that Elk Burger though. this place isn't cheap, but what is these days? If your a burger person and want meat options ROAM is the place.
author: Kimbo H.

description: Yummmm. Fry fecta hit the spot and the burger was also tasty. Will be turning to try another burger combo and beer.
author: Katie P.

description: Great burger, cool twists on seasoning for fries, loved the chipotle maple seasoning! only complaint is that seating is a bit hectic given how popular the place is, but it was much better than the alternative of waiting over an hour for umami burger down the road
author: Jack W.

description: Came here after a morning of beer tasting at Anchor Steam... yes, I said morning LOL... I was craving beef and a burger sounded so good at the moment.  i had Roam bookmarked for awhile so we decided to come here for lunch.  I love the idea that you can create your own burger with whatever meat you want and toppings but I decided to go with one of the special menu burgers, "French and Fries."   It has Parmesan truffle fries in it and that caught my eye because I like to stick fries in my burgers (and chips in my sandwiches).  It was really tasty and cooked perfectly but the dijon mustard that they put it in it was really overpowering that it cleared my sinuses and that's all I could taste.  It was more like wasabi to me than dijon mustard.  We also got the fryfecta, which was a great size for three of us.  All three type of fries were good, the regular, sweet potato and the zucchini and onions.  Delish!  i also had a salted caramel milkshake that was amazing!  It was very flavorful and delicious!  The girl who took our order was very friendly and helpful when i had to ask questions.  She was patient when waiting for us to decide.  The place is clean and the tables are turned over pretty fast.  There is also a couple tables for outdoor seating.  People were actually even eating outside while it rained!
author: Kymberli C.

description: The bison and elk burger are the way to go.  While it isn't cheap at least you're not paying $13+ for a "gourmet burger" at a restaurant that needs to charge more to make up for the exorbitant rentals in SF.  I haven't tried their Fillmore location but this place has it done right.  I've been here many times so if a foodie like me that puts a big emphasis on price and taste can give this place 5 stars you know you got something good.
author: Danny M.

description: The burger was good, but I'm giving a not so positive review for their lack of attention to my order.  When I placed the order, I mentioned SEVERAL times that I wanted a well done burger, but got a burger pink inside. I called them and they made a well done burger for me, but I had to walk back several blocks twice while I needed my time for other things.
author: Monica R B.

description:
I went there yesterday and I'm still salivating over that cheeseburger.

We went there because people raved about the french fries. I LOVE french fries. We got the Fry-Fecta.  They were okay.

The burger. Oh my god!

I "create[d] my own" - beef burger, sesame seed bun, herb mayo, mustard, special ketchup, swiss, lettuce, avocado.  Juiciest burger I've ever had. I'm in love.

I'm excited and scared to go back because I'm not sure the next burger can live up to my first.
author: alex g.

description: I was so delighted by this place! A sanctuary for the sorry people amongst the kings and queens at every other upscale restaurant on this block. I had the classic beef burger --GREAT quality beef especially for this price --and sweet potato fries and it hit the spot. Service was good and fast.
author: Lauren C.

description: The burgers by themselves are worth eating here......the decor is great and the shakes are yummy, although my bruleed marshmallow didn't look like the one advertised. The fries are delicious although i thin the fried zucchini strings need to be thickets, either that they need more spice, salt wasn't cutting it. the staff was extremely friendly and the crowd is very union street. My only complaint, more families need to eat there.......
author: brian k.

description: The staff is very friendly and I enjoy the atmosphere. I recommend the buffalo burger. If you want to watch a sports game and Brickyard is too crowded, this is a good alternative. I prefer Roam's food anyways. Being right across the street from my apartment is a definite plus.
author: Sivanne K.

description: Great burgers. service and crowd can be a little slow though. overall good for the taste.
author: Hello G.

description: Artisan burgers? more like the sistene chapel of burgers. freakin delicious! cooked exactly to order.
author: Dana D.

description: Loved it! My husband and I went here on the Monday after the 4th of July, and it was wonderful. Its in a great location surrounded with lots of cute shops. My husband got a strawberry milkshake with a creme brulee marshmellow that was simply amazing! The burgers are delicious and we shared a portion of fries with parmesan and truffle! The best part... we got two burgers, fries, a milkshake and an artisan soda for $20!! Its a casual atmosphere which and perfect for lunch! The parking on the street is a bit pricey... $2 per hour in the paking meters so you'll need change.
author: Megan T.

description: YUM! This three letter word sums it up completely. I went in this week for lunch and ordered the French and Frie burger wrapped in lettuce (no bun). It was perfectly cooked (pink in the middle), had sauteed onions, truffle fries (OMG) and other toppings. Food was out quick. Good portions. Friendly service. Highly recommend.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Really good burgers - 4 stars!  They have specialty burgers, or pick your own and customize with good condiment options.  They have beef, bison, turkey, veggie and elk burgers. Basic Burgers are $5.99; add $2.99 to make it a double.  We ordered our beef burgers medium rare and they didn't have any problem with that - some places don't want to serve burgers that border on "rare."   We got an order of tries ($2.99) and a Zucchini and Onion Stack ($3.49).  On arrival, both seemed skimpy for the price, but it turned out to be enough to 3 of us.  They do have a kid's menu. 

The overall atmosphere of the restaurant was nice, and they have seating inside and with heaters outside. You order at the counter and then seat yourself.  THAT was the problem - it was pretty crowded so it was very difficult to get a table.  I asked at the counter if we should get a table first and then order, but the guy told us to order first because a table usually opens up by the time your food comes.  It did, but only because we had to stand around and look for a table where the dinners were almost finished and then guard it with your life!  Its a pretty small place, and the tables are close together.  When it's crowded, people are standing everywhere waiting for tables. Waiters are dodging around people to deliver drinks.  There's no order to the process of getting a table, so people who came in after you get a table first if they are closer when the table opens up.  When a table does become available, if you are lucky enough to get it, you take it whether or not it is the right size for your party.  Four of us crowded around a table for two. 

I didn't like watching people, hoping to get their table while they finished their food, and I didn't like people standing over us while we were eating.  Despite our best efforts to ignore eager dinners who were waiting for our table, it didn't make for an enjoyable dinning experience.  To make it more uncomfortable, they bring you your drinks right after you order, so you are juggling your drinks and your things while waiting for a table - our wine glasses were empty by the time we sat down.  

This type of seating experience (seems to be very common in restaurants in San Francisco as we encountered it several times during our recent visit) really brings out the worst in people - dog eat dog to get a table.  This mess seems like something that could be handled with a little effort by the staff - they could give you a number and seat you when a table became available.  We are definitely craving the burgers at Roam, but not the experience - 2 stars.
author: TL R.

description: I really like the place for it's atmosphere and flavor of the burgers. However, the Heritage beef burger was soggy the last time I went and as I recall generally is pretty messy every time I get any burger there. I have stopped ordering the Russell fries because the are just too salty and are the really thin stringy fries I just don't prefer. The sweet potato fries are okay, but I'm not a big fan of sweet fries. The plain burger needs more beef, it just doesn't make sense to have a menu that prides itself on high quality meats and then hide it in the other ingredients around it. The buns and sauce are pretty tasty and keep me coming back with the hopes the other items are resolved. That keeps me coming back and the fact that I can't find another burger alternative that caters to single people any better. I usually have the anchor steam on tap or kambucha, both are good.
author: Chris M.

description: Do you like meat? Good meat? Happy Meat? What about really, REALLY fresh lettuce and tomatoes that taste like tomatoes. Inspired drinks? Inspired fries? Don't ask, just go here.
author: Renee C.

description: Great burger, great fries, great atmosphere. I ordered the Pacific Blue with a side of Truffle Fries - both very tasty. This place is great if you want an artisan burger without the hastle of a sit down restaurant or the chaos of a classic burger joint. Slightly dimmed lighting and classy family style seating serves for a relaxing dining experience!
author: Sophie F.

description:
French and Fries burger was heavenly. I got a turkey burger, and the fries on the side.
Just a few few tasty truffle fries were all I needed to be happy without feeling greasy afterwards!
author: L B.

description: Delicious burgers - lots to choose from (beef, turkey, bison, elk, veggie) and very well prepared.  I had the Turkey Burger French and Fries (Truffle Parmesan Fries, Gruyere, Avocado, Carmelized Onions, Watercress, Dijon Mustard) on their house baked buns.  OhMyGah...so delicious!  Lots of Beers on tap, house-made sodas, amazing.  Friendly staff, very friendly neighborhood folks, very popular - crowded when we went in, but the friendly folks were willing to share their table!  Only negative: parking is pretty hard to come by, but what else is new in SF?  Check this place out - there is something for everybody!
author: Pearl S.

description:
Simple, good, burgers made with high-quality meats.   One of my new go-to places when I'm in the area.  I wish there were more places like this!  

That said, I think their salad compilation is kind of light.  If you get a burger wrapped in lettuce (bunless) it feels like your meal lacked adequate vegetables but if you get the salad topped with the mini burgers it feels like an endless pile of lettuce with not enough meat (strangely, I think a burger patty and the mini burger trio are both 6 ounces?).  A happy medium would be nice..
author: Ava C.

description: Oh man. Hardly do I ever enjoy burger joints, so me enjoying a place like this in a beautiful area of San Francisco is on point. My entire family and I went. We ordered bison burgers all around and their meat was so tender. What I enjoyed the most though had to be the zuchinni and onion haystack and the sweet potato fries - crispy and thick enough to enjoy and devour. What I absolutely loved though: everything was organic & locally grown. From the vegetables, to the buns, to the potatoes to the condiments! They only used whole foods salt & pepper. We also ordered the Red Raspberry Sofa which was in season & Meyer lemon which were pretty tart but enjoyable. The amazingness of the place supports local farms & makes everything (the pickles are made in house and were delicious) & it's totally healthy. No corn syrup, no hormones. It was a beautiful experience. AND! The atmosphere was so cozy and delightful. It was hardy and clean at the same time. I'm definitely going back & recommend it to everyone! From adults to kids, it's a great time for friends & family.
author: Kai S.

description: I've been to Roam twice now but have only had the coffee and vanilla milkshakes and the sweet potato fries. Oh. My. God. You're missing out if you haven't tried them. I know I'm missing out on their burgers. I'll try one the next time I'm here!
author: Kate J.

description:
I was looking for a good burger in the City and I finally found one! Not only was it really tasty, but one burger filled me up (enough that I resisted getting one of their delicious looking shakes).

The place is cute and cozy, service was good, everyone in there was nice, and burgers definitely hit the spot.  My friend got the Tejama (I think that's what it was called), and I got the French and Fries one and we were both impressed.

Will definitely come back here.
author: Megha A.

description: As a vegetarian, I love this place but their ability to get orders right has nose-dived.  On my last three visits, they got my order wrong three times during each visit, including right now.  Looks like I'm not the only one - on my last visit on October 15th, three other people had their orders wrong as well - I was sitting at the bar and heard each of them explain how they didn't get what they ordered.  I will say that their veggie burger is very good.  Oh, well.  Guess it's back to Plant Organic Cafe I go....  Bonus points:  I have now learned how to make my very own Roam veggie burger - mine tastes better and, surprise, is done right the first time I make it!!
author: V B.

description: Amazing burgers! I had the french which had the amazing truffle fries with Gruyere cheese on them and on the burger. Not much needs to be said about this place except absolutely delicious. We sat outside on the patio which was nice to watch the coming and going of people on this little shopping strip.
author: Eisa m.

description: Pretty nice burgers at reasonable price. They also have online ordering, which makes it very easy to order takeouts.
author: X L.

description: New fave burger is the french and (truffle) fries burger. YUMMY!
author: Natalie S.

description: First time at the hamburger joint.  Great food.  Self seat.  Lt's of families with young kids.  Very busy but good food.  Great deal on the kid's menu.
author: John R.

description: One if the best burgers I have tried. The fries mirrored the great tasting burgers. Only reason Roam doesn't get a full 5 stars is the service was lack luster(table not bussed and they sent the wrong beer.
author: Ron J.

description: I freaking love Roam.  Its close, decently priced and has great customer service.  The burgers are pretty standard, but have a few great options in terms of Bison and turkey for the patties.  They are tasty!
author: Bryson S.

description: Plain burger was waaaaay better than just plain.  This place has a nice variety of burgers, high quality ingredients and reasonable prices.  Good fries too.  I had no idea this place was here but it is nice to find something quick, reasonably priced and high quality in this neck of the nook.  The offer a range of politically correct and medically correct meat choices for those who are so inclined. For me, who cares, life is too short to eat turkey burgers.
author: Greg G.

description: delicious, tender juicy burgers  with great sauces and the best fries ever! i looved my french n fries burger- it comes with only about 4 fries in the burger so get a side order. the sweet potato fries were delish but if you can't have both i'd highly recommend getting the truffle parm fries!!
author: Layla L.

description: The burgers are great but make sure to try any of the shakes. They are unbelievable.
author: Alireza R.

description: Had the tejano style on beef.  Real good.  Enough selection for return visits and variety.  10 dollar burgers.  Its the burger place around town, everybody would send you there if you start asking around.
author: Kyle L.

description: Roam Artisan Burgers definitely live up to the Yelp hype. Quality fresh ingredients thoughtfully prepared. Helpful staff. I wish San Jose were closer to SF to have this much more often!
author: Shelly G.

description: Crowded = annoying but also a good sign that the food must be good right?? We pass by this place a lot on Union St. and decided to stop in today. It was well worth the wait. absolutely delicious burger (I had the Pacific Blue) with blue cheese (just enough not to overwhelm), caramelized onions and some greens. The bun is not too thick, toasted well on the underside, and the patty is juicy. I did the beef patty but I can't wait to go back and try the bison or elk. And as a certified french fry lover, I couldn't pick one so we went with the fry-fecta (sweet potatoes, regular, and Zucchini/Onion strings) which were yummy!!!!
author: Janelle C.

description: I usually go for the salad with the skewers of meat.  Good paleo eating!  They vary the salad ingredients based on what is in season so it always tastes fresh.  Burgers are great too and the bread doesn't taste gratuitously sweet like at Umami burger.
author: Neo M.

description: Solid burgers, yummy fries (the fry-fecta is a good way to try em all) and blood orange (seasonal) soda ~  BBQ burger was too sweet for my taste, but the classic is amazing and the tejano is so legit. I pretty much hate pickles, but I realllllly enjoyed Roam's housemade pickles- weird.
author: Kiran M.

description: Very Skillful made burger with all the bells and whistles it was worth the Drive to the city and seeing parts of the city i have not been too. anyway i would be back again it was a pricey burger but for the burger lovers its worth it.
author: kim c.

description: Deeeeeelicious burgers!  They have a great selection of burgers with different toppings.  Sign of a good burger:  does not need any ketchup.  I am a ketchup lover, so for me to say that means a lot.  I got the classic burger, which was topped with their yummy homemade pickles, tomatoes, lettuce, onion, and special sauce (some sort of mayo based thing that wasn't heavy).  My boyfriend gobbled down his BBQ burger.  Their sweet potato fries taste fresh and nongreasy.  Big thumbs up for the blood orange soda.  And I could not resist getting a chocolate milkshake to go for dessert later (the bf got mint chip which was also good).  Prices are actually very reasonable, cheaper than other places in the area that are not nearly as good.  I'm sure we'll be back again for tasty burgers!
author: Danielle B.

description: There burgers are on point. I created my own burger and enjoyed it immensely though it was huge. My boyfriend got the bison with the egg and chili sauce and he thought it was different yet flavorful. He enjoyed this burger also, but our favorite #1 burger still resides in Vegas-- the Kobe beef burger. Additionally, we got the Fryfecta consisting of regular fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini-onion strings. It was just alright. It was $5 which isn't bad considering the portion size, but definitely had better. There blood orange soda was also good, but could have been sweeter.
author: Kelly T.

description: Who knew there could be so many burger places in the City and you could find one that really stood out. Located in busy Union Street it can be a bit difficult to find parking, but once you're there it's definitely worth while. The menu serves up burgers in many many ways making one of the best rare burgers I've had. The buns are great and there's too many toppings to count. The fries are a must. And if you want there's grilled veges to which I'll Rey next time I'm back. Wash it all down with a good beer or a nice hand crafted soda. Roam definitely makes you want to roam the area for parking to eat a delicious burger.
author: Rebecca D.

description: I definitely liked roam and thought the food was solid, but I just wasn't completely wowed.  we shared the sunny side and the french and fries (one was turkey and one was beef) and we also shared the fryfecta. The burgers were good and a good value and the fries were delicious. I would definitely come back if I wanted a good burger.
author: Lisa C.

description: Amazing burgers.  Great choice of organic meats - Bison, Elk, Beef and Turkey.
author: Andrew B.

description: When coming to picking a good hamburguer, my stomach, not  my paladar can speak more, I could get a good sleep even after having this for dinner not repeting/burping (sorry if that disgusts you) every time , the Taste was really really good, love the french and fries version of it.  Bad part, beer is expensive at  $6
author: Rafael G.

description: So there are a lot of burger joints in San Francisco.  Most have seemed to have sprouted in the last few months.  So I try them them out and try objectively find the best one in my opinion.  And although there are some really great ones I have landed on Roam as my favorite.  their burger choices are great and you can't go wrong with any of them.  Though I recommend the BBQ!!  Check them out and enjoy!!
author: Nigel G.

description:
No thanks.  I'm sure you are paying a premium because it's on Union Street and more or less in the Marina District.  

$5.99 for a classic which is no better, no worse than a burger at Five Guys or In-N-Out.  Beyond the house sauce which is their version of thousand island or the standard condiments, any "special" sauces is a $.50 upcharge!  If you want to upgrade to Elk or Buffalo meat, it's $2.00+ more to your burger.  The burger is small.  Not sure what makes it artisan if it's the bread or the meat.  

The fries are unique.  You can order it tossed with garlic parmesean or a maple chipotle glaze.  For what you are paying for, I would expect a basket of fries but it was more like a cup and a half of fries.  

I tried the salted caramel shake.  The flavors was very very very subtle.  I was expected an explosion of caramel flavor like at Bi-Rite or Smitten.  But it tasted more like a vanilla shake with an essence of caramel.  

I'd rather have a burger at Barney's, Burger Bistro, Burgermeister or The Counter.  Sure the price is $1-$2 more, it's also 20-30% bigger.  

Don't fall for the hype.  It's uppity and snobby burgers.  This place is not worth the money you are paying.
author: David C.

description: Roam is a very good burger spot and here the burger it is all about the toppings.  The buns are toasted to a perfect buttery crisp and everything goes together so well.  I recommend the Heritage or the French and Fries.  The bacon on the heritage tastes like it is on steroids, soooo good.  My only complaint is I wish their sides were a little better but it doesn't bother me b/c it is all about the burgers.
author: Andrew J.

description: Delicious! We ate here 3 days in a row whilst visiting San Fran and loved every meal. The best vege burger I've ever had! Be sure to try the home made sodas...
author: Nicole D.

description: I am a vegetarian (I know, ugh.) But I did eat here w/my meat eating fiance and let me tell you...this place is the bomb!!! We normally don't venture out into this neighborhood, but it was recommended to us (we are burger lovers) and I must say, this was THE BEST homemade veggie burger I've ever had! The meaty burger my fiance ate was also divine (according to him), along w/the fries and milkshake we ordered. We are trying to make time to stop by again. Loved it!!!
author: Ms. B.

description: Delicious burgers and herb fries. Really can't go wrong here with so many different combos, fixings and fresh/local food!
author: Katherine L.

description: LOVE their burger with a fried egg and the trifecto - regular fries, sweet potato fries, and onion strings. Perfect place for a quick bite with friends, especially after having drinks on Union.
author: Jenna Q.

description:
I am re-writing my review because Yelp! removed the old one at the request of complainers. I will be more succinct this time.
1. atmosphere: people just out of work who wear business casual. When they say casual, they mean business casual. The people coming out of the kitchen were wearing jeans - more casual than the patrons.
2. the long table in the middle (at least when I was there) is a bit annoying and in the way, unless you bring 30 of your friends to sit with you.
3. burger - good. Artisan... hmm... when I was there, they didn't give a choice between rare, medium, well, you had to state "pink or not pink." Well, regardless of where you are, most of the time the cook gets it wrong anyway, so there. Be aware, what I ordered as "pink" was not rare; not dripping blood, but it was brown on the outside and a cooked pink inside.
4. Staff - the guy who came out of the kitchen to deliver my burger was friendly. The rest of the staff seemed like they'd just as soon be somewhere else - but I suppose maybe that's the case with anyone selling burgers for a living - even if they're grass fed and called artisan. p.s. for those who complained and got my prior review removed - I feel the people who frequent a restaurant contribute to its atmosphere and make others feel either comfortable or uncomfortable - that's part of the dining experience and choice of where to dine. Therefore, it's appropriate to comment on the nature of the crowd.
author: James L.

description: I LOVED the Zucchini Onion Haystack and Salted Caramel Shake with Bruléed Marshmallow!  Try them both along with a burger of your choice, and you'll be one happy fatty.
author: K V.

description:
They make a great burger.  The menu offers novel selection, but not so much as to overwhelm.  The prices were damn decent and, by the end of the meal, I was ready to go for seconds. 

They even took the time to slice itty, bitty, tomatoes on their simple and delicious side salad.  Its attention to details like that that really grabbed my attention.
author: Modern S.

description:
Beef, Turkey, Veggie, Bison, Elk....wait, what? ELK?

OK...sorry I was a little shocked about the Elk. Anyway getting back to the review. After being rejected from Umami Burger at 8:30pm (Yes, 8:30pm, Yea, I know right?), we found our way to Roam Artisan Burgers. Still hungry for burgers, I scanned my brain and remembered that Roam recently opened a few blocks down. The place reminded me of a western version of Super Duper.  Same set up --- order at the register and take a seat.  Maybe a cowboy would walk by soon. *crosses fingers* I was a bit over-whelmed by all variety of meats and sauces, so I decided to play it safe and ordered THE CLASSIC w/ Beef, Cheddar and a Fried Egg. It was a decent burger -- juicy, but too much pepper for me. I was a fan of the butter lettuce and the fresh tomatoes, but I'd skip on the chopped onions though. Not amaze-balls. Just an OK burger for my tastes. However, I was a bit jealous of my friend as she was chopping down the French and Fries burger. She was loving that burger down, son! If I ever do come back, I'd probably grab that one. I had a bite of both the Bison and Elk. Too Dry for a burger. Would advise against those patties. 

Final Burger Verdict: Only when I'm in the neighborhood and Umami turns me away.

Reccommendations: 
French and Fries Burger. That is all.
author: Lisa T.

description: Best turkey burger I've had in years!
author: Christine G.

description: Good burgers and good prices. The hired help could use a little work though. The two women working were great, but when the one on register asked a third women to cover for her while she used the restroom, the third women gave the worst stink eye I've ever seen. Apparently she couldn't be bothered to cover for a co-worker, but then managed to find the time to flirt with some random dude at the bar. Pretty pathetic.
author: Alfredo A.

description: Finally had a chance to try Roam (and was more eager to do so after it made a recent top 10 in the country list) and decided to go with the French and Fries burger. There were actual truffle fries in the burger...amazing! It was a little on the salty side but other than that amazing. My only other gripe is that they didn't ask us how we wanted the burger cooked (and we were to focused on quickly getting food during halftime to ask). Burgers come with pink and the other option is "no pink". No standard medium, medium well, well. Can't wait to go back and try another burger and the sweet potato fries... heard they're amazing!
author: Gina C.

description: Came here after a nice Pilates workout looking for a light meal that wouldn't negate my whole workout...yet I go to a burger place...but this isn't a regular run of the mill joint like Johnny Rockets, it's a great little gourmet burger place with a little twist of Marina's healthy lifestyle. I ordered the farmer's salad with the trio of turkey patties (I really need protein or else I'll be hungry in an hour). The dressing was perfectly seasoned yet light and the turkey patties were juicy and not dry like turkey usually is. My friends who got the turkey burgers said it was the best they've ever had. To top it off, they had pomegranate flavored Kombucha! Now I'm pretty picky with my Kombucha, it can't be overwhelmingly "Kombucha-y" (not too acidic or yeasty tasting) it's an antioxidant among other health benefits and best of all it's aids in digestion! I would definitely come here again.
author: Kristina L.

description: GRASS FED beef made my gf's taste buds go insane!  Talk about a mood changer, this place makes me feel like I'm eating a heavenly burger.  The fry fecta is also a must eat here as its definitely different from any other burger place I've been to.
author: Joseph C.

description: This burger joint is really the best in San Francisco .....okay the best I've eaten at.  My son turned us on to this restaurant and we love returning there!  The sweet potato fries are a must and a burger!
author: Debbie H.

description:
so i gave ROAM another chance, but even with beef patty cooked to the way i wanted, i am still going with my first impression. my tongue remains unfazed. yes, they're good burgers, but if i'm craving a delicious burger, ROAM just wouldn't be one of the first places i think of... not even top 5. 

however, the parm truffle fries continue to enchant and bedazzle my tongue. but since this IS a burger joint, i can only give 3-stars. 

1 burger + 1 parm truffle fries + soda + beer = $25ish
author: Erin M.

description: My daughter and I ordered the French and fries burger.  The burgers were very juicy which is great if the bun doesn't get soggy.   Oops too late both of our burger bottom buns were very soggy.  If they can get a thicker maybe toasted bun the  burger would world class. The avocado slices were too thick.  As you took a bite the 1/4" thick sliced avocado squirted out more than once.  The fries trio was awesome. The overall 3 star rating is because the place is a very clean classy place to eat.  I will return here again.
author: Brett S.

description: turkey burger a winner there, their whole grain bun is amazing , great service, amazing décor and concept , every item on menu looked interesting .... a  five +  star place for sure.
author: NAEL K.

description: Nice joint, like the sound of the menu, but disappointing. Beef burger was tasteless, out of the milkshakes (how does this happen?), and the truffle fries were not all that for the extra cost.
author: Eric M.

description:
Could ya wipe down a table every once in a while? Geez...

Just because a table doesn't have crumbs on it doesn't mean its clean. I didn't ask for someone to clean the table because there were only crumbs on it. I know you "didn't mean anything by it" but you should've just asked.

Otherwise the food was damn good. Bacon done just right. Sweet potato fries are done just right. Burger as a whole is far superior to the usual Marina burger.

The artisan soda however, tasted more like colored mineral water.
author: Paul w.

description: Quality of the burgers are good.  I had the sunnyside but i wasnt a fan of the sauce.  Its too sweet for my fatty taste buds.  I had elk meat which was pretty gamey.  Glad I tried it. The best thing I had here was the mint chip milkshake.  The shakes here are very good.  I recommend ordering two burgers cuz they pretty small.  Fatty out.
author: Fatty A.

description: Had the grass fed beef with gruyere and french fry topping.  It worked beautifully.  Nice space, great service, excellent meat.
author: Ash A.

description: My friends and I shared a few burgers: Beef Burger Classic, Turkey Burger Sunnyside, and Veggie Burger Tejano. YUMMY! The food is so impressively tasty - flavored to perfection with all natural ingredients and at totally reasonable prices. You can tell that they really care about the food. And the staff really cares about the environment - friendly, smart, knowledgeable, smiley. And the decor is supercool - the bar is one of the coolest ones I have ever seen anywhere. The right taste, the right cost, the right people! Thank you to the Roam team for making a fantastic burger joint.
author: Eric F.

description: If youre looking for a top burger and dont mind the $10 to $15 price tag, this place does the trick. Get the bison over the beef. Its significantly tastier, and as long as you're forking out it's worth the extra $3. The sweet potato fries are an awesome salty and herby indulgence.
author: Eric N.

description: I like this place.  Great topping selection on the burgers and cool ambiance.  The workers her were really cool too.  I found the burger a little small though, but I would definitely come back here the next time I'm in SF.  I still prefer Umami burger, but   Roam is definitely better than LA's Counter, but not as good as Father's Office. I like their fries too, but the onion strings are kind of difficult to eat and I prefer more onions and less batter.
author: jamie N.

description:
if i lived in cow hollow i would give this place 5 stars b/c i wouldn't have to trek outside the hood for a good burger and shake. but i live in pac heights and have a car so i can drive to any part of the city at any hour for a great burger. which is why i'm giving Roam Artisan only 3 stars. with so many other places in the city to get a great tasting burger its unlikely i'll come back here.

i had their classic. it was good. nothing extraordinary about it. they have other varieties, and you can get creative and build your own burger.

my bf and i didn't order the bison patty. seems that's what really sets this burger place apart from others. that, and it's artisan style milkshakes. on that front, both of us were REALLY disappointed. what's the deal with a) serving them in a plastic cup like you're getting an iced coffee at Starbucks. i'm used to milkshakes being served in a glass and the extra being in a silver/metal cup w/ a spoon. b) the plastic cup is so small, you wonder why you're paying $5.25 for such a small portion. 

i had the chocolate and he had the strawberry. both were good milkshakes. again, nothing extraordinary. maybe we have to try the salted caramel or other specialty milkshake. i can't help but feel this place is overhyped. i'm all about spending $$ for quality food. but unfortunately this spot doesn't qualify.
author: Maria A.

description: I love this place! Great SF vibe. Everyone in our group ate every last bite. ROAM even had a delicious salad and vegetable side dish AND gluten-free buns.
author: Gabrielle O.

description: I got the french and fries burger, and it was pretty good! The atmosphere was lively and the physical set up was communal. The burger was juicy and not overdone. I didn't give it 4 or 5 stars because the burger was not anything spectacular compared to other specialty burger places I have been. It was just a solid, good burger. No complaints.
author: christine h.

description: My favorite veggie burger in town!  They make them with quinoa!  Love the farmers market salad.  Kombucha on tap is pretty amazing
author: Anna V.

description:
I've never had a hamburger this dry. Maybe I didn't read the fine print -- it said "grass fed beef," but maybe they meant lawn clippings or something.

The patties were shaped and tasted like the flat, pre-molded, pre-packaged burgers that you get at a company picnic. Regular fries and sweet potato fries were decent.

Burgermeister has Niman Ranch burgers that are far superior, for less $.
author: Norm M.

description:
Service was severely lacking!!!! Very, very disappointing.

My husband was experiencing a craving for a burger and this place had pretty good reviews. I've been here before but this time we decided to sit down and eat at the restaurant. For those who haven't been, this is not the most inexpensive place for a burger, but we get that it's quality so we are ok with this. The burgers were pretty good, I must say. However, the service was just bad...and strange. When we ordered, the lady was pleasant enough. She seemed a bit bothered we didn't know what we wanted within a minute of walking in but got over it quickly enough. So after we were done, we decided to split a shake. My guy went to the restroom, but left his jacket and a bag at the table, as I left my over half-full beer- clear signs we weren't finished with our meal, or so we thought. 

While I ordered the shake the bus boy came over to our table and stacked up the glasses...I very politely told him I wasn't done with my beer and he said "You're kidding right?!" I told him I indeed was not kidding, and then he tried to unstack the four glasses to give me my beer back. Then he realized that maybe was not the best idea and asked what type of beer I had. I told him I was sorry because I wasn't sure, and pointed to the lady who took our order and told him that I asked her for the lightest beer they had on tap. He then said "So you don't even know what beer you were drinking???" I again told him no, not thinking it was really a big deal...to which he said "Lady, you should know what kind of beer you're drinking."

I don't know about any of you but there are several times I'll go into a bar and just ask for the hefeweizen on tap or whatever. I'm not saying I shouldn't know, however I really was disappointed that for the price point the service and attitude was so negative. To make matters worse he sent someone else over who asked what beer I was drinking, I again said I didn't know, the lightest beer on tap and that the lady WHO WAS STILL AT THE COUNTER could tell them. He then proceeded to bring me a beer in a glass that was about half full. 

So. Long story short- burger is good, but don't expect the service to be on par with the price by any means. There are several restaurants in this city, many of which have burgers. While it was a good burger, I feel that for the $50 bucks we spent we can take our hard-earned cash to a place that actually cares about customers coming back.
author: Megan C.

description: I just started working around the corner from this fabulous burger joint and I'm afraid it'll be the death of me...I came because I had a "fat-girl-all-I-want-are-french-fries" kind of day and this place hit the spot! I ordered the sweet potato fries with the parmesan/ truffle topping, and they melted in my mouth! I cant wait to come back and try one the delicious looking burgers I've seen pictures of on here! Also, upon entering I was greeted by not one, not two, but three super friendly but unobtrusive staff/bartenders? 5 stars!
author: Tate P.

description:
Holy wow...One of the best veggie burgers I've ever had.  If you've ever had a Houston's burger - it's quite similar to that, but smaller and more manageable in size.  I must not lie, I went here twice within a 2-week span because I literally could not stop thinking about this delightful vegetarian option!  It's refreshing to go to a place that actually makes a veggie burger instead of slapping a Morningstar or Gardenburger on a bun.

The first time I went here, I ordered the zucchini and onion strings on the side and the second time, we got the french fries.  Overall, I preferred the zucchini and onion strings to the french fries - but hey, this is a 5-star review so the fries couldn't have been too bad ;) !

Unfortunately, this location isn't that convenient to where I live (please bring Roam to Noe!!), but I will be sure to make my way back soon!
author: Rachel G.

description: I will say the food and drinks here taste great. That being said, in all of my experiences here it has taken forever to get my food and drinks. I understand it may take a bit if it's busy but it doesn't make sense if there are only 5 other people in the restaurant. Needless to say I won't be back because Umami Burger is right down the street and it only takes a couple mins to get your food there.
author: Jordan J.

description: Pretty dang tasty, I got the blue cheese burger (my go-to). The burger was 7/10 the fries were the same. It was satisfying, but not impressive. I will however go again and get a salad, they look pretty good.
author: Drew W.

description:
As soon as it opened, I came here and have been a regular customer ever since. I've also brought many others to this place for the best hamburgers in the city. The bun is always fresh and the meats super tasty. I also get the veggie burger and it's great. 

I'm also a fan of their organic homemade sodas. There isn't anything that isn't done well here.
author: M H.

description: Great burgers and liked the root beer too. The meet tastes fresh and love all the choices on unconventional condiments, like spicy chile sauce. Will definitely be back!
author: Brian S.

description: As a burger afficionado, I can say that Roam makes a very SOLID burger.  Highly recommended.
author: Fred X.

description:
4 stars because the turkey burger never fails!!!  The veggie burger needs some work in my opinion but still tasty.  
Everything is very fresh and if you order to go they are super quick!
author: Holly S.

description:
love roam burgers. get the western burger with the grass fed beef--mmmmm, delish. the one thing to look out for here is how crowded it gets due to the smaller size of the venue. 

enjoy!
author: Jason G.

description: Line out the door at about 7:30pm on a Saturday evening in April, but it moves fast.  Great burgers, perfectly drippy.  I loved the beef Sunny Side, but all at our table looked great.  Can be a long wait for a seat but we were lucky that a kind couple offered their larger table to us and moved to the small table at the back.  San Francisco-ans are so nice!  Sweet potato fries were terrific.  Atmosphere noisy but we loved it.
author: Geralyn H.

description: Wow. Nice burger and nice meat. Nicely done--oh but of course you're in the Marina...MINUS ONE STAR!!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Came here with 3 other people on a Saturday night. Place was crowded.  The deal with this place is you order your food and then find your own seat...which can be hard when it's crowded. We got lucky and found seats right away. Burgers were delicious...but WAY overpriced IMO. I ordered the sunnyside beef burger...very tasty and juicy. We also shared the Fry-Fecta...nothing spectacular. The size of the burger is just alright...if you're a big eater...you'll probably leave hungry.

All in all, the burgers are good...but I probably wouldn't go back.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Burgers were yummy, shakes were fantastic, the vegi of the night was a butternut squash sauteed with kale and served with a pumpkin-seed pesto ... sounded risky but tasted great!  

We went earlyish on a Friday evening and it was not very full, most of the groups, like us, were there with kids.  Friendly, low-key atmosphere.  

I appreciated the serving sizes - the kids' shakes were small enough that little ones could actually finish them, the "big people" shakes and burgers were generous without being overwhelming.

Really want to go back and check out their other drinks.
author: AJ W.

description: Strauss Family Creamery Milkshakes.  Oh My God. I picked up our food, got in the car & unfortunately, started driving before I took my first sip of milkshake. I almost passed out.  It's a miracle I didn't get in an accident.    I was pounding the steering wheel --  alternating between "OH MY GOD THIS IS THE BEST MILKSHAKE EVER" and muttering "This is Bad. So Very Bad." (for my fitness plan).     If there is a heaven, my first meal will be a buffalo burger & a Chocolate Shake w/ Strauss.
author: nomi c.

description: I like this place- I've been here a handful of times and the food is solid and the price is super affordable. I always get the veggie burger (which is vegan w/o the house sauce) and either their russet or sweet potato fries (both are fabulous). The veggie burger is homemade and a healthy mix of quinoa and beets and other veggies, and is a great deal for only $5.99. My only complaint is that there have been a couple times when the veggie burger was a bit bland- maybe just needed more spices or salt in that batch. Oh and try their homemade sodas- they're fantastic and not too sweet! All in all, this place is great!
author: Karin O.

description: Roam has the world's most delicious garden burger and I'm a huge fan of their sweet potato fries. I do wish they had a wider variety of beers on tap and that seating wasn't such a nightmare. If you sit at the bar don't try to order a drink there, you have to actually go up to the register, wait in line, get a number, go back to your seat, and wait for the drink that could be given to you by the bartender that is literally poised and ready to pour drinks at a moment's notice. Kind of silly, but I'm a big enough fan of the food that these minor flaws can be overlooked. Try the BBQ veggie burger!
author: Mariah M.

description:
I am a vegetarian and never have I had the most perfect Veggie burger in my life. I usually stick to grilled cheese since the veggie patties usually are so narrrsty and dry. But Roam has shown me the light. 
I make my own Veggie burger with Herb Ranch, pepperjack cheese, jalapeno relish, tomatoes, onions, lettuce & pickles with a side of Chipotle maple sweet potato fries. 
Efff!! Writing this review is making me hungry.
author: Himani A.

description: I just had the best turkey burger here. I had it French and Fries style. I'll will definitely be back! :)
author: Sara R.

description: Forget in and out burger! Roam you are now my best friend.  I love this place.  The food is so delicious and natural.  Price is pretty fair.  The sweet potato fries are to die for.  Its sweet and not as salty.  Service is fast and friendly and the place is georgeous.  You walk in, place your order, find a seat, and enjoy your meal.  How simple is that.? I had the bison classic burger.  The house sauce jizzed all over my hands.  Which is somewhat a problem I guess.  But that doesnt bother me.   The sandwhich is too good.  According to the menu, they open till 12midnight on the weekends.  Soo... if you ever want a late night burger bite, GO TO ROAM!!!!! and dont forget to buy me one too.  Bison classic is my fave. :)
author: Mimi S.

description: Gourmet burgers built a la carte' are a dime a dozen these days, but Roam is doing some different things to stand apart. They have great meat and topping selections, socially conscious ingredients, and some tasty side dishes too. I had a bison burger with grilled onions, tomato, mixed greens, home made chili sauce, and a fried egg. The bun was a soft, chewy sesame seed bun. I had a side of sweet potato fries with truffles parmasian on it. Everything was very food, my only complaint would be that they were heavy handed on the oil  when they cooked the burger. The milk shakes looked very good...next time. The best part is all of this good food is served in a comfortable environment for a very reasonable price relative to typical Cow Hollow eateries. Great addition to Union Street.
author: Jeff C.

description: I drool everytime I walk by this place as the smell of flavorlicious grass fed beef burgers wafts through the air. French and fries is amazing, and the one with the egg is also very good. House made sodas are so good and strauss creamery milk shakes are needless to say, fabulous! One word to describe this place is AMAZING! And the burgers are soooo well priced! Only $7 a burger!
author: Kristen L.

description: Best Burger I've ever had! I tried the beef, Elk and Vegetarian... all so yummy. Not to mention the house made sodas and milkshakes..... Love Love...
author: Katelyn D.

description:
I went here with my Fab X-roomie Day and her Sis-in-law and my BF by mistake.. we just walked down Union St and saw this place and the menu looked good.. so we gave it a shot!
We were glad we took a chance and went inside.. the set up was very modern and felt like a burger joint with the hardwood tables and flooring.. the dark wood modern-ness made me feel like i was in a ranch-type setting.. silly i know.. but still cool! 
the menu looked great..i went with the Heritage Turkey burger and was glad i did... the meat tasted very fresh and the seasonsing was perfect.. all the adidtions to the burger again were great.. the only part i ddint like was my burger fell aprt half-way thru... i thikn it was too much mayo or additions and just made the burger that much more heavier, maybe the bread bun was a little too thin??... nonetheless, i ate the rest with a fork and enjoyed every bite of it... 
we all shared some fries with parmesan cheese and also shared the 3 selction of fries plate as well...loved the 3 choice fries selection !!
My adventure here with our lil group turned out great and i was glad that i went... i would DEF recommend this place to a friend or family member.. the food was good and reasonably priced and the service was great.... only smal problem is parking is such a pain in the a$$ but im pretty sure that you all know that if you go somewhere in SF... be prepared to circle the blocks a few times before you find parking... 
Thanks Roam for a great meal!
author: Spookee X.

description: Their French and Fried Burger was amazing! Cooked beautifully, medium rare. Sweet Potato Fries were yummy!
author: Summer M.

description: It's on Union Street. The Marina. I get a rash every time I'm anywhere near the Marina/Cow Hollow area. It's blandness galore and where all of the "glory days" people seem to congregate. I do venture to this area for a few things, and one of them is Roam. The Sunny Side which consists of Organic Free-Range Egg, Aged White Cheddar, Caramelized Onions, Greens, Tomato, Sweet Chili Sauce is a favorite. They also have Straus Family Cremery Shakes. So, get your favorite emblem laden collared shirt, rent a hybrid BMW, dye your hair blonde and go to Roam.
author: Mike C.

description: I like being able to get a good burger made with grass-fed beef. I'd give you five stars if you had American cheese (it's just how a good burger is served). But it was excellent. I also don't care for free for all seating. But my food was excellent, it was prompt, quality, and worth a revisit. but I am holding out for American cheese on a good burger (which is SO close).
author: Sean Q.

description: The turkey burger was really good and the atmosphere's very lively on a Friday night. Good spot!
author: Jen N.

description: Roam burgers are okay. I like the different toppings more than I like the patties. Also I don't really love how crowded this place can get.
author: Alex D.

description: Best burgers in the neighborhood.   Even the turkey burgers are great.  Service is always friendly and the food is reasonably priced.  Get a turkey burger with sweet potato fries... can't go wrong.
author: Owen S.

description: I went to Roam with my service dog and the owner made me eat outside even after I showed him my licence. I proceded to ask him if I would have to sit outside if I was blind and he said yes. The food was fresh and good but the burgers were thin and not very interesting.
author: Erica L.

description:
$8.00 FOR A BOTTLE OF BEER? Yagottabekiddinme!

First visit: Good burgers, good vibe, mostly organic/free-range, reasonable prices, definitely makes the list.

Second visit: Good burgers, not-so-good vibe, and the 12 oz. bottled beer special (no price listed) cost $8 (that's a $50 six-pack!).

How it went down (hill): Ordered burgers and fries. Scanned the menu for drink options. GF spotted a Pumpkin Ale on the Specials board. No price listed. My bad for not asking. Did not see the rather aloof counter guy enter the items individually into the computer, and did not ask for an itemized receipt. My bad, also. 

After the meal, tried to figure out how a venison burger ($6.99), veggie burger ($4.99), fries, and beer added up to $24.59. Yet another SF meal tax? Asked aloof guy if there was a mistake. "No," said he, "that beer is $8."

OK...my mistake for not finding out, but outside of NYC jazz bars, does anyone expect a bottle of beer to cost $8? How about putting a price on display? Every other item on the menu has a price.

Yup, caveat emptor and mea culpa. But I'm taking my bidness elsewhere.
author: Tom H.

description: Gave it another shot and sitting up at the bar was much better.....it was still a little tight but better than the seats we had before.  Service was much better as well and this time I tried another burger and it was delish.  This is a good addition to Union street.  I love that finally there is a place that doesn't have massive portions.
author: Kirsten M.

description: French and fries is definitely the best burger in San Francisco. Not a single doubt!
author: Jose C.

description: Rainy day.... and a nice Elk Burger with wine! Of course, you can't let the truffle fries go unnoticed. They are pretty good! Oh, and for dessert? No questions, the mint seasonal milkshake. All in all, great burger joint.
author: Michel A.

description: A great low-key place to grab a bite. Has a cozy neighborhood feel, the type of place where you run into friends you haven't seen in awhile. It was shockingly crowded on a Friday night, but not as hard to get a table as it originally seemed (apparently a lot of people get their burgers to go).
author: Priya N.

description: Medium-rare with bacon, no cheese or toppings and a side of sweet potatoe fries with a shake?  So good, and worth the gym time required to cancel it out.
author: Pootaire J.

description:
Great burger.  Grass fed beef?  Tastier than white, whole weat bun?  I'm all over it.  

I initially thought the burger may be over priced for the size, but then you bite into it and realize that you're getting really great qualtity ingredients.  A larger, comparable flavor and quality burger would set you back $15 @ Burger Bar.  Really, you're helped out by the portion control, and you can always double down on the meat.

Salads are excellent too.  Homemade italian-style sodas excellent, especially the blood orange flavor.  OH, the milk shakes!  Man, oh, man.  Strauss creamery ice cream merged with flavors like Dagoba chocolate, and/or burt caramel, and many more.

Note; turkey burger was a serious disapointment.  Go meat, or stay home.
author: Moz R.

description: My mom and I went here had were quite pleased with our meal.  I had the French & Fry burger made with parmesan truffle oil fries-very tasty.  You can choose beef, bison, turkey or vegi which I like so if you go with  a group of picky eaters everyone has an option.  The cashier was having a bad day and gave me our total before I decided on an agave nectar fizzy drink, she made up for it by suggesting the blackberry which was to die for.  LOVED it!!!
author: Tara W.

description: Burger was very juicy and well made. This is my third time at this place and they seem pretty consistent. I've tried the Tejano and Sunny Side styles so far. I like the Sunny Side better since its more flavorful. Will definitely go back for more.
author: Ariful H.

description: Perfectly good patty, moist and packed with flavor. They didn't even ask how I wanted my burger simply bringing it out medium rare. You have to tip your hat to a burger place that makes it default like that. I tried the Sunny Side burger and absolutely inhaled it, fried egg and all. The really remarkable aspect of this place is just how affordable such a quality burger is $7.99. I've easily spent twice this amount on fancy burgers that were not even half as good. Definitely worth a trip.
author: Procter F.

description: I'm writing this review for my hubby who is a burger fanatic. Here is what he says about Roam: Where do I begin...a unique one of a kind burger restaurant. All organic! Great menu with unexpected options. They have elk and buffalo burgers in addition to the juicy steak burgers. Chocolate shakes are perfect every time, with organic sodas to match. Most of all, the service and the quality are execellent all 20+ times I've eaten here. They never let me down! You will leave satisfied every time.
author: Cindy W.

description: The trifecta zucchini fries are delicious.
author: Gregory N.

description: Great artisan burgers, cool ambience, savory sides and friendly hostess/cashier...we will eat here multiple times.  JA
author: John A.

description:
great food, shitty service.  the girls at the front made us wait two whole minutes to order while they chatted about how caloric the kid-size shake was.  luckily the service only needs to be tolerated for the few minutes it takes to order.  and at the end of the day, i care more about food than service anyways. 

the ingredients are all really fresh, the house-made natural sodas are delicious, and there is a solid range of special toppings (ie truffle parmesan...yum!) for the fries and burgers.  the classic burger is a solid choice, and is probably the best deal on the menu (5.99).  as for the strauss shakes, the salted caramel and blue bottle flavors are bomb.

great place to relax and watch the game over dinner!
author: Yael D.

description: One of the best burgers on union st hands down...also had a winter lager on draft (during the winter season) and it tasted great with my meal! Could have eaten two-  but the basket of fries filled my wife and I right up!!
author: Hessam V.

description:
Moo! Props to Cow Hollow for Roam.

Bison burger (+$3, ordered not pink) was tasty and juicy but not dripping with fat the way beef would be. Made my way, with dijon mustard, tomato, watercress (+$1) and gruyere (+$1), and tasted perfect, a great combination of flavors.

Chocolate shake was sooo good and 12 oz. portion was just fine.

Prices can add up quickly here for a place where you order at the register. Burger and shake came to $17 and change with tax. But the quality is quite high and I was satisfied and didn't need to order fries.

I went during off-peak time (Sunday 3 p.m.) and didn't need to wait to give my order but still wound up sitting at the bar. Fortunately, they have a nice deep overhang on the bar, if oddly curved in a wave.

I had to ask for a napkin.

Service reasonably friendly if a bit overly casual.

I would eat here again, during off-peak hours and not too often.
author: Charles B.

description:
I am very particular about the meat that I eat and will only meat if I know that the animal's life was valued, and that it was raised and slaughtered in a humane manner.  I was ecstatic when I heard about Roam-- the first place I've seen that only serves meat that fits the above description. 

Customers walk-up to the counter to place their order- turkey burger, bison burger or regular burger- and pick their toppings/sides. Customers are then given a number and need to hunt for a table (see it and grab it seating--- I can see finding a table getting pretty difficult for large parties during meal times).  It took us about fifteen minutes to get a table for a group of five at around 7 pm.  Our food then took over 30 minutes to arrive-- it took us a while to notice that we had been skipped, and when we pointed this out to the manager- he explained that the kitchen may have misplaced our ticket.  He ended up not having us pay for our meal which I thought was a very nice gesture deserving of loyalty.

I thought that the food was worth the wait, but then again, I don't eat meat often-- I had a turkey burger on multigrain bread with tomato, lettuce, avocado and caramelized onions (approx $8) and sweet potato fries ($3).  Both were phenomenal.

This is the type of place that will tailor your order to give you exactly what you want-- I REALLY wanted honey mustard on my burger but the restaurant didn't have any so they mixed together yellow mustard and agave nectar for me-- it was delicious!!!  If you're the type of person who doesn't eat their bun, you can also order your burger in a lettuce wrap instead.

I'm definitely going back again!
author: Loving L.

description:
First off I work in the neighborhood and Love their food, I hate to admit that In the past I have gone upto 4 times a week, I feel that their veggie burgers are fantastic, healthy and delicious.  

Why such a low score you might ask, well one tuesday night mid november I got off work at 8:30 and went straight to Roam for a great Tejano veggie on whole wheat bun, yum.
