But half way through the burger  I happened to look down at the delicious-ness and noticed a black straight hair sticking out of the center of my patty, my heart sank, yuck.  

I have worked in restaurents all through high school and college and understand that mistakes can be made and one bad experience does not define a good restaurent.  I showed the lady at the frount counter and she was great expressing sincere apologies for the gross mistake they offered a refund and gave me a free giftcard good for a kids size shake.   

At the time I didn't think I would be returning for a while but a few weeks later a co-worker asked if I wanted to join her there after our shift, truth be told I couldn't resist I was craving a veggie sunny side up on a whole wheet bun, it was delicious! I had returned one other time before going out of town for winter break and yet again perfection.

Today I returned for lunch around 11am, ordered the veggie sunny side on whole wheat,  yet again half way through the burger I did not find a black hair but something chewy, I had to spit it out and there I found a large piece of SOFT PLASTIC.  One side had a straight cut to it and the other rather ragged.  I hate to say it, I believe I digested part of it.  The piece that I spit out was about the size of a 1/3 of a dollar bill.  The woman at the couter was really nice a gave me a refund and said she would be contacting the owners.  So my days a Roam are over.

While I was leaving I ran into a friend eating lunch with her little boy about 18 months old and I am only greatful that the plastic was in my food not his.  This would be a choking hazzard for a child that doesn't know better than to spit it out.  

I have to end with the food is good but the "extras" make it not worh it...
author: Bridget W.

description: This place is semi-self-serve. You order your food first and get a number here. Water, condiments, and utensils are all on a counter for your convenience. I slammed down ~$20 here for a heritage (beef) burger, fry-fecta, and a beer. Not bad, it was a decent burger and fries. Great place to hang out and chat, but it can get quite loud here.
author: Curieux V.

description: Burger is better than average.  Sunny side is flavorful.  Milkshake is worth trying.  Great place to bring the family.  If you are with a big group, go early to get a table.
author: Frank M.

description: Back to Roam!  Rereading my previous review from January I mentioned that I wanted the fries hotter.  Now I know why.  They were fresh from the fryer yesterday, and they rocked my world!  Having established that they make a great basic burger, I branched out and tried the Pacific Blue burger.  Very tasty, and perfectly cooked.  The place was hopping, but everyone had a seat before their food came.  I want to try their veggie burger some day, but I need to visit more than once per SF trip in order for that to happen.  Maybe next time!
author: J.D. W.

description: Great burgers.  Try the tejano style.  They also have good beers on tap.
author: Craig S.

description:
I've been twice - The first time I went, I had an just an okay experience - not the best but they had just opened and therefore I gave them the benefit of the doubt.  The second time I went, it was a much better experience.  Their burgers are the perfect size and their milkshakes are very tasty.  Their menu has many options that aim to please everyone - everything from the type of beef on the burger down to the type of seasoning on your french fries.  Their burgers are very lean and very easy to mow down....you don't need a bunch of napkins and you can actually set the burger down without having it collapse on you.
My only issue with this place is the seating configuration (per my sister's review below)...The large table in the center means well but in the end, I think it takes up too much space because the bar is also large in size.  If they did away with the large table, the tables against the walls could actually have their dining partner face them and not sit off to their side which seems a bit awkward, especially if you're like on a date or something.  I like this place though and if I'm craving a burger, I'll definitely be hittin this place up!  Welcome to the hood!!!
author: Danielle V.

description:
This place rocks!  The cliché saying applies - "Quality you can taste".

I had a bison burger in the style with the egg on top.  What?  Dope.

The sweet potato fries were delicious and such a welcome way mix it up in the fry zone.

Not cheap but what do you want for a high quality "Artesian" .  Regular burgers are EVERYWHERE!
author: Richard I.

description: This place is so good. They have so many types of burgers to choose from, not just chicken or beef either! I love their sweet potato fries and the place is cozy.
author: Sherri L.

description: I looked at Roam's menu online before I actually went and right when I saw the french and fries, I knew I had to try it! Fries in my burger.. there's nothing better!  This burger definitely delivered all of my expectations.  The water crest was also a nice touch.  I also had the prickly pear soda.  It was good, but definitely on the tart side.  Also, you must have their milkshakes!  They come garnished with a graham cracker and a marshmallow brulee!  It was amazing.  Burnt marshmallow to top a milkshake.. just genius!  I would recommend the blue bottle coffee, just the right amount of sweetness.  I'll definitely think Roam is worth going back to.  The french and fries was great, and I'm sure their other burgers are just as good.
author: Cecille B.

description: Roam is a great spot for dining at and take-out! I usually order a salad with the bison trio ----mmm is it filling and very tasty! When I feel like indulging, their burgers will knock your socks off - best burger in the city so far. My favs include the SunnySide and the Tejano - delicious. AND you cannot go to Roam and not order sweet potatoe fries - they are crispy and seasoned perfectly! AND if you are feeling extra extra crazy, please get a shake - best milkshake I've had in a long while.
author: Natalie W.

description: Bison burger for me, Turkey for my wife.  Best burger I have had in SF.  Delicious and cooked perfectly. Great place for dinner on the go with small children as well.
author: Don N.

description:
My burger group (nerd alert) had our inaugural pigout at Roam. It may have been a random selection out of our long list to tackle, but I find the creativity of the signature burgers and the vast freedom to engineer the burger of one's ultimate imagination that Roam offers to have been an appropriate start to our adventure.

But the execution was not as spot-on as the concept is noble. I was underwhelmed by the experience and  don't care to dwell too much longer than I have on the subject so will simply copy and paste the feedback I gave to the panel, except to add that Roam at least knows how to season, and if the French and Fry (my burger with gruyère, avocado, truffle-parmesan fries, watercress and mustard) were simply a modified sandwich, it'd be a great one:

-Structure: 9. One of the better composed burgers I've had in a while; did not fall apart the entire time. I also liked that the bun was quite sturdy while still managing to be soft and was impressed that it didn't sog up or fall apart in any way.
-Texture: 5. All I got, unfortunately, was the chewiness of the bun. Avocado, as expected, did nothing (who needs more creamy when you have really rich flavors to stand up to); fries were a bit soggy (a recurring problem in the Fryfecta, as well); and the burger was a bit well for my liking.
-Proportion and Flavor: 6. I did love the gruyere and truffle oil, but the beef definitely takes a back seat. My patty was a little over, and with no sear/caramelization to show for it. Onions helped bring out the sweetness of the beef, though. The proportion of everything between the bun was spot-on, but then the bread took over as this really big obstacle in chewing and in starchy flavor. And I think the watercress did work particularly well within this sandwich, but further took the focus from the beefy integrity of the burger, as it really just complemented the French flavors.
-Bottom line: 8 for the concept and the establishment as whole; 6.5 for the burger experience.
author: Nuri K.

description: Not the best burger but a step up from a greasy spoon. Burger was kinda thin for my liking. Not a big juicy medium rare that I like. Beer selection is limited too which to me is essential for a great burger spot. In the end I'd go back if i had to but not if I Barneys burgers were an option.
author: KL H.

description:
Great tasty burgers full of flavor and not full of things to make it fall apart and impossible to take a bite! You can definitely enjoy a classic burger and sweet potato fries without feeling like all you ended up was a mouthful of grease.  Quick service, simple clean menu with high quality ingredients that will satiate any burger craving. Also, the price is nice for a quality burger like the ones served here with all the options. Casual and easy environ:)

 Located in cute neighborhood with lots of shops and pubs/wine bars, so take your time to roam around.
author: Yelping T.

description:
I wish I could give this place 5 stars, because in theory it's a great idea. The food overall is good - by no means drop what you're doing and run there immediately, but a solid burger, and their salad with avocado and mini burger skewers is pretty good.  Also, if you like milkshakes they do a bang-up job.

The two biggest knocks are the price and the wait time.  On my last visit I ordered the salad with bison skewers and a shake.  Grand total: $20.44.  I didn't mind as I had a gift card they sent me after a to-go order was totally botched, but I was still taken aback at the excessive price.

Wait time.  Horrible.  On my last two visits I stopped in on a Saturday at an odd time, around 3 or 4.  While many seats were filled, there was no line at the register but still my order took 30 minutes.  I just had dinner at Benu and food came out quicker.

If you want a good burger and you're in the area, give it a try, but there are plenty of other places that do it better for cheaper and in less time (see: In-N-Out).
author: Josh G.

description: I was excited to hit up Roam and try our some artisan burgers.  The place is pretty good and the shakes are awesome (Strauss FTW).  The burgers are not super big so if you are hungry get a double!  The meat is good quality as are the other ingredients.  It does get a little pricey but then burgers have been for a while.  In the same vein/style I'd say that Pearls still wins, but if you happen to be in the 'hood, Roam is a good bet.
author: Gene X.

description: I wanted to update my review as I am very impressed with the owner.  He contacted me and sent me a gift card for another shake to erase the memory of the one that I didn't like.  I went back last night for dinner with friends and tried the Barbeque Burger - it was good.  I definitely think this place is a great addition to Union and I look forward to trying more burgers in the future.
author: Arica V.

description: I wouldn't necessarily consider myself a burger connoisseur but I definitely do enjoy a tasty beef patty every now and again.  My husband, a friend of ours and I recently went to Roam Artisan Burgers down in the Marina and we are still talking about our dinner!  I decided to "Make My Own" and went with a 100% Grass-Fed beef patty on whole grain Pacific Coast Bakery bun topped with Blue Cheese and Cremini Mushrooms.  Now that is a mouthful, but not in comparison to this burger!!  It was DELISH!  My husband order the Elk Burger and was completely satisfied.  We shared a side of sweet potato fries and left stuffed.  My husband also ordered a Salted Caramel shake and my, oh, my....the combination of sweet and salty was so savory.  I had to remind myself that as I was tasting it, it was actually "his" shake.  Highly recommend!!
author: Tara P.

description: Pretty darn good.  The meat was a little pink.  The bun (regular) made it!  The shake was awesome!  Fries pretty darn good - ok, I'm changing my rating to 4 stars!  I'd go back!
author: Julie B.

description: My husband and I used to go to Polker's twice a week when they had good burgers, but they recently changed everything and their burgers aren't worth the price anymore.  We've been trying fruitlessly to find a new go-to burger place, when we happened upon Roam last night. SCORE!!! Our search is over.  High quality grass-fed beef (or bison, or turkey or veggie!) and Nieman Ranch bacon with sauteed onions and yummy herb mayo = the Heritage. And the Fry-fecta (three different types of fries!) was amazing.  We honestly would eat there every day if we didn't feel guilty.  Very good food, way better than our old haunts, at a reasonable price, eat in or take out, PLUS online ordering available for on-the-go.  I can't say enough good things, but I can't wait to try everything.  Loads of fancy add-ons for those who want it and all at reasonable prices.  Excellent beer selection. Reasonable wait time. We'll be back!
author: Diane C.

description: Overall, very good.  The milk shake was amazing.  The truffle parmesan fries were very good.  I split a couple different veggie burgers with my dinner partner.  The flavors and accouterments were great.  The burger itself was very tasty.  My only complaint was that it didn't hold together at all.  I would go back, however.
author: Lemar M.

description: Let's just say, I've never finished a burger until I visited this place today. And the truffle Parmesan fries! On point!
author: student s.

description: The burger was purple and totally matched my outfit!
author: Wayne F.

description: The Heritage Burger was really nice! But the Sunny Side burger wasn't that good... The sweet potato fries were also great. Not the best shake I had in SF.
author: Maria C.

description:
Another addition to the burger seen, and its a very good one.  The owners had the good sense to put in a place that really deserved a high end burger at a bargain price and they got it.  It's a upscale well designed place with sliding windows looking out on Union Street and their snazzy row of outside tables.  Entering you find a small but well laid out diner style space that looks and feels warm and friendly while very streamlined and contemporary.  Two tones of brown, some brick red, wood and imaginative lighting based on bottles and glass bulbs, very neat.  About a dozen tables including a ten seat family table in the center of the room, and an 8 stool bar with bright red metal stools and walls bereft of anything other than the menu board complete the interior landscape.

Now to the gritty details, the burger (plural in this case, food that ranks near the top of the burger pyramid here in OZ.  For a pick and choose menu, this one is easy to decipher and master, thank you management.  So I ordered the grass fed beef with Gruyere and all the trimmings, their plain fries and a diet coke.  The burger was $4.99 plus a buck for the very good cheese, the fries were $2.49 and the Boylans diet coke another $2.29 so prices are a bargain in today's overpriced, undervalued burger market.  The burger came on a toasted local bakery made sesame bun that was perfect for the meat and burger fixings, no natural spillage disasters here.  The burger was GOOD, really good.  Fresh lettuce, tomato and onion, house made pickles and a tasty house sauce made it one of my favorite new burgers this year.  The Fries were really good, but no longer hot or even warm when served.  The meat choices are turkey, grass fed beef and buffalo are really top quality and the veggie burger sounds like a real winner too.  Various high quality cheeses, sauces, and artisan toppings round out the burger menu.  Salads are also available as well as seasonal vegetables along with the sides.  

Beverages are also fabutastic and include Straus Family ice cream or frozen yogurt milk shakes in quite a few unique flavors, their own house made artisan sodas (Meyer lemon, ginger lime, prickly pear and caramelized pineapple), bottled Boylan diet and regular cola, Kemper root beer, mighty leaf teas, organic Kombucha Botanica, Blue Bottle coffee, organic milk and apple juice.  There are more beverages than food items, a first for this intrepid raconteur.  A selection of micro brews and good wines are also available.

Made fresh with mindful ingredients, lots of organic and green touches, a really sweet and thoughtful staff, great prices and a super location make Roam a natural winner, sure to pop up in future locations, a well developed and executed restaurant, get thee to Roam.
author: Stu S.

description: Amazing!  My first time here and I had the turkey burger--the style I chose was "French and Fries" which has gruyere, avocado, caramelized onions, watercress, dijon mustard AND a few truffle parmesan fries INSIDE the burger itself!  This was the best turkey burger I've ever had, moist and juicy, and super tasty.  Also gave the ginger lime soda a try and loved that too!!  I will be back!!
author: Hannah G.

description:
Really liked the food but wasn't so fond of the atmosphere or the servers behind the counter.  Roam is a large spare room with a family table in the middle seating about 10, bar seating, which looked incredibly uncombortable on these red metal chairs, and several two and four top tables.  You order at the end of the bar, where the menu is posted on the wall, then you get a number, sit down and wait for your food.  Water and condiments are available at a side table. It's kind of like a Chipotle, and I just don't like that atmosphere. It makes you want to eat and run, which I guess might be what they want so they can turn the tables over more quickly. They did have the world cup soccer match on the big screen tv above the bar, which we did watch.
The food was quite good and really too good for the space. Next time, maybe I'll take it to go.  We had a burger with jack cheese, jalapeno relish and ranch dressing and corn tortilla chips--strange combo but it tasted great on the lightly sweetened bun. Our choices were: red or not red. We ordered it red and it was just a tad more medium rare than medium rare.  We also tried the fry basket of fried onions/zucchini, sweet potatoes and potatoes.  The onions/zucchini are finely shredded almost in long strands, salted and they have a very light dusting of flour (or cornmeal or something along that line). They are veryyyy tasty, but a bit too salty.  The sweet potatoes are actually crisp, which is difficult to do with a fried sweet potato. And, the french fried potatoes were mediocre at best. I wouldn't order them again.  We didn't even eat half of them.
We also had a salted caramel shake with the marshmallow brulee. YUM.  The shake was a bit salty and caramelly, which was perfect. It's not huge but we shared it and didn't finish it. I loved the marshamallow brulee, which is one marshmallow burnt almost to a crisp by a torch, sitting ontop of a graham cracker.  I could have had a whole meal of these!
the condiments available are haberno sauce, dijon and regular mustard and ketchup.  The person who brings the food also comes by and clears the table as you are eating, so there is a sense here that they want you done and out of there as quickly as possible, which is a shame. A good burger, just like a good anything, should be savored and enjoyed.
author: Vivek V.

description: guess I found the best burger in town.  And try sweet potato fries w/ chipotle maple seasoning.  Absolutely delicious.
author: Woosung A.

description: Like the other reviewers, I was underwhelmed.  I was shocked by the expensive prices here, given the quality of the food and portion size.  Both the size of the burgers and fries (I had sweet potato) were small.  Also the burger didn't really have a great flavor or anything.  And, they charge extra for little things like sprinkling a spice mixture on fries.  I won't go back---Burgermeister, I am sorry I cheated on you!
author: Sameer D.

description: Best burger and fries in San Francisco.  Beats anything we've had in NYC! Came twice in one week! Staff including the owner were super friendly. All 7 people in our party were blown away, both times. Make sure to try the milkshakes and house made sodas. This was the only restaurant that we ate at twice on our week long food crawl.
author: Jill K.

description: Amazing burgers, probably the best I have experienced, cool location, fast, right on
author: Brady S.

description: I had the French & Fries and I loved the concept. But the burger itself didn't have me panting for more. I felt like the flavors were too powerful and sort of canceled each other out. The beef was very fresh, though, and left no aftertaste in my mouth at all. I would come back here again to try other combinations, but not the French & Fries again. The Father's Office burger in Santa Monica is much better.
author: Kimmie M.

description:
Maybe I came here on a bad day.  They were out of bison patties, the milkshake machine wasn't working, and the cashiers seemed confused by... everything.  So I ended up with a turkey patty and a hole in my heart where a milkshake should be.

The burgers are pretty small for the price, but the buns are huge.  I get it: bread is cheaper than meat.  But the balance was just way off and you could barely taste the patty through all that bun.  (Other reviewers point out that this may be because the meat is lacking flavor, too.)  Roam also offers a broad selection of cheeses, but I couldn't taste my aged white cheddar under the mountains of bread, so it's kind of a waste.  Hubs had a beef burger with gruyere and was also disappointed.  To be fair, he was pretty bummed that they didn't have a bacon add-on.

The fry-fecta is awesome in theory, but the execution is sorely lacking.  The zucchini strips are sliced too thin to eat with your hands (more like strings than fries) and make a mess.  The sweet potato fries were delicious, but the regular ones totally forgettable.  The house-made prickly pear soda tasted kind of thick, but the kombucha was awesome.  I just wish they had a small/large option, because their cups are tiny... cute, but tiny.

I didn't stick around too long, because my burger was done real fast (it's small, you know?) and the place started filling up with the stroller crowd.  The verdict: since I don't like bland over-priced burgers or screaming babies, I won't be coming back.  Oh Pearl's, I'll never leave you again!
author: Alisa N.

description: A nice modern burger place. I split the french and fries burger, heritage burger, truffle Parmesan fries, and had a little taste of the salted caramel shake with the  bruléed marshmallow. The french and fries burger had a little too much mustard for my taste, so I had to take off half the bun. The rest of the burger was good though, I had to use the avocado to kill the mustard taste. My favorite burger was the heritage, the ingredients were so fresh and I love bacon. The fries were delicious with truffle Parmesan on it. The last thing was the shake which was perfect and the marshmallow was the best marshmallow everrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr.
author: Jen K.

description: Now this is a high integrity burger without being in your face about it. In fact, the whole place is like that. Grass feb beef, organic vegetables, whole wheat bun if you want it, and ecologically designed interior that just makes you feel good being in there. I recommend brunch there, ask for the Sunny-side but swap the patty with bacon...you will thank me later. BTW, a small fact;  their long community table was commissioned by Roam using all scrap wood pieces from local wood shops. There are some great people behind this restaurant.
author: Conor M.

description: OMGGGG THE BEST BURGERS EVER!!!  They have other food too which looked delicious.  I also met one of the owners when I was there and he was out and about making sure everyone was having a great time.  He was super nice.  A large space to go with friends and it's really fast and relaxed!
author: Melissa B.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Thursday evening at about 8 pm.  The line was out the door but it moved along pretty quickly.  It took about 30 minutes from the time we arrived to the time we got our food.  We weren't too hungry so we ordered the beef sunny side burger, side salad, and trio of fries with truffle parmesan on the regular fries and the maple chipotle on the sweet potato fries.  That was such a good call. Thank you other yelpers for recommending that.  I didn't really care for the zucchini strings compared to the potato fries.  
The line continued to be up to the front door the whole time we were there.  We couldn't figure out why there were so many people who looked like they were fitness junkies coming in and ordering burgers.  People were still in work out and yoga clothes and coming in to eat a burger.  Pretty cool but weird.  I guess these burgers are healthier than other places but its still a burger.  
Will definitely be back and possibly get a shake the next time.  Some man next to us said the vanilla shake was the best shake he has ever had.  I guess the shakes are good also.
author: Bling L.

description: Went back and had the beef burger and enjoyed it much more than the bison burger (which I didn't think was cooked well).  Good selection of sides and drinks too.
author: M. C.

description: I think the burgers are very good but by the time you add in all the extras and a side of fries, its not really that cheap considering this is an order at the counter type of place. Overall its a solid eating option for Union St.
author: Roberta W.

description:
Roam is a perfect new addition to the neighborhood - organically and sustainably sourced, great food at a really affordable price. We stopped by for lunch on opening day and had a great meal and service. The "Fry-fecta," an amazing trio of sweet potato, russet potato and zucchini fries was unbelievably delicious and reason alone to come back. I had the BBQ bison burger with caramelized onion, white cheddar and slaw, which was really tasty. All the other burgers looked really good too, so there will be many more excuses to come back to Roam. 

While you're there, check out the beautiful bar, which gives new life to a beautiful old tree from Napa that had started losing all its branches and otherwise would've just wound up on the ground. I also loved the chandelier made out of recycled Strauss milk bottles and will have to try one of the Strauss shakes next time I'm there.
author: Cher E.

description: I am OBSESSED with the French and Fries style turkey burger on a whole wheat bun. Avocado, gruyere cheese, arugala, spicy mustard and TRUFFLE FRIES- all piled on top. You must try it.
author: Lauren S.

description: One of the best small burger joints i have ever been to.  great service, food, and environment.  highly recommended.
author: Rob L.

description: I'm not a big girl, but I have a good appetite and if the portions weren't so small - this place might have 4 stars. There's no doubt about the quality of food... I just want to be full and not go out for more. Plain and simple won't be coming back for more.
author: Joanna N.

description: Best lunch restaurant we have had in San Francisco! Proportions are perfect, burgers will make your mouth drool and service is welcoming. Great stop for a great price!
author: Kim M.

description: I live on the same block as this restaurant.....Roams burgers are unmatched for their custom tastes. Tejano burger is simply the most awesome thing on the menu. Trust me try it. Only issue is price... Burger fries and a drink 15$$$... Kinda pricey- but worth it
author: Tom R.

description:
buy the burgers, not the milkshakes. unless you like giving money away. 

everything is reasonably priced except the milkshakes, so i'm assuming that's where the margin is. 

served in a 12oz plastic to go cup, you'll get a tasty shake for $5.00, but unless it's served with alcohol, there's no reason to pay that much. Want a marshmallow? That'll be $1.00.

the (sweet potato) fries are great, but I wish they gave you more.

the burgers live up to the hype.

Our order --

2 burgers -- $16.00
2 milkshakes -- $10.00
1 basket of fries -- $3.50

w/taxes and $2 tip at the counter --$34.50

subtract $10.00 for milkshakes and you have yourself a deal.
author: Bruce A.

description: Just went to Roam and the burgers are fantastic. I had the Tejano burger with avocado, tortilla chips, and chipotle sauce and it was super tasty. The 3 fry combo was also very good with an incredible organic ketchup and a tangy/spicy chipotle habanero sauce that gives an extra kick.
author: Shelley T.

description: Heritage Burger with sweet potato fries.... enough said.
author: Pullse P.

description: Best veggie party I've ever eaten. I love that it's redish in color and made partly with quinoa. Everything about my burger was amazing....bun wasn't too hard, the egg was cooked perfectly and my tomatos were juicy.  I also highly recommend their kombucha on tap (goes down so easily-great mild favor) or a homemade ginger lime soda.
author: Kate K.

description:
A rare restaurant that is completely Club Dine In! approved. These burgers have me salivating just thinking about them. Yes, I do not eat any red meat and am selective of anything non-vegetarian, but a vegetarian would not go hungry here. And it's as healthy as a burger can get. For all of you meat lovers out there, this is the best meat you can consume! On that same thought, all of you veggie lovers out there; this is the best sourced veggie burger you can consume! All of the meats are humanely raised on open pastures and the house-made veggie burgers are organic, gluten free, and vegan. Also, Roam only employs local farms committed to sustainable practices. To add to the bucket of goodness, the entire restaurant is made on sustainable practices.  Low VOC paint on the walls means less toxic air you breathe in. To top it off, you can have a perfectly healthy, satiating, mouth-watering gourmet meal for about $13 or less! 

Taste: Mouthwatering delicious!  

All of the shakes are sweetened with Agave Nectar, not refined white sugar. If you are watching calories and fat intake, but still want to indulge, you can have a yogurt-shake. The fresh veggie burger is the healthiest burger, and its really good. Sunny Side fixing was perfect. I will have to go back to judge the turkey burger. 

Roam Artisan Burgers is a happy place, made from happy cows.
author: Nimisha G.

description: A friend and I shared a burger here and I can't wait to go back again. Burgers really don't rank high on my list of preferred foods, but I will have to make it back to Roam. We had the Turkey/French and Fries style. I don't think Fries and Avocado in a burger has tasted better than they did here. I need to experience more of such scrumptious burgers.
author: En J.

description:
Eats: French n Fries Bison Burger
Brussel sprouts
Regular and sweet potato fries

Drinks: homemade prickly pear soda

Decisions: the burger was moist and delicious, all of the flavors complemented one another perfectly. The bun was light and not overwhelming. Just the right size as well. Fresh ingredients.
The fries were crispy and just as fries should be.
Brussel sprouts were superb.
Prickly pear soda was awesome, not too sweet but flavorful still.
Service was simple, easy and nice. Auctioning off food is awkward when they bring it to your table, but it's a casual place so the expectations can't really be for much else. 
A must try for all burger enthusiasts.
author: Maximilian S.

description: yummy burgers and beer. relaxed vibe. Yay! I'm a fan.
author: K K.

description: Pretty awesome burgers and sweet potato fries.  There are so many burger joints these days.  Nice to actually see turkey and bison on the list too.  Was a great way to end our weekend stay in town.
author: Mae M.

description:
The concept of this place is great, especially since there really isn't that many great sit down lunch places on Union Street that aren't Italian or Ozumo.

I ordered a burger to go. So did the guy in front of me. The server spent the first fifteen minutes of my wait for the food flirting with said guy. It's was kind of cute, she gave him a free milkshake (where was mine), his food came out, and she was sad when left. 

While she was flirting with this guy, a tray of drinks sat idle at the end of the bar. 4 glasses of wine, a soda, and a few milkshakes. I actually thought it was weird that this tray of drinks just sat idle, but thought nothing of it, until a few minutes after the guy left the girl brought it over to a table. It wasn't my order or anything, but it urked me that this girl let at least a 5 item drink order sit there on the counter for at least 10 minutes. If I was waiting for my drinks that long I would have been pissed!

Anyways, fast forward 15 minutes later and my burger still wasn't out. By this time two 16 year old cashier guys were fooling around with the tv. Finally I asked one of them to please check on my order, they came out with it (they did apologize for the seriously long wait) and I walked the two block walk home to enjoy what I hoped to be a great burger.

Not only was my burger cold, the fries were soggy and also cold. I don't think it would have been much better hot, though. The bun is probably from the same vendor that Burger King uses for their burgers, and the meat was jut mediocre, like you could tell it's ben in a freezer for a significant amount of time. Overall, not good.

I wouldn't recommend this place unless you are a cute 30ish guy, maybe then you'll get warm food and a free milkshake.
author: Celine S.

description: The veggie burger here is incredible, and they have gluten free buns!
author: M. P.

description:
Not a bad burger. The patty is thin, unlike my all time favorite... Pearl's, but still tasty. I made my own with a beef patty, aged white cheddar, oil & vinegar slaw, and all the usual suspects (lettuce, onion, pickles, tomato). The oil & vinegar slaw made it for me. The fries are just fries. Nothing to write home about, but the housemade sodas are pretty darn good. I had the prickly pear flavor.
On to the service... which was just OK. Oh, and don't even think about asking them to split the shake for you. I asked and was rudely shot down by the cashier, who then snidely suggested two kids shakes which would cost more. When I asked for an empty glass so that I could split the shake myself, I was denied. Really? I couldn't have an empty glass? Wow. Then I noticed empty glasses by some water on the condiment table took one to split the shake. While waiting for the shake, I look over at another table and see that they were given a second milkshake glass from behind the bar. Not a huge issue, but WTF? Why the difference in treatment? 
Dear Manager,
Make sure training is consistent and customers are given the same courtesies and equal customer service. Just a thought from a fellow Manager.

Bottom line...
I don't mind paying the prices for good ingredients, but would I travel across town for Roam? NOPE.
author: Meredith K.

description: Ventured out to Roam with some friends last night. They talked it up so much that I was ready to throw down. It satisfied the intense burger craving that I was experiencing but I didn't think it was good enough to recommend to anyone else or plan to return. Blackberry soda and truffle fries were pretty tasty though!
author: Ashley C.

description:
This place has the best vegetarian beet burger! Sounds weird, but it doesn't really taste like beets. It tastes like savory rainbows! Do NOT expect a faux meat type burger. You'll be disappointed. 

And their bluebottle shake is friggin delicious. 

It gets noisy and seating gets tight, but that's nothing unusual for SF restaurants. It's good. Go there.
author: O. K.

description: Had a wonderful turkey burger, heritage style.  The bacon was thick and perfectly cooked.  If a place has great bacon, I am already a fan.  The truffle fries were some of the best I've had.  They will even let you bring your own bottle of wine (+ corkage fee) but call ahead to make sure.
author: Judy K.

description: So bummed out! This used to be one of my favorite places and I must have eaten there at least 50 times. Quality is decreasing a bit and still expensive for what it is (and tip is expected too). Importantly, the bathroom is usually a bit smelly and not at all clean (hadn't used it for the first couple years, but now this year have happened to need it a couple of times). Normally I eat meat of some sort there, but today, had Veggie burger, which was so "undercooked" that it just fell apart. Obviously it is mostly quinoa so it is not that it is raw, but it had no burger texture or "hold" like veggie burgers should to make them seem like a burger. It just flopped out of the roll like raw ground beef would - and was frankly lacking some flavor too (despite jack cheese). My shake was poorly made (again) and handed to me leaking all over (a nice bus boy noticed it on his own and came over to wipe it off a bit, which was thoughtful and proactive). What happened?! I used to love this place and have taken loads of friends and out of town visitors there over the years! Hope they improve on cleanliness and food/shakes.
author: E H.

description: OMG THE BURGERS ARE RIDICULOUSLY YUMMMMMMY! So i went here for their soft opening saturday night with my sister and I got to sample all of the burgers.  They were so freaking good, the blue cheese burger was my fav (I ate so many I had to leave because I fell into hardcore food coma) They were cooked to perfection, super juicy, and the meat was top quality.  As for the veggie burger I am a total carnivore but I would actually order the veggie burger if I felt like I had been eating too much red meat.  It was sooooo freakin' good, it tasted like really great chili with a fantastic texture...suprisingly made from beets and I hate beets i think they normally taste like dirt.  I love this place and their shakes are amazing especially the caramel one. mmmmm, ok well thats enough about that but this place is beautiful and the food is like a party in your mouth.
author: Alexis R.

description:
Seems (from some other reviews) that the place may be experiencing some pains common to just-unveiled eating establishments, but that's to be expected, I suppose.  
We got here at around 9:50 p.m. on a wednesday (they close at 10 p.m.), and let's face it, any restaurant's staff has reason to be in a snit about that.  We walked up and said that we'd been wanting to try them since they'd opened, but we could just as easily come back if they had shut down the kitchen or whatever, no problems.  But the lady taking the order was very friendly, and actually took her time giving us recommendations!  The beers & shake came out first (the blue bottle coffee shake is TO DIE FOR!), and then the burgers.  The bison burger is awesomeness incarnate.  The regular burger was great, too.  Of course, it was then we realized that we'd forgotten to order fries.  Off to the register sheepishly... was there any way they could do 1 order of fries?  She says, "don't worry about... they're on the house... I'll just bring you out some".  This staff has my loyalty.  As were were finishing up at our leisure (were never once made to feel rushed), the owner (Josh) stopped by to check on the guests, and chat for a little bit about our experience at the place.  All in all, it was a very pleasant experience, and we are already plotting our return.
author: Godot -.

description: So, I had the bison burger, classic, with aged cheddar, along with sweet potato fries, and a vanilla milkshake! Yes, a splurge! Loved it all. I'm not much of a carnivore, but every now and then, I have  a craving for a burger. The burger patty size is on the smaller end, but it was fine for me. I did go back a few days later to get the roasted veg. side. It was on the expensive end and not that great. I wil def be back for the burgers and fries...delicious!
author: B K.

description: Decent, but not exciting. Good prices, so a totally valid option when in search of a quick meal out. They use fresh and local ingredients, but overall their burgers fall short. Again -- decent, but not exciting.
author: m t.

description:
Best burgers in the city...hands down.  Sure, you might have a heart attack after seeing the bill and wonder how two people spent $30 at a burger joint, but I've never left without feeling like it was totally worth it.

Best ingredients, make it your own way with a variety of options, no hassle condiments/napkins (don't underestimate this), amazing fries (I prefer the sweet potato fries) and quality beverages.  Plus, you can grab a beer while enjoying your burger.  I have no complaints whatsoever, which is rare.  For you Angelinos, this burger, in my opinion, rivals Father's Office.  Yes, I went there. :)
author: Rob G.

description: Delicious, flavorful and filling! Would eat there again in a heartbeat....wished they had a restaurant in my neck of the woods in Socal. I ordered the French & Fries Burger and it was good....but I'm not a huge fan of horseradish, so it kind of killed it for me.  My friends let me try their burgers, the Sunny Side and the Heritage and they were AMAZING! I can honestly say it's one of the best burgers I've tasted! Comparable to Umami Burgers but Roams portion size is way bigger, so you get a better value for your dollar. This restaurant is a must when you're in Frisco!
author: Adriana B.

description: Damn good burger!  And the fries are good too!
author: Chris T.

description:
Make sure you bring at least 1.5 HOURS of change for the meters because that is about the length of time it will take you to get your burger and finish it.  No exagerrating: the OWNER told me today that during rushes it normally takes them 50 minutes to bring customers an average order.  And that is exactly the length of time we waited before we asked for our money back because we still hadnt gotten our food.  The decor is nice, the menu is about as interesting as you can make a burger and the prices were even reasonable however I would prefer to spend less on parking meters and more on the burgers if I could get faster service...


As alternatives, I would suggest:
1)  Burgermeister:  similar concept, excellent burgers, better service
2)  Rose's: Union St.  Excellent burgers, atmosphere and service
3)  Barney's:  SFclassic, excellent burgers
4)  Absinthe:  surprisingly also a great burger
5)  Jovino:  great food also on Union St.  More upscale than Roam
author: D G.

description: Great when they first opened and now horribly overcooked burgers when asked for rare or med rare. worse than the leather ones at In/Out at 3x the price. This is a precious spot for the .commers with noisy brats. Skip this and go to Perrys for a real and large American burger.
author: Tex M.

description: This place has amazing burgers! You can taste the quality of the ingredients in every bite. They have a great beer selection and the ambiance is great for a low key lunch in the city. The building is as modern and fresh as the ingredients. A must try if you are in the area! The music is great too!
author: Michael M.

description: Had the Pacific Blue sandwich, which is a burger with steak sauce, carmelized onions, and blue cheese.  It was pretty good, but there was a lot of blue cheese on it.  I probably wouldn't order it again.  Also got the trifecta (regular fries, sweet potato fries, and onion strings).  This was very tasty.  I will order that every time I go back.  And I will be back.  Oh, and prices are very reasonable.
author: Jeff R.

description:
Couple things:

1.) how is a turkey burger, fries, and a beer $18? I would break it out but they didn't give me a receipt.
2.) they have a hot sauce that supports the Black Panther Party. I don't like politically driven hot sauce. Not cool.
3.) burger was pretty tasty though, so 2-stars for that.
author: Patrick G.

description: Pretty good burger but not my favorite: the patty is too thin to be considered great. Toppings were good. Very good shakes, and nice atmosphere in a cozy Cow Hollow location.
author: George F.

description: I love these burgers! They melt in your mouth! Only reason it's not 5 stars is they ALWAYS forget to add my avocado. ALWAYS!
author: Katrina H.

description:
Everything here is delicious! If you have any room after consuming one of there burgers make sure to try the milkshakes, they are fantastic.  

I had the beef burger which was juicy and delicious, and my friend had the vegetarian burger and neither of us had any complaints.  Go to Roam you won't be disappointed.
author: Sarah V.

description: Turkey burger is pretty money with Sweet potato fries. It's a once a week go to spot.
author: Ben D.

description: Delicious!!! I ordered a Sunny Side Style Beef Burger and it was so juicy. Not only that the Fry-Fecta is such a great side for my burger...Only downside..price, but I guess that's normal for 100% grass fed beef.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Not that good...at all.  Super thin burgers...burger to bun ratio is like 1 to 6. 
as in stack 6 burgers up to match the thickness of the bun.  I chuckled when I saw the burger because they had asked me what temp.? HAH.  Would you like that burger done or more done sir?  Whatever.  There was some weird stringy green crap instead of lettuce.  The bun was doughy and COLD.  
Burger & fries $10 +.   Good luck!!!!!
author: Victor J.

description:
This is a good place for fancy pants burgers.  I'd have given it four stars, but it took me damn near 18 bucks to be full.  

The burgers themselves are really good.  The toppings work really well together and the burger was juicy.
author: Per C.

description:
Great selection here! You can choose many different options for the burger. Bison, turkey, veggie, classic beef are a all available which is nice because you can come with any of you friends no matter their food restrictions and get a tasty burger! The toppings were also pretty varied which was great! 

I ate a classic beef burger Tejano style Jalapeno relish and avocado among other things and it definitely had a nice kick to it. My lunch date had the BBQ topping on classic beef and her burger looked delish! We shared the "Fry-Fecta" which contained classic fries, sweet potato fries and zucchini onion haystack. This was absolutely one of my favorite parts of my meal. The sweet potato fries were perfect and I enjoyed the haystack way more than I planned to.

Service was efficient and the staff was friendly and helpful When I arrived there was what appeared to be a 8 year old convention going on and the restaurant was pretty full yet the staff cleaned tables effectively so the new guests could eat.

I will absolutely be returning!
author: Crystal C.

description: Burgers are good but can be better.  Due to the 1/4lb patties, you can't really get a juicy burger.  Patties need to be 1/3lb or more to give you that juicy center.  The different specialty burgers have unique favors and the price is pretty decent for being in the Marina.  Overall pretty good with the crispy fries and orion shreds.
author: MTBer I.

description: Roam is my favorite burger place in the city. The meat is always perfect and the veggies are always fresh. I love that everything is all natural or organic. The salted carmel milk shake is to die for!!!
author: Angela F.

description: For a quick burger joint, this place is as good as it gets.  Great menu with a lot of interesting options and the ability to custom-make your own burger.  I also loved the fries they had.  Without a doubt one of the best burgers I've had.
author: Craig B.

description: I wanted to update my review because I had the veggie burger.  I am a very big fan of Plant Cafe's burger and I have to confess this place can give them a run for their money.  I love quinoa and their quinoa burger is just as hearty and delicious as Plant's.  I'd have the veggie burger Tejano style and it makes for a very hearty lunch.
author: Sarah C.

description: Had a turkey patty tejano style with sweet potato fries. sooo yum! Turkey is usually a hit or miss for me and it was a definite hit here. Juicy and not tough at all. The fries were not oily and seasoned just perfectly
author: Kamalpreet K.

description: Great burgers! Really liked the French and frie burger, has a nice kick to it. Had the lemon merange pie milkshake, really good.
author: Alex W.

description: In general, I am not a big fan of burgers, large sandwiches, or any other foods that require people to unhinge their jaws.  However, I walked into Roam because I was intrigued by the fusion of traditional diner food (burger, fries and shakes) with grass fed, free range, organic and local food sources.  And I have to say, I loved my perfectly cooked pink bison burger with pepper jack, jalapeño relish, and white corn strips.  On a lark, I also ordered a side of sweet potato fries with truffle Parmesan seasoning.  Yumm!  Roam is definitely a welcome addition to the neighborhood, and I look forward to returning there to try their incredible looking milkshakes.
author: Michael P.

description: I was a piggy and ate two burgers my first time here. So yes, I liked it enough.  I finished work late and was super hungry.  So anything would have tasted great.  I had the burger with the avocado, fries, and gruyere, and the bbq burger with the jalapeno relish and carmelized onions.  The meat and the toppings were great, sweet potato fries are great (exactly the same as the ones at Pacific Catch and Unwind).  I didn't like the sesame bun (would have liked other bread options) and it was loud and fast-food-like in ambiance.  So, overall, decent burgers but not on my list of best in the city, loud and uncomfortable dining, but fast service.
author: Kari L.

description:
what a great new addition to Union Street.

the people there are super nice and the food is great as well. i work right down the street, so the few times I've been in there i have called my order in, and they call to tell me it's ready. which makes things that much easier.

they price is right as well. i have also gotten the kids meal as well. which comes with the perfect portions. The burger, fries, and a little soda. perfection.

i really enjoy the veggie burger they have. its very flavorful and the fries are excellent. i highly recommend the 'Fry-Fecta'
author: Vanessa A.

description:
I have been coming to this cute burger spot now for almost a year regularly and what brings be back is their incredibly delicious burgers, creamy yet healthy shakes, kombucha on tap and yummy sweet potato fries. 

I am very picky when it comes to burgers, but when I find the right spot there is no turning back. After eating at numerous burger spots in SF, I am so glad I found this place.... no other place compares, not even pearls!

Their classic burger is even amazing and is the most simple burger you can find on Roam's menu. Their french and frie burger is oh so good and I heard their burger salad is mouthwatering also - plus what a great concept!

I recently blogged about this place, along with other great SF Spots - www.distinctivestyle.wordpress.com.
author: Michaela w.

description: Best turkey and amazing veggie burger. Sweet potato fries done right. Yummy shakes.
author: Saul F.

description: Nice portion sizes, good price point. Their sense for flavor combinations is spot on -- the sweet chili sauce on the Sunny Side (egg burger) makes it work. Doesn't feel as authentic as my #1 burger joint, Pearl's Deluxe, but a nice change of pace with what feels like a healthier portion size.
author: David Y.

description: This is my favourite burger joint in San Francisco - and I'm a Pescetarian!  Seriously, their veggie burgers are totally amazing and the sweet potato fries are the best I've ever tasted (make sure you add the truffle parmesan!).  This is easily a once-a-week place, at least!
author: Vinny L.

description: Had lunch here saturday and the burgers are nice and juicy, i had the sunny side burger w/russet fries house made carmelized pineapple soda.. very good by the way lolz i had 2, my gf had passion fruit milkshake which was good too... if your in the union street area i would stop in..
author: jonathan h.

description:
These burgers are solid and tasty. The first time I chose turkey with the fried egg on top--delicious, but be prepared for the perfectly soft-cooked yolk to spurt. Best to use a fork and knife with this one. Today I had elk. I ordered bbq sauce, but that only detracted from the flavor. When the meat is good and cooked properly, only basic seasoning is necessary, and that was the case here. 

I've been very happy with Roam two out of two times and would easily recommend it. Prices are reasonable too.
author: Laurie R.

description: Kept reading about this place is 7x7 magazine and decided to make the trek across the city to try it out. Had the Sunny Side Turkey Burger with sweet potato fries and it was possibly the Best Burger I've EVER HAD. Invited my friend to swing through (she had the French and Fries Turkey Burger) and she loved hers as well. She kept raving about a familiar but unfamiliar taste (spicy mustard) that she loved. Mine also had a little kick to it that made it delicious. Her and I will definitely be going there again. ABSOLUTELY WORTH VISITING, even if you live on the other side of the city like myself.
author: Danielle J.

description:
I was looking forward to sampling the burgers at Roam. Unfortunately, even after almost an hour there, I never got the chance. We stopped by Roam on Saturday afternoon, and my first impression was good - interesting menu, decent prices, nice decor. It didn't take long to order, but once we got a seat, I realized that almost every other table in the place was full of people waiting for their food - not a good sign. After 30 minutes, still no sign of our order (not even the french fries to tide me over??), and we checked at the counter to make sure it was coming. After 50 minutes, we asked for a refund and walked out. 

Roam has promise, but needs better management and a lot more time to get it together.
author: J C.

description:
If I were only rating my veggie burger, I wouldn't be giving this place four stars.  The veggie burger is too sweet; just get it over with and call it a donut why don't you?  Of course, I am spoiled with the incredible veggie burger from THE PLANT Cafe, which sits alone as king of all veggie burgers.  Make me a queen to that burger and it could put its "meat" into my "buns" anytime.  I digress.

Still, to be fair, concept and ingredients all seem fine, and the meat burgers had by my companions were all raved about and spewed forth their juices in joy.  I mean the meat looked very juicy so that the buns were wet at the end.  Mind out of the gutter, a soggy bottom bun is sure sign of a happy ending.

Wow, I should write more burger reviews so I can have fun.

Speaking of fun, the staff sure didn't look like they were having fun.  Yes, I know, you can hire cheap food service staff who have no stake in the business.  But, employees without a stake in their workplace unfortunately have a way of acting like they don't care because, why should they?  I'm philosophizing, and I don't want to overdo the point, but when I go into some of the best run food places I get a strong sense of staff who really care about the business and are really into it.  And I sure wasn't hit with that type of feeling here.
author: Richard P.

description: The burgers were great! We had one grass-fed beef and a house-made vegetarian. Both the toppings and the fry-fecta were as good as it gets. Service was quick despite being crowded, and the staff was knowledgable about and accommodating of gluten allergies.
author: Chris C.

description: I really want to give this place a 3.5 stars because it was good! Not the best burger I've ever had and the price isn't right (I don't care what part of town it's in) but I was content and liked my food.  So I work nearby and I read the reviews on Yelp and decided to go!  I ordered a classic burger, the Fry-frecta and a lemon soda.  Burger was good, special sauce and butter lettuce was a little different and good. Fry-frecta..really different...I loved the sweet potato fries with the sweet, slightly spicy coating, the regular cut fries were cool with the truffle herb coating and the onion/zucchini stack was cool but too salty to me...the homemade lemon soda was light and refreshing but my total for this lunch for myself was $17.99 and it just wasn't worth that...I don't know if it was different and good enough to pay that again...but glad I tried it!!
author: Danielle W.

description:
I think that this is a great new place for the neighborhood. I had the BBQ burger. Everything was great except for the fact that the put way too much of this pickle relish. It kind of over-powered everything else, and found myself scraping it off. The service was great. The reason why I'm giving it 2 stars is that I think that it is a little over priced for a walk up/sit yourself restaurant. I got a standard hamburger, a beer and the fry-fecta. My meal came out to be $20 dollars.

I also find that their menu is contradicting itself. They are all about being organic, and having grass-fed meat. What I find strange is that on one of their hamburgers they have corn strips. If anyone has seen "Food Inc" corn is the vegetable villain, and find it rather interesting that they would incorporate corn into a dish.
author: Cortney H.

description: do yourself a favor and "roam" to In-n-Out or even Barney's instead.  The burgers are decent, but I agree with all the other reviews here about the long wait (you'll get your burgers 30 min after you order).  Burgers don't take that long at a full-service sit-down restaurant like Republic or Tipsy Pig.  If i was on a date that might be okay, but since you order at the counter, one would assume it's supposed to be more of a "quick service" place.  Also, half the bun was soggy and so my burger fell apart halfway through my meal.   This place needs to work out its issues.
author: Toby C.

description: Bison n Jack cheese, tejano Burger it is: ) This place is good a must try, it is very busy so it hard to get seats but if ur patient im sure by the time you get your food you will find a table.
author: Andreane R.

description: I was very excited to try this place, one reason being that I only live a block away. The burgers were great...I had a turkey burger and my boyfriend had the fried egg burger. The sweet potatoes were also wonderful, yet the fried zucchini was the reason for only 3 stars. They were cut too thin, had too much flour and tasted too fried. Other than that, I would recommend this place. The atmosphere is also great.
author: Jen B.

description: These burgers are awesome, and the sweet potato fries are perfect. It's like a more upscale version of Pearl's (and slightly more expensive). One time we were randomly given a glass of wine here that we didn't order, so maybe they are not the most organized at times (they got the stuff we did order right though).
author: David K.

description: I come here at least once a week, for the best freakin' food around. Get the seasonal greens, fryfecta and some kind of Buffalo burger! And a beer, and a shake..... Mmmmmmmm........
author: Ben R.

description: I had lunch here the other day with a friend and I had a pretty good meal at an affordable price. I thought I would be adventurous and try the bison as my patty choice.  It was pretty tasty and I don't believe I'll try the beef burger on my next visit since I enjoyed the bison so much!   The burger wasn't huge, but I ate my burger and fries with out feeling like a FA!!  I hear the milk shakes are great, so I'll be sure to try one on my next visit.
author: d p.

description: It's hard to get en affordable lunch in this area.  At roam you can get a really good burger for $4.99.  Everything is organic and super tasty.  I also recommend the parmesan russet fries.
author: Summer A.

description: More like a 3.5.  Veggie burger was pretty good, although i wish i had ordered the avacado on rather than the classic.  I was pretty disappointed that they didn't have the green tea milkshake anymore, that was one of the big things that was drawing me over there when i saw their menu.  The on-tap kombucha was a good sub though.  Amanda thought that their soda and fries were the best thing about the place.  Would definitely come back.
author: Phil J.

description: Decided to try Roam Artisan Burgers & try the artisan sodas. The Classic burger fairly tasty but found the wrapping too oily indicating more decibels of saturated fat than I was expecting.  Prickly Pear fountain soda did not have any kick nor did my spouse's Ginger Lime. Specialty sodas are my passion so I suggest Roam rework their soda making formula. Russet fries & Sweet potato fries are fine.
author: Kenny C.

description: Slightly below average burgers, but cheap. Zucchini fries with parmesan were too heavy to enjoy. My wheat beer tasted like carbonated water. As always happens and ho-hum spots like this, business will dry up once the novelty wears off.  Roam while you can.
author: Nick C.

description:
yum, yum, yum!!!  i just had my first dining experience at roam, and it lived up to everything i had been hearing about it.

i had the turkey burger chalet (swiss cheese & mushrooms...i'm a sucker for that combo!) and shared a side of sweet potato fries AND parmesan truffle fries.  all were delicious.  the burger patty was thin, but it had flavor, and didn't have a weird taste that sometimes turkey burgers can have.

we topped our lunch by sharing the salted caramel milkshake...yeah, try it...it's as good as it sounds!

my only negative is the atmosphere.  while it is a kid-friendly place, it gets a little too loud and crowded (being asked to get up and move for a stroller is not ideal while i'm eating)...try to beat the typical lunch hour-ish time...or else you're not dealing with just one stroller (+ kids), but several.
author: Kelly T.

description:
I was informed that for some reason Yelp is filtering my review.  Why is that?  I will post this again:

Love this place.  For all of you complaining about the price, the grass fed beef as well as other top quality ingredients are what make it a little pricier, but it is well worth it when you research what it means to your health.  

The only complaint I could have is that there aren't more Roam Artisan Burgers!  I hope they start opening some more down the Peninsula, because the Counter Burgers just aren't cutting it for me.
author: mariana c.

description:
OK,  I waited a couple of months since my less than stellar review when they first opened.  It seems like they really got it together.
The burger and fries came quickly and hot like it should.  The flovors I picked had my toungue sooo confused, in a good way.  Parts of my flavor palate thought I had forgot about them  What a wake up call.  I ate the Pacific Blue hamburger and truffle/permesian fries with a prickly pear soda.  So much flavor all around.  I'll come soon because of all the many other food and drink flavors available.  It's great to see them on track.
author: Ken C.

description: The French and Fries burger was awesome. Will need to go back to try out some Bison meat.
author: Patrick S.

description: The best sweet potato fries in the city, and great burgers. They use high quality beef and the price is worth it, and I think their burgers are in the top three burgers for San Francisco, and I have tried a lot of Burger joints of all types over last twenty years in this city. Other than being popular,  and therefore crowded, I can't think of anything negative to say about my experience. Just go Hungry and enjoy a Burger and see what I mean.
author: Jeff V.

description:
Pretty good burger for 7 dollars, truffle fries where a bit salty but overall crunch and taste was good. The burger (with egg and white cheddar) was a bit soggier than I'd like but the slipperiness could be attributed to my choice of yummy toppings. The house sauce had a bi too much going on, although it was a good stab at adding a kick to the typical thou. Isle dressing sauce. 

So let me begin with my never ending story:
Ordered before there was any lunch crowd- read: no one else there. And we sit down, people trickle in. Some other people get their stuff before us, fine, it's mostly salads and non- stove things... We check the recipt and it doesnt have all the toppings we chose on it, my bf asks if they got it right becuase our cashier seemed newbie-ish. Another girl comes up and reassures us that the back of thr house gets more info than the recipt shoes... Ok. But when we get our food, pretty much all our toppings are jumbled between two burgers ( think if they wrote all our toppings on pieces of paper, put them in a hat, then pulled them out at random to put them between the two burgers.) its ok, happens sometimes. The poor server had to use the menu i had to write it down :/ Then we realize that the fries that were the only things we kept of the order, were not truffle. Bugger. We get the food back after  a dozen (literally) other people get theirs and we have to insert more change in the meter... And my bf is like  oh, raw onions, not grilled. But low and behold there were both? One didn't cancel out the other, weirdly.

Nice decor, good concept, good toppings,but  just new and figuring it out?  I hope.
author: Sydel S.

description: Went to Roam last night for a burger. This place is nice & open with seating indoors & out. You order your food at the counter & then it is brought out to you. They have burgers, fries, beer & wine. The burger was good, but not the best I've had. There are couple of fries options including sweet potato, zuccini straws, and regular fries with toppings you can order!
author: Heather M.

description: Unlike most burger places, you don't leave Roam feeling heavy and regretful for your indulgences. My roommate, boyfriend and I are all burger connoisseurs. My roommate has been a Barney's Burger patron for the last few years until recently. He's a convert to Roam's higher quality burger and reasonable portions. Then there's my health-nut gourmand boyfriend, who was very impressed with the bison burger and kambucha. As for me, the taste and quality for the price is very fair. Wine and burgers with a side of truffle fries? Bring it on.
author: sarah m.

description:
Stand-Out Burgers.  Real creative flavor stacking that may come off odd on 1st glance, (Ex. Tejano Burger:
Pepper Jack, Jalapeño Relish, Avocado, Tomato, White Corn Strips, Herb Ranch) but after you give it a try, you feel like the newest PR rep for ROAM!  Burgers were cooked perfectly to temperature.  The fries are not an afterthought.  They are prepped with the same care and flare as the headliner.  Location is great.  Only reason for 4-Stars vs. 5-Stars has to do with take-out order logistics.  The lines can be significant & ROAM could really use a dedicated line for carry out payments and pick-ups.
author: Tom B.

description: I came here recently with my boyfriend after reading about it in a yelp newsletter. We ordered and sat down with a beer at the bar and almost instantaneously our burgers were placed in front of us! It made me question how they could cook a burger so fast. But I got a classic bison burger with aged white cheddar and *WOW* it was yummy!  Cooked exactly like I requested and the bun was squishy, fresh and delicious. I would probably come back here if I was in the area or lived in the marina (I will never live in the marina) but I enjoyed my first time experience and now on to something new!
author: kathryn s.

description: What I immediately love about Roam is that it is less than a block from my office...then, it's the superbly fresh greens that make up one of the best salads in town. Since I avoid wheat, I choose a turkey 'burger'' wrapped in lettuce or the delicious quinoa  'veggie burger' on top of sauteed squash. It's all delicious and so very reasonablly priced...never over $10. I must say that it is extremely busy and noisy...but I eat and run and am satisfied all the same.
author: Kay H.

description: What can I say, I LOVE THIS PLACE! I love knowing that i can get a quick, inexpensive meal that buys its produce, dairy and meats from local farmers. Organic. Local. Fast. Delicious. They even accommodate my gluten allergy with lettuce wrap burgers or gluten free buns.
author: Shelly M.

description:
1. Gave my friends and I the runs. One of which had HIS wedding to attend to the next day. 2 stars for helping him out with the last-minute weight loss.
2. Meat was too raw.
3. Fries = you can't mess up fried food.
4. Go to Father's Office in Los Angeles. Same concept but executed well.
author: Sarah A.

description:
There is very little I don't like about Roam - from the decor, to the unsweetened blackcurrant iced tea, burgers (perfectly made with custom sauces, fresh fresh veggies), seasonal veggies offered, fries, dagoba choc milk shake, the cutlery they chose for the restaurant to the seating, lighting, tables and positioning of its windows -- it never quite gets too stuffy in there but comfortably warm.

I do not always like the lines and the crowds there - they seem a bit preppy and.. uptight but the food is great.  The staff looks young and mildly dazed sometimes but if they are not rude, it is A-OK with me.  The service is excellent - seen pleasing the whims of a picky family of 5 with 3 screaming kids, to refilling the mustard jars within a minute of it being emptied and hand drying each utensil.

The sponge dough they use for their burger is light and fluffy, almost no carbs at all.  They offer bison burgers as well.  The cost is very reasonable for burgers.  They bring in greens from local farms, which I really like.  The lemons they put in their water and ice tea is very fresh, and freshly sliced - I smell them when I take my first sip.

Parking is a nightmare there, on that street.  But I strongly recommend that you go try it.  For the price and the quality you get, it is a rare, rare deal in san francisco.  I am deducting one star for the obnoxious crowds that frequent there, the parking, and the staff that look so lost all the time.  I hope that joint finds its pace, it is a great place.
author: tc h.

description: Burgers were REALLY good.  I'm a regular American burger fan and this is right up there with Five Guys and In and Out!  Definitely expensive though
author: Sheldon M.

description: This place is amazing. Great food, laid back staff, and a nice atmosphere. Spoil yourself with avocado on your bison burger and maple chipotle sauce on some sweet potato fries.
author: Alan B.

description: We went to the opening last night and they were passing around "tasters" of all the burgers they offer. The beef, bison and turkey burger were wonderful! The 'sunny-side' version was my favorite (caramelized onion, egg, aged white cheddar, tomato, sweet chili sauce, greens - wow, so good). I like that everything is grass fed and organic too. The burgers are probably some of the best I've had in a very long time. Prices really reasonable too. Big fan.
author: Brooke S.

description: We were pleasantly surprised by this small restaurant in this SF neighborhood. We stumbled upon it. We were actually going to a different restaurant but this sounded good. We were not disappointed! I am a vegetarian and to eat a house made patty is definitely a treat. It was delicious. My carnivore husband got the burger with gruyere and fries on the burger and thought it was fabulous. We liked it so much, we almost went back a second time and we were only there for a week!
author: Bridget M.

description:
What happened tonight?  A very embarrassing show by Roam.

First of all, we had to ask to have our tables cleaned.  When the woman who made our shake came over, we kindly asked her to clean the table.  She brought over a towel and wiped it down, but didn't take away the water glasses that remained.  

Getting back to the shake.  It was good, but it way overflowed the glass and it took about 6-10 napkins to clean it up.  At least they could have cleaned it up a bit or brought it on a plate.

We both had the turkey burgers classic style.  The turkey was dry though.  The rest of the burger was fine.

We also order the zucchini fries.  Although the truffle parmesan was a nice touch, it was way too cheesy and salty.  

With the layout, you can sit at a communal table, at the bar or at one of the few tables that remain.  They need to rearrange the space a bit on a busy night like tonight.  Some woman and her family asked if she could take one of the two tables were were dining at and was not very friendly.

Very disappointed.  I may give them one more try though.
author: Brian L.

description: Very tasty, high quality burger. I ordered the tejano burger with bison meat and the fry fecta combo fries. For dessert I ordered the coconut milkshake with the marshmellow on top. Hit the spot. I will definitely be back.
author: P E.

description: I was super stoked to hear about a burger place near my house that had bison and turkey!  The turkey burger had good flavor and the sweet potato fries with truffle parmesan were absolutely divine.  The prices are reasonable and the staff was very friendly.  We dined at about 9pm on a Wednesday night and it only took about 5-10 minutes for our food to be served and we were able to get a seat right away.  My only beef (hehe) with this place is the size of the meat patty.  The patty is the size of the bun, which is great, but way too thin.  If they can bulk their burgers up, then this place will pretty much be perfect.
author: Carolyn D.

description: Roam contacted me regarding my previous review and it is evident that they really care about making sure that their customers are satisfied every time whether they are eating in or taking out. They explained that they usually cook the burgers a tad longer for take-out because they do not want the buns to get soggy. And suggested that I order mine 'extra-pink' next time since I am not a fan of any meat even close to well done. They are going to look into their packaging and see if the mushy tomato issue can be resolved somehow as well. For now I am going to sick to eating in, but I will try their take-out sometime again in the future. Their burgers are really great along with their sweet potato fries and vanilla milk shakes! I really like a business that actually cares about their customers and Roam is one of those places.
author: Nicole S.

description: Well my opinion hasn't changes - this is still a really good place to get an uncomplicated bite to eat.  The staff is as friendly as ever, and the service I've received (despite other reviews) has always been good.  Advice - until Roam steam cleans the sidewalks by their outside tables, I would recommend eating inside.  Ick - not appetizing at all.
author: Emma L.

description: By far the best burger I have ever! My favorite food has to be a cheeseburger and I have thus eaten many burgers from many different places in many different regions. Roam's burgers literally melt in your mouth. Their sweet potato fries were also great. They only lost a star for their poor beer selection... Burger was definitely a "5"!
author: Anthony A.

description: I've been here 3 times in the last 2 weeks. My boyfriend and I can't get enough! The drive is over half an hour, but we always enjoy coming here. I always get the beef pacific blue and he gets the bison with the egg. We split the tri-fecta, which everyone MUST get. It is a combination of fries, sweet potato fries, and an onion cucumber mix (my favorite). They also have homemade sodas, which aren't my favorite, but still refreshing! The staff is also very nice and informative.
author: Tracy L.

description: A bison burger for $6 is enough to give Roam a 5 star rating. The decor is nice, the service isn't perfect but good considering it's a new place. I went immediately after the US World Cup game and they were slammed. We were warned it would take a while for our food before we ordered, and I'm glad we waited. The milkshake was tasty and the bruléed marshmallow took it to the next level.  Options for vegetarians and light eaters make it a place just about anyone can get a good meal for a great price. As a side note, there was an irate couple at the next table who also has reviewed on Yelp. I overheard the whole thing and was embarrassed by the couple's attitude and the way they treated the staff and was relieved when they stormed out of the restaurant. Try Roam yourself, and realize that if you go to a new restaurant when it's slammed, you might have to wait.
author: Hurston P.

description: Solid burgers. I had the turkey burger BBQ style. My boyfriend had your classic burger. Mine was better. Truffle fries were solid. We will be back.
author: Johanna W.

description:
Roam is the place that Union St needs.  It has a fun environment, cool decor, and great food.  I had the classic burger with American cheese, sweet potato fries, and a diet coke.  My husband had the bison BBQ style with chocolate milk shake and enjoyed it.  The owner is a UCLA and Redwood High School graduate and super nice.  

The downside was there were some screaming kids in the restaurant and taking over the communal table.  Once they figure out some more seating, this place will be the place to be.
author: vikki a.

description: i love everything about this place, except for one thing, the servers, they were rude, unfriendly, & didnt smile. BUT, back to the food, i ordered french w/ fries on beef & its organic, not to mention orgasmic. i also got the triple combo  fries thing( which you order seperately) & those too were soooo good. you order first & then sit down & they bring you your food, luckily my friend & i came when it was empty. kinda pricy but the burgers are big, & filling & i gobbled it up in like ten minutes. if in the area, id reccomend it.
author: KEN S.

description:
Agree w/ comments of others regarding issues w/ delivering on custom orders.  Pay attention..."Build your own" actually means "add toppings to our classic".  This was explained to me (without apology) by the staff when I asked why my burger came with 4 toppings I did not order as part of my "build your own" order.  

After it was clearly explained that it was MY fault for not realizing this, they did offer to replace my order.  At that point, I was over it.  The cloud of fruit flies and pee on the seat of the unisex bathrooms had kind of soured me on the experience.  

Quality meats, poor service & setup.   Hopefully they work out the kinks and clarify their menu language ASAP.  Ambiance is nice and I love the idea of a quality cheap eat destination on Union.
author: Megan j.

description:
My boyfriend and I have now been to Roam Burger 4 times. We live right around the corner and love the convenience of Roam burger, the friendly staff, and the prices. I have tried the veggie burger and the turkey burger. The veggie burger is great, very flavorful. it falls apart but i'm okay with that. The Turkey burger is also great, tasty and always perfectly prepared. There are a variety of interesting toppings and sauces that make these burgers even better. My boyfriend loves the "french and fry" burger and usually gets it doubled.
