I will ding Roam on not "doubling" the burger last time, but I forgive them because their milkshakes and sweet potato fries are awesome. 

my one suggestion - more options for sides!! I think having 2 or 3 side options would make this place my go-to take out spot.

complements to the owner/manager for being so friendly and laid back!
author: erin t.

description:
Stopped by Roam last week when looking for a casual lunch in the Marina.  The food was tasty and different.  As a reluctant carnivore, I always appreciate a turkey burger option.  Usually turkey patties aren't so inspired.  Au contraire, Roam's turkey patties are delicious - wonderfully seasoned and high quality.  

I had a hard time choosing the style - swiss and mushrooms or truffle fries, avocado and gruyere?  My friend opted to top his burger with an egg - brilliant!  I'll be back to try the other options soon.   If you are super hungry, add an extra patty for a few bucks more.  Excellent fry options as well.  I went for the mix of potato, sweet potato, and crunchy zucchini onion mix. Yum!  

I appreciate Roam's dedication to quality, local, natural ingredients.  

The surprising part- it was cheap! The burger was around $5.  Fries are a few bucks more (or $4.50 for the combo described above).  The Marina desperately needed a place like this.  

The owner stopped by to make sure the food was great and we were enjoying ourselves.  Check and check.  This guy truly cares about your experience and will go out of his way to right any wrong.  

The only negative was that it took a while to get our food.  I assume that's because all of the ingredients are fresh and burgers are made to order.  It's a new place and I assume that one little kink will work itself out.
author: laurie r.

description: Perhaps it's their proximity to my work, but I have found myself going to Roam several times in the same week.  I'm not a meat-head, but these burgers are incredible and I can't seem to get enough!  The menu offers a slate of prix-fixe burger notions (my favorite is the Sunny-Side--an egg atop the burger with white-cheddar cheese and grilled onions-MMMmmmm!)  You choose the meat (Grass-fed beef, Turkey, Bison, and a House-designed quinoa/black bean veggie option)  I've tried them all and have been more than pleased in all cases.  I often get the quinoa version with the egg on top and, while messy, it sets every lovey, seratonin booster off in my brain!!  This place is well worth going out of your way for!!  Oh, and the fri-fecta (russet potato, sweet potato, and zucchini fries), while an undertaking, is definitely worth at least one go-round too!
author: Colby J.

description: LOVE Roam Artisan Burgers!!  I am a vegetarian and their veggie burger is one of the best around.  Try the onion-zucchini stack...fried in rice bran oil it is light and so tasty.  Make sure to top it off with the parmesan truffle topping.  Can't wait to go back to Roam!!
author: A E.

description: Of all the burgers in this area, this one is the best! The fries and drinks are delicious too. 4 stars for how cramped and tight the joint is, contributing to the wait :/
author: Susan C.

description: fabulous and original veggie burger.  everything there is good, but if you are a vegetarian, you often don't have a solid option at a burger place.  nice people, good vibe.  a little pricey, but worth it.
author: Cristina S.

description: My friend wanted to go here beacause she is a huge hamburger fan and had not tried this place. We were not disappointed. My burger was awsome. I had the Chalet burger ( Swiss Cheese, Cremini Mushrooms, Watercress, Tomato, House Sauce) and we shared the Fry Fecta. An ice cold beer finished off the meal. All were great and I would definitely go here again to build my own burger. Service was quick, you order at the counter and before we reached our seats our drinks were coming out. The burgers arrived not to long after. It was a great meal.
author: lorna v.

description:
OMG, I can't believe it, ROAM made a burger lover out of me!!! I don't know what it is, maybe I never had a decent burger before but to me they are always just blah, normally I would take Thai or sushi over a burger anytime; in fact I only eat it when I am hungry and nothing else is available. Tonight, I was super hungry and this place just happened to be next to the parking spot I found. 

First, I was quite impressed by the decor, it didn't look like a regular burger joint but looked much more trendy. The menu was simple yet everything on it seemed to be super-delicious and I had a hard time choosing. I finally decided on a BBQ beef burger with caramelized onions, aged white cheddar, BBQ sauce, oil & vinegar slaw and jalapeno relish. 

The order came out lightening fast and the burger tasted simply astonishing. The sesame bun was amazing and complemented all other ingredients well. The beef patty was pink and the meat was melting in my mouth. With all the perfect trimmings there was big bang of flavor in every bite. I hoovered the whole thing in a minute, and drooling just thinking about it.... Great price too. My best meal in SF so far, and mind you I had all Chinese, Thai and Japanese i could handle for a lot more money. 

Too bad I haven't bumped into this place earlier.

I will be back tomorrow for lunch and will definitely try their fries and drinks!!!!
author: Love S.

description: I am soooo excited to find a burger place that has grass fed beef in my hood. All I had was a burger and a glass of brewed kombucha and both were delicious. I loved that they didn't over cook the meat; it was juicy and perfect. I had the blue cheese burger and loved the watercress on it. Awesome!
author: Kristin K.

description: For all the hype about nearby Umami, Roam gets my vote for best burger joint on the block. Big, juicy burgers with myriad customization options at a decent price and little wait time. (I'd skip the elk and the bison and stick with cow, FYI.) Zucchini strips are somewhat difficult to snack on, but they're damn delicious. Sweet fries aren't bad either. The milkshakes are pretty standard.
author: Brian C.

description: Amazing! 100% grass feed beef taste unique!
author: Fernando V.

description: Awesome place for a burger and a drink. Wine and beer on tap. Fancy sodas and milkshakes. Better customer service at this location than the Roam on Fillmore.
author: Jerrie D.

description:
Gotta say I was happy to see they were opening right down the street from the store I manage.

Sorry to say their burgers are WAY small. When I came in to get my first burger, they told me they had not yet set up in their registers for merchant discounts but would be doing so shortly.

The place is hopping. So when I went in a month later I found out they still hadn't put that in place. We all give each other a merchant discount (except them). I emailed to ask why and when would it be happening and I was told by Jason, they were just getting on their feet so hey had no idea when.  We're talking about 10% so I am not sure why they are being so stingy. We give 10% merchants discount on a $500 coat, they can't seem to give the same on a $9 (!!) burger!!

So I tried again on last Thursday, still no merchants discount AND when I went it to pick up the burger I ordered I had to ask why the price was so high. It seems they have decided to increase the purchase price on upgrading from a regular burger to a bison burger (from .99 cents to a whopping $2.99) though they haven't updated their menus OR their online menu. No apology, just a "our menu's are soooooo old."

Needless to say I won't be back.
author: Paolo M.

description: Burgers are cheap and AMAZING!  I also really enjoyed talking to the hostess, very personable.  My new favorite place in the Marina.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Roam Artisan Burgers redefines ground turkey burgers.  A little gruyere and some sauteed onions on top of turkey that seems to have special spices and a little magic makes the best turkey burger I've ever had.  It was quite a pleasant surprise to be able to order a glass of Clif Family wine, a small local organic winery made by the owners of Clif Bar.  Best burgers in the Bay, I say.

That was Jen.  I had dinner with her and the thoughts expressed here don't necessarily reflect those of Jen.  To be honest, I thought the name "artisan" in the restaurant name was a little pompous.  Until I had my first bite.  And I truly can say that the turkey burger that I had (turkey burger tejano style) was literally a masterpiece.  I forget all the ingredients; but it was (a) beautiful; and (b) friggin' delicious.  There was some little pieces of goodness in there that were well thought-out and worthy of being called an artisan burger.  I am typically a fan of Frankie's turkey burger and this blows that away.  Every order should have sweet potato fries.  Trust me--- just order them.  Overall, my first experience there was a 5-star night and I think the 'artisan' name is spot on!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Simple and fantastic. Got lunch here today and it was so refreshing to see a new restaurant open with reasonable prices! Seriously, just because it is organic it shouldn't cost an arm and a leg. Had a lovely sit down lunch with sides for under $20. Both the classic and the more complex Tejano burger we had were outstanding, as were the side salad and fries.  Lots of cute extras such as house made soda and additional seasonings for fries should be fun to try when we come back.  Well done!
author: Lindsey W.

description: GREAT BURGERS! Love the menu selections, you have to try the bison burgers if you havent yet.
author: C M.

description:
I went to Roam for lunch today expecting a great "Hamburger" experience. Ordered the BBQ Burger which came with a slaw or relish that could not have been a better match with the BBQ Sauce.
The meat was a big disappointment. Dry, flavorless not what I would have expected.
The seasonable Soda lacked flavor. Almost like colored sparkling water. Not worth ordering.
author: Juerg A.

description: Wow! One of the best burgers in the city. I had the heritage with bacon, butter lettuce, grilled onions, tomato, and beef. It was fantastic. Cooked to perfection. I also ordered the sweet potato fries and the fries order was enough for two people. Definitely a better burger than Super Duper.
author: Bobby D.

description:
Went last night - on opening night and it was great.  We only eat grass fed meat so Roam's opening is very exciting for us!!

My boyfriend got the regular burger and I got the veggie burger - we really enjoyed them.  We also got a Meyer lemon soda and it was great!  I can't wait to try the other flavors.  They brought us a sample of the russet fries seasoned with chipotle and mango (I think) and they were really tasty and unique.  Best of all, the entire meal ran us $20.00.

The staff was friendly and helpful.  We will certainly be returning soon!
author: Aliza S.

description: I almost don't want to write a review so that you won't go there, but that is just not fair to Roam! I have lived all over the country and crushed burgers everywhere I go and this place is one of the best burgers I have ever had. From late night fast food dives to upscale burger joints, Roam hangs with them all. Their eclectic choices of toppings is fantastic and their zucchini and onion strings (w/ Parmesan truffle seasoning) is too die for. I got the Bison burger w/ egg and white cheddar and it was phenomenal. The bun is soft w/ good texture and the burger was amazing. Very reasonably priced, you can definitely get out of their for 2 for $15-20 depending on what you get. Friendly wait staff that is willing to give good suggestions for newcomers, quick service, and a nice inviting dining room.  I will be going back very soon!
author: Sam R.

description: 100% grass-fed, humanely raised, delicious burgers!  Perfect!
author: Geek F.

description: Shame on me for giving them another shot.  Moments after they opened I learned what a rip off this place is.  Sure the food is solid, and I felt compelled to try it since it's very close to my office.  However, it's one of those places where you feel like you just paid about two bucks too much for everything.  That's not a big deal when you're out on the town with your wife at night, but when it's a quick lunch nobody likes feeling suckered...or worse...leaving hungry after over paying.  Well, today I had a craving for a milk shake and remembered Roam sells them...albeit for $5.  When I placed the order the cashier said "large or small."  I thought to myself, self, could they possibly have an even more expensive size than $5?  So I ordered the small and jokingly said "it better be really big and really good!  She assured me it would be.  NOT.  First, I think I blew a brain vessel trying to suck the shake through a straw that's better suited for stirring coffee.  What cheap mother f'ers for not providing a decent straw with their rip off shakes.  That's how Roam is with everything though.  Anyway, it was so not $5 quality.  Am I wrong to expect actual strawberries or at least frozen strawberry mix in my $5 shake?  No chance.  It's that cheap syrup flavoring mixed with soft serve ice cream and the dixie cup it came in was an insult.  I frigging hate Roam.  Two stars is generous.
author: Mister H.

description: I first read about this place in the SF Chronicle, and since have eaten there three times, each time with a friend.  The burgers are among the best I've ever had; the service is friendly and helpful.  Pricing is very reasonable.  Ambience is OK, but they do constantly keep the tables clean.  And again with the outstanding quality of the food, the outstanding service and the friendliness of the staff, it's a delight to eat here!  Thanks
author: Wolf B.

description: hands down best burger place in san fran! way way better than umami and cheaper! super fast too!!! amazing sweet potato fries :)
author: Anna W.

description: Solid hearty burger.  Loved the zuchini string/french fry/sweet potato fry combo bowl.  I'd go back if I was in the area.
author: Idin K.

description: nothing special, which is a shame considering the expense for every topper or side. Go to Barneys instead.
author: Casey A.

description: Great place to have a tasty burger for an inexpensive price! The meat was so tender and the veggies were all so fresh. The staff were also friendly and welcoming. Overall, I left satisfied and wanting more.!
author: Brittney J.

description: Our family of five went to Roam tonight, and it was fantastic!  My husband and I both had the Pacific something or other- bleu cheese, carmelized onions... it was delicious.  The kids loved the Fry-fecta- "normal" fries (13 year old's description), sweet potato fries, and friend onions and zucchini- YUM!  We split two milkshakes- also super tasty.  Affordable, delicious and sustainable- who could ask for anything more?  We'll travel from Berkeley to SF more often for this treat.
author: christa r.

description: Great burgers, better than umami or in-and-out. Just a shade under shake shack. Milkshakes are okay.
author: D Z.

description:
The turkey burger was ok...not great, just ok.

The fries were AWFUL: dry, no flavor, really unpleasant.

I might give the burgers another chance, but I definitely wouldn't order the fries again. (How can you have a burger without fries? At Roam, I would.)
author: M Z.

description: This place is gets a lot of buzz and the food stands up to all the hype.  The fry-fecta is awesome and the burger is super filling.  Try a milkshake, they are awesome!
author: Beatrice L.

description: Yes, this place is a must...I am a gluten free girl and am pretty picky about  where I eat and what I eat.  Was there last night and had the farmer's market salad topped with the mini bison burgers and then the carmelized onions on top...so perfect. They put lots of avocado on the salad which made me even happier. I had a taste of the kombucha which was excellent as well as the blueberry pomegranate shake...Loved the fresh flavors, the fact that everything tasted truly organic, local and the presentation- right on! I will definitely go back--- in a heartbeat...We so need a Roam in Marin...
author: Mary S.

description: Food was healthy, affordable, and conveniently quick.  I am huge fan of organic grass fed beef, especially after watching "Food inc."  Everything for the most part is local and organic, witch is great for the environment.  It's definitley an up-sell version of a very health and sustainable fast food restaurant and I definitley recommend it.
author: Justin M.

description:
When burgers are the featured item, they had better be great.  Roam Artisan Burgers are nowhere near this.  Mediocre at best.  Much better burgers elsewhere on Union St. or near Chestnut St.

Plain and boring dining room decor and the staff changes the music to fit their liking, not the customers

Don't waste your time or money.
author: D M.

description: The most delicious burger I have ever had with great service!  So many different mouth-watering options along with equally tasty sides such as the sweet potato fries, my favorite!  Still need to try their sodas!
author: Alex W.

description: I love their burgers, i go with Beef, Heritage style.  Can get a little messy but this is a juicy flavorful burger.
author: sdh H.

description: As someone who dislikes bread and normal hamburgers, Roam is fantastic. I get a burger, no bun, with caramelized onions, avocado and cheese. It comes with truffle fries. Absolutely delicious. Meat is soft and tender and the flavors work well together. They also have great milkshakes.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I live right near roam, looking from outside , it seems like it is a legit place and could be nice place to spend time with friends and enjoy an Artisan Burger.   but that's what they want you to think, they want you to taste with your eyes and not with your taste buds, but when you take a bite out of your burger you know that you have been fooled.

I spent about $30 for 2 burgers and basket of fries and a bear. I got the BBQ burger, it was not presented well, it lacked taste and it completely sucked ass.

if you have ever tasted burgers from the Counter in Palo Alto , you would never ever ever ever come back to this place any more. 

my suggestion to you is to save your money and spend it on something that is worth it. this place is not worth it and I don't recommend it to anyone.
author: Babo B.

description: I love this place. I always get the turkey burger. It is great! I love, love the Tejano turkey burger for $7.99.  My husband loves the beef here. It is his favorite place.
author: Shirley S.

description: Love their burgers and fries.  Wish they had a bigger place because it can get crowded.  My favorite place in the city for a burger.
author: Dan W.

description: I go to Roam all the time -- one of the best burgers i've ever had.  The fries are great, and actually the zucchini onion haystack is my favorite.  They usually have a good selection of beers, too.  Plus, on a nice day you can sit outside on the front patio and check out people dropping by on union street.
author: Jeff C.

description: Yum!  I left this new gem yesterday, and was so happy!  Great food, quick service, quality ingredients, nice interior and cheap prices.  It truly is going to be a neighborhood hotspot, and the best part is, you would NEVER know that yesterday was only their second day open.  They were packed, but things were running smoothly.  The staff was friendly, busy, and obviously well prepared to hit the ground running -- ahem, neighbors next door, take note!
author: Megan D.

description: The burgers here are juicy and worth the (long) wait.  We were here when they were super busy, so we were concerned we wouldn't find a place to sit, but their staff was super attentive and turn-around for tables was very quick.  In my opinion, the best burger in the neighborhood.
author: Colleen B.

description: our favorite local spot. those bison burgers and truffle fries are amazing!
author: Jamie H.

description:
I was driving down Union Street at about 9:30 about a month ago and was looking for a no frills place to go with the gf. We stumbled upon Roam which I had heard about and we stopped in. The place is really nice inside with benches towards the back, a large communal table, a bar (beer and wine only) and some tables up front. 
Ordered a turkey burger with swiss and mushrooms and the truffle fries. Everything was great. Portions were good considering the price. This is not the gut bomb 3/4lb burger by any means but you have the option of making it a double (for a couple bucks more).
The friendly owner came around and asked how everything was (a nice touch).
My only nit would have been with the mushrooms (perhaps some more seasoning needed) and the burger needed red onions (aren't red onions a standard on most burgers?). I'll ask for some next time.
Otherwise, great place. I'll definitely be back to try the Blue Bottle shake also!
author: Brett K.

description: Yum!  Sustainable ingredients, tasty fare, reasonable prices.  Elk burgers, too!  Don't miss the milkshakes.  Much better than Umami down the street.
author: Kyle F.

description: I have to agree with another reviewer. The bison burger classic was pretty good. But, the overall experience with two burgers a shake and some fries at over $36 with counter service was just so-so. The place did not seem that clean either. Only one guy was delivering burgers from the kitchen and he was also the only one wiping tables, which may have been the problem.
author: Tina Z.

description: Excellent burgers, definitely way better than your average burger, but Umami burger is better and Roam gets a little too busy at times. Good milk shakes but nothing unique about them other than the toasted marshmallow you can have them add to the top. Service was good. This place is worth going to if you don't have to wait too long.
author: Brian J.

description: Great Bison Burger! A little pricey, but you normally pay for what you get. Quality ingredients equal quality product.
author: Meredith G.

description: As a disclaimer: I am a vegetarian. However, even vegetarians are on the search for the perfect veggie burger. My husband and I (also a vegetarian) certainly did not enjoy the Roam veggie burger. It appeared to be made primarily of beets, which gave it an unsightly raw blood red color. It was also extremely mushy, so mushy I would not even call it a patty, but more like a heap of bloody beet mash. We went with my sister, who is a meat-eater, and even she said she can get much better burgers in her current hometown of San Diego. It was also overpriced. We were also not impressed with the atmosphere. It was unorganized, chaotic, and dirty.  We will not be returning.
author: Suzanne A.

description: love the burgers here.  The heritage and sunny side are my favorites.   The burger does not come with fries but there are plenty of fry sides to choose from.  the kids meal is a good deal, for $6 you get a burger, fries and a drink.  Even the kids don't waste much here.
author: Eric D.

description: Summary: Wonderful, tasty, pricey. Got the bison burger with caramelized onions. Onions were truly caramelized and sweet. Bun and meat were delicious and messy. Salt caramel shake for dessert was a delicious, decadent ending. Price for self-service was not cheap: about $11 for the burger, and for organic/artisan food, about what you'd expect.
author: M P.

description: I love ROAM! I don't even eat red meat and I love ROAM! Their veggie burgers are the best I've ever had. The ambiance and atmosphere at Roam is the perfect amount of fun/hip/trendy and casual. And the owner is seriously the coolest guy. We had a large group dining their this last Friday and he brought us 3 milkshakes (absolutely amazing btw). He was also busing tables and walking around making sure everyone was happy. It's a great place!
author: Kim T.

description: Heritage beef burger and an anchor steam.  Perfect meal!  Great place for a group and so convenient.  I will definitely be back to try the bison.
author: J S.

description: Good burger - good flavor, cooked nicely pink. Had the French and fries burger. Would definitely go back and try more of their burgers. Not as expensive as I would have expected for Union St.
author: A M.

description: The burgers here are very good and if you are in the mood for a burger and fries, I would personally go here over umami. You don't have to wait as long and it is more reasonably priced AND I actually liked my burger way more here!
author: Leslie M.

description: Best burgers in town! Entire menu is fantastic! The tejano burger, salted caramel shake and sweet potato fries with chipotle maple glaze are my favorites, but you can not go wrong here!
author: Bryan L.

description: At first it was OK but they have had a price increase so now I would have to say they are overpriced and worse yet they used to take some care in prep but now burgers seem to be just sloped together with no care. Over all I would say now it is just OK. Too bad at first it seemed like it would be way above average,.
author: art a.

description: I used to live down the block from Roam and went there multiple times a week! Wow you're arteries must be clogged you're thinking?!?! Well I always get the veggie burgers. They are sooo good!! They are homemade and like nothing I've had. I could never get sick of them. My favorite is the Pacific Blue or the Chalet. They also make homemade sodas with agave so it's not full of artificial sugars, they change seasonally and they are delicious! Recently I've had the apple, yummy autumn goodness!!! I also tried the salad for the first time recently with veggie burger sliders, it was delicious! I love this place!
author: Colleen m.

description:
Ate there last week. First let me state for the record I've never been a burger fan. But I wanted to try grassfed ground beef. Actually I wanted to try bison but all complaints are correct: despite ample time to change online menu to correct price, the bison is add'l $2.99, NOT $.99. For 1/4 lb. no way is that worth it even though I didn't pay.
Anyway, ordered tryfecta and the french style burger (it's not really but has some cutesy french style name) with gruyere, avocado and truffled french fries on it. Also got tomato and pickle. Friend got classic.
After paying I wanted a beer. Confusing as there is a bar but wasn't sure if supposes to tip or not, especially as there was tax on the beer. I did tip, which I think helped me later. $3+tax +$1 tip= pricey PBR.
Food arrives. Tryfecta lukewarm. I like my fried foods hot. My burger looks good but doesn't have the truffles fries. No fries on it at all. I ask the server who confirms that the fries were forgotten. Back it goes. The tryfecta coolness is yucky. This is where I think tipping for the beer may have helped. I asked same guy I tipped if we could get hot fried Food. He was nice about it. I think tryfecta mustve sat waitng for burgers.
Burger returns. Tasty! Chockful of stuff. Love the bun, but I'm a bread person.  Soft, yeasty and more sesame seeds than I've ever seen on a bun.  The meat? Can't really say! Cheese and avocado and fries kinda drowned out patty. Fatty tasty goodness. But as I told my friend- it could've just as easily been a veggie burger. The tryfecta- fries were good. Sweet potato fries pretty good. The onion and zucchini strings were tasty but more oil than vegetable. And I tasted those fried onions all night long. Ugh.
Friend said his was good. He's a burger person.  His assessment was buegermeister better. And he wasn't keen on the tryfecta. Said fries pretty good but didn't care for swt pots or onion things. 
All in all I found it tasty. But I'd rather have the bun and burger toppings with a nonfat Boca burger base. Then I could avoid the pointless meat but get all the tastiness.
No on the tryfecta. Next time just an order of the truffled parmesan fries.
Maybe it really should be 3 stars but they were nice and I did enjoy my burger thing.
oh but they really need some heat in there! Freezing! Everyone had on coats and some even hats and scarves!
author: Allucaneat G.

description: I clearly ordered the wrong thing (created my own) the first time I came here. I got the tejano burger (beef) last night and it was awesome. I'm still thinking about it. That's a 5 star spot.
author: Caitlin B.

description: Good place for counter service burgers! Plus, there beef is organic, grass fed, and local. How are they able to charge $7.99 for a burger? My tip: Try the heritage burger. It is the best one on the menu!
author: Liz K.

description: gotta love a good burger! we had the classic... simple and sweet. not over done w/ a bunch of sauce or condiments. it's about good quality meat and produce.  the fry-fecta was a compilation of sweet potato fries, potato fries and shoe string mix of onions and zucchini.  there will be a line but good food it worth the wait. thank goodness for something different in this part of sf.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Tasty burgers.  Maple & chipotle glazes for the fries are both really good. The fact that you have to go back to the line to order another drink when you're sitting at the bar is annoying. And speaking of drinks, stay away from the red wine on tap- over-priced & awful.
author: Maggie Z.

description: Bottom line: make the burger patties bigger for the price you charge... It's the size of a Krystal burger...
author: Sara L.

description: Bison burger n sweet potato fries n the drinks rock
author: priya j.

description: I came here last night with my girlfriend and I was thoroughly impressed. Full disclosure: my girlfriend is a vegetarian so, by proxy, I am as well. This means that on the rare occasion that I get meat, it comes with the joy of reuniting with a long lost friend. She got the veggie French and Fries burger and I got the Tejano with a beef patty and then we split a Fry-Fecta (partial orders of russet fries, sweet potato fries, and zucchini onion haystack). Sometimes I do this thing were I panic just before I order and end up randomly picking something on the menu. That's why I was a bit surprised when my burger came out with tortilla chips on it. All surprises aside, it was a great burger. I tried a bit of my girlfriend's and it was also very tasty. In the Fry-Fecta, the russet fries were definitely the weakest, but they were all very good. I love that you can match any of the patties with any of the burgers. It was on the noisier side inside the restaurant, but that might have been due to the large group all dressed in costumes. This place is absolutely prime for a return visit.
author: Jeremy J.

description: Great burgers at a decent price. I especially liked the fact that they have different type of meat (elk, bison...) and that they sell alternatives to the usual crappy sodas. The fries were ok. Amazing vanilla shake!!! Place is quite nice, with a terrace. A good burger joint!
author: Jerome L.

description: Quality ingredients, tasty burger combos, and the bison is a great option. And oh, definitely get a shake - they make some of the best around (salted Carmel or minted chocolate were my favs!)
author: Michael S.

description: Too many good burger places in the city for me to go back to Roam.  Overpriced and under delivered.  If I want to get a good burger I will just continue to go to Balboa.
author: C C.

description: Called in an order to go and Illyse was very nice.  I never felt rushed and asked her quite a few questions about the burgers since it was my first order.  When I got to the restaurant there was a huge line so a big plus for the service and patience of their employees.  I ordered the sunny side with truffle parmesan fries and boy was it good.  I'm not sure if I'll go with an egg on my burger again though.  I got the non-pink burger it wasn't dry or tough at all.  I do wish the burger was a bit bigger but it's the perfect meal for lunch.  I would suggest not getting the fries to go.  I work about 5 minutes away and by the time I got back, they were all soggy.  Maybe if I eat there, I will try the fries again.  I went there again last Friday and got the French and Fries.  You'd think i'd learn but again, the fries weren't that good.  The burger itself was delicious.  I really like that they have beer on tap and can't wait to come here for a sit down meal.
author: Ken W.

description: My fiance and I ate here a while back and it was typical SF grass fed organic food.  We both had burgers that were average and overpriced due to the nature and origin of the food.  If your into that sort of thing it was ok, otherwise steer clear.  The milkshake was pretty good however and the atmosphere was definitely a little more on the organic side.
author: Alex E.

description: Roam is a great burger joint. If you live in the Marina, great! If you live elsewhere, like myself, don't let the fact that Roam is in the Marina detour you. It's worth the effort. They serve gourmet burgers at regular burger prices. For $4.99 you can get a regular burger or $6 for a gourmet burger and you can't go wrong. Their milkshakes are a must, they are amazing!!!! It's an order and sit place so don't expect attentive hand-and-foot service. It's just not that kind of place, so if you have to wait a minute for a table to be cleared, get over it. If you want a quality burger, shake and fries (get the sweet potato fries) then this is your place. I would have given them 5 stars if it hand't been for one crucial mistake (and I sat on this for a few days to see if I would cool down, but I didn't). They ask you if you want your burger pink and I strongly said YES, Pink please. They served me an amazingly over cooked burger that was obviously for someone that asked for it welllllll done. My disappointment was squashed upon my first bite. Grinding my teeth into that rubbery patty was delightful, the taste of the meat, the dressings and experience was outstanding.
author: Spencer C.

description: This place has some mighty tasty burgers. I had the Beef Classic with Swiss and Bacon and an order of Russet Fries with Truffle Parmesan seasoning. The burger itself was quite juicy and I really liked the House-Made Pickles and Bacon. The fries with the seasoning was delicious as well. I can't wait to go back.
author: Rich M.

description: Despite the fact that I went veggie several months ago, I have to admit that I REALLY wanted some meat after reading the menu at this joint!  So, if I temporarily fall off the veg bandwagon, and decide to "splurge" and have a real burger, this will definitely be the place!  Grass fed, organic, etc is the ONLY way to go!  My husband and I decided to share a veggie burger "classic" no onions with a side of fry-fecta and a prickly pear soda.  (I'm looking forward to the blue bottle coffee shake on my next visit) !  Veggie burgers can often be disappointing, but this one was tasty thanks to the super fresh ingredients and perfect amount of seasoning.  I think the bun was my favorite part...and the house made pickles, and the special sauce!  The fries were light, not greasy, and had the perfect amount of salt on them.  (Next time I'll probably try the truffle seasoning.)  Even the prickly pear soda was delicious.  Not too sweet and really refreshing.  It's so nice to see the reinvention of a simple classic done in a responsible, healthier way!
author: Jocelyn C.

description: Really tasty, high quality food, great options, and relatively inexpensive.  Why 3 stars?  Because they honestly get your order wrong 3/4s of the time.  They are constantly forgetting toppings, sauce, even entire beef patties.  Its happened to both me and many of my friends multiple times.  Hoenstly I continue to go there because it really is that good, but if they were just able to actually put what you ask for on your burger, it would be such a better place to eat.
author: Ethan K.

description: I'm afraid to give these guys the review they deserve for fear the line will be out the door from now on!  Seriously awesome food.....and without the "I just ate a cheeseburger feeling" in your stomach.
author: Cate T.

description: quality ingredients, friendly staff, thoughtful interior. 5 stars...
author: Grant B.

description: great burgers, beers on tap, sweet potato fries, casual in a good way. one of my favorite burger places.
author: Andy P.

description: Love the concept, all organic fast food style.   Loved it!  Tastes good, good for your body and good for your soul.  This place is a winner.  Will be back often.
author: M C.

description: After a so-so experience, and a bad one, I really wanted to give Roam another chance. How could I resist the call of burgers anyway? Plus, after my initial review, one of the owners reached out to me to apologize for the bad experience I had, and I thought it was a very nice gesture. I am all about keeping local business alive, and my intention was really not to hurt Roam's business. My initial review was more a cry of disappointment, since I wanted to like Roam so much all the time. So fast forward, I went back to Roam early July, on a sunny sunday afternoon, with family from out of town. Yes, I put the bar high enough because they were craving for burgers, and we were really hungry. The place was not crowded, we ate outside, everything was perfectly executed: the burgers were juicy and delicious, the fries were crunchy, and everything was served promptly. So, I put the bar higher for the next visit: coming with my husband, my kid, and my parents, visiting from France. The place was a little bit more crowded, but we got spots at the big table. It feels always weird that people wiuld not move a bit to let you eat facing your party: instead, I had to listen to some chick stories, but well...I chose the seasonal salad with the mini veggie burgers trio, my mom took the same, but with beef trio, and both my dad and my husband took the classic beef with russet and potato fries. Again, an excellent experience: it was tasty, served after 10 mn or so waiting, and there was no mistake in the order (it happened in the past that we were missing the fries, or another item). Even more pleasant was the feeling that the team working there seemed more committed to offer great service with great quality food. One of the co-owners, as she introduced herself, even checked if we were having a nice experience, which is to me , quite unusual in a casual burger place, but this attention to the clients is adding the cherry on top of my burger cake.
author: Helene L.

description: I would have given this a four, but when we went(a group of 6) to eat there, the music was so loud, and people had to talk even louder over the music, that it made our visit not as enjoyable. The food was really delicious-everybody loved everything ordered. Also, one member of our group didn't receive her food until everyone else was done eating. She should have been comped the whole meal to our way of thinking. It was just too noisy to be a pleasant experience. I see I'm not the only one bothered by this, so perhaps they will work to correct it.
author: Deborah E.

description: Seasoning on the burger and fries  would have been good if the burger wasn't raw and the fries weren't cold.  No place to sit so server just handed me my plate--no offer to box up, serve me outside, or help clear a table.  Doesn't seem like they have it together.
author: SF A.

description: Let's face it, Union Street has desperately needed to step it up in the restaurant department for years. Compared to Chestnut, Polk or Fillmore - it's been pretty slim pickings. ROAM is the wonderful addition we've asked for - great ambiance, delicious food, plus it's cheap and cheerful.  Veggie burger is amazing (although it falls apart a bit) and the fries are dangerously tasty.  I've found my new neighborhood hangout.
author: kathryn w.

description: I love the idea of how many different ways you can order burgers!! I had the house made GLUTEN FREE veggie burger, made w/quinoa and yummy stuff, wrapped in lettuce, w/cheese it was PHENOMENAL, albe it hard to eat (fork/knife required) but so so so so so good, and all you other celiac/gf peeps know what a hard find that is! I was beyond relieved, and excited! my man had a burger, and said next tme he would get a double bc the patties were small, so heads up all you carnivores.  we also had fries-delish, but are they bad fries?!? and the BEST fro-yo milkshake to have ever been made....SALTED CARAMEL, holy moly....literally i would get this everyday for the rest of my life....the ONLY thing keeping this from a 5 star review is customer service...its an order at the counter kind of place, and well, the people walking around were kind of rude when one in our party wanted to order a shake to go. he had to wait all over in line again :( boo lame. but all in all, i will be back again....and again...and again.....
author: Jess L.

description: There are a lot to like about this place.  I liked the ambiance, and the staffs are friendly.  Seems like everything is organic, from ketchup to sugar.  The price is a little high compared to most burger places, but you have to pay extra for the fresh ingredients, and the nice design.  The choices on the menu is great too, just enough choices, and everything is interesting.  The burger tasted fresh.  The tomato, the fried egg, the greens, it's all very good.  By comparison, it seems like the meat itself is the weakest part of the whole experience.  I want a burger that's full of juice. It should be messy, and there's should be beef juice dripping from the mouth at every bite.  By the time when I finished my burger here, my hands and face are clean.  My wife had the veggie burger, and she can taste everything except the patty.  It's not bad overall.  I would bring friends here when I want a nice place to sit down, eat, and have a beer.  I would go somewhere else when I'm craving for burger
author: Dee L.

description: waited 20 minutes before i had to ask about my order -- a take away salad.  when it arrived, the salad was small and wilted, and it tasted as if it had been seasoned with a whole shaker of salt.
author: didi r.
